*   At least seven people are killed and more than 80 others injured after a train derails in [Bouknadel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bouknadel), [Morocco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morocco). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-morocco-train/at-least-seven-killed-in-train-derailment-in-morocco-idUSKCN1MQ1DX)
*   The death toll of an accidental explosion in [Aba](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aba,_Abia), [Nigeria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nigeria), rises to 200. Over 2,000 people protest, claiming that the pipeline explosion was caused by [NNPC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NNPC)'s negligence. [(Vanguard News)](https://www.vanguardngr.com/2018/10/osisioma-pipeline-explosion-death-toll-hits-200/amp/)
*   Two [Myanmar Air Force](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myanmar_Air_Force) [F-7](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chengdu_J-7) fighter jets crash into a broadcast tower in [Magway](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magway_Division), [Myanmar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myanmar), resulting in the deaths of both pilots and an 11-year-old girl, who was killed by falling debris. [(New York Times)](https://www.nytimes.com/2018/10/16/world/asia/myanmar-fighter-jet-crash-student.html)

## International relations

*   [United States sanctions against Iran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_sanctions_against_Iran)
    *   The [United States Treasury Department](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Treasury_Department) announces new sanctions on 22 Iranian corporations and banks. [(Bloomberg)](https://www.bloomberg.com/amp/news/articles/2018-10-16/u-s-treasury-sanctions-iranian-companies-banks-and-others)
*   [Australia–Israel relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia%E2%80%93Israel_relations)
    *   [Australian Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Australia) [Scott Morrison](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scott_Morrison) announces that [his government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morrison_Government) is considering recognising [Jerusalem](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jerusalem) as the Israeli capital and relocating its embassy accordingly, [in line with the United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_recognition_of_Jerusalem_as_capital_of_Israel), drawing local criticism and sparking outrage from members of the opposition. The announcement comes days before a [by-election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wentworth_by-election,_2018) in which the governing party's candidate is [Dave Sharma](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dave_Sharma), a former ambassador to [Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-australia-45871402)
*   [Saudi Arabia–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabia%E2%80%93United_States_relations)
    *   [United States Secretary of State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Secretary_of_State) [Mike Pompeo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mike_Pompeo) meets in [Riyadh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riyadh) with [Saudi Arabia King](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/King_of_Saudi_Arabia) [Salman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salman_of_Saudi_Arabia) to express concerns about the disappearance of [Saudi Arabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabia) journalist [Jamal Khashoggi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jamal_Khashoggi). [(Fox News)](https://www.foxnews.com/politics/pompeo-lands-in-saudi-arabia-to-meet-with-king-salman-over-missing-writer) [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-saudi-politics-dissident-meeting/pompeo-tells-saudis-u-s-is-concerned-about-khashoggi-state-department-idUSKCN1MQ1L9)
    *   Senior [U.S. Senator](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Senate) [Lindsey Graham](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lindsey_Graham) states that [Mohammed bin Salman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohammed_bin_Salman) has murdered Khashoggi and that the country's [crown prince](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crown_Prince_of_Saudi_Arabia) has "got to go". [(Aol)](https://www.aol.com/article/news/2018/10/16/sen-lindsey-graham-says-mohammed-bin-salman-had-khashoggi-murdered/23562756/) [(CNBC)](https://www.cnbc.com/2018/10/16/lindsey-graham-says-saudi-crown-prince-bin-salman-has-got-to-go.html)

## Politics and elections

*   [Armenian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armenia) Prime Minister [Nikol Pashinyan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nikol_Pashinyan) resigns from his post in order to dissolve the [National Assembly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Assembly_(Armenia)) and force early elections by the end of the year. [(RFE/RL)](https://www.rferl.org/a/armenia-s-pashinian-expected-to-resign-to-force-new-elections/29546171.html)

# 2018-10-18

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [War in Afghanistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_in_Afghanistan_(2001%E2%80%93present))
    *   [Afghan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghanistan) general and [Kandahar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kandahar) police chief [Abdul Raziq Achakzai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abdul_Raziq_Achakzai) is assassinated by one of his bodyguards during a high-level meeting inside the governor's compound with [U.S.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) general [Austin S. Miller](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Austin_S._Miller). Gen. Miller escaped unharmed according to officials while the governor was critically injured. The [Taliban](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taliban) claims responsibility. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-45899845)

## Business and economy

*   [Cobalt Air](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cobalt_Air) suddenly announces its dissolution, cancelling all future operations and leaving many passengers stranded in [Cyprus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyprus). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/business-45897567)
*   The [Federal Aviation Administration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Aviation_Administration) states that it will allow [U.S. airlines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_airlines_of_the_United_States) to resume flights at three [Ukrainian airports](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_airports_in_Ukraine), at [Kharkiv](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kharkiv), [Dnipro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dnipro) and [Zaporizhia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zaporizhia), and over parts of the [Black Sea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Sea), citing improved safety and security in parts of [Ukraine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukraine). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-ukraine-airlines/u-s-allows-airlines-to-resume-flights-to-ukraine-airports-black-sea-routes-idUSKCN1MS2NA)

## Disasters and accidents

*   Severe flooding in [Texas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Texas) kills at least two people and damages dozens of houses. Weather forecasters predict that more rain will come and possibly flood hundreds more houses. [(CBS News)](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/texas-flooding-catches-homeowners-off-guard-kingsland/)

## Science and technology

*   Astronomers discover [Hyperion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hyperion_proto-supercluster), an ancient proto-[supercluster](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supercluster) that appeared 2.3 billion years after the [Big Bang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Big_Bang). [(CNET)](https://www.cnet.com/news/hyperion-is-an-ancient-cosmic-beast-formed-2-3b-years-after-big-bang/) [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-space-galaxy/scientists-in-chile-unveil-a-cosmic-titan-cluster-of-galaxies-idUSKCN1MR2RS)
*   The [China space industry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_space_program) plans to launch the world's first "artificial moon" into orbit by 2020 at the [Xichang Satellite Launch Center](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xichang_Satellite_Launch_Center) to illuminate city streets after dark. [(Straits Times)](https://www.straitstimes.com/asia/east-asia/china-to-launch-worlds-first-man-made-moon-in-2020-to-help-with-urban-illumination) [(Time)](http://time.com/5429288/china-chengdu-artificial-moon/)

## International relations

    *   [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._President) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) says the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) will withdraw from the [Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intermediate-Range_Nuclear_Forces_Treaty), a 1987 nuclear arms treaty with [Russia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia). [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/oct/20/trump-us-nuclear-arms-treaty-russia)

## Disasters and accidents

*   Four U.S. tourists are killed in [Costa Rica](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Costa_Rica) after a rafting accident on a swollen river. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-45931227)

## Law and crime

*   A spat in a market in [Nigeria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nigeria)'s northern [Kaduna State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kaduna_State) results in 55 dead. After the brawl, 22 people were arrested. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-45930407)

## Politics and elections

*   [Afghan parliamentary election, 2018](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghan_parliamentary_election,_2018)
    *   After a delay of three years, voters in [Afghanistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghanistan) head to the polls to elect members of the nation's [parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_of_the_People_(Afghanistan)). The election is marred by violence and suicide attacks which leave over 170 dead or wounded nationwide. [(_Deutsche Welle_)](https://www.dw.com/en/afghanistan-election-multiple-blasts-reported-at-kabul-polling-stations/a-45966503)

Additionally, voting in the [Kandahar Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kandahar_Province) will be delayed by one week following the assassination of police commander [Abdul Raziq Achakzai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abdul_Raziq_Achakzai) two days prior. If she wins, the [Australian House of Representatives](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australian_House_of_Representatives) will enter into a [hung parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hung_parliament). [(_The Sydney Morning Herald_)](https://www.smh.com.au/politics/federal/wentworth-byelection-gap-between-kerryn-phelps-and-dave-sharma-narrows-in-surprise-count-update-20181021-p50azw.html)
*   [Opposition to Brexit in the United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opposition_to_Brexit_in_the_United_Kingdom)
    *   More than 600,000 people gather at [Parliament Square](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parliament_Square) in [London](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London) as protesters from the [People's Vote](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/People%27s_Vote) campaign call for a second [Brexit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit) referendum deal between the [United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom) and the [European Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Union). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-45925542) [(_Time_)](http://time.com/5430241/600k-march-london-second-brexit-vote/)

[(_The Express Tribune_)](https://tribune.com.pk/story/1830940/1-least-15-passengers-killed-dg-khan-road-accident/) [(Arab News)](http://www.arabnews.com/node/1392036/press-review)

## Politics and elections

*   [British Columbia electoral reform referendum, 2018](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/British_Columbia_electoral_reform_referendum,_2018)
    *   The [Canadian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canada) province of [British Columbia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/British_Columbia) begins a [postal ballot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postal_voting) to determine whether to maintain the current [first-past-the-post voting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/First-past-the-post_voting) system or switch to a form of [proportional representation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Proportional_representation) for their provincial elections. *   [Transgender rights](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transgender_rights)
    *   The [Trump administration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trump_administration) through the [United States Department of Health and Human Services](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Department_of_Health_and_Human_Services) plans to include a legal definition of gender in the federal civil rights [Title IX](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Title_IX) law. The proposed alteration to the law would define gender as an unchangeable anatomical and genetic condition determined at birth. Members of the [LGBT](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT) community plan to contest the move, which they state would largely end protections for [transgender](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transgender) Americans. *   [Russian interference in the 2018 United States elections](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_interference_in_the_2018_United_States_elections), [cyberwarfare by Russia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyberwarfare_by_Russia)
    *   The [United States Cyber Command](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Cyber_Command) contacts individual [Russians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russians) with the hope to deter them from interfering with upcoming [American elections](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elections_in_the_United_States), including the [November midterms](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_elections,_2018). [(CNBC)](https://www.cnbc.com/2018/10/23/us-warning-individual-russians-over-midterm-election-interference.html)
*   [October 2018 United States mail bombing attempts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/October_2018_United_States_mail_bombing_attempts)
    *   The [United States Secret Service](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Secret_Service) intercepts two suspicious packages described as "potential explosive devices" addressed to former President [Barack Obama](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barack_Obama) and former Secretary of State [Hillary Clinton](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hillary_Clinton). One addressed to former CIA director [John O. Brennan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_O._Brennan) was received at [CNN](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CNN)'s New York studios, which were evacuated. Other politicians who received similar packages include U.S. Representatives [Debbie Wasserman Schultz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Debbie_Wasserman_Schultz) (whose name and address was on the return label of a package meant for former Attorney General [Eric Holder](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eric_Holder) but had the wrong recipient address) and [Maxine Waters](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maxine_Waters). Authorities are also attempting to locate a suspicious package sent to former Vice President [Joe Biden](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Biden) that was marked return to sender due to a bad address. [(_Washington Examiner_)](https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/news/authorities-searching-for-package-addressed-to-joe-biden-amid-bomb-scare) [(NPR)](https://www.npr.org/2018/10/24/660161491/u-s-intercepts-suspicious-packages-addressed-to-clinton-and-obama)
*   [Junpei Yasuda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Junpei_Yasuda), a [Japanese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_people) journalist kidnapped by [Al-Nusra Front](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Nusra_Front) in [Syria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syria), is released. [(Time)](http://www.time.com/5432820/japanese-journalist-syria-released-turkey/)

# 2018-10-28

## Business and economy

*   American online payments system company [PayPal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PayPal) bans American social media site [Gab](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gab_(social_network)), known for its association with the [alt-right](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alt-right) movement, while [Joyent](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joyent), Gab's American hosting provider, states that they will terminate their service tomorrow. The move comes after it was revealed that the suspect in yesterday's 11 deaths at the [Pittsburgh synagogue shooting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pittsburgh_synagogue_shooting), Robert Bowers, was an active member on the social network. [(CNET)](https://www.cnet.com/news/after-pittsburgh-synagogue-shooting-paypal-bans-gab-social-network/)
*   American computer company [IBM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IBM) announces plans to acquire American software company [Red Hat](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_Hat) for [US$](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/US$)34 billion. [(CNBC)](https://www.cnbc.com/2018/10/28/ibm-is-reportedly-nearing-deal-to-acquire-red-hat.html)

    *   [Georgian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Georgia_(country)) citizens vote in the last presidential election to be decided by [direct election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Direct_election). *   [Hessian state election, 2018](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hessian_state_election,_2018)

# 2018-10-30

## Disasters and accidents

*   [2018 Pacific typhoon season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_Pacific_typhoon_season)
    *   [Typhoon Yutu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Typhoon_Yutu) causes landslides in the [Philippines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines), leaving at least four people killed and thirty-one others trapped. ## Health and environment

*   [Complications of pregnancy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Complications_of_pregnancy)
    *   Research published in _[JAMA Internal Medicine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JAMA_Internal_Medicine)_ describes that mothers should wait at least a year between giving birth and getting pregnant again to reduce health risks to mother and baby. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/health-46017789)

## Law and crime

*   [List of serial killers by number of victims](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_serial_killers_by_number_of_victims)
    *   [German](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germans) convicted serial killer and former nurse [Niels Högel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Niels_H%C3%B6gel) begins his third trial (previous convictions were in 2008 and 2015), this time in [Oldenburg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oldenburg), for additional patient murders by administering fatal doses of medication between 1999–2005 which may include his assignment as one of Germany's worst serial killers since [World War II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II). At the beginning of the trial, Högel confesses to the murder of 100 of his patients. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-46027355),[(Deutsche Welle)](https://www.dw.com/en/german-former-nurse-confesses-to-killing-100-patients/a-46084584)
*   _[Assange v Swedish Prosecution Authority](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assange_v_Swedish_Prosecution_Authority)_
    *   A judge in [Ecuador](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecuador) rules against [WikiLeaks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WikiLeaks) co-founder [Julian Assange](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Julian_Assange), who had contested new rules imposed on him in [the country's embassy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Embassy_of_Ecuador,_London) in [London](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London). Assange had argued that the conditions violated his "fundamental rights and freedoms", and were intended to force him to leave. His lawyers have appealed against the ruling. Assange took refuge in the embassy six years ago to avoid extradition to [Sweden](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sweden) in a sexual assault case that has since been dropped. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-46027963)
*   [Boston](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boston) convicted serial killer and former [FBI Ten Most Wanted Fugitive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FBI_Ten_Most_Wanted_Fugitives) [Whitey Bulger](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whitey_Bulger) dies in the [United States Penitentiary at Hazelton](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Penitentiary,_Hazelton), [West Virginia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/West_Virginia). [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2018/10/30/us/james-whitey-bulger-killed/index.html)

## Politics and elections

*   [United States Constitution](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Constitution)
    *   [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) vows to revoke the right to automatic citizenship given to children born on [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) land to [illegal immigrants](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Illegal_immigrant). [Birthright citizenship in the United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Birthright_citizenship_in_the_United_States) is protected in the [Citizenship Clause](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Citizenship_Clause) of the [Fourteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fourteenth_Amendment_to_the_United_States_Constitution). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-46032075)
*   American rapper [Kanye West](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kanye_West) announces he will separate himself from politics after feeling used by conservative activist [Candace Owens](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Candace_Owens) to promote her '[Blexit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blexit)' campaign. [(ABC)](https://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-10-31/kanye-west-says-he-is-distancing-himself-from-politics/10451460)

## Science and technology

*   [NASA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NASA)'s _[Parker Solar Probe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parker_Solar_Probe)_ spacecraft becomes the closest ever sent to the [Sun](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sun), by passing 42.7 million km (26.6 million miles) from the Sun's surface. The previous record was set in 1976 by the _[Helios 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Helios_(spacecraft))_ spacecraft. Parker's elliptical orbit will eventually take it to within 6.1 million km (3.8 million miles) of the Sun. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-46030852)
*   [NASA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NASA) announces that the _[Kepler](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kepler_(spacecraft))_ spacecraft has expended all its fuel and will be retired after nearly 10 years of service, having found more than 2,600 exoplanets. [(_Los Angeles Times_)](http://www.latimes.com/science/sciencenow/la-sci-sn-nasa-kepler-retires-20181030-story.html)
*   The [Hawaii](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hawaii) [Supreme Court](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hawaii_Supreme_Court) affirms the permit for the [Thirty Meter Telescope](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thirty_Meter_Telescope) on [Mauna Kea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mauna_Kea). [(Thirty Meter Telescope)](https://www.tmt.org/news/361)

## Armed conflicts and attacks

The agency is Russia's primary state security agency and a successor to the [KGB](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/KGB). [(_Meduza_)](https://meduza.io/en/feature/2018/10/31/the-terrorist-attack-on-a-federal-security-service-branch-in-arkhangelsk-what-we-know-so-far)

[(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-nigeria-security-insurgency/suspected-boko-haram-militants-kill-15-in-northeast-nigeria-residents-idUSKCN1N64EU?il=0)

    *   Indian Prime Minister [Narendra Modi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Narendra_Modi)'s [Statue of Unity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Statue_of_Unity), which depicts the first [Deputy Prime Minister of India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deputy_Prime_Minister_of_India) and winner of the highest [civilian award](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indian_honours_system) of the [Republic of India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republic_of_India), the [Bharat Ratna](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bharat_Ratna), [Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vallabhbhai_Patel), becomes the world's largest statue. The statue is located near the [Narmada Dam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Narmada_Dam) in the Indian state of [Gujarat](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gujarat).     *   With the previous [Colombia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colombia) census thirteen years ago, the [National Administrative Department of Statistics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Administrative_Department_of_Statistics) registered 45.5 million [Colombians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colombians) and [legal foreign residents](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Immigration_to_Colombia) living in the country. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-europe-migrants-spain/seventeen-migrants-perish-crossing-from-africa-to-spain-spanish-coast-guard-idUSKCN1NB0ZO)

*   [Antiguan constitutional referendum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antiguan_constitutional_referendum,_2018), [Grenadian constitutional referendum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grenadian_constitutional_referendum,_2018)
    *   Referenda are held in [Antigua and Barbuda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antigua_and_Barbuda) and [Grenada](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grenada) to decide whether to maintain the UK-based [Judicial Committee of the Privy Council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Judicial_Committee_of_the_Privy_Council) as the final court of appeal, or to adopt the appellate jurisdiction of the [Caribbean Court of Justice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caribbean_Court_of_Justice); both are rejected by voters. ## Science and technology

*   [2018 in science](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_in_science)
    *   [NASA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NASA)'s [Chandra X-ray Observatory](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chandra_X-ray_Observatory) confirms earlier observations by [Indian Space Research Organisation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indian_Space_Research_Organisation)'s [Astrosat](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Astrosat) space observatory of a [rotating black hole](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rotating_black_hole) in the [binary star system](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Binary_star_system) 4U 1630-47, which is spinning close to the [speed of light](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Speed_of_light), one of the fastest ever observed. [(_India Today_)](https://www.indiatoday.in/education-today/gk-current-affairs/story/indian-satellite-astrosat-helps-find-black-hole-spinning-near-maximum-possible-rates-1380893-2018-11-02) [(Metro)](https://metro.co.uk/2018/11/08/astronomers-found-a-black-hole-rotating-so-fast-its-sucking-up-space-itself-8117430/)
    *   A new study from [Eötvös Loránd University](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E%C3%B6tv%C3%B6s_Lor%C3%A1nd_University) confirms the existence of two [Kordylewski clouds](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kordylewski_cloud) orbiting [Earth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earth). [Kazimierz Kordylewski](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kazimierz_Kordylewski) first observed the faint clouds of dust around the [L4](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lagrangian_point#L4_and_L5) and [L5](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lagrangian_point#L4_and_L5) [Lagrangian points](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lagrangian_point) in the 1960s. [(India Times)](https://www.indiatimes.com/technology/science-and-future/scientists-now-say-earth-has-two-extra-moons-made-entirely-of-dust-clouds-356300.html) [(Inquisitr)](https://www.inquisitr.com/5150418/new-discovery-earth-officially-has-three-moons/)

[(Star Tribune)](http://www.startribune.com/romania-10-injured-after-suspect-stabs-drives-into-people/500228052/)

    *   A 50-year-old former strawberry farm supervisor is arrested in [Queensland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Queensland) in connection with 230 reports of sewing needles found hidden in strawberries. The "strawberry scare" spread throughout the country and to [New Zealand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Zealand), and devastated Australia’s multimillion-pound strawberry industry. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-australia-46168814) [(The Mail)](http://www.nwemail.co.uk/news/national/17216904.australia-strawberry-tampering-suspect-motivated-by-spite-or-revenge/)

# 2018-11-12

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Gaza–Israel clashes (November 2018)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaza%E2%80%93Israel_clashes_(November_2018))
    *   [Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel) and [Hamas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hamas) exchange missile fire with 300 rockets being launched from [Gaza](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaza_City) within the span of three hours. [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2018/11/12/world/middleeast/israel-gaza-rocket-fire.html)
    *   The [Israeli Air Force](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israeli_Air_Force) bombs [Hamas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hamas)-run [Al-Aqsa TV](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Aqsa_TV)'s headquarters in [Gaza City](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaza_City), completely destroying it. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-israel-palestinians-violence-tv/israel-bombs-hamas-tv-station-in-gaza-after-warning-calls-shots-idUSKCN1NH29Z)
    *   A rocket fired from [Gaza](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaza_Strip) strikes an apartment building in [Ashkelon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ashkelon), killing a man and injuring two others. The victim was a middle aged Palestinian [illegal immigrant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Illegal_immigration) from [Hebron](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hebron). This is the first person killed on Israeli soil due to Palestinian rocket fire since 2014. [(_Ynetnews_)](https://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-5399726,00.html)

## Arts and culture

*   [Amnesty International](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amnesty_International) strips [Myanmar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myanmar) [State Counsellor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/State_Counsellor_of_Myanmar) [Aung San Suu Kyi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aung_San_Suu_Kyi) of its highest honor, the Ambassador of Conscience Award, which she received in 2009, because of her inaction regarding the [persecution of Myanmar's Rohingya Muslim population](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Persecution_of_Muslims_in_Myanmar) in [Rakhine State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rakhine_State) and the [military operations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internal_conflict_in_Myanmar#Main_fronts) in [Kachin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kachin_State) and [Shan State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shan_State). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-46179292) [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2018/11/12/asia/suu-kyi-amnesty-award-intl/index.html)
*   [Pope Francis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pope_Francis) asks the [US Conference of Catholic Bishops](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Conference_of_Catholic_Bishops), now meeting in [Baltimore](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baltimore), to delay voting on proposals to address the [sexual abuse crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catholic_Church_sex_abuse_cases_in_the_United_States) until he leads a global summit in February. [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2018/11/12/us/conference-of-catholic-bishops-vatican/index.html) [(Axios)](https://www.axios.com/pope-francis-us-bishops-sex-abuse-proposals-0c9ac11b-9637-4c14-bc14-27955e6c4647.html)
*   [Marvel Comics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Comics) editor and [comic book](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comic_book) writer [Stan Lee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stan_Lee) dies at the age of 95. [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2018/11/12/obituaries/stan-lee-dead.html) [(The Guardian)](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2018/nov/12/stan-lee-fans-stars-pay-tribute-to-comic)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [2018 California wildfires](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_California_wildfires)
    *   The [Camp Fire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Camp_Fire_(2018)) in [Butte County](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Butte_County,_California) is now ranked as the deadliest wildfire in [Californian history](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_California), with 42 people confirmed dead and 228 people missing. [(HuffPost)](https://m.huffpost.com/us/entry/us_5bea3cc4e4b044bbb1a7b522)

## International relations

*   [Killing of Jamal Khashoggi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Killing_of_Jamal_Khashoggi), [Foreign relations of Saudi Arabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foreign_relations_of_Saudi_Arabia)
    *   [Prime Minister of Canada](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Canada) [Justin Trudeau](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Justin_Trudeau) confirms that Canadian intelligence officials have listened to the recording provided by Turkey of the killing of [Jamal Khashoggi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jamal_Khashoggi), though he himself had not heard it. ## Politics and elections

    *   A week after the election, which was initially too close to call, [Democratic Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democratic_Party_(United_States)) candidate [Kyrsten Sinema](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyrsten_Sinema) is elected to the [United States Senate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Senate), defeating [GOP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_Party_(United_States)) candidate [Martha McSally](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martha_McSally). Sinema is the first woman elected to represent [Arizona](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arizona) in the Senate and first Democrat to win a Senate [election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elections_in_Arizona) in the state since 1994. ## Armed conflicts and attacks

    *   The [United Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations) announce that seven [MONUSCO](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MONUSCO) [peacekeepers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_peacekeeping) were killed in clashes with militia yesterday in [Beni](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beni,_Democratic_Republic_of_the_Congo), [North Kivu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Kivu), [Democratic Republic of the Congo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democratic_Republic_of_the_Congo). *   [War in Afghanistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_in_Afghanistan_(2001%E2%80%93present))
    *   [Taliban](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taliban) kill 30 policemen in an attack on an outpost in [Farah Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Farah_Province). [(AP via Fox News)](https://www.foxnews.com/world/afghan-officials-taliban-kill-30-policemen-in-west-province)

## Business and economy

*   [Rail transport in Morocco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rail_transport_in_Morocco)
    *   The [Kenitra–Tangier high-speed rail line](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenitra%E2%80%93Tangier_high-speed_rail_line), the first in [Africa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Africa), is inaugurated. [(AP via KSLA News)](http://www.ksla.com/2018/11/15/morocco-unveil-africa-first-ever-high-speed-train-line/)
*   [Criticism of Walmart](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Walmart)
    *   [US Senator](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Senate) [Bernie Sanders](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bernie_Sanders) launches the Stop [Walmart](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walmart) Act, which would prohibit big employers from repurchasing shares until they adopt a $15-an-hour minimum wage. [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2018/11/15/business/bernie-sanders-walmart-minimum-wage/index.html) [(Market Watch)](https://www.marketwatch.com/story/bernie-sanders-rolls-out-stop-walmart-act-that-would-block-stock-buybacks-until-retailer-raises-pay-2018-11-15)

## International relations

*   [Killing of Jamal Khashoggi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Killing_of_Jamal_Khashoggi), [Foreign relations of Saudi Arabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foreign_relations_of_Saudi_Arabia)
    *   Saudi Arabia accuses five of its officials of killing and dismembering journalist [Jamal Khashoggi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jamal_Khashoggi). [(_Times Now_)](https://www.timesnownews.com/international/article/jamal-khashoggi-drugged-and-dismembered-in-consulate-admits-saudi-arabia/314621)
    *   The [Donald Trump administration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presidency_of_Donald_Trump) announces sanctions on 17 [Saudi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabia) officials, but not Crown Prince [Mohammad bin Salman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohammad_bin_Salman), for their alleged involvement in killing Khashoggi. [(ABC News)](https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/us-sanctions-17-saudis-allegedly-implicated-khashoggi-murder/story?id=59216650) [(Politico)](https://www.politico.com/story/2018/11/15/trump-administration-sanctions-saudi-khashoggi-992296)

## Politics and elections

*   [Cabinet of the United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cabinet_of_the_United_Kingdom), [Brexit negotiations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit_negotiations)
    *   [Minister of State for Northern Ireland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northern_Ireland_Office) [Shailesh Vara](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shailesh_Vara), [Secretary of State for Exiting the European Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secretary_of_State_for_Exiting_the_European_Union) [Dominic Raab](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dominic_Raab), and [Secretary of State for Work and Pensions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secretary_of_State_for_Work_and_Pensions) [Esther McVey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Esther_McVey) resign in protest of [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_the_United_Kingdom) [Theresa May](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theresa_May)'s Brexit plan. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-46219495) [(Bloomberg)](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-11-15/brexit-secretary-raab-quits-u-k-cabinet-in-severe-blow-to-may) [(_The Telegraph_)](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/politics/2018/11/15/exclusive-esther-mcvey-resigns-tells-theresa-may-brexit-deal/)
    *   A total of eight British government officials quit in one day, in response to the proposed Brexit deal. [(Evening Standard)](https://www.standard.co.uk/news/politics/brexit-resignations-latest-the-full-list-of-ministers-to-quit-so-far-over-theresa-mays-deal-a3990691.html)
    *   [Conservative Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conservative_Party_(UK)) [backbencher](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Backbencher) [Jacob Rees-Mogg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jacob_Rees-Mogg), with the backing of at least a dozen Tory MPs, says he will submit a letter to the chair of the [1922 Committee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1922_Committee), [Graham Brady](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graham_Brady), to trigger a [motion of no confidence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Motion_of_no_confidence) against Prime Minister [Theresa May](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theresa_May). [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2018/nov/15/jacob-rees-mogg-to-send-letter-of-no-confidence-in-may)

# 2018-11-16

## Business and economy

*   [Johnston Press](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Johnston_Press), which owns _[i](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/I_(newspaper))_, _[The Scotsman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Scotsman)_, the _[Yorkshire Post](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yorkshire_Post)_ and other [UK](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom) newspapers, enters administration after failing to secure a buyer. It is set to be de-listed on the [London Stock Exchange](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London_Stock_Exchange) on 19 November 2018. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/business/2018/nov/16/owner-of-the-scotsman-and-i-newspapers-enters-administration)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [2018 California wildfires](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_California_wildfires)
    *   The death toll in the [Camp Fire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Camp_Fire_(2018)) rises to 71, with the statewide total at 74. The number of missing and unaccounted-for people rises to more than 1000. [(CNN)](https://www-m.cnn.com/2018/11/16/us/california-fires/index.html)
*   At least 42 people have died while more than 20 others are injured in a deadly fire aboard a bus in [Zimbabwe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zimbabwe). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-46242382)
*   A total of eight people die when a strong wintry storm strikes the eastern [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States), causing tens of thousands of people to lose power. [(CNN)](https://edition-m.cnn.com/2018/11/16/us/snow-storm-northeast-southeast-wxc/index.html?r=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.it%2F)
*   Iran's [Social Security Organization](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Social_Security_Organization) chairman Mohammad Taghi Nourbakhsh and his deputy die after a car accident during a visit to [Gorgan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gorgan). [(Mehr News)](https://en.mehrnews.com/news/139648/Iran-Social-Security-Organization-head-his-deputy-die-in-car)
*   [Disappearance of ARA _San Juan_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Disappearance_of_ARA_San_Juan)
    *   The [Argentine Navy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentine_Navy) announces that [ARA _San Juan_ (S-42)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ARA_San_Juan_(S-42)), an [Argentine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentinia) submarine that disappeared on November 15, 2017, with 44 crew onboard, has been found on the seabed in the South [Atlantic Ocean](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atlantic_Ocean). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-latin-america-46245686)

## Law and crime

*   An unrelated court filing accidentally reveals that [Julian Assange](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Julian_Assange), a major target of the investigation into [Russia's interference in the 2016 United States election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_interference_in_the_2016_United_States_elections), has been charged. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/media/2018/nov/16/julian-assange-charged-in-secret-mistake-on-us-court-filing-suggests) [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2018/11/16/us/politics/julian-assange-indictment-wikileaks.html)

Kelly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Timothy_J._Kelly) orders the Secret Service to temporarily restore [Jim Acosta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jim_Acosta)'s White House press pass. ## Politics and elections

*   [Politics of the United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Politics_of_the_United_Kingdom)
    *   [British](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom) [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_the_United_Kingdom) [Theresa May](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theresa_May) appoints [Stephen Barclay](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephen_Barclay) as [Secretary of State for Exiting the European Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secretary_of_State_for_Exiting_the_European_Union), and [Amber Rudd](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amber_Rudd) as [Secretary of State for Work and Pensions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secretary_of_State_for_Work_and_Pensions) following yesterday's resignations of [Dominic Raab](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dominic_Raab) and [Esther McVey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Esther_McVey).     *   [Democratic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democratic_Party_(United_States)) gubernatorial candidate [Stacey Abrams](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stacey_Abrams) ends her campaign, acknowledging that [Brian Kemp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brian_Kemp) will be the next [Governor of Georgia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Georgia). ## Science and technology

*   The first genetic analysis of [hemimastigotes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hemimastigote) reveals they are distinct enough from other forms of life to be classified in a separate supra-kingdom. [(CBC)](https://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/hemimastigotes-supra-kingdom-1.4715823)
*   [Redefinition of SI base units](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Redefinition_of_SI_base_units)
    *   A new definition of [SI](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_System_of_Units) units, i.e., the kilogram, the ampère, etc., is decided by the [General Conference on Weights and Measures](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/General_Conference_on_Weights_and_Measures). They are now entirely defined by physical constants, and no longer dependent on any physical object, as was previously the case for the [kilogram](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kilogram#International_Prototype_of_the_Kilogram). [(National Physical Laboratory)](http://www.npl.co.uk/news/international-system-of-units-overhauled-in-historic-vote)

# 2018-11-18

## Disasters and accidents

*   [2018 California wildfires](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_California_wildfires)
    *   The number of structures destroyed in the [Woolsey Fire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Woolsey_Fire) rises to 1,452. [(Los Angeles Times)](http://www.latimes.com/local/california/la-me-california-fires-woolsey-hill-camp-california-fires-structures-destroyed-1542596522-htmlstory.html)

## Politics and elections

*   A planned [transgender rights](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transgender_rights) rally in [Kyiv](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyiv), [Ukraine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukraine), is attacked by far-right radicals. [(CBC News)](https://www.cbc.ca/news/world/ukraine-transgender-lgbt-far-righ-1.4910844)
*   [Central American migrant caravans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_American_migrant_caravans)
    *   Hundreds of residents take to the streets in the [Mexican](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico) city [Tijuana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tijuana), in protest of the arrival of thousands of migrants trying to get to the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-46256878)

## International relations

*   [APEC Papua New Guinea 2018](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/APEC_Papua_New_Guinea_2018)
    *   The [APEC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asia-Pacific_Economic_Cooperation) summit in [Papua New Guinea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Papua_New_Guinea) ends without a [communiqué](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Communiqu%C3%A9) for the first time in the forum's history. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-apec-summit-energy/apec-fails-to-reach-consensus-as-u-s-china-divide-deepens-idUSKCN1NN00M)

## Sports

*   [2018 ATP Finals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_ATP_Finals)
    *   In [tennis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tennis), [Alexander Zverev](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexander_Zverev) upsets [Novak Djokovic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Novak_Djokovic) 6–4, 6–3 to win his first ATP Finals title. [(ESPN)](http://www.espn.com/tennis/story/_/id/25312437/alexander-zverev-upsets-novak-djokovic-win-atp-finals-title)
*   [2018 NASCAR Cup Series](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_Monster_Energy_NASCAR_Cup_Series)
    *   In [motorsport](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Motorsport), [Joey Logano](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joey_Logano) wins the season finale, the [Ford EcoBoost 400](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ford_EcoBoost_400), to claim his first career Cup Series title. [(ESPN)](http://www.espn.com/racing/nascar/story/_/id/25315625/joey-logano-wins-homestead-claim-nascar-cup-series-championship)

# 2018-11-19

## Business and economy

*   [Nissan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nissan) chairman and former CEO [Carlos Ghosn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carlos_Ghosn) is arrested in [Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan) for breaching the country's financial trading laws, prompting Nissan to recommend that he and director Greg Kelly step down for misconduct. Ghosn is also the chairman and CEO of [Renault](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Renault). [(_The Irish Times_)](https://www.irishtimes.com/business/manufacturing/nissan-accuses-chairman-carlos-ghosn-of-misconduct-1.3702809)
*   The 930-kilometre (580 mi) offshore section of the [TurkStream](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TurkStream) gas pipeline, between [Russia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia) and [Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey), is completed. [(Bloomberg)](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-11-19/putin-s-gas-link-to-make-landfall-in-turkey-amid-u-s-opposition)
*   [David's Bridal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David%27s_Bridal) files for [Chapter 11 bankruptcy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chapter_11,_Title_11,_United_States_Code). [(_USA Today_)](https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2018/11/19/davids-bridal-bankruptcy/2053083002/)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [2018 Vietnam floods](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_Vietnam_floods)
    *   Landslides due to rains from a tropical storm have killed 13 people and left four others missing in south-central [Vietnam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vietnam). [(News24)](https://m.news24.com/World/News/landslides-kill-13-leave-4-missing-in-south-central-vietnam-20181119)

## Law and crime

*   [Watts family homicides](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Watts_family_homicides)
    *   Chris Watts of [Frederick, Colorado](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederick,_Colorado), is sentenced to three consecutive terms of life in prison without the possibility of parole for killing his pregnant wife Shanann and their two young daughters. [(CBS News)](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/chris-watts-sentencing-hearing-in-killings-of-young-daughters-pregnant-wife-shanann-watts-live-updates-today-2018-11-19/)
*   [Mercy Hospital shooting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mercy_Hospital_shooting)
    *   A shooting takes place at [Mercy Hospital](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mercy_Hospital_and_Medical_Center) in [Chicago](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicago), leaving four dead, including the gunman. [(ABC)](https://abcnews.go.com/US/multiple-victims-injured-shooting-chicago-hospital-police/story?id=59301252)
*   _[CNN v. Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CNN_v._Trump)_
    *   [CNN](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CNN) drops its lawsuit against the [Trump administration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presidency_of_Donald_Trump) after the White House restores reporter [Jim Acosta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jim_Acosta)'s press pass. [(_The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/style/cnn-drops-suit-against-white-house-after-acostas-press-pass-is-fully-restored/2018/11/19/519763fc-ec3a-11e8-8679-934a2b33be52_story.html?utm_term=.74c2bd78de6e)
    *   The White House also issues a set of four guidelines reporters must follow at press conferences to avoid further press pass revocations. [(ABC News)](https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/white-house-jim-acostas-press-pass-cnn-seeks/story?id=59291734)
*   [List of executive actions by Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_executive_actions_by_Donald_Trump)
    *   A federal judge blocks an order by President Trump that denies asylum to illegal immigrants. [(_The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2018/11/20/blow-trumps-immigration-agenda-federal-judge-blocks-asylum-ban-migrants-who-enter-illegally-mexico/?utm_term=.85d0b52b2295)

## Science and technology

*   [Exploration of Mars](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exploration_of_Mars)
    *   [NASA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NASA) selects [Jezero](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jezero_(crater)) crater on [Mars](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mars) as the landing site for the [Mars 2020](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mars_2020) [rover](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mars_rover). The crater was once a large [lake](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lake) and may hold evidence of [ancient life](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Astrobiology). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-46264383)

## Sports

*   [2018 NFL season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_NFL_season)
    *   The [Los Angeles Rams](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Los_Angeles_Rams) defeat the [Kansas City Chiefs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kansas_City_Chiefs) 54-51 on [Monday Night Football](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monday_Night_Football) in the [third-highest scoring NFL game](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_highest_scoring_NFL_games) in history. [(The Guardian)](https://amp.theguardian.com/sport/2018/nov/20/la-rams-kansas-city-chiefs-score-monday-night-football)

# 2018-11-20

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [War in Afghanistan (2001–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_in_Afghanistan_(2001%E2%80%93present))
    *   At least 50 people are killed and 83 others wounded in a suicide bombing on a [Mawlid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mawlid) gathering in [Kabul](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kabul), [Afghanistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghanistan). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-46273612)
*   A policeman is stabbed near the Grand Place in [Brussels](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brussels) historic centre by a man carrying a knife. The attacker was shot and wounded with non-life threatening injuries. [(ABCNEWS)](https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/policeman-stabbed-brussels-attacker-shot-59309779)

## Disasters and accidents

*   One person is killed and six others are injured after a train derails due to a landslide in the [Catalonian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catalonia) town of [Vacarisses](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vacarisses), [Province of Barcelona](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Province_of_Barcelona). [(CNN)](https://edition-m.cnn.com/2018/11/20/europe/barcelona-train-derailment-intl/index.html)

## International relations

*   The general assembly of [Interpol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interpol) elects [Vanuatu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vanuatu) and [Kiribati](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kiribati) as new members, but not [Kosovo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kosovo). [(_The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/national/kosovos-application-for-interpol-membership-rejected/2018/11/20/f6a70dc8-ecaf-11e8-8b47-bd0975fd6199_story.html)
*   [Poland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poland) and [Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel) join [Bulgaria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bulgaria), the [Czech Republic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Czech_Republic), [Croatia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Croatia), [Hungary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hungary), [Australia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia) and [Austria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Austria) in announcing that, despite their agreement in July, they will not sign the [United Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations) [Global Compact for Migration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Global_Compact_for_Migration) in [Marrakech](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marrakech) on 10–11 December 2018. [(Fox News)](https://www.foxnews.com/world/the-latest-poland-withdraws-from-global-migration-pact) [(Yeni Safak)](https://www.yenisafak.com/en/world/polands-government-rejects-un-migration-pact-3466921) [(_Jerusalem Post_)](https://www.jpost.com/Israel-News/Israel-joins-US-and-European-countries-in-pulling-out-of-migration-pact-572361)
*   [Erik Solheim](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erik_Solheim) resigns as head of the [United Nations Environment Programme](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_Environment_Programme) over allegations of expenses abuse and a lack of accountability. [(BBC News)](https://www.bbc.com/news/science-environment-46281051)
*   [North Korea–South Korea relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Korea%E2%80%93South_Korea_relations)
    *   [North Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Korea) blows up ten of its front-line guard posts in the [Korean Demilitarized Zone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korean_Demilitarized_Zone) (DMZ) in accordance with agreements made with [South Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korea) earlier this year. [(ABC News)](https://abcnews.go.com/International/north-korea-detonates-dmz-guard-posts-southern-border/story?id=59314370)

## Law and crime

*   [Nikola Gruevski](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nikola_Gruevski), former [Prime Minister of Macedonia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Macedonia), says he is granted political asylum in [Hungary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hungary) after he fled his [home country](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republic_of_Macedonia) last week to avoid a two-and-a-half-year jail sentence for corruption. [(_The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/europe/report-hungary-grants-asylum-to-former-macedonian-leader/2018/11/20/829acc40-ecd1-11e8-8b47-bd0975fd6199_story.html) [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/nov/20/anti-asylum-orban-makes-exception-for-a-friend-in-need)

## Politics and elections

*   Disgruntled police officers and [soldiers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Papua_New_Guinea_Defence_Force) storm the [National Parliament of Papua New Guinea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Parliament_of_Papua_New_Guinea) due to unpaid allowances related to the [APEC Papua New Guinea 2018](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/APEC_Papua_New_Guinea_2018) conference last weekend. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/nov/20/papua-new-guinea-parliament-in-lockdown-after-soldiers-attack-building)
*   The [European Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Union) reaches a provisional agreement on a system to investigate [foreign investments](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foreign_direct_investment) into Europe. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-eu-china-investment/eu-reaches-provisional-deal-on-screening-foreign-investments-idUSKCN1NP1IJ)
*   [Gilets jaunes protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gilets_jaunes_protests)
    *   [France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France)'s "Yellow Vest" protests over [fuel taxes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fuel_tax) enter their fourth day as around 10,000 people continue to block roads around the country. [(The Local)](https://www.thelocal.fr/20181120/latest-yellow-vest-fuel-protests-enter-fourth-day-as-french-government-stands-firm)
*   [Ivanka Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ivanka_Trump), elder daughter of U.S. President [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump), is found to have used a private e-mail account to handle government business e-mails. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-46271021)

# 2018-11-21

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [War in Afghanistan (2001–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_in_Afghanistan_(2001%E2%80%93present))
    *   The death toll in the suicide bomb attack at a gathering of religious scholars in [Kabul](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kabul) rises to 55. [(Reuters)](https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-afghanistan-blast/afghans-try-to-identify-group-behind-attack-on-clerics-toll-climbs-to-55-idUKKCN1NQ0JI)
*   [Yemeni Civil War (2015–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yemeni_Civil_War_(2015%E2%80%93present))
    *   A report by charity [Save the Children](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Save_the_Children) estimates that 85,000 children died of starvation as a result of the war. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/nov/21/yemen-young-children-dead-starvation-disease-save-the-children)

## Disasters and accidents

*   One person is killed and five people are injured in an auto wreck on New York City's [Brooklyn Bridge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brooklyn_Bridge), which sparked a fire that engulfed three vehicles. [(ABC News)](https://abcnews.go.com/amp/US/wireStory/vehicles-catch-fire-brooklyn-bridge-crash-59338260) [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2018/11/21/nyregion/brooklyn-bridge-fire.html)

## Law and crime

*   A 27-year-old [American](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) [Christian missionary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christian_mission) is killed upon landing on [North Sentinel Island](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Sentinel_Island) in an effort to convert the indigenous [Sentinelese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sentinelese) people. He is the first person killed by the isolated islanders since two [Indian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/India) nationals in 2006. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-46286215)
*   [Matthew Hedges](/w/index.php?title=Matthew_Hedges&action=edit&redlink=1), a [British](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/British_people) academic student studying at [Durham University](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Durham_University), is sentenced to life imprisonment in the [United Arab Emirates](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Arab_Emirates) after being accused of spying. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-46288510) [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/nov/21/british-academic-matthew-hedges-accused-of-spying-jailed-for-life-in-uae)

## Politics and elections

*   [2018 Iranian general strikes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_Iranian_general_strikes)
    *   Workers of the [Haft Tappeh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haft_Tappeh) sugar mill company in the ancient city of [Shush](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shush,_Iran), southwest Iran, continued their strike and protests to the unpaid salaries for the 15th consecutive day. [(Al Arabiya)](https://english.alarabiya.net/en/features/2018/11/21/Largescale-strikes-protests-continue-in-Iran-s-ancient-city-of-Shush-.html)
*   [Interpol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interpol) elects South Korean [Kim Jong-yang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kim_Jong-yang) as its president, beating Russian candidate [Alexander Prokopchuk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexander_Prokopchuk). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-46286959)
*   [Chief Justice of the United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chief_Justice_of_the_United_States) [John Roberts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Roberts) replies to [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) who described the judge who ruled on Monday against his migrant asylum order as an "Obama judge." [(Associated Press)](https://www.apnews.com/c4b34f9639e141069c08cf1e3deb6b84)
*   [Kosovo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kosovo) puts a 100% trade tariff on all goods imported from [Serbia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serbia) and [Bosnia and Herzegovina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bosnia_and_Herzegovina). The [European Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Union) says this is a "clear violation" of the [Central European Free Trade Agreement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_European_Free_Trade_Agreement). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-46287975)

## Sports

*   [World Chess Championship 2018](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Chess_Championship_2018)
    *   After nine consecutive draws, a record for the 132-year-old championship, [Magnus Carlsen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magnus_Carlsen) and [Fabiano Caruana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fabiano_Caruana) are tied 4½ points each in the best-of-12-games match. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2018/nov/21/world-chess-championship-game-9-carlsen-caruana)

# 2018-11-22

## Arts and culture

*   The [Leaning Tower of Pisa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leaning_Tower_of_Pisa) Surveillance Group reports the structure is leaning less, by 4 cm (1.6 in) over the past two decades. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-46300789)

## Disasters and accidents

*   A 500-kilometre-wide (310 mi) dust storm, that engulfed parts of [Australia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia)’s outback, reaches [Sydney](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sydney). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-australia-46298309) [(_Irish Times_)](https://www.irishtimes.com/news/world/asia-pacific/dust-storm-hits-sydney-sparking-public-health-warnings-1.3706680)

## International relations

*   [Foreign relations of Denmark](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foreign_relations_of_Denmark)
    *   Denmark suspends future weapons export licenses to [Saudi Arabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabia) in response to the [killing of Jamal Khashoggi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Killing_of_Jamal_Khashoggi) and the [Saudi Arabian–led intervention in Yemen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabian%E2%80%93led_intervention_in_Yemen). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-saudi-khashoggi-denmark/denmark-suspends-weapon-export-approvals-to-saudi-over-khashoggi-yemen-idUSKCN1NR0G6)
*   [Brexit negotiations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit_negotiations)
    *   [President of the European Council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_European_Council) [Donald Tusk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Tusk) says there is agreement "in principle" on a political deal that can be endorsed at an [EU summit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_European_Council_meetings). [(RTÉ)](https://www.rte.ie/news/brexit/2018/1122/1012555-brexit/)
*   The [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) urges their allies not to use [Huawei](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Huawei) network equipment, reportedly out of national security concerns. [(The Hill)](https://thehill.com/policy/technology/418000-us-urging-allies-to-drop-chinas-huawei-report)

## Law and crime

*   [2017 Jewish Community Center bomb threats](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2017_Jewish_Community_Center_bomb_threats)
    *   An Israeli-American man, Michael Ron David Kadar, is sentenced to 10 years in prison in Israel for making 2,000 hoax bomb threats that forced evacuations of Jewish community centers in the United States. The threats, made by phone and email in 2016 and 2017, helped to raise concerns about rising antisemitism in the United States. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/israel-crime-threats/us-israeli-man-sentenced-in-israel-over-global-bomb-threats-idUSL8N1XX2MS)
*   Chinese state media report that five people are killed and 18 others are injured after a car plowed into children outside a primary school in [Huludao](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Huludao), [Liaoning](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liaoning), [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China). [(_Toronto Star_)](https://www.thestar.com/news/world/2018/11/22/children-hurt-by-vehicle-outside-of-school-chinese-state-media-reports.html)
*   [Me Too movement in South Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Me_Too_movement#South_Korea)
    *   [Lee Jae-rock](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jaerock_Lee), a [South Korean](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korea) pastor and leader of [Manmin Central Church](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manmin_Central_Church), is sentenced to 15 years in prison over 42 counts of sexual harassment and sexual assault against eight of his followers. According to the [Seoul](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seoul) Central District Court, the victims could not resist his advances "due to their absolute faith in the infallibility of the accused." [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2018/11/22/asia/lee-jae-rock-pastor-indicted-intl/index.html)

## Science and technology

*   [Global warming](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Global_warming)
    *   The [World Meteorological Organization](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Meteorological_Organization) reports that average [global carbon dioxide concentrations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carbon_dioxide_in_Earth%27s_atmosphere) rose to 405.5 [parts per million](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parts-per_notation) in 2017. They say this level was not seen since at least 3 million years ago. [(Associated Press)](https://apnews.com/a2f10b10adcb47599158c7d912e7a308)

## Sports

*   [World Chess Championship 2018](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Chess_Championship_2018)
    *   After ten consecutive draws, a record for the 132-year-old championship, [Magnus Carlsen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magnus_Carlsen) and [Fabiano Caruana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fabiano_Caruana) are tied 5 points each in the best-of-12-games match. # 2018-11-23

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [2018 Karachi Chinese consulate attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_Karachi_Chinese_consulate_attack)
    *   Four people are killed in an armed assault on the [Chinese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China) consulate in [Karachi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karachi), [Pakistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pakistan). Three attackers are also dead. The attack is claimed by the [Balochistan Liberation Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Balochistan_Liberation_Army). [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2018/11/23/asia/karachi-chinese-consulate-attack-intl/index.html)
*   [2018 Orakzai bombing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_Orakzai_bombing)
    *   An explosion kills at least 35 people and wounds at least 55 at a market in [Kalaya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kalaya), [Khyber Pakhtunkhwa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khyber_Pakhtunkhwa), northern [Pakistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pakistan). [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2018/11/pakistan-deadly-blast-hits-market-orakzai-district-181123072104727.html)
*   [War in Afghanistan (2001–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_in_Afghanistan_(2001%E2%80%93present))
    *   At least 26 Afghan security forces are killed and 50 are wounded by a suicide blast in a mosque inside an army base in [Khost Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khost_Province), [Afghanistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghanistan). [(Reuters via _U.S. News & World Report_)](https://www.usnews.com/news/world/articles/2018-11-23/at-least-26-killed-in-a-blast-in-mosque-in-afghanistan-officials)
*   Witnesses say that gunmen in pickup trucks attacked a police station in [Tazirbu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tazirbu), southeast [Libya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libya). At least five people were killed and several civilians were abducted. [(AP via WETM TV18)](https://www.mytwintiers.com/news/reports-gunmen-kill-at-least-5-in-southeast-libya/1614624665)

## Law and crime

*   [Khadim Hussain Rizvi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khadim_Hussain_Rizvi), chief of [Pakistani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pakistan) [political party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_political_parties_in_Pakistan) [Tehreek-e-Labbaik Pakistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tehreek-e-Labbaik_Pakistan) (TLP), together with his party leaders, is arrested after TLP's refusal to postpone their call for a public rally planned for 25 November at [Liaqat Bagh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liaqat_National_Bagh), Rawalpindi. Pakistan's [Federal Minister for Information and Broadcasting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ministry_of_Information,_Broadcasting_and_National_Heritage_(Pakistan)) [Fawad Chaudhry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fawad_Chaudhry) clarifies that the action has no connection with the [Asia Bibi case](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asia_Bibi_blasphemy_case). [(_Dawn_)](https://www.dawn.com/news/1447217/), [(_Pakistan Today_)](https://www.pakistantoday.com.pk/2018/11/23/crackdown-against-tlp-begins-several-arrested/)

## Politics and elections

*   [2018 Sri Lankan constitutional crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_Sri_Lankan_constitutional_crisis)
    *   Lawmakers opposed to [Mahinda Rajapaksa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mahinda_Rajapaksa) as [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Sri_Lanka) win a vote for control of a new 13-member [parliamentary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parliament_of_Sri_Lanka) main committee. [(AP via WSFA)](https://www.wsfa.com/2018/11/23/amazon-staff-europe-protest-coincide-with-black-friday/) [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-amazon-com-strikes-germany/amazon-workers-strike-in-germany-spain-on-black-friday-idUSKCN1NS1AU)
*   The [London](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London) [Metropolitan Police Service](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_Police_Service) releases video footage of police cars being driven into suspected criminals on scooters. They say the tactic isn't new. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-london-46321720)

# 2018-11-24

## Armed conflicts and attacks

    *   [Syrian state](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syria) media report that more than 50 civilians are injured in a suspected [poison gas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poison_gas) attack by [Syrian rebels](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_rebels) on [Aleppo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aleppo). [(_The Sydney Morning Herald_)](https://www.smh.com.au/world/middle-east/syria-accuses-rebels-of-poison-gas-attack-in-aleppo-20181125-p50i6d.html)

*   [Traffic accidents in India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Traffic_accidents_in_India)
    *   A bus crash in [Karnataka](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karnataka), [India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/India), leaves at least 25 people dead as the vehicle sinks into a canal. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/nov/24/schoolchildren-among-the-dead-in-indian-bus-crash)
*   At least 29 people died after a cruise boat carrying party revellers capsized on [Lake Victoria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lake_Victoria), [Uganda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uganda). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-46334275)

## International relations

*   [Brexit negotiations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit_negotiations)
    *   The [Spanish government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_Spain) and the [UK government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_the_United_Kingdom) reach an agreement on [Gibraltar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibraltar) whereby Spain lifts its threat of boycotting Sunday's summit on Brexit. [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Spain) [Pedro Sánchez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pedro_S%C3%A1nchez_(politician)) says there are now "sufficient guarantees" that any future decisions regarding Gibraltar would be made with Spain. [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/reuters/2018/11/24/world/europe/24reuters-britain-eu-gibraltar.html) [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/britain-eu-sanchez/spains-sanchez-confirms-deal-reached-over-gibraltar-idUSL8N1XZ0BS)
*   [Mexico–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico%E2%80%93United_States_relations)
    *   U.S. President [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) announces that migrants seeking asylum at the southern border will wait in Mexico while their claims are processed in U.S. courts. Mexico's incoming foreign minister [Marcelo Ebrard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marcelo_Ebrard) denies an agreement has been reached, and says "(no) specific proposal" has been received from the United States. [Andrés Manuel López Obrador](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andr%C3%A9s_Manuel_L%C3%B3pez_Obrador)'s administration will take power next Saturday, December 1. [(_USA Today_)](https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2018/11/24/u-s-mexican-government-reach-deal-handling-asylum-seekers-report/2101037002/) [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-46333119)

## Politics and elections

*   [Politics of Taiwan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Politics_of_Taiwan)
    *   [Taiwanese President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_Republic_of_China) [Tsai Ing-wen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsai_Ing-wen) resigns as [leader of the Democratic Progressives](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_leaders_of_the_Democratic_Progressive_Party) and refuses [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Premier_of_the_Republic_of_China) [William Lai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Lai)'s offer to quit after a major defeat in [local elections](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taiwanese_local_elections,_2018). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-taiwan-politics-president/taiwan-president-resigns-as-ruling-party-chairwoman-after-election-defeats-idUSKCN1NT0HO) [(Associated Press)](https://www.apnews.com/bfe77bf1843947e58c26c40897f8762d)
    *   [Same-sex marriage in Taiwan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Same-sex_marriage_in_Taiwan)
        *   Referendum voters in Taiwan reject [a proposal to allow same-sex marriage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_Taiwanese_referendum). A March 2017 [Constitutional Court](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Judicial_Yuan) ruling found the ban on these unions unconstitutional and ordered parliament to change the law within two years. Earlier, the government said the results of this vote would not affect its complying with the court's decision. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-46329877)
*   [_Gilets jaunes_ protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gilets_jaunes_protests)
    *   Violent clashes between [French](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France) police and protesters last well into the night on the [Champs Elysees](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Champs_Elysees) in [Paris](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paris) over rising fuel taxes. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-france-protests/french-police-clash-violently-with-protesters-on-champs-elysees-over-petrol-costs-idUSKCN1NS2EC)
*   [United Kingdom national security](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_security#United_Kingdom), [Russia-United Kingdom relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia-United_Kingdom_relations)
    *   The [British Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/British_Army) [Chief of the General Staff](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chief_of_the_General_Staff_(United_Kingdom)), [Mark Carleton-Smith](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mark_Carleton-Smith), says [Russia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia) is a "far greater threat" to the United Kingdom's national security than the [Islamic State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_State_of_Iraq_and_the_Levant). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-46327046)

## Sports

*   [World Chess Championship 2018](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Chess_Championship_2018)
    *   After eleven consecutive draws, a record for the 132-year-old championship, [Magnus Carlsen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magnus_Carlsen) and [Fabiano Caruana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fabiano_Caruana) are tied 5.5 points each in the best-of-12-games match. # 2018-12-31

## Armed conflicts and attacks

The attacker shouted "Allah" during the attack. The attack is being treated as a terror-related incident, police have confirmed, and due to concerns over his mental health, the suspect is being held under the Mental Health Act. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-manchester-46728702)

## Disasters and accidents

[(Stuff.co.nz)](https://www.stuff.co.nz/world/asia/109671504/flooding-in-the-philippines-leaves-56-dead) [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/dec/31/death-toll--philippine-storm-usman-devastating)
*   [2018 Magnitogorsk building collapse](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_Magnitogorsk_building_collapse)

## International relations

*   [Russia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia)'s [FSB](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Security_Service) state security agency says it has arrested a U.S. citizen "caught spying" in [Moscow](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moscow).     *   Joining several other democrats in the race, [Senator](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Senate) [Elizabeth Warren](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elizabeth_Warren) of [Massachusetts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Massachusetts) announces the formation of a presidential [exploratory committee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exploratory_committee) for running in the 2020 presidential election.
