# 2019-01-01

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [War in Afghanistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_in_Afghanistan)
    *   The [Taliban](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taliban) kill 27 security forces in a series of coordinated attacks in northern Afghanistan. They refuse to sit down with [Afghan officials](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_Afghanistan) about peace in the country after the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) announced last month that they would withdraw about half of their 14,000 troops. [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/01/01/world/asia/afghanistan-attacks-taliban.html)
*   [War in North-West Pakistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_in_North-West_Pakistan)
    *   [Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tehrik-i-Taliban_Pakistan) gunmen attack a security base in the [Loralai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loralai) area of [Pakistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pakistan), resulting in the deaths of four security guards and four terrorists, including a [suicide bomber](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suicide_attack). Two guards were also injured in the attack. [(Channel NewsAsia)](https://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/asia/gunmen-attack-security-base-in-pakistan-s-balochistan-province-11078440)

## Law and crime

*   [2019 Tokyo car attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Tokyo_car_attack)
    *   A car plows into New Year's celebrators in [Tokyo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tokyo), injuring eight. A ninth person was assaulted by the driver after he got out of the vehicle. Police believe the incident to be intentional. [(Global News)](https://globalnews.ca/news/4805677/tokyo-car-hits-pedestrians-new-years/) [(ChannelNewsAsia)](https://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/asia/9-hurt-as-car-rams-into-crowd-at-famed-tokyo-street-on-new-year-11077634)
*   [Bottrop and Essen car attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bottrop_and_Essen_car_attack)
    *   Five people are injured after a man intentionally drives a car into multiple crowds of people in the cities of [Bottrop](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bottrop) and [Essen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Essen), [Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany). Police say the incident appears to be a xenophobic far-right attack. [(_The Independent_)](https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/germany-car-attack-far-right-crowd-injured-syrian-afgan-bottrop-a8706546.html)
*   Armed men believed to be traditional hunters have killed at least 37 people in an attack on a village in central [Mali](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mali). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-46732703)
*   A [Thai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thai_people) man kills six members of his family before killing himself in a drunken shooting spree. [(RT)](https://www.rt.com/newsline/447866-thailand-new-year-rampage/)
*   [Same-sex marriage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Same-sex_marriage_in_Austria) becomes legal in [Austria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Austria). [(ABC News)](https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/austrian-women-celebrate-countrys-sex-marriage-60104054)
*   [Intersex rights in Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intersex_rights_in_Germany)
    *   A law recognising a [third gender](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Third_gender) that can be administered for [intersex people](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intersex_people) takes effect in [Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-46727611)

## Politics and elections

*   [Jair Bolsonaro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jair_Bolsonaro) is inaugurated as the 38th [President of Brazil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Brazil), succeeding [Michel Temer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michel_Temer). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-46720899)
*   [Patrick M. Shanahan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patrick_M._Shanahan) becomes acting [United States Secretary of Defense](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Secretary_of_Defense) following the resignation of [Jim Mattis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jim_Mattis). [(_New York Post_)](https://nypost.com/2019/01/01/patrick-shanahan-issues-first-memo-as-acting-defense-secretary/)
*   [2018 Democratic Republic of the Congo general election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_Democratic_Republic_of_the_Congo_general_election)
    *   U.S. and EU diplomats urge the Congolese government to restore internet connection to the country after it was shut down the previous day amid fears of election fraud. [(The Guardian)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/jan/01/drc-electoral-fears-rise-as-internet-shutdown-continues)
*   [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._President) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) requests a bipartisan meeting with lawmakers to discuss border security as a [partial government shutdown](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_federal_government_shutdown_of_2018%E2%80%932019) enters its second week. [(MPR News)](https://www.mprnews.org/story/2019/01/01/trump-invites-top-lawmakers-for-talks-as-shutdown-continues?fbclid=IwAR1YRs78X_IjfPg9M_ATRF9oVcF6YT3BbHk3cMCnDPXCTRsUcMDcXt-_j20)

## Science and technology

*   [2019 in spaceflight](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_in_spaceflight)
    *   _[New Horizons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Horizons)_ makes a flyby of Kuiper belt object [2014 MU69](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_MU69), nicknamed Ultima Thule, at 05:33 UTC. It is a [contact binary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Contact_binary_(small_Solar_System_body%29). # 2019-01-02

## Business and economy

*   [China–United States trade war (2018–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China%E2%80%93United_States_trade_war_(2018%E2%80%93present%29)
    *   American electronics maker [Apple](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple_(company%29) warns that [iPhone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IPhone) sales are slowing significantly and the product is in weak demand, blaming trade tensions with [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China). The company says that it has lowered its expected fiscal earnings for the first quarter as a result, citing disappointing holiday sales figures, and that it could lose $9 billion due to the decline. [(The Verge)](https://www.theverge.com/2019/1/2/18165804/apple-iphone-sales-weak-demand-tim-cook-letter-revised-q1-estimate)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [Great Belt Bridge rail accident](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Great_Belt_Bridge_rail_accident)
    *   An [express train](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Express_train) crashes into an object dropped from a cargo train on the [Great Belt Bridge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Great_Belt_Bridge) between [Funen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Funen) and [Zealand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zealand) in [Denmark](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Denmark), killing at least eight people and leaving several injured. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-46745652)

## Politics and elections

*   [United States federal government shutdown of 2018–2019](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_federal_government_shutdown_of_2018%E2%80%932019)
    *   On the last day of the [115th United States Congress](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/115th_United_States_Congress), Democratic leaders [Nancy Pelosi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nancy_Pelosi), [Chuck Schumer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chuck_Schumer), and others meet with President [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) at the [White House](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White_House) to discuss implementing a new [budget agreement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_United_States_federal_budget) that may include funding for a new [Mexico–United States barrier](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico%E2%80%93United_States_barrier) that could end the current federal government shutdown. [(CNBC)](https://www.cnbc.com/2019/01/02/pelosi-schumer-go-to-white-house-as-shutdown-over-trump-border-wall-persists.html)
    *   President Trump and congressional leaders fail to resolve their political differences over federal funding for [the border barrier](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico%E2%80%93United_States_barrier), with Pelosi stating that the president will receive "nothing for the wall" from her party. [(Politico)](https://www.politico.com/story/2019/01/02/trump-congress-meeting-shutdown-1077466) [(The Hill)](https://thehill.com/homenews/house/423596-pelosi-on-negotiations-with-trump-nothing-for-the-wall)
*   [Indigenous territories of Brazil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indigenous_territory_(Brazil%29)
    *   [President of Brazil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Brazil) [Jair Bolsonaro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jair_Bolsonaro) issues a decree to place the responsibility for "identification, delimitation, demarcation and registration of lands traditionally occupied by indigenous people" at the [Ministry of Agriculture](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ministry_of_Agriculture_(Brazil%29), instead of the Indian affairs agency [FUNAI](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Funda%C3%A7%C3%A3o_Nacional_do_%C3%8Dndio). The management of [public forests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/State_forest_(Brazil%29) also goes to the agriculture ministry. The move is seen as a big win for the industrial [agribusiness](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agribusiness) lobby. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-brazil-politics-agriculture/brazil-farm-lobby-wins-as-bolsonaro-grabs-control-over-indigenous-lands-idUSKCN1OW0OS)

    *   [President of the National Assembly of Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_National_Assembly_of_Venezuela), [Juan Guaidó](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Guaid%C3%B3), declares a State of Emergency as the country enters a "_[de facto](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/De_facto)_ [dictatorship](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dictatorship)". More than 120 million [Hindu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hindu) devotees, as well as tourists, are expected. [(The Guardian)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/jan/15/kumbh-mela-hindus-converge-for-largest-ever-human-gathering-prayagraj-festival)

[(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/video/2019/01/15/north-korean-officials-may-visit-us-this?videoId=503733548&videoChannel=117760&channelName=World+News) [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/01/north-korea-hold-talks-week-nuclear-impasse-190115055218069.html)

## Science and technology

*   The correction of the [North Magnetic Pole](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Magnetic_Pole) model, one year ahead of the regular five-year update, scheduled to be released this week is delayed until the end of January because of the [U.S. federal government shutdown](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_federal_government_shutdown_of_2018%E2%80%932019). The model is used in navigation and by the [GPS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Global_Positioning_System) systems in smartphones. The pole has been wandering, much faster than expected, away from the [Canadian Arctic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northern_Canada) toward [Siberia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siberia). [(UPI)](https://www.upi.com/Science_News/2019/01/14/Magnetic-Norths-erratic-behavior-forces-update-to-global-navigation-system/1611547434485/) [(_M.I.T. Technology Review_)](https://www.technologyreview.com/the-download/612758/the-magnetic-north-pole-is-messing-with-your-smartphones-mapping-apps/) [(_The Maritime Executive_)](https://maritime-executive.com/article/magnetic-north-pole-shifting-rapidly-and-unpredicatably)

This is the first time that [United States Armed Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Armed_Forces) servicemembers have not been paid during a shutdown or other lapse in government appropriation.     *   A massive explosion targetting a [Tahrir al-Sham](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tahrir_al-Sham) base in [Idlib](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idlib) kills 15 people and wounds 20 others.     *   [Al Shabaab](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Shabaab_(militant_group)) claims they killed over 57 [Ethiopian troops](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethiopian_National_Defense_Force) in an [ambush](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ambush) in [Somalia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Somalia). [Ethiopian troops](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethiopian_National_Defense_Force) rejects that claim. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-thailand-south/gunmen-kill-two-buddhist-monks-in-thailands-troubled-south-idUSKCN1PC26B)
*   [Colombian armed conflict](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colombian_armed_conflict)

# 2019-01-30

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   A [grenade](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grenade) is lobbed in a [Zamboanga](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zamboanga_City) [mosque](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mosque) in the [Philippines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines), killing two people and injuring four others. No group has claimed responsibility. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/01/southern-philippines-mosque-hit-deadly-grenade-attack-190130004852265.html)

## Business and economy

*   [Foxconn's Wisconsin plant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foxconn%27s_Wisconsin_plant)
    *   [Taiwanese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taiwan) manufacturer [Foxconn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foxconn) announces that the company is reconsidering their plan to manufacture [LCD](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liquid-crystal_display) panels in a promised [Wisconsin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wisconsin) plant because of a changed global marketplace, and the high cost of [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) labor. Foxconn said, earlier in January, that it still planned to create 13,000 jobs in Wisconsin. The State of Wisconsin pledged subsidies worth more than $3bn. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/business-47062142) [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-foxconn-wisconsin-exclusive-idUSKCN1PO0FV)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [January 2019 North American cold wave](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/January_2019_North_American_cold_wave)
    *   Several hundred flights are cancelled in [Chicago](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicago) amidst an extreme cold wave bringing temperatures of −22 °F (−30 °C) to the region. [Amtrak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amtrak) has also cancelled services. [(WBBM-TV)](https://chicago.cbslocal.com/video/4019067-cbs-2-weather-watch-10-pm-1-29-19/) [(NBC News)](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/weather/relief-coming-blast-chilled-midwest-not-until-after-another-record-n965136)
    *   Ten deaths have been reported across the midwest due to the record breaking low temperatures. [(NBC News)](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/weather/relief-coming-blast-chilled-midwest-not-until-after-another-record-n965136)
*   Two overcrowded boats carrying migrants capsize off the coast of [Djibouti](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Djibouti), leaving at least 28 people dead and over 130 others missing, according to the [International Organization for Migration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Organization_for_Migration). [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2019/jan/30/djibouti-130-migrants-feared-dead-after-two-boats-overturn)

## International relations

*   [Canada–Cuba relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canada%E2%80%93Cuba_relations), [Havana syndrome](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Havana_syndrome)
    *   [Canada](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canada) announces that it will withdraw half of its embassy staff in [Cuba](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cuba) following the fourteenth confirmed illness since 2017 of a Canadian diplomat in the country. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/amp/world-us-canada-47066652)

## Science and technology

*   [Cancer research](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cancer_research)
    *   An [Israeli](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel) team of scientists claim to have developed a cure for cancer. This claim is criticized by other scientists, who say it is likely faked. [(Times of Israel)](https://www.timesofisrael.com/israelis-claiming-cancer-cure-say-they-cant-afford-to-publish-findings/)

[Italian Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_Prime_Minister) [Giuseppe Conte](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Giuseppe_Conte) blames the recession on external factors, including trade tensions between the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) and [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China).     *   [Colombian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colombians), [Spanish](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spaniards) and [French](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/French_people) journalists are arrested and detained by [SEBIN](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SEBIN) agents in [Caracas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caracas). All four work for Spanish [news agency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/News_agency) [EFE](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/EFE). The arrests follow the [deportation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deportation) of two [Chilean](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chile) journalists yesterday. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-venezuela-politics-france/venezuela-detains-colombian-spanish-french-journalists-idUSKCN1PO2FJ?il=0)

[(_Asia News_)](http://www.asianews.it/news-en/Abdullah-of-Pahang-is-Malaysia%E2%80%99s-newly-elected-king-46059.html)

## Politics and elections

*   [Crisis in Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crisis_in_Venezuela), [2019 Venezuelan presidential crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Venezuelan_presidential_crisis)
    *   Venezuela's [Nicolás Maduro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicol%C3%A1s_Maduro) supports a proposal by the [2017 Constituent National Assembly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2017_Constituent_National_Assembly) to hold [early legislative elections](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Next_Venezuelan_parliamentary_election), which is seen as an attempt to eliminate the threat posed by the [opposition](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democratic_Unity_Roundtable)-controlled [National Assembly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Assembly_(Venezuela)). [U.S. Vice President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vice_President_of_the_United_States) [Mike Pence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mike_Pence) tells a [Florida](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Florida) rally that the time for dialogue "had ended" and "all options were on the table." [(RTE)](https://www.rte.ie/news/world/2019/0202/1027078-venezuela/)
    *   [Venezuelan Air Force](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venezuelan_Air_Force) general Francisco Yáñez becomes the first high-ranking general to publicly support [Juan Guaidó](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Guaid%C3%B3) after he denounced the "dictatorship" of Maduro and recognized Guaidó's claim as the nation's legitimate leader. [(Fox News)](https://www.foxnews.com/world/top-venezuela-general-rejects-maduros-legitimacy-throws-support-behind-interim-president)
    *   Hundreds of thousands of Venezuelan people take to the streets to protest socio-economic and political situation of the country and to demand a better economic situation. Large competing anti-Maduro and anti-Guaidó rallies are held in [Caracas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caracas). [(The Washington Post)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/the_americas/venezuela-protests-guaido-vs-maduro/2019/02/02/ef043b00-2660-11e9-b5b4-1d18dfb7b084_story.html?utm_term=.887de157eb3d)
*   [Governor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Governor_of_Virginia) of the U.S. state of [Virginia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virginia) [Ralph Northam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ralph_Northam) says he will not resign from office because he does not believe that he appears in a controversial photograph from his 1984 medical school [yearbook](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yearbook) showing one person wearing [blackface](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blackface) and another person wearing [Ku Klux Klan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ku_Klux_Klan) attire. However, Northam later admits to wearing blackface during the same time period for a dance contest, in order to imitate musician [Michael Jackson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Jackson). [(_Post and Courier_)](https://www.postandcourier.com/politics/va-gov-ralph-northam-says-he-won-t-resign-denying/article_70e61994-2725-11e9-aed6-87235b6577f8.html?fbclid=IwAR3Gfo3KxT0burB3DzaqDJhJFKjb8hAaZZSG-hsPpWcQeAmTXrQKROPbKXM) [(_The Washington Examiner_)](https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/news/northam-says-he-did-wear-blackface-but-not-in-racist-yearbook-photo?fbclid=IwAR3zb8shDREXRWQjnoZPcZshTuEw6srfofae2QZ64DyR51OYevarIEfZvec)

[(Fox 5 Atlanta)](http://www.fox5atlanta.com/news/rapper-21-savage-taken-into-custody-by-ice-in-atlanta)
*   The Abbott of the [Montserrat Abbey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Santa_Maria_de_Montserrat_Abbey), in [Barcelona](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barcelona), [Spain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spain), apologizes for the sexual abuses that a monk did and that came to light two weeks ago. [(_El País_)](https://elpais.com/sociedad/2019/02/03/actualidad/1549192942_693881.html)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Salvadoran presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Salvadoran_presidential_election)
    *   Former San Salvador mayor [Nayib Bukele](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nayib_Bukele) of the [Grand Alliance for National Unity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_Alliance_for_National_Unity) is elected [President of El Salvador](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_El_Salvador) with over 50% of the ballots cast. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/02/el-salvador-elections-nayib-bukele-takes-strong-lead-190204023433625.html) [(BBC Mundo)](https://www.bbc.com/mundo/noticias-america-latina-47112059)

## Sports

*   [Super Bowl LIII](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Super_Bowl_LIII)
    *   In [American football](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_football), the [New England Patriots](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_New_England_Patriots_season) defeat the [Los Angeles Rams](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_Los_Angeles_Rams_season) in Super Bowl LIII by a score of 13–3. [(CBS Sports)](https://www.cbssports.com/nfl/news/super-bowl-2019-score-takeaways-patriots-stifle-rams-to-win-sixth-championship-in-13-3-defensive-battle/)

# 2019-02-04

## Armed conflicts and attack

*   [Iraqi insurgency (2017–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraqi_insurgency_(2017%E2%80%93present))
    *   Seven [Iranian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran) pilgrims are wounded after their bus comes under attack by unidentified gunmen in central [Iraq](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq); one woman is described as being in serious condition. [(AP)](https://www.apnews.com/3790174eeaa74bd0a1b1d02a022934ea)
*   [Somali Civil War (2009–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Somali_Civil_War_(2009%E2%80%93present))
    *   [2019 Mogadishu bombing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Mogadishu_bombing)
        *   A [car bomb](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Car_bomb) kills 11 people and injures 10 others in an attack on a mall in [Mogadishu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mogadishu), [Somalia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Somalia). [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/02/04/africa/mogadishu-car-bomb-intl/index.html)
    *   A [Maltese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malta) port manager is killed at a fish market in [Puntland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Puntland) by [Al-Shabaab](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Shabaab_(militant_group)) militants disguised as fishermen. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-47114779)

## Business and economy

*   [German](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany) airline [Germania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germania_(airline)) declares [bankruptcy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bankruptcy) and ceases operations, cancelling all flights immediately. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-germania-bankruptcy/holiday-airline-germania-collapses-cancels-all-flights-idUSKCN1PU0D6)

## International relations

*   [2019 Venezuelan presidential crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Venezuelan_presidential_crisis)
    *   Several [European Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Union) states, including the [United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom), [Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany), [Portugal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portugal) and [Spain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spain), officially recognize [Juan Guaidó](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Guaid%C3%B3) as interim [President of Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Venezuela) after [Nicolás Maduro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicol%C3%A1s_Maduro) rejects the European ultimatum to call a new [snap election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snap_election). Other European Union countries, such as [Greece](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greece) and [Ireland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ireland), stop short of recognizing Guaidó, while [Italy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italy)'s leading coalition party, the 5 Star Movement, declares that it is not "for the EU to tell another nation what to do". [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-latin-america-47115857)

## Law and crime

*   25-year-old [Australian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia) footballer and refugee from [Bahrain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bahrain), [Hakeem al-Araibi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hakeem_al-Araibi), is ordered to defend an extradition order back to Bahrain in a [Bangkok](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bangkok) court, after being detained upon arrival in [Thailand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thailand) for his honeymoon with his wife in November 2018. International community is treating it as a [human rights](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_rights) issue; a campaign to free al-Araibi and return him to Australia is growing. [(news.com.au)](https://www.news.com.au/sport/sports-life/craig-foster-steps-up-campaign-to-help-refugee-footballer-hakeem-alaraibi/news-story/d7b56da24963e536ab269d79a8e6396c)

## Science and technology

*   [Alaskan Way Viaduct replacement tunnel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alaskan_Way_Viaduct_replacement_tunnel)
    *   After numerous cost overruns and delays, a 1.8-mile (2.9 km) [highway tunnel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alaskan_Way_Viaduct_replacement_tunnel) in [Seattle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seattle), Washington, U.S., opens to traffic, becoming the largest [road tunnel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Road_tunnel) in the contiguous United States. It was bored using [Bertha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bertha_(tunnel_boring_machine)), the world's largest [tunnel boring machine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tunnel_boring_machine). [(Washington Post)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/trafficandcommuting/a-look-at-how-transportation-can-transform-a-city/2019/01/31/da8418de-0ec4-11e9-8938-5898adc28fa2_story.html?noredirect=on)

    *   The Government of the [Central African Republic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_African_Republic) sign a peace deal with 14 rebel groups. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/02/central-african-republic-initials-peace-deal-armed-groups-190205121250705.html)

*   Several homes have been damaged in an uncontrolled [bushfire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wildfire) near the [New Zealand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Zealand) city of [Nelson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nelson,_New_Zealand).     *   Eleven [Lima Group](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lima_Group) member states support a declaration recognizing [Juan Guaidó](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Guaid%C3%B3) as interim [President of Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Venezuela), while three members of the Lima Group, [Guyana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guyana), [Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico) and [Saint Lucia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saint_Lucia), did not back the declaration.     *   [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) delivers [his second State of the Union Address](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_State_of_the_Union_Address) to the [116th United States Congress](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/116th_United_States_Congress) in the chamber of [the House of Representatives](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_House_of_Representatives). # 2019-02-06

## Disasters and accidents

*   [2018 Anchorage earthquake](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_Anchorage_earthquake)
    *   Two aftershocks strike [Anchorage, Alaska](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anchorage,_Alaska), the first a magnitude 4.1, and the second a magnitude 3.7, occurring 23 minutes later. [(_Anchorage Daily News_)](https://www.adn.com/alaska-news/anchorage/2019/02/06/2-more-aftershocks-strike-anchorage-within-a-half-hour/)
*   Heavy rain hits [Rio de Janeiro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rio_de_Janeiro), leaving three people dead and two missing. [(_G1_)](https://g1.globo.com/rj/rio-de-janeiro/noticia/2019/02/06/chuva-volta-ao-rio-na-noite-desta-quarta-e-deve-ficar-ate-domingo.ghtml)
*   Ten people were killed and thirteen others are injured when an eight-story apartment building collapsed in [Istanbul](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Istanbul), [Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey). [(Sky News)](https://news.sky.com/story/istanbul-apartment-block-collapse-girl-5-pulled-from-rubble-in-turkey-11630839)

## Health and environment

*   The Philippines [Department of Health](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Department_of_Health_(Philippines)) declares a [measles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Measles) outbreak attributed to the drop in trust in vaccines due to the [Dengvaxia controversy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dengvaxia_controversy). [(_The Philippine Star_)](https://www.philstar.com/headlines/2019/02/07/1891623/measles-outbreak-declared-metro-manila-central-luzon)

## International relations

*   [Accession of Macedonia to NATO](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Accession_of_Macedonia_to_NATO)
    *   In [Brussels](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brussels), an accession protocol for joining [NATO](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NATO) is signed between [Jens Stoltenberg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jens_Stoltenberg), [Secretary General of NATO](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secretary_General_of_NATO), and [Nikola Dimitrov](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nikola_Dimitrov), foreign minister of the [Republic of Macedonia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republic_of_Macedonia). [(The Washington Post)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/amphtml/world/europe/nato-allies-sign-key-macedonia-membership-protocol/2019/02/06/58a1bca8-29fa-11e9-906e-9d55b6451eb4_story.html?noredirect=on)
*   [2019 Venezuelan presidential crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Venezuelan_presidential_crisis), [Colombia–Venezuela relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colombia%E2%80%93Venezuela_relations)
    *   The [Venezuelan National Guard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venezuelan_National_Guard) blocks off a bridge on the [Colombia–Venezuela border](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colombia%E2%80%93Venezuela_border) with a [tanker truck](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tank_truck). The Venezuelan opposition were planning to use the bridge to bring [humanitarian aid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Humanitarian_aid) into the country, but the government of [Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venezuela) does not allow unauthorized border crossings into the country. President [Nicolás Maduro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicol%C3%A1s_Maduro) has rejected foreign aid, saying "we're not a nation of beggars". [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-latin-america-47143492) [(_Daily Star_)](http://www.dailystar.com.lb/News/World/2019/Feb-06/475999-us-sends-food-medical-aid-to-venezuela-border.ashx)

## Law and crime

*   [Game law](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Game_law)
    *   In a landmark decision, the [Constitutional Court of Colombia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Constitutional_Court_of_Colombia) rules to ban [recreational hunting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trophy_hunting), citing [environmental protection](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Environmental_protection) concerns. ## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Guatemalan general election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Guatemalan_general_election)
    *   The [Attorney General](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attorney_General_of_Guatemala) filed a request to withdraw immunity to the presidential candidate of [National Unity of Hope](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Unity_of_Hope), former [First Lady](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/First_Lady_of_Guatemala) [Sandra Torres](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sandra_Torres_(politician)), for alleged crimes of illicit electoral financing. # 2019-02-10

## Law and crime

*   [Sexual abuse scandal in Southern Baptist churches](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sexual_abuse_scandal_in_Southern_Baptist_churches), [Religious abuse](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Religious_abuse), [Baptists in the United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baptists_in_the_United_States)
    *   An investigation by _[Houston Chronicle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Houston_Chronicle)_ and the _[San Antonio Express-News](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Antonio_Express-News)_ found that since 1998, about 380 Southern Baptist church [clerics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clergy), [laypersons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laity), and [volunteers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volunteering) have faced credible accusations of [sexual abuse](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sexual_abuse) and that of those, roughly 220 were convicted of [sex crimes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sex_and_the_law) or received [plea deals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plea_bargain), in cases involving more than 700 victims. Many accusers were young men and women, who allegedly experienced everything from [molestation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sexual_abuse) to [rape](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rape) and [impregnation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_fertilization) at the hands of church members. [(_Houston Chronicle_)](https://www.houstonchronicle.com/news/investigations/article/Southern-Baptist-sexual-abuse-spreads-as-leaders-13588038.php) [(_Houston Chronicle_2)](https://projects.houstonchronicle.com/2019/southern-baptist-abuse/) [(_San Antonio Express-News_)](https://www.expressnews.com/news/investigations/article/Southern-Baptist-sexual-abuse-spreads-as-leaders-13588038.php)
    *   President of the [Southern Baptist Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Southern_Baptist_Convention) [J. D. Greear](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._D._Greear) condemns the sexual abuse committed by the [clergy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clergy), [laypersons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laity), and [volunteers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volunteering) and calls it "pure [evil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evil)". [(_The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/religion/2019/02/10/pure-evil-southern-baptist-leaders-condemn-decades-sexual-abuse-revealed-investigation/?noredirect=on&utm_term=.b7a520318d0e)
*   Three people are killed in [Gandhinagar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gandhinagar), [India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/India), by a [serial killer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serial_killer). The alleged killer, who is later identified as a [eunuch](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eunuch), remains at large. [(Ahmedabad Mirror)](https://ahmedabadmirror.indiatimes.com/ahmedabad/others/gnagar-terrorised-by-serial-killer-on-prowl/articleshow/67920922.cms)

*   [Special Counsel investigation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special_Counsel_investigation_(2017%E2%80%93present))

[(CBS News)](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/andrew-mccabe-says-he-ordered-the-obstruction-of-justice-case-of-president-trump-60-minutes/)

[(NBC News)](https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/congress/senate-confirms-trump-nominee-william-barr-attorney-general-n971326)
*   [Brexit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit)
    *   The [House of Commons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_of_Commons) votes to reject British Prime Minister [Theresa May](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theresa_May)'s negotiating strategy with the [EU](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Union), though this motion has no legal force. [(BBC News)](https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-47245992)

[(_The Japan Times_)](https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2019/02/15/national/japan-recognize-indigenous-ainu-people-first-time/#.XGcbRdJCeUk)

[(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-venezuela-politics-trump/trump-urges-venezuelan-military-to-abandon-maduro-or-lose-everything-idUSKCN1Q71G8)
*   [North Korea–Vietnam relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Korea%E2%80%93Vietnam_relations)
    *   [North Korean leader](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_leaders_of_North_Korea) [Kim Jong-un](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kim_Jong-un) will meet with [Vietnamese General Secretary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/General_Secretary_of_the_Communist_Party_of_Vietnam) and [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Vietnam) [Nguyễn Phú Trọng](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nguy%E1%BB%85n_Ph%C3%BA_Tr%E1%BB%8Dng) in [Hanoi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hanoi) ahead of talks with [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump). # 2019-02-19

## Armed conflict and attacks

*   [Insurgency in Egypt (2013–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Insurgency_in_Egypt_(2013%E2%80%93present))
    *   Sixteen militants are killed in two different raids in [Egypt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Egypt)'s [Sinai Peninsula](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sinai_Peninsula). A number of weapons and explosives are also found in the raids. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/02/egyptian-security-forces-kill-16-suspected-fighters-sinai-190219145158965.html)
*   [2019 Kaduna State massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Kaduna_State_massacre)
    *   [Kaduna State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kaduna_State) governor [Nasir el-Rufai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nasir_Ahmad_el-Rufai) reports the death toll from Friday's attack in [Kajuru](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kajuru) is now more than 130, most from the [Fulani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fula_people) ethnic group. [Nigerian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nigeria) authorities have not identified the gunmen's motive, but they do not believe the attack was related to [the upcoming election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Nigerian_general_election). [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/02/death-toll-week-nigeria-attack-doubles-130-190219193655675.html) [(Eyewitness news)](https://ewn.co.za/2019/02/19/death-toll-from-last-week-s-northwest-nigeria-attack-doubles-to-130)

## Business and economy

*   [Economy of the United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Economy_of_the_United_States)
    *   American retailer [Payless ShoeSource](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Payless_ShoeSource) files [Chapter 11 bankruptcy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chapter_11,_Title_11,_United_States_Code) with plans to close all of their U.S. stores. [(_USA Today_)](https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2019/02/19/payless-shoesource-chapter-11-bankruptcy/2913106002/)
*   [Ford Motor Company](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ford_Motor_Company) will stop selling commercial trucks in [South America](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_America). [(CNBC)](https://www.cnbc.com/2019/02/19/ford-will-stop-selling-commercial-trucks-in-south-america.html)
*   [Honda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Honda) confirms that it will be closing its car plant in [Swindon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swindon), South West England, because of decreased demand for diesel cars and tougher emissions regulations. The closure in 2021 will result in the loss of about 3,500 jobs. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/business-47287386)
*   [Teva Pharmaceutical](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teva_Pharmaceutical_Industries) settles outstanding cases with the [U.S. Federal Trade Commission](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Trade_Commission) involving payments from brand-name drugmakers to delay releasing a cheaper version of its product, so-called ["pay-for-delay" agreements](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reverse_payment_patent_settlement). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-ftc-teva-settlement/us-settles-with-teva-over-keeping-generic-drugs-off-market-idUSKCN1Q82U0)

## Culture and entertainment

*   The opening round of the [Aeroflot Open](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aeroflot_Open), an international open [chess](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chess) tournament, is postponed a day after 45 minutes of play as a bomb threat locks down the [Moscow](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moscow) hotel hosting the event. Similar threats also shut down cinemas, shopping centres, and theatres; thousands are evacuated. [(Chess.com)](https://www.chess.com/news/view/aeroflot-open-round-1-called-off-after-bomb-threat) [(Chessbase)](https://en.chessbase.com/post/bomb-threats-in-moscow-round-1-of-the-aeroflot-open-was-aborted)

## Disasters and accidents

*   An [avalanche](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avalanche) at the [Crans-Montana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crans-Montana) [ski resort](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ski_resort) in [Switzerland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Switzerland) injures four, one seriously, with fears that up to a dozen skiers may have been hit according to witnesses. 240 rescuers including police and army search the affected piste area. No further victims are immediately found, or missing persons reported. [(Fox News)](https://www.foxnews.com/world/at-least-a-dozen-skiers-may-be-buried-after-avalanche-hits-popular-swiss-alps-resort) [(SwissInfo)](https://www.swissinfo.ch/eng/mountain-accident_crans-montana-avalanche-buries-skiers/44769096)
*   A house fire in [Halifax](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Halifax,_Nova_Scotia), [Nova Scotia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nova_Scotia), [Canada](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canada), kills seven children from a [Syrian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syria) family. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-47299551)

## Politics and elections

*   [2020 United States presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_United_States_presidential_election), [2020 Democratic Party presidential primaries](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Democratic_Party_presidential_primaries)
    *   [Bernie Sanders 2020 presidential campaign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bernie_Sanders_2020_presidential_campaign)
        *   [Vermont](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vermont) Senator and [2016 presidential candidate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bernie_Sanders_2016_presidential_campaign) [Bernie Sanders](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bernie_Sanders) announces on [Vermont Public Radio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vermont_Public_Radio) that he is running for [President of the United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) as a [Democrat](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democratic_Party_(United_States)) in 2020. [(NPR)](https://www.npr.org/2019/02/19/676923000/bernie-sanders-enters-2020-presidential-campaign-no-longer-an-underdog?t=1550576496363)
*   [Politics of Spain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Politics_of_Spain)
    *   [Francisco José Alcaraz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francisco_Jos%C3%A9_Alcaraz), from [Vox](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vox_(Spanish_political_party)), becomes the first far-right politician to become a [Senator](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Senate_of_Spain) since the restoration of democracy. [(_El Mundo_)](https://www.elmundo.es/andalucia/2019/01/31/5c52df2ffc6c839b798b4652.html)
*   [History of the UK Labour Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_the_Labour_Party_(UK)), [Antisemitism in the UK Labour Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antisemitism_in_the_UK_Labour_Party)
    *   [Joan Ryan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joan_Ryan) becomes the eighth [MP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Member_of_Parliament_(United_Kingdom)) to quit the [Labour Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Labour_Party_(UK)) and join [The Independent Group](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Independent_Group), citing a "culture of anti-Jewish racism" within the party as the reason for her departure. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-47300832)

# 2019-02-20

## Arts and culture

*   The [Southern Poverty Law Center](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Southern_Poverty_Law_Center) reports a 30 percent increase in U.S. hate groups over the past four years with a 7% increase in 2018 alone. [(NPR)](https://www.npr.org/2019/02/20/696217158/u-s-hate-groups-rose-sharply-in-recent-years-watchdog-group-reports)

## International relations

*   [2019 Venezuelan presidential crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Venezuelan_presidential_crisis), [2019 shipping of humanitarian aid to Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_shipping_of_humanitarian_aid_to_Venezuela)
    *   The [Venezuelan Navy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venezuelan_Navy) closes its maritime borders with the [Dutch Caribbean](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dutch_Caribbean) islands of [Aruba](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aruba), [Curaçao](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cura%C3%A7ao) and [Bonaire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bonaire) ahead of the planned entry of international [humanitarian aid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Humanitarian_aid) into [Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venezuela) on February 23, which [Nicolás Maduro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicol%C3%A1s_Maduro) considers a precursor to invasion. [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2019/02/20/americas/venezuela-closes-border-intl/index.html)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [2019 Dhaka fire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Dhaka_fire)
    *   A fast-moving fire has swept through a historic district of [Bangladesh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bangladesh)'s capital [Dhaka](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dhaka), killing at least 80. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-47314098)

## Law and crime

*   _[Timbs v. Indiana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Timbs_v._Indiana)_
    *   The [U.S. Supreme Court](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supreme_Court_of_the_United_States), in a unanimous 9–0 decision, rules the [8th Amendment](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eighth_Amendment_to_the_United_States_Constitution)'s prohibition on excessive fines [applies to state and local governments](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Incorporation_of_the_Bill_of_Rights), as well as the federal government. [(_The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/courts_law/supreme-court-says-constitutional-protection-against-excessive-fines-applies-to-state-actions/2019/02/20/204ce0d4-3522-11e9-af5b-b51b7ff322e9_story.html)

## Politics and elections

*   [History of the UK Conservative Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_the_Conservative_Party_(UK))
    *   Three British [MPs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Member_of_Parliament_(United_Kingdom)) – [Anna Soubry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anna_Soubry), [Sarah Wollaston](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sarah_Wollaston) and [Heidi Allen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heidi_Allen) – defect from the [Conservative Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conservative_Party_(UK)) to [The Independent Group](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Independent_Group), citing their opposition to [Brexit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit) and the party's adoption of [UKIP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom_Independence_Party) policies. This brings the total number of The Independent Group MPs to eleven following recent defections from [Labour](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Labour_Party_(UK)). [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2019/feb/20/tory-mps-defect-independent-group-soubry-allen-wollaston)
*   [2019 North Korea–United States Hanoi Summit Vietnam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_North_Korea%E2%80%93United_States_Hanoi_Summit_Vietnam)
    *   The [United Nations Security Council Sanctions Committee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UN_Security_Council_Sanctions_Committee_on_North_Korea) permits those [North Koreans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Korea) on its global travel ban list to travel to [Hanoi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hanoi), [Vietnam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vietnam), for the second summit meeting with [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-northkorea-usa-un/u-n-permits-north-koreans-to-travel-to-vietnam-for-trump-summit-idUSKCN1Q92KF)

## Science and technology

*   One surviving female specimen of the Fernandina [Galápagos tortoise](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gal%C3%A1pagos_tortoise) species, which was thought to be extinct for more than 100 years, is found. [(_USA Today_)](https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2019/02/20/galapagos-rare-tortoise-species-considered-extinct-until-now/2930134002/)

# 2019-02-23

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [2019 Venezuelan presidential crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Venezuelan_presidential_crisis), [2019 shipping of humanitarian aid to Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_shipping_of_humanitarian_aid_to_Venezuela), [2019 Venezuelan protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Venezuelan_protests), [Colombia–Venezuela relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colombia%E2%80%93Venezuela_relations)
    *   Trucks carrying humanitarian aid from Colombia and Brazil attempt to enter Venezuelan territory. Two trucks are set on fire on the Francisco de Paula Santander International Bridge. [(Herald Sun)](https://www.heraldsun.com.au/news/national/aid-trucks-burn-amid-clashes-between-aid-convoys-and-venezuelan-military/video/890b1357274fb8a9165d13b62e4dbd35)
    *   Venezuelan people clash with the [Venezuelan National Guard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venezuelan_National_Guard) on the Venezuela's border with Colombia and Brazil. Three people have died in southern [Bolívar State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bol%C3%ADvar_(state)). [(The Guardian)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2019/feb/23/venezuela-brazil-border-aid-live-news-latest-updates)
    *   Sixty [Venezuelan National Guard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venezuelan_National_Guard) personnel defect to [Colombia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colombia); three of them defect after smashing a barrier at the [Simón Bolívar International Bridge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sim%C3%B3n_Bol%C3%ADvar_International_Bridge) on the [Colombia–Venezuela border](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colombia%E2%80%93Venezuela_border) in two armored vehicles, leaving some injured. A video posted on [social media](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Social_media) shows the men with their guns above their heads in a sign of surrender. [(Miami Herald)](https://www.miamiherald.com/news/nation-world/world/americas/venezuela/article226677254.html) [(AFP)](https://twitter.com/AFP/status/1099329008880234497) [(Reuters)](https://twitter.com/ReutersVzla/status/1099440148461297664)
    *   Venezuela breaks diplomatic relations with Colombia and expels all of Colombia's diplomats; however, Colombia maintains _de jure_ diplomatic relations with Guaidó's ambassador, [Humberto Calderón Berti](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Humberto_Calder%C3%B3n_Berti). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-venezuela-politics-colombia/venezuela-breaks-diplomatic-relations-with-colombia-over-aid-maduro-says-idUSKCN1QC0SR) [(Colombian Foreign Minister)](https://twitter.com/CarlosHolmesTru/status/1090325743060570112) [(Colombia's Caracol TV)](https://noticias.caracoltv.com/mundo/colombia-reconocio-humberto-calderon-berti-como-representante-diplomatico-de-venezuela)
    *   [Venezuelan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venezuela) opposition deputy [Freddy Superlano](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freddy_Superlano) and his assistant are poisoned at a restaurant in [Cúcuta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C%C3%BAcuta), Colombia. His assistant and cousin, Carlos Salinas, has died while Superlano is in a serious but stable condition in hospital. [(Washington Post)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/venezuelan-opposition-looks-to-foreign-allies-for-further-steps-to-unseat-maduro/2019/02/24/3f046ce4-37bc-11e9-8375-e3dcf6b68558_story.html?utm_term=.1bb728c15c56) [(BNO News)](https://bnonews.com/index.php/2019/02/venezuelan-lawmaker-freddy-superlano-poisoned-in-colombia/)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [Atlas Air Flight 3591](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atlas_Air_Flight_3591)
    *   A [Boeing 767](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boeing_767) on a cargo flight crashes into the [Trinity Bay](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trinity_Bay_(Texas)) en-route from [Miami](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miami) to [Houston](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Houston), killing all three crew members. [(The Weather Channel)](https://weather.com/news/news/2019-02-23-amazon-cargo-plane-crash-houston-trinity-bay)

## International relations

*   [2019 North Korea–United States Hanoi Summit Vietnam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_North_Korea%E2%80%93United_States_Hanoi_Summit_Vietnam)
    *   The [Vietnamese Foreign Ministry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs_(Vietnam)) announces that [North Korean leader](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_leaders_of_North_Korea) [Kim Jong-un](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kim_Jong-un) will make an official visit to the country in the coming days, ahead of the upcoming summit between him and [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) in [Hanoi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hanoi).     *   After having been postponed by a week, [Nigeria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nigeria)'s general election takes place nationwide. [(_DW_)](https://www.dw.com/en/vote-counting-begins-in-nigerias-delayed-presidential-election/a-47634708)

# 2019-02-24

## Arts and culture

    *   The 91st [Academy Awards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Academy_Awards) are presented in Hollywood. _[Bohemian Rhapsody](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bohemian_Rhapsody_(film))_ wins a leading four awards, followed by _[Black Panther](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Panther_(film))_, _[Green Book](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Green_Book_(film))_, which won [Best Picture](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Academy_Award_for_Best_Picture), and _[Roma](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roma_(2018_film))_, with three awards each. *   During a training exercise, a twin-engine aircraft crashes through the roof of a home in [Winter Haven, Florida](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winter_Haven,_Florida), shortly after takeoff. The pilot was killed. A trainee pilot and eight people in the house suffered minor injuries. The [Federal Aviation Administration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Aviation_Administration) and [National Transportation Safety Board](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Transportation_Safety_Board) will be investigating. *   [Biman Bangladesh Airlines Flight 147](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biman_Bangladesh_Airlines_Flight_147)
    *   [Bangladeshi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bangladesh) special forces shoot and kill an armed man after he attempted to hijack a [Biman Bangladesh Airlines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biman_Bangladesh_Airlines) flight heading to [Dubai International Airport](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dubai_International_Airport). All 148 passengers and crew members disembarked safely. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-47350138)

*   [2019 Moldovan parliamentary election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Moldovan_parliamentary_election)
    *   Voters in [Moldova](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moldova) go to the polls to elect the new members of [Parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parliament_of_the_Republic_of_Moldova). [(_France 24_)](https://www.france24.com/en/20190224-moldova-vote-divisive-parliamentary-election)
*   [2019 Senegalese presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Senegalese_presidential_election)
    *   Voters in [Senegal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Senegal) assemble to vote for the country's next [president](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Senegal). [(_DW_)](https://www.dw.com/en/senegal-votes-for-new-president/a-47662841)
*   [2019 Cuban constitutional referendum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Cuban_constitutional_referendum)
    *   Voters in [Cuba](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cuba) are asked whether they approve of a new constitution that gives criminal defendants the [presumption of innocence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presumption_of_innocence), recognizes [private property](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Private_property), bans some forms of [discrimination](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Discrimination), creates a term limit for the [president](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Cuba), and restores the position of [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Cuba).     *   [Pakistani Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Pakistan) [Imran Khan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Imran_Khan) says that captured [Indian Air Force](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indian_Air_Force) pilot Abhinandan Varthaman will be released tomorrow as a gesture of peace. # 2019-03-02

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [2019 India–Pakistan standoff](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_India%E2%80%93Pakistan_standoff)
    *   Indian and Pakistani soldiers target each other’s posts and villages in Kashmir, killing at least six civilians and two Pakistani troops. [(Associated Press)](https://www.apnews.com/207c8bfb372640e9be2379d03c65ac05)
*   [Douma chemical attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Douma_chemical_attack), [Use of chemical weapons in the Syrian Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Use_of_chemical_weapons_in_the_Syrian_Civil_War)
    *   The [Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons's Fact-Finding Mission in Syria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OPCW_Fact-Finding_Mission_in_Syria) issues its report regarding the [April 7, 2018 chemical attack in Douma](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Douma_chemical_attack). It reveals that there is conclusive evidence that proves a toxic chemical containing molecular chlorine was used in the attack. However, it did not assign blame for the attack. Syrian President [Bashar al-Assad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bashar_al-Assad) and the opposition blame each other for the attack. [(Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons)](https://www.opcw.org/media-centre/news/2019/03/opcw-issues-fact-finding-mission-report-chemical-weapons-use-allegation)

## International relations

*   [North Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Korea) [leader](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supreme_Leader_of_North_Korea) [Kim Jong-un](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kim_Jong-un) departs [Vietnam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vietnam), after his [summit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_North_Korea-United_States_Hanoi_Summit) with [U.S.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) was cut short, with no agreements made between the two countries. [(_The Washington Times_)](https://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2019/mar/2/kim-jong-un-boards-train-for-return-trip-to-north-/)
*   The [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) and [South Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korea) announce that their annual large-scale exercises, commonly known as [Foal Eagle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foal_Eagle) and [Key Resolve](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Key_Resolve), will end and will be re-configured into smaller exercises. The joint exercises will be done on a small unit level and may include virtual training similar to the 2018 exercises. [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/03/02/politics/us-south-korea-military-exercises/index.html)

## Law and crime

*   Through a [royal decree](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decree), [King Salman of Saudi Arabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salman_of_Saudi_Arabia) revokes the citizenship of [Hamza bin Laden](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hamza_bin_Laden), [Osama bin Laden](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Osama_bin_Laden)'s son. He works in the [Al-Qaeda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Qaeda) terrorist organization. The announcement comes after the United States government offered a reward of up to $1 million for information leading to the identification or location of him. [Interpol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interpol) has issued an [Interpol notice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interpol_notice) for him after [United Nations Security Council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council) imposed sanctions on him which includes assets freeze, travel ban and arms embargo. He remains at large. [(CBS News)](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/saudi-arabia-revokes-hamza-bin-ladens-citizenship-this-is-an-example-of-history-rhyming-2019-03-02/) [(Interpol)](https://www.interpol.int/en/notice/search/un/6297888) [(United Nations Security Council)](https://www.un.org/press/en/2019/sc13726.doc.htm)

He had remained in the Department as a senior counselor to the Associate Attorney General after his stint as acting Attorney General. [(AP)](https://apnews.com/0d618b3641c542e98286845c821e28cb)
*   [Stormy Daniels–Donald Trump scandal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stormy_Daniels%E2%80%93Donald_Trump_scandal), [Rupert Murdoch's political activities in the United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rupert_Murdoch#Political_activities_in_the_United_States)
    *   _[The New Yorker](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_New_Yorker)_ reports that [Fox News](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fox_News) owner [Rupert Murdoch](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rupert_Murdoch) [prevented the release](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catch_and_kill) of a story about [hush money](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hush_money) which [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) paid to [Stormy Daniels](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stormy_Daniels) before the [2016 election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2016_United_States_presidential_election) because Murdoch wanted Trump to win the election. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-china-47447976)
*   [2019 Venezuelan presidential crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Venezuelan_presidential_crisis)
    *   [Venezuelan National Assembly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Assembly_(Venezuela))-declared interim President [Juan Guaidó](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Guaid%C3%B3) defies [Venezuelan President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Venezuela) [Nicolás Maduro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicol%C3%A1s_Maduro)'s threats and returns to [Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venezuela) where he is received by tens of thousands of people in Caracas. [(Associated Press)](https://www.apnews.com/f60b33eaf80c462382f2077cafe8827f)

## Science and technology

*   [USB4](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USB#USB4), [Thunderbolt 3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thunderbolt_(interface)#Thunderbolt_3), [2019 in science](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_in_science)
    *   [Intel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intel) makes [Thunderbolt 3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thunderbolt_(interface)#Thunderbolt_3) [open](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Open_standard) and [royalty-free](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Royalty-free) and gives the specification to [USB Implementers Forum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USB_Implementers_Forum), while [USB Promoter Group](/w/index.php?title=USB_Promoter_Group&action=edit&redlink=1) announces the [USB4](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USB#USB4) specification that is based on [Thunderbolt 3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thunderbolt_(interface)#Thunderbolt_3). USB4 supports 40 Gbps transfer rates and enables the use of multiple data and display protocols simultaneously. [(Intel)](https://newsroom.intel.com/news/intel-takes-steps-enable-thunderbolt-3-everywhere-releases-protocol/#gs.IxSiv18Q) [(USB Promoter Group)](https://usb.org/sites/default/files/2019-02/USB_PG_USB4_DevUpdate_Announcement_FINAL_20190226.pdf) [(Ars Technica)](https://arstechnica.com/gadgets/2019/03/thunderbolt-3-becomes-usb4-as-intels-interconnect-goes-royalty-free/)

*   [Management of HIV/AIDS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Management_of_HIV/AIDS)
    *   An [HIV-positive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HIV) man, identified as "the London patient", is the second known adult worldwide cleared of the HIV virus after a [bone marrow transplant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hematopoietic_stem_cell_transplantation) from an HIV-resistant donor. He has been in remission from HIV for 18 months and is no longer taking HIV drugs. ## Business and economy

*   The [United States Commerce Department](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Department_of_Commerce) reports the country's 2018 trade deficit was $621 billion (£472.5 bn), the highest since 2008. The [Bureau of Economic Analysis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bureau_of_Economic_Analysis) found surpluses with, for instance, [South](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_America) and [Central America](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_America) ($41.5 billion), [Hong Kong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hong_Kong) ($31.1 billion), and [Australia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia) ($15.2 billion). Some of the regions where the U.S. had deficits include [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China) ($419.2 billion), [European Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Union) ($169.3 billion), [Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico) ($81.5 billion), [Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan) ($67.6 billion), [Malaysia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malaysia) ($26.5 billion), [India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/India) ($21.3 billion), [OPEC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OPEC) ($21.2 billion), and [Canada](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canada) ($19.8 billion). [(CNBC)](https://www.cnbc.com/2019/03/06/dollar-tree-to-close-up-to-390-family-dollar-stores-this-year.html)

## Sports

*   [2018–19 UEFA Champions League](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018%E2%80%9319_UEFA_Champions_League)
    *   [Manchester United](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manchester_United_F.C.) defeats [Paris Saint-Germain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paris_Saint-Germain_F.C.) 3–1 [in Paris](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parc_des_Princes), overcoming a 2–0 [home-leg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Old_Trafford) deficit to advance to the [quarter-finals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018%E2%80%9319_UEFA_Champions_League#Quarter-finals) with a 3–3 win on [away goals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Away_goals_rule). ## Disasters and accidents

    *   A major power outage leaves most of [Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venezuela) without electricity, including the capital [Caracas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caracas). At least 18 of Venezuela's 23 [states](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/States_of_Venezuela) have reported blackouts. Venezuelan news website [El Pitazo](http://elpitazo.net/) blames failures at [Simón Bolívar hydroelectric plant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guri_Dam); state TV blames anti-government saboteurs. *   [Buffalo Billion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buffalo_Billion)
    *   Joe Percoco, former aide to [New York Governor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Governor_of_New_York) [Andrew Cuomo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andrew_Cuomo), is denied bail and is expected to start his six-year prison term for bribery. # 2019-03-08

## Disasters and accidents

*   [Crisis in Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crisis_in_Venezuela)
    *   A nationwide [power outage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Power_outage) enters its second day in [Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venezuela). Information Minister [Jorge Rodríguez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jorge_Rodr%C3%ADguez_(politician)) and [Defense Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ministry_of_Defense_(Venezuela)) [Vladimir Padrino López](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vladimir_Padrino_L%C3%B3pez) claim the country appears to be the victim of a [cyberattack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyberattack) intended to "derail the whole system". [Juan Guaidó](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Guaid%C3%B3) stated that "state corruption and mismanagement (...) have left the electrical grid in shambles". [(AP)](https://www.apnews.com/6ba2f69b77e2457da64593a7b8eced16)
*   A truck overturns on a highway in [Chiapas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chiapas), [Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico), killing 25 [Central American](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_America) migrants who were hiding inside. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mexico-accident/truck-roll-over-in-mexico-kills-at-least-25-idUSKCN1QP0I1)

## Law and crime

*   [Shoreham Airshow crash](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shoreham_Airshow_crash)
    *   Pilot Andy Hill is acquitted of eleven counts of manslaughter arising from the 2015 accident, in which a jet flown by Hill struck a road in [Shoreham](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shoreham-by-Sea), [England](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/England). [(The Guardian)](https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2019/mar/08/shoreham-airshow-crash-pilot-andrew-hill-cleared-over-deaths-of-11-people)
*   [Chelsea Manning](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chelsea_Manning) is jailed for refusing to answer questions from a federal grand jury in [Virginia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virginia) looking into the release of documents to [WikiLeaks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WikiLeaks). [(NBC News)](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/chelsea-manning-jailed-refusing-testify-grand-jury-virginia-n980016)
*   Actor [Jussie Smollett](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jussie_Smollett) is indicted on 16 felony counts of disorderly conduct for allegedly filing a false police report in January in Chicago. [(Yahoo! News)](https://www.yahoo.com/gma/empire-actor-jussie-smollett-hit-16-count-felony-221107076--abc-news-topstories.html)

## Politics and elections

*   [Politics of Finland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Politics_of_Finland)
    *   The entire coalition government of [Finland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Finland) resigns after a failure to deliver on [healthcare](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Healthcare_in_Finland) reform, a month ahead of the [country's general election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Finnish_parliamentary_election). The coalition, made up of Prime Minister [Juha Sipilä](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juha_Sipil%C3%A4)'s [Centre Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Centre_Party_(Finland)), the conservative [National Coalition Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Coalition_Party) and the [Eurosceptic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Euroscepticism) [Blue Reform Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blue_Reform), were unable to agree on a package that would have slowed healthcare spending over the next decade. The government will be _interim_ until April elections. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-finland-government/finlands-cabinet-quits-over-failure-to-deliver-healthcare-reform-idUSKCN1QP0R6)

# 2019-03-11

## Armed conflict and attacks

*   [Battle of Baghuz Fawqani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Baghuz_Fawqani), [International military intervention against ISIL](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_military_intervention_against_ISIL)
    *   [US-backed Syrian forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Democratic_Forces#Support_by_the_United_States,_France_and_other_Western_nations) resume their offensive on the final enclave controlled by [ISIL](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISIL) in [Syria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syria) at [Baghuz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Baghuz_Fawqani). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-islamic-state/islamic-state-enclave-pounded-in-u-s-backed-assault-idUSKBN1QS1I3?il=0) [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/03/backed-syrian-forces-resume-attacks-final-isil-enclave-190310180555338.html)

## Business and economy

*   [Economy of Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Economy_of_Turkey)
    *   The [Turkish](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey) economy enters a [recession](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Recession) for the first time since 2009 after the [currency and debt crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkish_currency_and_debt_crisis,_2018) of 2018. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-47522338) [(Bloomberg)](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-03-10/debt-catches-up-with-turkey-as-recession-ends-boom-and-bust-run)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [Ethiopian Airlines Flight 302](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethiopian_Airlines_Flight_302)
    *   Shares of [Boeing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boeing) lose roughly 9 percent after one of its best-selling planes, the [Boeing 737 MAX](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boeing_737_MAX) jet, saw its second deadly crash in less than five months. [(CNBC)](https://www.cnbc.com/2019/03/11/boeing-shares-sink-after-fatal-crashthree-experts-weigh-in.html)
    *   [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China) and [Indonesia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indonesia) ground 737-8 MAX aircraft across their nations in response to the Ethiopian Airlines Flight 302 and [Lion Air Flight 610](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lion_Air_Flight_610) disasters; airlines elsewhere including [Ethiopian Airlines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethiopian_Airlines) voluntarily ground their own 737 MAX jets. [(The Independent)](https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/africa/ethiopia-plane-crash-china-boeing-a8817271.html)
*   [HMS Argyll](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMS_Argyll_(F231)) rescues a 27-strong crew from a burning container vessel 150 miles off the coast of [France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/av/uk-england-devon-47527837/royal-navy-save-crew-from-burning-container-ship)

## International relations

*   [Iran–Iraq relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93Iraq_relations)
    *   [Iranian President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iranian_President) [Hassan Rouhani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hassan_Rouhani) begins his first official visit to Iraq to boost bilateral ties and trade amid re-instated [U.S. sanctions on Iran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_sanctions_against_Iran#Post-JCPOA_sanctions). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-47524688)
*   [U.S. Senator](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Senate) [Lindsey Graham](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lindsey_Graham) visits the [Israeli](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel)-occupied [Golan Heights](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golan_Heights), saying he will start an effort to recognize the Golan as part of the State of Israel. [(Times of Israel)](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog-march-11-2019/)

## Politics and elections

*   [Crisis in Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crisis_in_Venezuela)
    *   Partially recognized [Venezuelan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venezuela) acting President [Juan Guaidó](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Guaid%C3%B3) says the country has "truly collapsed already", while accusing the [Nicolás Maduro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicol%C3%A1s_Maduro)-led government of murdering 17 people during the ongoing nationwide blackouts. [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2019/03/11/americas/venezuela-guaido-maduro-blackout/index.html)
*   [2019 Algerian protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Algerian_protests)
    *   [Algerian President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algerian_President) [Abdelaziz Bouteflika](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abdelaziz_Bouteflika) says he will postpone the country's [elections](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Algerian_presidential_election) next month, and will not seek a fifth term in office. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/03/algeria-bouteflika-delays-elections-seek-term-190311174206302.html)
    *   [Prime Minister of Algeria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Algeria) [Ahmed Ouyahia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ahmed_Ouyahia) resigns after Bouteflika's speech. He is replaced by [Noureddine Bedoui](/w/index.php?title=Noureddine_Bedoui&action=edit&redlink=1). [(Jeune Afrique)](https://www.jeuneafrique.com/747782/politique/algerie-le-premier-ministre-ahmed-ouyahia-demissionne-noureddine-bedoui-le-remplace/)
