# 2019-03-12

## Disasters and accidents

*   [Ethiopian Airlines Flight 302](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethiopian_Airlines_Flight_302), [2019 Boeing 737 MAX groundings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Boeing_737_MAX_groundings)
    *   The [European Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Union), [Australia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia), [India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/India), [Malaysia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malaysia), [Singapore](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Singapore), and [Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey) ground all [Boeing 737 MAX 8](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boeing_737_MAX_8) jets. This means 40% of the global fleet is now grounded, with [Indonesia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indonesia), [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China) and several airlines grounding their aircraft yesterday. Boeing states they will issue a software update for the model within weeks. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/mar/11/airlines-and-agencies-reassure-alarmed-passengers-about-boeing-737-max-8) [(BNO)](https://twitter.com/BNONews/status/1105506460237209601) [(AFP)](https://twitter.com/AFP/status/1105532685059932161)

## International relations

*   [United States–Venezuela relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States%E2%80%93Venezuela_relations), [Crisis in Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crisis_in_Venezuela)
    *   The [United States Secretary of State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Secretary_of_State) [Mike Pompeo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mike_Pompeo) announces that the U.S. will be withdrawing all remaining diplomatic staff from [Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venezuela). The withdrawal follows televised remarks from [Nicolás Maduro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicol%C3%A1s_Maduro) calling _[colectivos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colectivo_(Venezuela))_ (paramilitary groups) to active resistance, and alleging that [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) masterminded the [ongoing nationwide power blackout](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Venezuelan_blackout) as part of a "demonic plot" to oust him, by crippling the country's [electricity sector](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electricity_sector_in_Venezuela) with an "electromagnetic attack". [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/mar/12/nicolas-maduro-blames-demonic-trump-plot-for-blackout-crippling-venezuela) [(Infobae)](https://www.infobae.com/america/venezuela/2019/03/12/en-medio-del-masivo-apagon-en-venezuela-nicolas-maduro-llamo-a-los-colectivos-chavistas-a-la-resistencia-activa/)
*   In an annual report, the [Estonian Foreign Intelligence Service](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Estonian_Foreign_Intelligence_Service) warns that Russia will "very likely" try to intervene in European parliamentary elections this May to undermine unity within the European Union "by sowing disorder and disbelief" within and between the 28 [European Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Union) member states. [(Sky News)](https://news.sky.com/story/russia-very-likely-to-meddle-in-european-parliament-elections-warns-estonia-spy-chief-11663051)

## Law and crime

*   [2019 college admissions bribery scandal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_college_admissions_bribery_scandal)
    *   A college admission scheme across the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) results in the indictment of over 50 people including athletic coaches, CEOs, and two Hollywood actresses, accused of using bribery and fraud in order to cheat their children into universities such as [Yale](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yale) and [Stanford](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stanford). [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/03/12/us/indictment-college-admissions-scheme/index.html) [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-education-cheating/hollywoods-huffman-loughlin-snared-in-25-million-u-s-college-fraud-scheme-idUSKBN1QT1WJ)
*   [Catholic Church sexual abuse cases](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catholic_Church_sexual_abuse_cases)
    *   [Cardinal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cardinal_(Catholic_Church)) [George Pell](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Pell), the most senior official of the [Catholic Church](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catholic_Church) to be convicted of sexual abuse to date, is sentenced to six years in prison for the sexual assault of two children in the late 1990s. [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/03/12/australia/cardinal-george-pell-sentencing-intl/index.html?no-st=1552451368)
*   [Capital punishment in California](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capital_punishment_in_California)
    *   It is reported that [California](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/California) [Governor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Governor_of_California) [Gavin Newsom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gavin_Newsom) will sign an executive order placing a [moratorium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moratorium_(law)) on the death penalty for all 737 inmates on California's death row, ensuring that no executions will take place while he is governor. [(_Los Angeles Daily News_)](https://www.dailynews.com/2019/03/12/gov-gavin-newsom-to-halt-death-penalty-despite-voter-efforts-to-hasten-executions/?utm_content=fb-ladailynews&utm_source=facebook.com&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=socialflow)
*   [Crisis in Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crisis_in_Venezuela), [Censorship in Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Censorship_in_Venezuela)
    *   Prominent Venezuelan journalist Luis Carlos Diaz is released after being taken by the national intelligence service on Monday; he has been ordered not to speak of his time in detention or publish anything. [(The Guardian)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/mar/12/venezuela-luis-carlos-diaz-journalist-taken-sebin)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Micronesian parliamentary election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Micronesian_parliamentary_election)
    *   [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_Federated_States_of_Micronesia) [Peter M. Christian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_M._Christian) is defeated for re-election to his at-large seat in [Congress](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Congress_of_the_Federated_States_of_Micronesia) by David Panuelo. [(Pacific Islands Times)](https://www.pacificislandtimes.com/single-post/2019/03/12/FSM-elections-certified-Peter-Christian-loses-seat-to-Panuelo)
*   [Brexit negotiations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit_negotiations)
    *   [British parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parliament_of_the_United_Kingdom) rejects Prime Minister Theresa May's [Brexit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit) deal by 149 votes. A vote for leaving the European Union without a deal is scheduled for tomorrow. If Parliament rejects the decision to leave with no deal, Britain could request its withdrawal from the EU be postponed with the unanimous consent of the other 27 member states. [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/12/world/europe/brexit-vote.html)

# 2019-03-14

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [2019 Tel Aviv rocket strike](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Tel_Aviv_rocket_strike)
    *   Two rockets are fired from the [Gaza Strip](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaza_Strip) at [Tel Aviv](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tel_Aviv), [Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel); neither rocket was intercepted by the [IDF](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel_Defense_Forces)'s [Iron Dome](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iron_Dome) system. [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/14/world/israel-reports-rocket-attack-on-tel-aviv.html) [(IDF Spokesperson)](https://twitter.com/AmichaiStein1/status/1106287055108218880)

## Law and crime

*   [Bloody Sunday](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bloody_Sunday_(1972))
    *   Prosecutors in [Northern Ireland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northern_Ireland) charge a former [British Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/British_Army) soldier with murdering two people during the [mass shooting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mass_shooting) in [Derry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Derry) during [the Troubles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Troubles) in 1972. The man, known only as Soldier F, is also charged with three attempted murders. It is also announced that no other charges against either soldiers or civilians will be brought due to insufficient evidence. Soldiers shot 28 unarmed protestors, killing 13. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-northern-ireland-47540271)
*   [2019 college admissions bribery scandal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_college_admissions_bribery_scandal)
    *   Eight universities are sued by two [Stanford University](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stanford_University) students in regards to the college admissions bribery scandal. [(ABC News)](https://abcnews.go.com/US/elite-schools-hit-lawsuit-massive-college-admissions-bribery/story?id=61679252)
*   [Caracas drone attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caracas_drone_attack)
    *   An investigation by [CNN](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CNN) reveals new details about the plot to kill [Nicolás Maduro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicol%C3%A1s_Maduro), based on new videos. [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2019/03/14/americas/venezuela-drone-maduro-intl/index.html)

## Politics and elections

*   [Brexit negotiations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit_negotiations)
    *   The [House of Commons of the United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_of_Commons_of_the_United_Kingdom) votes 412 to 202 to seek a delay to [Brexit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit) of three months if [May](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theresa_May)'s deal can be passed at a third attempt next week, else significantly longer. The delay, which means the UK will no longer leave the [European Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Union) on March 29, will have to be unanimously approved by all other 27 EU member states. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-47576813)
*   [National Emergency Concerning the Southern Border of the United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Emergency_Concerning_the_Southern_Border_of_the_United_States)
    *   The [U.S. Senate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Senate) votes 59–41 to cancel [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump)'s emergency declaration to fund the [Mexico–United States border wall](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trump_wall). Trump plans to veto the decision. [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/14/us/politics/senate-vote-trump-national-emergency.html)

# 2019-03-15

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Christchurch mosque shootings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christchurch_mosque_shootings), [Terrorism in New Zealand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terrorism_in_New_Zealand)
    *   At least 50 people are killed and dozens others are injured during two attacks on mosques in [Christchurch](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christchurch), [New Zealand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Zealand). [(NBC News)](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/new-zealand-shooting-death-toll-rises-50-attack-mosque-n984066)
    *   Four people—three men and one woman—are arrested in connection to the shootings, according to [New Zealand Police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Zealand_Police) Commissioner Mike Bush. It is later learned that one of them was an armed citizen trying to help police and was released. [(_Sky News_)](https://news.sky.com/story/live-significant-number-killed-in-shootings-at-new-zealand-mosques-11665829)
    *   A gunman involved in the shootings of at least one of the two mosques is identified as Brenton Tarrant, a 28-year-old [Australian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australian_New_Zealanders) man. [(Associated Press)](https://apnews.com/1e19fefcb2e948a1bf7ce63429bc186e)
*   [2019 Tel Aviv rocket strike](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Tel_Aviv_rocket_strike)
    *   In response to the launching of two rockets from the [Gaza Strip](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaza_Strip) towards [Tel Aviv](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tel_Aviv) the day before, Israel launches counter strikes directed at the town of [Khan Yunis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khan_Yunis). [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/14/world/israel-reports-rocket-attack-on-tel-aviv.html) [(Associated Press)](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/israeli-military-announces-strikes-gaza-sites-after-rocket-attack-tel-n983551)

## Health and environment

*   [School strike for climate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/School_strike_for_climate)
    *   Hundreds of thousands of students protest worldwide against [global warming](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Global_warming). [(ANSA)](http://www.ansa.it/english/news/general_news/2019/03/15/italian-climate-protesters-demand-action_dc295006-6a6a-4062-ac72-29f15a28c9d7.html) [(Archynewsy.com)](https://www.archynewsy.com/climate-events-all-over-the-world-students-invade-the-squares-in-italy-we-are-one-million/) [(The Sydney Morning Herald)](https://www.smh.com.au/education/don-t-want-the-earth-to-get-hurt-150-000-students-strike-20190315-p514ky.html)
*   [Keystone pipeline](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keystone_Pipeline) expansion
    *   A U.S. appeals court denies [TransCanada's](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TransCanada_Corporation) request to lift an injunction preventing pre-construction work on the Keystone XL expansion from beginning. The company claims this will delay the project by a year. [(CBC)](https://www.cbc.ca/news/business/transcanada-keystone-pipeline-1.5058988)

## International relations

*   [United States and the International Criminal Court](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_and_the_International_Criminal_Court), [United States war crimes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_war_crimes), [War crimes in Afghanistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_in_Afghanistan_(2001%E2%80%93present)#War_crimes)
    *   [United States Secretary of State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Secretary_of_State) [Mike Pompeo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mike_Pompeo) bars the entry of [International Criminal Court](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Criminal_Court) investigators into the United States as part of the ICC's investigation into possible [war crimes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_crime) committed by [the United States military](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Armed_Forces) in [Afghanistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghanistan). [(Associated Press)](https://www.apnews.com/08e538e370914f6e8243e237dbde50b5)
*   [North Korea and weapons of mass destruction](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Korea_and_weapons_of_mass_destruction), [North Korea–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Korea%E2%80%93United_States_relations)
    *   [North Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Korea) has reportedly threatened to suspend negotiations with the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) regarding nuclear weaponry, as well as resume related missile testing. [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/15/world/asia/north-korea-kim-jong-un-nuclear.html)

## Law and crime

*   [Volkswagen emissions scandal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volkswagen_emissions_scandal)
    *   The [Securities and Exchange Commission](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Securities_and_Exchange_Commission) alleges in a court filing that [Volkswagen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volkswagen) has "perpetrated a massive fraud" and repeatedly lied to U.S. investors in connection with diesel emissions. [(CNBC)](https://www.cnbc.com/2019/03/15/dieselgate-sec-says-volkswagen-perpetrated-fraud-lied-to-investors.html)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Algerian protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Algerian_protests)
    *   The 2019 Algerian protests, the largest protests since the [Algerian Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algerian_Civil_War), have led the government to cancel the Presidential elections, to replace the Prime Minister, and to promise [Abdelaziz Bouteflika](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abdelaziz_Bouteflika) would not run for re-election. [(_The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/why-algeria-is-still-protesting-after-ruler-relents/2019/03/13/e5353bb2-455d-11e9-94ab-d2dda3c0df52_story.html)
*   [National Emergency Concerning the Southern Border of the United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Emergency_Concerning_the_Southern_Border_of_the_United_States)
    *   [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) issues his first ever veto after Congress attempts to block his emergency declaration to fund construction of the [Mexico–United States border wall](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trump_wall). [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/15/us/politics/trump-veto-national-emergency.html)
*   Lawmakers in [Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico)'s [lower chamber of Congress](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chamber_of_Deputies_(Mexico)) approve a constitutional reform that would allow for [recall referendums](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Recall_election) to cut short the six-year presidential term limit; the measure still needs the approval of the [Senate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Senate_of_Mexico) and the state legislatures. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mexico-politics/mexicos-lower-house-passes-measure-to-cut-short-presidential-term-idUSKCN1QW0FC)

# 2019-03-16

## Disasters and accidents

*   A fire at a refugee camp in [Nigeria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nigeria) kills eight and leaves 15,000 homeless. The residents are persons displaced by ongoing conflict with [Boko Haram](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boko_Haram). [(Reuters)](https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-nigeria-security-insurgency/fire-kills-at-least-eight-destroys-homes-in-northeast-nigeria-camp-idUKKCN1QX0EA)
*   Flooding over large portions of [Nebraska](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nebraska) leave one dead and two missing with over 900 people using emergency shelters. Many roads and highways in the state are also closed. [(_USA Today_)](https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2019/03/16/nebraska-flooding-worst-50-years-following-bomb-cyclone-storm/3184806002/)

    *   [Progressive Slovakia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Progressive_Slovakia) candidate [Zuzana Čaputová](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zuzana_%C4%8Caputov%C3%A1), who ran on an [anti-corruption](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anti-corruption) campaign against the backdrop of [Ján Kuciak's murder](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Murder_of_J%C3%A1n_Kuciak), wins the first round of [Slovakia's presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Slovak_presidential_election) with 40.5% of the vote while the ruling [Direction – Social Democracy Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Direction_%E2%80%93_Social_Democracy)'s candidate [Maroš Šefčovič](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maro%C5%A1_%C5%A0ef%C4%8Dovi%C4%8D) receives 18.6% of the vote. As no candidate reached 50%+1 votes in the first round, Čaputová and Šefčovič will take part in a second round on March 30, 2019. The ruling Direction – Social Democracy Party suffers its worst result since its founding in 1999. # 2019-03-18

## Law and crime

*   [2019 Utrecht shooting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Utrecht_shooting)
    *   A man [opens fire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mass_shooting) in a tram in the city of [Utrecht](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Utrecht), [Netherlands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Netherlands), killing three people and injuring nine others, before fleeing. [Terrorism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terrorism_in_Europe) is suspected by authorities. A 37-year-old [Turkish](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turks_in_the_Netherlands) man is arrested. [(Fox News)](https://www.foxnews.com/world/the-latest-no-indication-utrecht-shooter-knew-victims)
*   [Christchurch mosque shootings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christchurch_mosque_shootings), [Internet censorship in Australia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_censorship_in_Australia)
    *   [Telstra](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telstra) blocks access to several websites in [Australia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia) for hosting footage of the recent mass shootings in [Christchurch](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christchurch), [New Zealand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Zealand), which were [livestreamed](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Livestreamed) on [Facebook](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Facebook), including [LiveLeak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiveLeak), [4chan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/4chan), [8chan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/8chan), [Voat](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Voat) and popular blog [Zero Hedge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zero_Hedge). [Optus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Optus) and [Vodafone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vodafone_(Australia)) took similar actions but did not list which sites had been blocked. [(9news)](https://www.9news.com.au/2019/03/19/16/47/telcos-block-access-to-4chan-liveleak)

## Science and technology

*   [Kamchatka superbolide](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kamchatka_superbolide)
    *   [NASA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NASA) reports that it has detected a huge [meteor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Meteor) explosion in [Earth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earth)'s atmosphere on December 18, 2018, above [Russia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia)'s [Kamchatka Peninsula](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kamchatka_Peninsula). The explosion went largely unnoticed due to its location. The explosion, which was ten times more powerful than the [atomic bomb](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Little_Boy) dropped on [Hiroshima](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hiroshima), was the second largest of its kind in 30 years. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-47607696)

# 2019-03-24

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [War in Afghanistan (2001–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_in_Afghanistan_(2001%E2%80%93present))
    *   A United States [airstrike](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Airstrike) in Afghanistan early Saturday kills 10 children and 3 adults. The family was displaced because of the conflict according to early findings by the [United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_Assistance_Mission_in_Afghanistan). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-afghanistan-casualties/ten-children-killed-by-u-s-air-strike-in-afghanistan-u-n-idUSKCN1R60V0)

## Arts and culture

*   The 2019 [Global Teacher Prize](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Global_Teacher_Prize) and its $1 million (£760,000) purse is awarded to Brother Peter Tabichi, a [Franciscan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franciscans) science teacher from rural [Kenya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenya). Tabichi gives away 80 percent of his salary to support poorer pupils at the Keriko Mixed Day Secondary School in Pwani Village, [Nakuru](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nakuru). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/business-47658803)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [Stoneman Douglas High School massacre aftermath](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stoneman_Douglas_High_School_shooting)
    *   More than 60 school, county, city, child services and law enforcement officials, as well as mental health specialists, teachers and parents, hold an emergency meeting after the suicide of a second Stoneman Douglas survivor. Florida's emergency chief is requesting the state Legislature provide more mental health resources for the community. [Coral Springs, Florida](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coral_Springs,_Florida), police reported that, Saturday night, a current sophomore killed himself. Last week, Sydney Aiello, a 19-year-old graduate who had recently been diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder, took her own life. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2019/mar/24/parkland-student-second-death) [(_Miami Herald_)](https://www.miamiherald.com/news/local/community/broward/article228350134.html)

## International relations

*   [Russia–Venezuela relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia%E2%80%93Venezuela_relations)
    *   Two [Russian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia) military planes, an [Ilyushin Il-62](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ilyushin_Il-62) and an [Antonov An-124](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antonov_An-124_Ruslan) land at [Simón Bolívar International Airport](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sim%C3%B3n_Bol%C3%ADvar_International_Airport_(Venezuela)) near [Caracas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caracas), [Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venezuela), carrying senior Defence Ministry official [Vasily Tonkoshkurov](/w/index.php?title=Vasily_Tonkoshkurov&action=edit&redlink=1) \[[ru](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%A2%D0%BE%D0%BD%D0%BA%D0%BE%D1%88%D0%BA%D1%83%D1%80%D0%BE%D0%B2,_%D0%92%D0%B0%D1%81%D0%B8%D0%BB%D0%B8%D0%B9_%D0%9F%D0%B5%D1%82%D1%80%D0%BE%D0%B2%D0%B8%D1%87)\], a large amount of equipment and about 100 troops. Russia, which three months earlier held joint military exercises on Venezuelan soil, condemned other countries for backing Venezuelan opposition leader [Juan Guaidó](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Guaid%C3%B3) against embattled [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Venezuela) [Nicolás Maduro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicol%C3%A1s_Maduro). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-venezuela-politics/russian-air-force-planes-land-in-venezuela-carrying-troops-reports-idUSKCN1R50NB) [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-46989279)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Thai general election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Thai_general_election)
    *   Voters in [Thailand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thailand) head to the polls to elect all 500 members of the [House of Representatives](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_of_Representatives_(Thailand)). This is the first parliamentary election held in the country since the invalidation of the [2014 Thai general election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_Thai_general_election) and the ensuing [2014 Thai coup d'état](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_Thai_coup_d%27%C3%A9tat). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-thailand-election/thai-voters-go-to-polls-as-coup-leader-democratic-front-face-off-idUSKCN1R5027) [(_The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/asia_pacific/thailands-military-junta-allows-first-elections-in-8-years-but-the-rules-appear-to-tip-in-its-favor/2019/03/23/b29f36fa-4bd2-11e9-8cfc-2c5d0999c21e_story.html?noredirect=on&utm_term=.6713bae9e993)

    *   Voters in the [Comoros](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comoros) head to the polls to elect a new [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_Comoros). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-47685991)

    *   Special Counsel [Robert Mueller](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Mueller)'s report on [Russian interference in the 2016 United States elections](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_interference_in_the_2016_United_States_elections) does not find that any US officials or [Trump campaign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump_2016_presidential_campaign) members knowingly conspired with the government of [Russia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia). Mueller drew no conclusions about whether Trump [illegally obstructed justice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Obstruction_of_justice). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trump-russia-barr/mueller-does-not-find-trump-campaign-knowingly-conspired-with-russia-idUSKCN1R50RG) [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/24/us/politics/mueller-report-summary.html)
    *   Attorney General William Barr releases the "principal conclusions" of Mueller's investigation in a four-page public letter to the Congress's [Judiciary Committee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Judiciary_Committee) leadership. [(Fox News)](https://www.foxnews.com/politics/barr-releases-letter-summarizing-muellers-key-findings-after-long-running-russia-probe) [(_The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2019/03/24/takeaways-mueller-reports-principal-conclusions/?utm_term=.cabfa868c97a) [(William Barr letter to congress via _The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/context/read-attorney-general-barr-s-principal-conclusions-of-the-mueller-report/?noteId=9048a12b-2332-4645-a1be-d645db216eb5&questionId=218b8095-c5e3-4eab-9135-4170f5b3e87f&utm_term=.1cc3924e144f)

# 2019-03-25

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Gaza–Israel conflict](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaza%E2%80%93Israel_conflict)
    *   Seven people are moderately injured after a rocket attack destroys a home in [Mishmeret](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mishmeret), [Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel). The [Israel Defense Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel_Defense_Forces) claim that [Hamas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hamas) is responsible for any attack from Gaza. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-47689684)
    *   As a result, [Israeli Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Israel) [Benjamin Netanyahu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benjamin_Netanyahu) cuts his four-day trip to the United States short after meeting with [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-israel-palestinians-violence/netanyahu-cuts-short-u-s-trip-after-rocket-attack-from-gaza-idUSKCN1R60M3) [(_The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/gaza-rocket-hits-israeli-home-injuring-7-netanyahu-cuts-short-washington-trip/2019/03/25/7eb5f062-4ed0-11e9-a3f7-78b7525a8d5f_story.html)
    *   In retaliation [Israeli Air Force](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israeli_Air_Force) jets strike multiple targets in the [Gaza Strip](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaza_Strip), including the office of senior [Hamas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hamas) official [Ismail Haniyeh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ismail_Haniyeh), and Hamas' military intelligence headquarters in [Gaza City](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaza_City). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-israel-palsetinians-violence-haniyeh/israel-air-strike-targets-office-of-hamas-leader-in-gaza-hamas-radio-idUSKCN1R62BJ) [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/03/israeli-military-begins-striking-hamas-targets-gaza-190325152429228.html)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [Flash flooding](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flash_flooding) in the southern provinces of [Iran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran) kills at least 19 people and injures more than 100. The majority of the deaths occurred in the city of [Shiraz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shiraz). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-47694423)

## Health and environment

*   [Bayer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bayer) and [Johnson & Johnson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Johnson_%26_Johnson) announce that they have reached a $775 million agreement to settle approximately 25,000 outstanding litigation cases, which claim that their drug [Xarelto](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xarelto) caused severe and sometimes fatal bleeding episodes. Bayer and Johnson & Johnson had successfully defended the safety of the drug in all six prior cases that went to trial. [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/25/health/xarelto-blood-thinner-lawsuit-settlement.html)

## International relations

*   [United States recognition of the Golan Heights as part of Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_recognition_of_the_Golan_Heights_as_part_of_Israel), [Israel–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel%E2%80%93United_States_relations), [Syria–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syria%E2%80%93United_States_relations)
    *   [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) signs a proclamation formally recognising the disputed [Golan Heights](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golan_Heights) as sovereign [Israeli](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel) territory. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/03/trump-formally-recognises-israeli-sovereignty-golan-heights-190325153937336.html)
    *   [Syria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syria)'s [Foreign Affairs Ministry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs_and_Expatriates_(Syria)) condemns Trump's move as a "flagrant violation of the sovereignty of Syria". [(Xinhuanet)](http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2019-03/26/c_137923014.htm)
*   [Greek–Turkish relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greek%E2%80%93Turkish_relations)
    *   [Greek prime minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Greece) [Alexis Tsipras](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Tsipras) says [Turkish fighter jets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkish_Air_Force) threatened his helicopter, in Greek [airspace](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Airspace), heading to the [Aegean island](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aegean_Islands) of [Agathonisi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agathonisi), near Turkey's coastline, for [Greek Independence Day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greek_Independence_Day) which celebrates the country's 1821 uprising against the [Ottoman Empire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ottoman_Empire). [Turkish security forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkish_Armed_Forces) rejected the accusation, insisting the jets were carrying out a routine mission. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-47692529)

## Law and crime

*   A judge rules that former [Guantanamo Bay](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guantanamo_Bay_detention_camp) prisoner [Omar Khadr](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Omar_Khadr) has completed his prison sentence. [(CBC)](https://www.cbc.ca/amp/1.5068610) [(Vancouver Courier)](https://www.vancourier.com/edmonton-judge-rules-omar-khadr-s-sentence-has-expired-1.23769542)
*   Attorney [Michael Avenatti](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Avenatti) is arrested and charged with extortion, embezzlement and bank fraud. [(CNBC)](https://www.cnbc.com/2019/03/25/michael-avenatti-to-be-charged-with-wire-and-bank-fraud.html)

# 2019-03-27

## Business and economy

*   [Cathay Pacific](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cathay_Pacific) announces the acquisition of low-cost carrier [HK Express](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HK_Express) for US$628 million ([HK$](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HK$)4.93 billion). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/business-47715426) [(_South China Morning Post_)](https://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/transport/article/3003412/hong-kongs-cathay-pacific-airways-pay-hk493-billion-buy)

## International relations

*   [European migrant crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_migrant_crisis)
    *   The [European Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Union) says it is suspending [Operation Sophia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Sophia) ship patrols. Instead, the operation will rely on air missions and close coordination with [Libya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libya). The EU also announces the mandate for Operation Sophia, which was scheduled to expire March 31, 2019, will be extended for six months. [(AFP via Yahoo! News)](https://news.yahoo.com/eu-suspends-naval-patrols-libya-migrant-operation-150040225.html)
    *   More than 100 migrants hijack a [merchant vessel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elhiblu_1) that rescued them off [Libya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libya)'s coast, ordering the crew to head towards [Malta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malta). Malta's military said the ship would not be allowed into its waters. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-47725242)

## Law and crime

*   Aftermath of the [Charlottesville car attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlottesville_car_attack)
    *   James Alex Fields, who drove his car into a crowd of protestors at the [Unite the Right rally](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unite_the_Right_rally) in [Charlottesville, Virginia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlottesville,_Virginia), in 2017, killing one person and injuring 28 others, pleads guilty to 29 federal hate crimes. He will be sentenced on July 3, 2019. [(NBC)](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/driver-deadly-car-attack-charlottesville-white-nationalist-rally-pleads-guilty-n987961)
*   Aftermath of the [kidnapping of Jayme Closs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kidnapping_of_Jayme_Closs)
    *   Jake Patterson pleads guilty to the kidnapping of teenager Jayme Closs and the murder of her parents last year. [(_New York Post_)](https://nypost.com/2019/03/27/jake-patterson-pleads-guilty-to-kidnapping-jayme-closs-killing-her-parents/)
*   [Medicaid expansion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patient_Protection_and_Affordable_Care_Act#Medicaid_expansion)
    *   Judge [James Boasberg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._Boasberg) of the [U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_District_Court_for_the_District_of_Columbia) blocks [Kentucky](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kentucky) from implementing [Medicaid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medicaid) work requirements and [Arkansas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arkansas) from continuing its program, stating the program's approval by the [Department of Health and Human Services](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Department_of_Health_and_Human_Services) "... is arbitrary and capricious because it did not address ... how the project would implicate the 'core' objective of Medicaid, the provision of medical coverage to the needy". [(NPR)](https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2019/03/27/707401647/federal-judge-again-blocks-states-work-requirements-for-medicaid)
*   Former [Argentine President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Argentina) [Carlos Menem](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carlos_Menem) is sentenced to 3 years and 9 months in prison for the sale of a goverment ground. His government's [Minister of Economy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ministry_of_the_Treasury_(Argentina)) [Domingo Cavallo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Domingo_Cavallo) was also sentenced to 3 years and 6 months. In addition, both were disqualified from holding public office for life. As Menem is currently a National Senator and has immunity, he will not comply with his sentence yet. [(CNN in Spanish)](https://cnnespanol.cnn.com/2019/03/27/argentina-condenan-al-expresidente-carlos-menem-a-3-anos-9-meses-de-prision/)

## Politics and elections

*   [Brexit negotiations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit_negotiations)
    *   The UK parliament holds "[indicative votes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indicative_vote)" on eight options regarding [Brexit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit) in an attempt to find an approach which can command a majority. None of the options are passed at this stage; however, a further round of voting is planned for Monday. [(CBC)](https://www.cbc.ca/news/world/theresa-may-job-brexit-alternatives-vote-1.5073190) [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2019/mar/27/alternative-brexit-options-what-will-john-bercow-select-for-indicative-votes) [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2019/mar/27/mps-reject-all-alternative-brexit-options)
    *   [Theresa May](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theresa_May) announces that she will resign before the next phase of Brexit negotiations, if her deal were to be passed. At present, no such vote is planned. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2019/mar/27/theresa-may-to-resign-before-next-phase-of-brexit)
*   [2019 Guatemalan general election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Guatemalan_general_election)
    *   The [Supreme Electoral Tribunal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supreme_Electoral_Tribunal_(Guatemala)) dismisses six nullity proceedings against the presidential candidacy of [Thelma Aldana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thelma_Aldana). However, it accepts two processes and requests the [Supreme Court of Justice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supreme_Court_of_Justice_of_Guatemala), the Public Prosecutor's Office and the Comptroller General of Accounts to present a report on their legal situation. It was also reported that after resolving these processes this week, it will proceed to issue the credential that grants immunity to the candidate. [(_Prensa Libre_)](https://www.prensalibre.com/guatemala/politica/tse-pide-informacion-a-mp-contraloria-y-oj-sobre-thelma-aldana/)
    *   The Supreme Electoral Tribunal acts legally before the [Constitutional Court](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Constitutional_Court_of_Guatemala) to appeal the permission granted to the presidential candidate [Zury Ríos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zury_R%C3%ADos) to participate in the elections despite having constitutional impediment. [(_Prensa Libre_)](https://www.prensalibre.com/guatemala/politica/los-argumentos-del-tse-para-apelar-la-candidatura-de-zury-rios/)
    *   Director of the Registry of Citizens of the Supreme Electoral Tribunal [Leopoldo Guerra](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leopoldo_Guerra) denounces pressures and threats by [far-right](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Far-right_politics) groups not to register Thelma Aldana as a presidential candidate and request precautionary measures from the [Inter-American Commission on Human Rights](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inter-American_Commission_on_Human_Rights). [(_Prensa Libre_)](https://www.prensalibre.com/guatemala/politica/leopoldo-guerra-pide-medidas-cautelares-a-la-cidh-por-amenazas/)

## Armed conflicts and attacks

    *   At least 11 people are killed following an explosion in [Mogadishu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mogadishu), [Somalia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Somalia). [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/03/8-killed-car-bomb-mogadishu-190328110849696.html)
*   [European migrant crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_migrant_crisis)
    *   The [Maltese Navy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maritime_Squadron_of_the_Armed_Forces_of_Malta) seizes control of commercial tanker _[Elhiblu 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elhiblu_1)_, which was hijacked by migrants off the coast of [Libya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libya) yesterday. The tanker is now docked in the Maltese capital, [Valletta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Valletta). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-47730693)

## Business and economy

*   [WOW air](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WOW_air), an [Icelandic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iceland) low-cost airline, ceases operations. [(Icelandic Transport Authority)](https://www.icetra.is/about/press-room/news/end-of-operation-of-wow-air) [(CBC)](https://www.cbc.ca/news/world/icelandic-budget-airline-wow-air-ceases-operations-1.5074662)

## Disasters and accidents

*   At least 32 people have died after a truck struck a crowd gathered at a road accident in western [Guatemala](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guatemala). The group had apparently gathered on the road to inspect a person who had been killed in a separate crash when the vehicle ploughed into them. [(Sky News)](https://news.sky.com/story/30-dead-after-truck-hits-crowd-in-guatemala-11676960)
*   A fire breaks out in [Dhaka](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dhaka), [Bangladesh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bangladesh), at a 22-story tower, killing at least 25 people and injuring more than 70 others. [(_BBC_)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-47751005)

## Law and crime

*   The [Supreme Court of the United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supreme_Court_of_the_United_States) rejects a request by gun rights activists to grant a temporary stay on the Trump administration's ban on [bump stock](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bump_fire) attachments that allow semi-automatic firearms to be fired rapidly. The policy took effect Tuesday after a similar bid to delay implementation was rejected. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-court-guns/us-supreme-court-refuses-to-block-trumps-gun-bump-stock-ban-idUSKCN1R9230)

## Politics and elections

*   [Venezuelan presidential crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Venezuelan_presidential_crisis)
    *   [Venezuelan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venezuela) state [comptroller](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comptroller) Elvis Amoroso announces that opposition leader [Juan Guaidó](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Guaid%C3%B3) is barred from holding public office for 15 years because of irregularities in his financial records. Guaidó, the [National Assembly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Assembly_(Venezuela)) leader, says he will continue his campaign to oust [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Venezuela) [Nicolás Maduro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicol%C3%A1s_Maduro). [(CBS News)](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/juan-guaido-venezuelan-opposition-leader-barred-from-holding-office-for-15-years-live-updates-2019-03-28/)

    *   [Cayman Islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cayman_Islands) legalises [same-sex marriage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Same-sex_marriage) after a judge rules that a law defining marriage as a relationship between a man and woman is [unconstitutional](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Constitution_of_the_Cayman_Islands).     *   [UK Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_the_United_Kingdom) [Theresa May](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theresa_May) suffers another defeat of 286–344 on her Withdrawal Agreement. [European Council President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_European_Council) [Donald Tusk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Tusk) schedules an emergency summit on April 10, two days before [Brexit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit) is scheduled to happen. # 2019-03-31

## Disasters and accidents

*   A plant explosion in the [Jiangsu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jiangsu) province of [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China) kills seven and injures five others. The explosion is the second deadliest in the month after the [2019 Xiangshui chemical plant explosion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Xiangshui_chemical_plant_explosion). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-china-blast/seven-killed-in-china-plant-explosion-second-deadly-blast-this-month-idUSKCN1RC0AC)
*   Severe thunderstorms in [Nepal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nepal) leave at least 25 people dead while more than 400 others are injured. [(ABC News)](https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/officials-20-killed-hundreds-injured-rainstorm-southern-nepal-62073305) [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/mar/31/nepal-thunderstorm-severe-25-dead-hundreds-injured)

## International relations

*   [Cross-Strait relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross-Strait_relations)
    *   [Taiwan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taiwan) condemns [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China) after two [PLAAF](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/People%27s_Liberation_Army_Air_Force) fighter jets pass the maritime line on the [Taiwan Strait](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taiwan_Strait). Though there was no immediate response from China, the move comes after a week when the [United States Navy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Navy) and [United States Coast Guard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Coast_Guard) sent ships through the Strait. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-taiwan-china/taiwan-condemns-china-after-chinese-jets-flew-past-a-maritime-line-idUSKCN1RC0ID) [(Channel NewsAsia)](https://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/asia/taiwan-condemns-china-after-chinese-jets-flew-past-a-maritime-line-11397794) [(_The Japan Times_)](https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2019/03/31/asia-pacific/taipei-blasts-provocative-flight-chinese-fighters-taiwan-strait/#.XKDRt5hKhPY)
*   [United States recognition of the Golan Heights as part of Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_recognition_of_the_Golan_Heights_as_part_of_Israel)
    *   During the 30th [Arab League](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arab_League) summit held in [Tunisia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tunisia), leaders condemn the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) recognition of the [Golan Heights](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golan_Heights) belonging to [Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel), and stated the establishment of a [Palestinian state](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palestinian_state) is essential for stability. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-tunisia-arabs-summit/arab-leaders-grappling-regional-rifts-condemn-u-s-decision-on-golan-idUSKCN1RC060) [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/03/arab-leaders-call-palestinian-state-condemn-golan-move-190331122623860.html) [(_The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/africa/arab-leaders-meet-in-tunisia-with-eye-on-trumps-golan-move/2019/03/31/c3b66466-5390-11e9-aa83-504f086bf5d6_story.html?utm_term=.25ca29cf269c)

## Law and crime

*   Fourteen suspected communist rebels are killed in the [Philippines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines). However, human rights groups dispute the claims by police forces stating those killed were farmers. [(_The Bangkok Post_)](https://www.bangkokpost.com/news/asean/1654224/philippine-police-kill-14-men-rights-groups-say-were-farmers) [(Channel NewsAsia)](https://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/asia/14-farmers-killed-in-philippine-police-massacre-activists-11397608)
*   Three teenage migrants who partook in the hijacking of _[Elhiblu 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elhiblu_1)_ are charged in [Malta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malta). [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/31/world/europe/migrants-hijacking-ship-malta.html)
*   American rapper [Nipsey Hussle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nipsey_Hussle) is shot and killed outside a [Los Angeles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Los_Angeles) clothing store. Two other people with him were also shot and wounded. [(Global News)](https://globalnews.ca/news/5116559/rapper-nipsey-hussle-shot-dead/)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Ukrainian presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Ukrainian_presidential_election)
    *   Voters in Ukraine go to the polls today in the first round of the presidential election. [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Ukraine) [Petro Poroshenko](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Petro_Poroshenko) is seeking re-election, with comedian [Volodymyr Zelensky](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volodymyr_Zelensky) and former [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Ukraine) [Yulia Tymoshenko](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yulia_Tymoshenko) the primary challengers. All three have expressed largely pro-European views. Former Vice Prime Minister [Yuriy Boyko](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuriy_Boyko) is the front-runner among the pro-Russian candidates. A total of 39 candidates are on the ballot, increasing the probability no candidate will win more than 50 percent of the votes. If so, the top two will meet in a second round on 21 April. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-47763176)
*   [2019 Slovak presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Slovak_presidential_election)
    *   Anti-corruption candidate [Zuzana Čaputová](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zuzana_%C4%8Caputov%C3%A1) of the [Progressive Slovakia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Progressive_Slovakia) party wins the second round of Slovakia's presidential election, defeating the governing party candidate [Maroš Šefčovič](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maro%C5%A1_%C5%A0ef%C4%8Dovi%C4%8D), 58 percent versus 42%. She will be the country's first female head of state. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-47756368)
*   [2019 Turkish local elections](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Turkish_local_elections)
    *   Voters head to the polls in [Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey) to vote on metropolitan and district municipal mayors along with provincial and municipal councillors. The election is believed to be contested on challenging the current [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Turkey) [Recep Tayyip Erdoğan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Recep_Tayyip_Erdo%C4%9Fan). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-47764393) [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/03/economy-security-spotlight-turks-set-local-polls-190330150248508.html)

## Sports

*   [Elvis Luciano](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elvis_Luciano) of the [Toronto Blue Jays](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toronto_Blue_Jays) becomes the first person born in the 2000s to play in a [Major League Baseball](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Major_League_Baseball) game. [(MLB.com)](https://www.mlb.com/news/elvis-luciano-first-mlb-player-born-in-2000s)

# 2019-04-01

## Disasters and accidents

*   [2019 Iran floods](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Iran_floods)
    *   [Iranian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran) government announces an emergency in southwestern provinces threatened by flooding and worked to evacuate dozens of villages as forecasters predicted more of the [heavy rains](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/March_2019_North_Iran_Floods) that have killed at least 45 people last week. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-iran-floods/iran-calls-emergency-in-flood-threatened-southwest-province-idUSKCN1RB0F3)
*   The death toll from thunderstorms in southern [Nepal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nepal) rises to 30. Several houses are ruptured, trees uprooted and vehicles overturned in [Bara district](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bara_district) and [Parsa district](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parsa_district). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-47772482)
*   Thirty firefighters die in southwestern [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China) after a forest fire trapped them due to a sudden shift in winds. [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/01/world/asia/china-fire-sichuan.html) [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-china-47772483)
*   Two children die and twenty are injured after a [dust devil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dust_devil) in [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China) lifts an [inflatable castle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inflatable_castle) off the ground. [(_South China Morning Post_)](https://www.scmp.com/news/china/society/article/3004174/two-children-killed-when-bouncy-castle-swept-air-dust-devil)

## Health and environment

*   [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China) announces that it will add [fentanyl](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fentanyl) to a list of regulated narcotic drugs on May 1, 2019 in an effort to curtail its manufacturing. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-china-47772484) [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/04/01/asia/china-us-fentanyl-trump-intl/index.html) [(_Time_)](http://time.com/5561887/china-regulate-fentanyl-drugs/)
*   Aftermath of [Cyclone Idai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyclone_Idai)
    *   The first death due to [cholera](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cholera) is confirmed in [Mozambique](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mozambique), with confirmed cases rising to 517. [(CBS News)](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/cholera-outbreak-cyclone-mozambique-first-death-disease-spreads-fast/) [(_The Independent_)](https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/africa/cyclone-idai-mozambique-cholera-death-beira-a8848971.html)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Turkish local elections](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Turkish_local_elections), [Erdoğanism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erdo%C4%9Fanism)
    *   In an election [marred by electoral fraud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Turkish_local_elections#Controversies), [Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey)'s ruling [Justice and Development Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Justice_and_Development_Party_(Turkey)) wins with 44% of the vote while [Republican People's Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_People%27s_Party_(Turkey)) comes in second with 30% of the vote. Overall, [People's Alliance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/People%27s_Alliance_(Turkey)) gets 51% of the vote while [Nation Alliance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nation_Alliance_(Turkey)) receives 37% of the vote. [Voter turnout](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Voter_turnout) was 84%. [(Anadolu Agency)](http://secim.aa.com.tr/#en)
*   [2019 Japanese imperial transition](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Japanese_imperial_transition)
    *   [Reiwa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reiwa_period) (令和) is revealed as the new [Japanese Era name](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_era_name) set to start on May 1 upon [Crown Prince Naruhito](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crown_Prince_Naruhito)'s [accession](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enthronement_of_the_Japanese_Emperor) to the [Crysanthemum Throne](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crysanthemum_Throne) as the 126th [Emperor of Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emperor_of_Japan). [(_The Japan Times_)](https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2019/04/01/national/politics-diplomacy/japan-readies-announce-name-new-era/)
*   [2019 Guatemalan general election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Guatemalan_general_election)
    *   The [Supreme Electoral Tribunal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supreme_Electoral_Tribunal_(Guatemala)) accepts the nullity recourses against the candidacy of [Thelma Aldana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thelma_Aldana) and temporarily leaves her out of the general elections. However, an appeal will be filed before the Supreme Court of Justice and ultimately, the [Constitutional Court](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Constitutional_Court_of_Guatemala). [(_Prensa Libre_)](https://www.prensalibre.com/guatemala/politica/tse-rechaza-inscripcion-de-thelma-aldana/) [(Fox News)](https://www.foxnews.com/world/guatemala-election-court-puts-former-prosecutor-out-of-race)

*   [2019 Algerian protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Algerian_protests)
    *   [Algerian President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Algeria) [Abdelaziz Bouteflika](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abdelaziz_Bouteflika) announces that he will resign by April 28, following intense pressure from the [Algerian People's National Armed Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algerian_People%27s_National_Armed_Forces) and ruling party to step down amid anti-government protests, bringing an end to his 20-year rule. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-algeria-protests-businessmen/algerias-bouteflika-to-resign-before-mandate-ends-april-28-state-media-idUSKCN1RD217)
*   [Brexit negotiations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit_negotiations)
    *   The [British parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parliament_of_the_United_Kingdom) votes against four alternative [Brexit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit) plans. [(CBC)](https://www.cbc.ca/news/world/brexit-monday-indicative-votes-1.5079353)
    *   Protesters strip naked in the public galleries of the [House of Commons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_of_Commons_(United_Kingdom)), pressing their rear ends against the window facing Ministers. [(the Guardian)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OVdl6lKxG-Q)
*   [Michele Muratori](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michele_Muratori) and [Nicola Selva](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicola_Selva) are sworn in as [Captains Regent](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captains_Regent_of_San_Marino) of [San Marino](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Marino). # 2019-04-02

## Business and economy

*   [Google](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Google) starts deleting consumer accounts from its social network [Google+](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Google%2B) after seven years due to low user engagement and the discovery of [security vulnerabilities](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Security_vulnerabilities) which potentially exposed user data to developers. [(_The Verge_)](https://www.theverge.com/2019/4/2/18290637/google-plus-shutdown-consumer-personal-account-delete)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [Boeing 737 MAX groundings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boeing_737_MAX_groundings)
    *   [Boeing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boeing) delays the availability of the software update for its [737 Max](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boeing_737_MAX) airliners. The [Federal Aviation Administration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Aviation_Administration) anticipates the update to be rolled out "in the coming weeks." [(CBC)](https://www.cbc.ca/news/business/boeing-faa-more-time-needed-737-max-fixes-1.5080823)

## International relations

*   [Russia–Venezuela relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia%E2%80%93Venezuela_relations)
    *   [Russia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia) opens a helicopter training facility in [Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venezuela). Under the plans, Russian state-owned [Rostec](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rostec) will train Venezuelan pilots to operate [Mi-35M](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Mil_Mi-24_variants) gunships and transport helicopters. The move comes after the White House warned Moscow against sending troops or military equipment to the country. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-venezuela-politics-russia/russia-says-it-has-opened-helicopter-training-center-in-venezuela-idUSKCN1RE1G3)

## Law and crime

*   According to a criminal complaint filed in a U.S. District Court, a [Chinese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_people) woman is arrested and charged with making a false statement to the [United States Secret Service](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Secret_Service) after illegally entering [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump)'s [Mar-a-Lago](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mar-a-Lago) resort in [Florida](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Florida) on 30 March 2019 while carrying multiple passports, four mobile phones and a [thumb drive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thumb_drive) containing [malware](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malware). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-47795513), [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trump-intruder-idUSKCN1RE2HW)
*   Eric Holder (not to be confused with [the former U.S. Attorney General](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eric_Holder) of the same name) is arrested and charged with the murder of rapper [Nipsey Hussle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nipsey_Hussle). [(_The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2019/04/02/police-name-nipsey-hussle-murder-suspect-after-stampede-breaks-out-memorial/?utm_term=.7865bd46c335)

# 2019-04-03

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Libyan Civil War (2014–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libyan_Civil_War_(2014%E2%80%93present)), [2019 Western Libya Offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Timeline_of_the_Libyan_Civil_War_(2014%E2%80%93present)#April_2019,_Western_Libya_Offensive)
    *   The [Libyan National Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libyan_National_Army) (LNA) launches a surprise offensive in western [Libya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libya), moving units towards the [Government of National Accord](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_National_Accord)-held capital [Tripoli](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tripoli), with reports of clashes in the city of [Gharyan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gharyan). The LNA say their operation, ordered by General [Khalifa Haftar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khalifa_Haftar), is aimed at "cleansing the western zone from terrorist groups". [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-libya-security/eastern-libya-forces-move-west-triggering-alert-in-tripoli-idUSKCN1RF1LQ?il=0) [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/04/libyan-strongman-khalifa-haftar-orders-forces-advance-west-190403155045917.html)

## Law and crime

*   [Special Counsel investigation (2017–2019)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special_Counsel_investigation_(2017%E2%80%932019)), [Russian interference in the 2016 United States elections](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_interference_in_the_2016_United_States_elections)
    *   The U.S. [House Committee on the Judiciary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_Committee_on_the_Judiciary) approves a [subpoena](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Subpoena) to obtain, in its full and unredacted form, the final report written as part of [special counsel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special_prosecutor) [Robert Mueller](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Mueller)'s recently concluded investigation into Russian meddling in the [2016 presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2016_United_States_presidential_election). [(_New York Post_)](https://nypost.com/2019/04/03/house-panel-authorizes-subpoena-to-get-unredacted-mueller-report/?fbclid=IwAR36cSsP6Qn2SUPCmX-r_NBQpSVX0sbnAHWo66wCMj3Nt86YtlZdOWIDKlI)
*   [Disappearance of Timmothy Pitzen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Disappearance_of_Timmothy_Pitzen)
    *   A teenage boy claiming to have escaped two kidnappers tells the authorities that he is Timmothy Pitzen, who has been missing since 2011. [(New York Post)](https://nypost.com/2019/04/03/teen-tells-police-he-is-missing-illinois-boy-timmothy-pitzen/)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Ukrainian presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Ukrainian_presidential_election)
    *   [Volodymyr Zelensky](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volodymyr_Zelensky) wins the first round of [Ukraine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukraine)'s [presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Ukrainian_presidential_election) with 30 percent of the vote, with President [Petro Poroshenko](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Petro_Poroshenko) coming in second with 15 percent of the vote. Since no candidate reached the required number of votes to achieve the office of the presidency, a runoff election between the two candidates will be held on April 21. [Voter turnout](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Voter_turnout) was 63 percent. [(Ukrinform)](https://www.ukrinform.net/rubric-elections/2673673-cec-counts-9999-of-ballots.html) [(_The Jerusalem Post_)](https://www.jpost.com/Diaspora/Jewish-comedian-most-voted-in-first-Ukraine-presidential-election-round-585406?fbclid=IwAR3qZ0K33c_faad62-zYmtUyHYvR0V1PdMRZTNQNCjUwKbokdeNuFoZSYdA)
*   In an effort led by [U.S. Senate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Senate) Majority Leader [Mitch McConnell](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mitch_McConnell), Senate [Republicans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_Party_(United_States)) vote 51-48 to approve new Senate rules to limit the in-session debate time for most of President [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump)'s appointed political nominees to two hours instead of the previously required 30 hours. Senate Republicans invoke the so-called "[nuclear option](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuclear_option)" to approve the new rules, a procedure that allows the Senate to amend rules with a simple majority of 51 votes, rather than the two-thirds [supermajority](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supermajority) normally required to do so. [(_Axios_)](https://www.axios.com/senate-gop-nuclear-option-mcconnell-trump-nominees-b4ba06fb-0c23-434e-abc9-8597041b0df4.html)
*   The [U.S. House Committee on Ways and Means](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_House_Committee_on_Ways_and_Means) formally requests six years of President [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump)'s personal and business tax returns from the [Internal Revenue Service](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internal_Revenue_Service). [(ABC News)](https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/house-democrats-treasury-trumps-tax-returns/story?id=62150855)
*   [Saudi Arabian–led intervention in Yemen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabian%E2%80%93led_intervention_in_Yemen)
    *   The [U.S. House of Representatives](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_House_of_Representatives) approves a resolution to end U.S. support for the [Saudi Arabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabia)-led coalition in the [war in Yemen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yemeni_Civil_War_(2015%E2%80%93present)). [(Politico)](https://www.politico.com/story/2019/04/04/house-rebukes-trump-with-vote-ending-us-support-for-yemen-war-1255866)

# 2019-04-04

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Libyan Civil War (2014–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libyan_Civil_War_(2014%E2%80%93present)), [2019 Western Libya Offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Timeline_of_the_Libyan_Civil_War_(2014%E2%80%93present)#April_2019,_Western_Libya_Offensive)
    *   [Libyan National Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libyan_National_Army) forces continue to advance on the [Libyan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libya) capital [Tripoli](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tripoli), capturing the city of [Gharyan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gharyan), with only light resistance reported. General [Khalifa Haftar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khalifa_Haftar) has ordered the LNA to seize control of Tripoli, prompting the Tripoli-based [Presidential Council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presidential_Council_(Libya)) to declare a general mobilization. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/apr/04/un-chief-urges-restraint-as-libyan-army-leader-plans-tripoli-assault) [(_Middle East Monitor_)](https://www.middleeastmonitor.com/20190404-libya-declares-mobilization-to-face-haftars-forces/)

## Art and culture

*   [Belarusian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belarus) authorities begin demolishing crosses with bulldozers at the [Byelorussian Soviet Socialist Republic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Byelorussian_Soviet_Socialist_Republic)-era [mass grave](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mass_grave) site [Kurapaty](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kurapaty) on the outskirts of [Minsk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minsk), where at least 30,000 people were executed by the [NKVD](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NKVD)'s [secret police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secret_police) in the 1930s and 1940s. The bulldozing is widely condemned in Belarus. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-47816897)

[(CNN)](https://www.cbsnews.com/live-news/ethiopian-airlines-flight-302-crash-preliminary-report-today-live-updates-04-04-2019/)
*   A rapidly spreading [wildfire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wildfire) in [Gangwon Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gangwon_Province,_South_Korea), [South Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korea), kills two people, injures 11 others, and forces the evacuation of thousands of civilians. # 2019-04-05

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Second Libyan Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libyan_Civil_War_(2014%E2%80%93present)), [2019 Western Libya Offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Western_Libya_Offensive)
    *   [Libyan National Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libyan_National_Army) troops reach the outskirts of the [Libyan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libya) capital [Tripoli](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tripoli), securing a key military checkpoint known as "Bridge 27". [(AFP)](https://www.afp.com/en/news/15/pro-haftar-militia-forces-reach-outskirts-tripoli-doc-1fd5e05)
    *   The LNA captures several more towns in the [Tripoli District](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tripoli_District,_Libya), including [Qasr bin Ghashir](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qasr_bin_Ghashir), [Wadi Rabie](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wadi_Rabie) and [Suq al-Khamis](/w/index.php?title=Suq_al-Khamis&action=edit&redlink=1), as well as the town of [‘Aziziya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E2%80%98Aziziya) in the [Jafara District](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jafara), to the west of Tripoli. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-libya-security-advance-idUSKCN1RH24V) [(_The Economist_)](https://www.economist.com/middle-east-and-africa/2019/04/05/khalifa-haftar-libyas-strongest-warlord-makes-a-push-for-tripoli)
    *   LNA forces say they have seized control of [Tripoli International Airport](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tripoli_International_Airport). [(Reuters)](https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-libya-security/east-libyan-troops-close-on-tripoli-alarming-u-n-idUKKCN1RH0SK)
    *   The [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States), [United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom), [France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France), and [Italy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italy) issue a joint statement calling on Field Marshal [Khalifa Haftar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khalifa_Haftar) to end the offensive. [(Euronews)](https://www.euronews.com/2019/04/04/tensions-flare-in-libya-as-eastern-libyan-commander-orders-forces-to-move-on-tripoli)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [Boeing 737 MAX groundings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boeing_737_MAX_groundings), [Ethiopian Airlines Flight 302](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethiopian_Airlines_Flight_302)
    *   The CEO for [Boeing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boeing), [Dennis Muilenburg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dennis_Muilenburg), apologizes for the loss of lives in the two [737 MAX](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/737_MAX) accidents, recognizing the role that the [MCAS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MCAS_(737)) system played in the disasters. [(Washington Post)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2019/04/04/boeing-ceo-dennis-muilenburg-apologizes-lives-lost-ethiopian-indonesian-plane-crashes/)

## Health and environment

*   The U.S [Centers for Disease Control and Prevention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Centers_for_Disease_Control_and_Prevention) reports the source of [E. coli](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Escherichia_coli) O103, that has infected 72 people in five states, has not been identified. [Bill Marler](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Marler), a food safety lawyer in Seattle, notes this O103 outbreak is by far the largest in recent memory. [(_The Washington Post_ via MSN.com)](https://www.msn.com/en-us/health/health-news/dozens-have-fallen-ill-during-a-five-state-e-coli-outbreak-and-nobody-knows-where-its-coming-from/ar-BBVFhpN?ocid=spartanntp)

## Law and crime

*   [Julian Assange's asylum at the Ecuadorian embassy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Julian_Assange#Political_asylum_and_life_at_the_Ecuadorian_embassy), [INA Papers](/w/index.php?title=INA_Papers&action=edit&redlink=1)
    *   A high-level source within the government of [Ecuador](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecuador) tells [WikiLeaks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WikiLeaks) that [Julian Assange](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Julian_Assange) will be expelled within "hours to days" and that Ecuador's government already has an agreement with the UK for his arrest. On April 2, 2019, [Ecuadorian President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Ecuador) [Lenín Moreno](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Len%C3%ADn_Moreno) accused WikiLeaks of leaking the [INA Papers](/w/index.php?title=INA_Papers&action=edit&redlink=1). The INA Papers are a set of documents published in February 2019 which uncover the operations of [INA Investment Corp](/w/index.php?title=INA_Investment_Corp&action=edit&redlink=1), an offshore [tax haven](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tax_haven) created by the brother of President Moreno. The trove of emails, phone communications and expense receipts are said to link the president and his family to a series of [corrupt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Political_corruption) and criminal dealings, including [money laundering](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Money_laundering) and [offshore accounts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Offshore_bank). The leak has sparked a [parliamentary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Assembly_(Ecuador)) investigation into President Moreno for corruption. [(Wikileaks)](https://defend.wikileaks.org/2019/04/03/ecuador-twists-embarrassing-ina-papers-into-pretext-to-oust-assange/) [(Al-Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/04/wikileaks-founder-assange-expelled-ecuador-embassy-190405030521011.html)
*   A 29-year-old man is charged with five counts of attempted murder after stabbing five people in "random attacks", including four people in a 10-hour period on March 30, in [Edmonton, London](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edmonton,_London). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-47823157)
*   An inquest finds that Jennifer and Sarah Hart intentionally killed themselves. In 2018, a vehicle with the couple and their six adopted children drove off a cliff, killing all of them. [(MSN.com)](https://www.msn.com/en-ca/news/world/inquest-finds-the-hart-parents-intentionally-killed-their-6-adopted-kids-and-themselves/ar-BBVEzk4?ocid=spartanntp)

## Science and technology

*   A small 5-200 kilometer [planetesimal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Planetesimal), with a similar mineral composition to Earth, is found orbiting in the [debris disk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Debris_disk) of a white dwarf star. This discovery is among the first of its kind and expected to provide insight into the future of our own planetary system. [(Astronomy.com)](http://www.astronomy.com/news/2019/04/astronomers-discover-a-chunk-of-a-planets-core-around-dead-star)
*   [JAXA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JAXA) space probe _[Hayabusa2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hayabusa2)_ successfully fires a bullet at [Apollo asteroid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_asteroid) [162173 Ryugu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/162173_Ryugu), forming a crater which will be used to collect underground samples. [(AP)](https://apnews.com/2dd46c807e13486c9f658ec74776ce52)
