## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Second Libyan Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libyan_Civil_War_(2014%E2%80%93present)), [2019 Western Libya offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Western_Libya_offensive)
    *   The [Government of National Accord](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_National_Accord) in [Tripoli](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tripoli) formally announces the start of a counteroffensive to reclaim all parts of the capital held by the [Libyan National Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libyan_National_Army). [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/04/libya-gna-forces-announce-counteroffensive-defend-tripoli-190407121535177.html)
    *   The [United States Africa Command](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Africa_Command) evacuates a contingent of U.S. troops from Libya due to the unrest. [India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/India) also withdraws a contingent of peacekeepers from Tripoli. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/apr/07/libya-us-forces-evacuated-haftar-seeks-military-control)
    *   [Libyan Air Force](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libyan_Air_Force) jets loyal to [Khalifa Haftar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khalifa_Haftar) strike GNA positions in Tripoli for first time since the offensive began, including four airstrikes near the [Bab al-Azizia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bab_al-Azizia) military barracks. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-libya-security-strike/eastern-libyan-forces-conduct-air-strikes-on-tripoli-as-un-fails-to-reach-truce-idUSKCN1RJ0CU) [(Voice of America)](https://www.voanews.com/a/un-calls-for-urgent-libya-truce-to-evacuate-civilians-wounded/4865342.html)
    *   [Russia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia) blocks a [United Nations Security Council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council) statement calling on Libyan [Field Marshal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Field_marshal_(Libya)) Khalifa Haftar to immediately halt the Libyan National Army's offensive on Tripoli, because it wants the UN statement to also apply to pro-GNA forces, including Islamist militias from [Misrata](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Misrata). [(_South China Morning Post_)](https://www.scmp.com/news/world/middle-east/article/3005069/air-strikes-bombard-tripoli-eastern-libyan-forces-attempt)
*   Two female suicide bombers attack a crowd on the outskirts of [Maiduguri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maiduguri), [Nigeria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nigeria), killing three civilians and injuring 33 others. [(_The Guardian.ng_)](https://guardian.ng/news/suicide-bomb-attack-kills-three-in-maiduguri/)

## Disasters and accidents

*   A major [power outage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Power_outage) occurs in [Sudan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sudan), leaving almost the entire country without electricity amid ongoing anti-government [protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sudanese_protests_(2018%E2%80%9319)). [(Africanews)](https://www.africanews.com/2019/04/07/sudan-suffers-total-power-outage-amid-anti-bashir-protests/)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Andorran parliamentary election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Andorran_parliamentary_election)
    *   Andorrans head to the polls to elect the new members of the [General Council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/General_Council_(Andorra)). The ruling party, [Democrats for Andorra](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democrats_for_Andorra), loses the majority in the chamber. [(_La Vanguardia_)](https://www.lavanguardia.com/internacional/20190407/461499938895/andorra-elecciones-democrates-per-andorra-toni-marti-partit-socialdemocrata-xavier-espot-pere-lopez.html)
*   [Political appointments by Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Political_appointments_by_Donald_Trump), [List of Trump administration dismissals and resignations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Trump_administration_dismissals_and_resignations)
    *   [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._President) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) announces that [Homeland Security Secretary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Secretary_of_Homeland_Security) [Kirstjen Nielsen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kirstjen_Nielsen) is leaving the administration. [Customs and Border Protection](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._Customs_and_Border_Protection) commissioner [Kevin McAleenan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kevin_McAleenan) will serve in her stead until a new secretary is confirmed by Congress. [(_The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/homeland-security-secretary-kirstjen-nielsen-leaving-trump-administration-amid-surge-of-migrants/2019/04/07/97d20358-597d-11e9-b8e3-b03311fbbbfe_story.html?utm_term=.0e7beeafa83f)

# 2019-04-08

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Second Libyan Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libyan_Civil_War_(2014%E2%80%93present)), [2019 Western Libya offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Western_Libya_offensive)
    *   Forces loyal to the [Government of National Accord](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_National_Accord) retake [Tripoli International Airport](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tripoli_International_Airport) from the [Libyan National Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libyan_National_Army). [(Anadolu Agency)](https://www.aa.com.tr/en/africa/libyan-govt-forces-retake-tripoli-airport-from-haftar/1445449)
    *   One of the vice chairmen of the GNA [Presidential Council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presidential_Council_(Libya)), [Ali Faraj Qatrani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ali_Faraj_Qatrani), defects to the [Tobruk-based government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_of_Representatives_(Libya)). [(Asharq Al-Awsat)](https://aawsat.com/english/home/article/1669676/sarraj-deputy-quits-voices-support-libyan-national-army)
    *   A warplane loyal to [Field Marshal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Field_marshal_(Libya)) [Khalifa Haftar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khalifa_Haftar), reported to be a [MiG-23](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mikoyan-Gurevich_MiG-23), strikes [Mitiga International Airport](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mitiga_International_Airport), the only functional airport in [Tripoli](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tripoli). A LNA spokesman says civilian planes were not targeted in the air raid. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/apr/08/eu-uk-urges-france-to-condemn-khalifa-haftar-assault-on-tripoli)
*   [War in Afghanistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_in_Afghanistan_(2001%E2%80%93present))
    *   A roadside bomb kills three [U.S.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) troops and one civilian contractor near [Bagram Airfield](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bagram_Airfield), [Afghanistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghanistan). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-47860816)

## Arts and culture

*   _[The Nation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Nation)_'s editor [Katrina vanden Heuvel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katrina_vanden_Heuvel) announces that she will step down as editor after 24 years, on June 15, 2019. _The Nation_ is the oldest continuously published weekly magazine in the United States. [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/08/business/media/katrina-vanden-heuvel-the-nation.html)

## Law and crime

*   Nationwide protests against animal cruelty take place in [Australia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia). In the city of [Melbourne](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Melbourne), protesters blocked a major intersection for four hours before it was dispatched by police; several people were arrested. [(News.com.au)](https://www.news.com.au/lifestyle/food/animal-activists-hold-protests-around-the-country-on-one-year-anniversary-of-confronting-documentary/news-story/4bce0ca02fa6c71f000638f5bf0379c9)
*   The [Department for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Department_for_Digital,_Culture,_Media_and_Sport) in the United Kingdom releases a white paper proposing to set up an independent regulatory body which would require Internet companies to [remove content and block websites](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_censorship_in_the_United_Kingdom) considered harmful. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-47826946)
*   [2019 college admissions bribery scandal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_college_admissions_bribery_scandal)
    *   American actress [Felicity Huffman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Felicity_Huffman) and 13 other defendants involved in a conspiracy regarding admission to prestigious colleges have agreed to plead guilty in the matter, prosecutors say. The 14 individuals are among 50 people accused of engaging in schemes that involved cheating on college entrance exams and paying $25 million in bribes to secure their children admission to well-known colleges. [(WKZO)](https://wkzo.com/news/articles/2019/apr/08/felicity-huffman-others-to-plead-guilty-in-us-college-admissions-scandal-prosecutors/)
*   U.S. district judge [Richard Seeborg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Seeborg) halts the Trump administration’s policy of sending some asylum seekers to [Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico) while their cases are pending in the United States. The national injunction will take effect Friday. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-immigration-asylum/u-s-judge-halts-trump-policy-of-returning-asylum-seekers-to-mexico-idUSKCN1RK2E6)

## Politics and elections

*   [United States Secretary of State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Secretary_of_State) [Mike Pompeo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mike_Pompeo) announces the designation of the entirety of [Iran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran)'s [Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_Revolutionary_Guard_Corps) as a foreign [terrorist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terrorism) organization (FTO), marking the first time that the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) has designated a part of another government as a terrorist organization. [(United States Department of State)](https://www.state.gov/secretary/remarks/2019/04/290966.htm) [(United States Department of State2)](https://www.state.gov/r/pa/prs/ps/2019/04/290963.htm) [(White House)](https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefings-statements/statement-president-designation-islamic-revolutionary-guard-corps-foreign-terrorist-organization/)
*   [Trump administration dismissals and resignations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Trump_administration_dismissals_and_resignations)
    *   [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) terminates the employment of [Randolph Alles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Randolph_Alles), the [Director](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Director_of_the_United_States_Secret_Service) of the [United States Secret Service](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Secret_Service). [(CNN)](https://amp.cnn.com/cnn/2019/04/08/politics/randolph-tex-alles-secret-service-director/index.html)

## Science and technology

*   [David Saint-Jacques](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Saint-Jacques) becomes the fourth Canadian astronaut to take part in a spacewalk and the first in 12 years as he begins a roughly seven-hour mission. [(_The Hamilton Spectator_)](https://www.thespec.com/news-story/9272303-astronaut-david-saint-jacques-first-canadian-to-perform-spacewalk-in-12-years/) [(CBC.ca)](https://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/david-saint-jacques-first-spacewalk-1.5088545)
*   [List of gravitational wave observations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_gravitational_wave_observations)
    *   [LIGO](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LIGO) and [Virgo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virgo_interferometer) detect a gravitational wave from a galaxy 6 billion light-years away in the direction of [Cassiopeia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cassiopeia_(constellation)), with further details being released on April 10. [(newscientist.com)](https://www.newscientist.com/article/2199107-ligo-has-spotted-another-gravitational-wave-just-after-turning-back-on/)

# 2019-04-09

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Second Libyan Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libyan_Civil_War_(2014%E2%80%93present)), [2019 Western Libya offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Western_Libya_offensive)
    *   The UN cancels a planned [Libyan National Conference](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libyan_National_Conference) that was due to take place later in April for negotiations between different political factions to organise [new elections](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Libyan_general_election) due to the ongoing fighting in [Tripoli](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tripoli). [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/apr/09/un-postpones-libya-national-conference-amid-fighting-tripoli)
*   [Sinai insurgency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sinai_insurgency)
    *   A 15-year-old [suicide bomber](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suicide_bomb) attacks a market in [Sheikh Zuweid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sheikh_Zuweid), [Egypt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Egypt), killing four policemen and three civilians, and injuring 27 others. [(Xinhua)](http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2019-04/09/c_137963410.htm)
*   [2018–19 Sudanese protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018%E2%80%9319_Sudanese_protests)
    *   Heavy gunfire is reported in the [Sudanese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sudan) capital [Khartoum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khartoum) as [Rapid Support Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rapid_Support_Forces_(Sudan)) loyal to [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Sudan) [Omar al-Bashir](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Omar_al-Bashir) attempted to break-up an anti-government protest outside the military's headquarters, killing at least 14 people, including five Sudanese soldiers who defected to the opposition. [(Sky News)](https://news.sky.com/story/sudan-unrest-14-killed-on-tuesday-as-anti-government-sit-in-intensifies-11689032)

## Business and economy

*   [Debenhams](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Debenhams), one of the largest [department stores](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Department_store) in the [United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom) which employs 25,000 people, collapses into administration. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/business/2019/apr/09/debenhams-is-taken-over-by-lenders-mike-ashley-loses-sta)

## Disasters and accidents

*   A [Japan Air Self-Defense Force](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan_Air_Self-Defense_Force) [F-35 Lightning II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lockheed_Martin_F-35_Lightning_II) jet disappears from radar while on a training mission over the [Pacific Ocean](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pacific_Ocean). Japanese [Defense Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minister_of_Defense_(Japan)) [Takeshi Iwaya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Takeshi_Iwaya) subsequently grounds Japan's fleet of F-35s. [(CBS News)](https://www.cbsnews.com/amp/news/f-35-fighter-japan-missing-fleet-grounded-today-lockheed-martin-latest-updates/)

## Law and crime

*   [2019 college admissions bribery scandal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_college_admissions_bribery_scandal)
    *   16 people are indicted on new charges in the nationwide college admissions cheating scandal, one day after it was announced that 13 of the defendants charged in the case would plead guilty for conspiracy. [(_The Boston Globe_)](https://www.bostonglobe.com/metro/2019/04/09/actress-lori-loughlin-others-indicted-college-admissions-cheating-chase/J8ZGXQDIMyeP0vuNeKqxNP/story.html) [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/09/us/lori-loughlin-update.html)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Israeli legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Israeli_legislative_election)
    *   Israelis go to the polls to elect the new members of the [Knesset](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knesset) ([Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel)'s parliament) and a new [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Israel). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-israel-election/israelis-go-to-polls-in-referendum-on-netanyahus-record-reign-idUSKCN1RL00K)
*   [2019 Venezuelan presidential crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Venezuelan_presidential_crisis)
    *   The [Organization of American States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Organization_of_American_States) votes 18 to 9, with six abstentions, to accept [Gustavo Tarre Briceño](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gustavo_Tarre) as the ambassador from Venezuela. Tarre is the envoy from [Juan Guaidó](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Guaid%C3%B3)'s government; [Nicolás Maduro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicol%C3%A1s_Maduro)'s Foreign Ministry calls Tarre a "political usurper". [(Washington Post)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/oas-recognizes-opposition-envoy-as-venezuelan-ambassador/2019/04/09/7ffa3bb0-5b12-11e9-98d4-844088d135f2_story.html)

# 2019-04-10

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Second Libyan Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libyan_Civil_War_(2014%E2%80%93present)), [2019 Western Libya offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Western_Libya_offensive)
    *   [Aguila Saleh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aguila_Saleh), speaker of the [Tobruk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tobruk)-based [Libyan parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_of_Representatives_(Libya)) which [Khalifa Haftar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khalifa_Haftar)'s [Libyan National Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libyan_National_Army) is loyal to, states that no peace agreement or UN-backed conference is possible while [Tripoli](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tripoli) "is occupied by armed groups." [(Fox News)](https://www.foxnews.com/world/libya-speaker-no-deals-while-armed-groups-kidnap-tripoli)
    *   The Libyan National Army says it has shot down a pro-[GNA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_National_Accord) [L-39 Albatros](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aero_L-39_Albatros) over [Tripoli](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tripoli). [(RT)](https://www.rt.com/news/456161-libya-plane-shot-down/)

## International relations

*   [Brexit negotiations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit_negotiations)
    *   The [United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom) and [European Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Union) agree to delay [Brexit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit) until October 31, 2019. This means that the UK will participate in next month's [European Parliament election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_European_Parliament_election). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-47889404)

## Law and crime

*   The United States federal government charges 24 in a [Medicare](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medicare_(United_States)) [fraud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medicare_fraud) scheme involving the billing of Medicare for nearly $1.2 billion in unnecessary [back braces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Back_brace) and other medical braces pitched via [telemarketing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telemarketing) through [durable medical equipment](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Durable_medical_equipment) companies. [(NPR)](https://www.npr.org/2019/04/10/711688988/feds-charge-24-in-alleged-1-2-billion-medicare-fraud-scheme)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Venezuelan presidential crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Venezuelan_presidential_crisis)
    *   After the [Organization of American States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Organization_of_American_States) accepts an envoy from the government of President of the [Venezuelan National Assembly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Assembly_(Venezuela)) [Juan Guaidó](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Guaid%C3%B3) as ambassador, [United States Vice President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vice_President_of_the_United_States) [Mike Pence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mike_Pence) asks for the [United Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations) to expel and replace the [Nicolás Maduro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicol%C3%A1s_Maduro)-appointed Venezuelan envoy in its own chamber. [(Bloomberg)](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-04-10/pence-demands-un-expel-venezuela-s-ambassador-support-guaido)
    *   The [International Monetary Fund](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Monetary_Fund) denies Venezuela access to its money as there is no majority of member states recognizing either Maduro or Guaidó, describing the situation as "political chaos" and asking for debate between its members on the nation. [(Bloomberg)](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-04-10/imf-freezes-venezuela-funds-as-members-debate-who-s-president)

## Science and technology

*   [Katie Bouman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katie_Bouman) and scientists at the [Event Horizon Telescope](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Event_Horizon_Telescope) project release the first ever photograph of the event horizon of a [black hole](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_hole), that of the supermassive black hole at the center of [Messier 87](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Messier_87) galaxy, taken using a network of eight radio telescopes around the world. [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/04/10/world/black-hole-photo-scn/index.html)
*   _[Homo luzonensis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Callao_Man)_ is identified as a new species of [human beings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Homo) discovered in the [Callao Cave](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Callao_Cave), [Northern Philippines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luzon). [(National Geographic)](https://www.nationalgeographic.com/science/2019/04/new-species-ancient-human-discovered-luzon-philippines-homo-luzonensis/)

# 2019-04-11

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [2018–19 Sudanese protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018%E2%80%9319_Sudanese_protests), [2019 Sudanese coup d'état](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Sudanese_coup_d%27%C3%A9tat)
    *   The [Sudanese military](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sudanese_Armed_Forces) surrounds the [presidential palace](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presidential_palace) in the capital [Khartoum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khartoum), and takes over state media buildings amid protests against [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Sudan) [Omar al-Bashir](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Omar_al-Bashir). Several senior ministers are reportedly arrested, including former Defense Minister [Abdel Rahim Mohammed Hussein](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abdel_Rahim_Mohammed_Hussein). [(_The National_)](https://www.thenational.ae/world/africa/army-poised-to-take-power-in-sudan-after-mass-protests-against-president-omar-al-bashir-latest-1.847537)
    *   The army forms an [interim council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transitional_Military_Council_(2019)), with [First Vice President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vice_President_of_Sudan#First_Vice_Presidents) Lt. General [Ahmed Awad Ibn Auf](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ahmed_Awad_Ibn_Auf) as the leader. President al-Bashir is reported to have stepped down. [(BBC News)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-47891470)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Australian federal election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Australian_federal_election)
    *   [Australian Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Australia) [Scott Morrison](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scott_Morrison) calls an election for 18 May. [(ABC News Australia)](https://www.abc.net.au/news/2019-04-11/federal-election-live-scott-morrison-calls-may-18-election-date/10968588)
*   [North Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Korea) appoints [Choe Ryong-hae](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Choe_Ryong-hae) as President of the Presidium of the [Supreme People's Assembly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supreme_People%27s_Assembly), the country's nominal head of state, replacing [Kim Yong-nam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kim_Yong-nam) after 21 years. [Kim Jae-ryong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kim_Jae-ryong) becomes [premier](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Premier_of_North_Korea). [(Yonhap)](https://en.yna.co.kr/view/AEN20190412001351325)

## Law and crime

*   [Abortion in South Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abortion_in_South_Korea)
    *   The [Constitutional Court of Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Constitutional_Court_of_Korea) rules that the 1953 [abortion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abortion) ban is unconstitutional. [(Korea Herald)](http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20190411000679)
*   [WikiLeaks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WikiLeaks) founder [Julian Assange](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Julian_Assange) is arrested in [London](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London) after [Ecuador](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecuador) withdraws [asylum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Right_of_asylum). He is later found guilty of breaching bail in 2012 by a British court, however he faces likely [extradition](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Extradition) to the United States over allegations he conspired with former US military analyst [Chelsea Manning](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chelsea_Manning) to acquire classified U.S. government files. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/media/live/2019/apr/11/wikileaks-founder-julian-assange-arrested-at-the-ecuadorean-embassy-live-updates)
*   Police in Louisiana arrest Holden Matthews, a suspect in arson at three historically [African-American churches](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/African-American_church) in the past weeks which the [NAACP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NAACP) flagged as hate crimes. Matthews is the son of a local deputy sheriff. He has ties to [black metal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_metal) music and commented on memes about musician [Varg Vikernes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Varg_Vikernes), who boasted about burning churches in Norway and was imprisoned for arson and murder, but researchers are unsure if they prove hate was his motive. [(CBS)](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/black-church-fires-louisiana-suspect-holden-matthews-charged/) [(Rolling Stone)](https://www.rollingstone.com/culture/culture-features/holden-matthews-varg-wikernes-norwegian-black-metal-lords-of-chaos-820995/) [(Daily Beast)](https://www.thedailybeast.com/holden-matthews-arrested-in-string-of-louisiana-church-fires)
*   [Michael Avenatti](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Avenatti) is charged by a [federal grand jury](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_juries_in_the_United_States#Federal_law) in [California](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/California) on 36 counts, including [embezzlement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Embezzlement), [wire fraud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mail_and_wire_fraud#Wire), [tax evasion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tax_evasion), [bankruptcy fraud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bankruptcy#Fraud) and [bank fraud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bank_fraud) connected to his alleged [theft](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theft) of tens of millions of dollars from several clients. [(United States Department of Justice)](https://www.justice.gov/usao-cdca/pr/attorney-michael-avenatti-named-federal-grand-jury-indictment-accuses-him-stealing) [(ABC News)](https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/feds-file-charges-michael-avenatti/story?id=62329205)

*   [Yale University](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yale_University) researchers led by professor [Nenad Sestan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nenad_Sestan) announce, through the _[Nature](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nature_(journal))_ journal, that they successfully partly revived the brains of deceased [pigs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pig), four hours after death occurred. However, there were no signals from the brains that would indicate awareness or consciousness. [(NPR)](https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2019/04/17/714289322/scientists-restore-some-function-in-the-brains-of-dead-pigs?t=1555539084348)

# 2019-04-18

## Disasters and accidents

*   At least 13 people are killed and 29 others are injured when a wall collapses in [Empangeni](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Empangeni), [South Africa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Africa), at the start of an Easter service at a Pentecostal church. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-47987959)
*   Mountain climbers [Jess Roskelley](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jess_Roskelley), [David Lama](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Lama) and [Hansjörg Auer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hansj%C3%B6rg_Auer) are suspected dead after an [avalanche](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avalanche) on [Howse Peak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howse_Peak) in Canada's [Banff National Park](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Banff_National_Park). [(MSN.com)](https://www.msn.com/en-ca/news/canada/trio-of-world-renowned-climbers-missing-and-presumed-dead-in-banff-avalanche/ar-BBW4W3p?ocid=spartanntp)

## Law and crime

*   [Dissident Irish Republican campaign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dissident_Irish_Republican_campaign)
    *   Northern Irish journalist [Lyra McKee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lyra_McKee) is shot dead by [dissident republicans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dissident_republican) on the [Creggan estate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Creggan_estate) in [Derry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Derry). [(The Irish News)](https://www.irishnews.com/news/northernirelandnews/2019/04/19/news/journalist-lyra-mckee-29-shot-dead-during-derry-rioting-1601462/)
*   The [Royal Thai Navy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Royal_Thai_Navy) is planning to remove a house that was allegedly constructed illegally 12 mi (19.31 km) off the Thai coastline to promote [seasteading](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seasteading). The owners had planned to start a community of at least 20 houses in the area. Thai authorities have filed a complaint, which if prosecuted could carry a death sentence for "threatening the sovereignty of a state, and erosion of a state's independence". [(_Time_ via MSN)](http://www.msn.com/en-us/news/world/an-american-thai-couple-are-in-deep-water-over-their-attempt-to-establish-a-community-at-sea/ar-BBW3KHd?li=BBnb7Kz)
*   Aftermath of the [Bishop International Airport attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bishop_International_Airport_attack)
    *   Amor Ftouhi is sentenced to life in prison for stabbing a police officer at [Bishop International Airport](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bishop_International_Airport) in [Flint, Michigan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flint,_Michigan), United States in June 2017. [(MLive)](https://www.mlive.com/news/flint/2019/04/flint-airport-stabber-sentenced-to-life-in-prison-says-he-doesnt-regret-actions.html)

## Politics and elections

*   [Special Counsel investigation (2017–2019)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special_Counsel_investigation_(2017%E2%80%932019)), [Russian interference in the 2016 United States elections](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_interference_in_the_2016_United_States_elections)
    *   The [redacted version of the report](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mueller_Report) by Special Counsel [Robert Mueller](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Mueller) is released by [U.S. Attorney General](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Attorney_General) [William Barr](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Barr). The investigation did not find any conspiracy between President [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) and the Russian government regarding the accusation that they collaborated to win the [2016 presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2016_United_States_presidential_election). The report did not rule out if the Trump administration committed obstruction of justice. The Department of Justice also stated some members of Congress will received a less-redacted version of the report in the near future. [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/18/us/politics/mueller-report.html) [(_USA Today_)](https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2019/04/17/mueller-report-congress-get-less-redacted-version-doj-says/3501962002/)

[(_The Atlantic_)](https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2019/04/joe-biden-running-president/587560/) [(NBC News)](https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2020-election/biden-set-announce-presidential-run-next-week-n985421)
*   [Special Counsel investigation (2017–2019)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special_Counsel_investigation_(2017%E2%80%932019)), [Russian interference in the 2016 United States elections](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_interference_in_the_2016_United_States_elections)
    *   [House Judiciary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_House_Committee_on_the_Judiciary) Chairman [Jerry Nadler](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jerry_Nadler) issues a subpoena to the [Justice Department](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Department_of_Justice) for, by May 1, the full, unredacted version of the [Mueller Report](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mueller_Report), and for the underlying grand jury evidence and testimony. ## Armed conflict and attacks

# 2019-04-21

## Armed conflict and attacks

*   [2019 Sri Lanka Easter bombings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Sri_Lanka_Easter_bombings)
    *   A series of explosions at churches and hotels in four cities in [Sri Lanka](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sri_Lanka), including the nation's commercial capital and largest city [Colombo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colombo), kills at least 300 people and wounds around 500. Sri Lankan officials claim that no specific group has claimed responsibility but are saying that the work is that of [Islamic extremists](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_extremists). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-48008073)
    *   The Sri Lankan government temporarily [blocks access](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Censorship_in_South_Asia#Sri_Lanka) to all social media platforms to stop the spread of "false media reports" about the attacks. [(_The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2019/04/21/sri-lankan-government-blocks-social-media-imposes-curfew-following-deadly-blasts/)
    *   [U.S. Secretary of State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Secretary_of_State) [Mike Pompeo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mike_Pompeo) has stated that several United States citizens were killed in the attacks and Sri Lanka's Foreign Ministry officials have stated that at least five of the victims were of British nationality. [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/asia/live-news/sri-lanka-easter-sunday-explosions-dle-intl/h_7cf075d83c893b55b334e94892ffb15c)
*   Four attackers are killed in a failed attack in [Riyadh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riyadh), [Saudi Arabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabia). The attackers had machine guns, bombs, and petrol bombs. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/04/killed-foiled-attack-saudi-police-station-reports-190421101113605.html)

## Disasters and accidents

*   Seventeen people are killed and over a dozen are left missing after a [landslide](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Landslide) in the municipality of [Rosas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rosas,_Cauca), in southwestern [Colombia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colombia). [(CBC)](https://www.cbc.ca/news/world/colombia-landslide-1.5106015) [(El Tiempo)](https://www.eltiempo.com/colombia/cali/drama-por-deslizamiento-que-arraso-viviendas-en-rosas-cauca-351816)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Ukrainian presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Ukrainian_presidential_election)
    *   According to exit polls, comedian [Volodymyr Zelensky](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volodymyr_Zelensky) wins Ukraine's presidential run-off election over incumbent [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Ukraine) [Petro Poroshenko](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Petro_Poroshenko) with more than 70 percent of the votes. Poroshenko concedes defeat. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-ukraine-election/comedian-zelenskiy-wins-ukrainian-presidential-race-by-landslide-exit-poll-idUSKCN1RX01N) [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-48007487) [(CBC)](https://www.cbc.ca/news/world/ukraine-presidential-election-second-round-1.5105896)
*   [2019 North Macedonian presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_North_Macedonian_presidential_election)
    *   [North Macedonians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Macedonia) go to the polls to elect the next [President of North Macedonia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_North_Macedonia) in an election dominated by divisions over the [Prespa agreement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prespa_agreement), which resolved the [naming dispute](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macedonia_naming_dispute) between North Macedonia and [Greece](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greece). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-north-macedonia-election/macedonians-vote-in-election-dominated-by-splits-over-name-change-idUSKCN1RX008)

# 2019-04-22

## Disasters and accidents

*   [2019 Luzon earthquake](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Luzon_earthquake)
    *   Eleven people are killed when a magnitude 6.1 [earthquake](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earthquake) strikes the municipalities of [Porac](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Porac,_Pampanga) and [Lubao](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lubao,_Pampanga), [Pampanga](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pampanga) province, [Philippines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines) at 17:11 [Philippine Standard Time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippine_Standard_Time). [(Philippine Daily Inquirer)](https://newsinfo.inquirer.net/1109601/earthquake-death-toll-in-pampanga-climbs-to-11)
    *   According to [PHIVOLCS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippine_Institute_of_Volcanology_and_Seismology), the [epicenter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Epicenter) of the earthquake is located 18 kilometres (11 mi) northeast of [Castillejos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Castillejos), [Zambales](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zambales). PHIVOLCS originally records the earthquake, which is tectonic in origin, at magnitude 5.7, but later upgrades it to 6.1. [(GMA News)](https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/scitech/weather/692003/magnitude-5-7-earthquake-jolts-zambales/story/)

## Politics and elections

*   [2020 United States presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_United_States_presidential_election), [2020 Democratic Party presidential primaries](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Democratic_Party_presidential_primaries), [Seth Moulton 2020 presidential campaign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seth_Moulton_2020_presidential_campaign)
    *   [U.S. Representative](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_House_of_Representatives) for [Massachusetts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Massachusetts) [Seth Moulton](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seth_Moulton) announces he is running for the [Democratic Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democratic_Party)'s nomination to be [President of the United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) in the 2020 presidential election. [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2019/04/22/politics/seth-moulton-2020-campaign-announcement/index.html)
*   [United States sanctions against Iran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_sanctions_against_Iran)
    *   The [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) demands that all countries cease purchasing oil from [Iran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran) by May 1 or face sanctions, in a move aimed at reducing Iran's income. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-iran-oil/u-s-to-end-all-waivers-on-imports-of-iranian-oil-crude-price-jumps-idUSKCN1RX0R1)

# 2019-04-23

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [2019 Sri Lanka Easter bombings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Sri_Lanka_Easter_bombings)
    *   [ISIL](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_State_in_Iraq_and_the_Levant) claims responsibility for the bombings in [Sri Lanka](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sri_Lanka) that took place on Easter Sunday. [(New York Times)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/23/world/asia/sri-lanka-bombing.html)

[(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-sri-lanka-blasts/sri-lanka-bomb-attacks-were-revenge-for-new-zealand-mosque-killings-minister-idUSKCN1RZ06M)

## Business and economy

*   The [Federal Aviation Administration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Aviation_Administration) (FAA) certifies [Alphabet Inc.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alphabet_Inc.)-owned [delivery drone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Delivery_drone) service [Wing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wing_(company)) to operate as an [airline](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Airline) in the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States). Wing is the first delivery drone company to receive FAA air carrier certification. [(Reuters)](https://reuters.com/article/uk-usa-drone-alphabet/faa-paves-way-for-alphabet-unit-to-make-first-u-s-drone-deliveries-idUKKCN1RZ25R) [(NPR)](https://www.npr.org/2019/04/23/716360818/faa-certifies-googles-wing-drone-delivery-company-to-operate-as-an-airline)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [2019 Visayas earthquake](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Visayas_earthquake)
    *   A magnitude 6.5 [earthquake](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earthquake) strikes the islands of [Visayas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Visayas) in the [Philippines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines) at 13:37 [Philippine Standard Time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippine_Standard_Time). [(ABS-CBN News)](https://news.abs-cbn.com/news/04/23/19/62-magnitude-quake-hits-eastern-samar)
    *   According to [PHIVOLCS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippine_Institute_of_Volcanology_and_Seismology), the [epicenter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Epicenter) of the earthquake is located 9 kilometres (5.6 mi) northwest of [San Julian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Julian,_Eastern_Samar), [Eastern Samar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eastern_Samar). PHIVOLCS originally records the earthquake, which is tectonic in origin, at magnitude 6.2, but later upgrades it to 6.5. [(_The Philippine Star_)](https://www.philstar.com/headlines/2019/04/23/1911918/phivolcs-upgrades-magnitude-65-quake-jolted-eastern-samar-town)
    *   The earthquake happened less than 24 hours after the [6.1 magnitude earthquake that struck Luzon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Luzon_earthquake). [(ABS-CBN News)](https://news.abs-cbn.com/news/04/23/19/62-magnitude-quake-hits-eastern-samar)
*   A [mudslide](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mudflow) at a [jade mine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jade_trade_in_Myanmar) in [Hpakant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hpakant), [Kachin State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kachin_State), northern [Myanmar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myanmar) caused by the collapse of a nearby lake kills three miners and leaves 51 missing. ## Law and crime

*   [Murder of Karina Vetrano](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Murder_of_Karina_Vetrano)
    *   In the United States, [Chanel Lewis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chanel_Lewis) is sentenced to life in prison without the possibility of parole for the 2016 [murder](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Murder_(United_States_law)) of Karina Vetrano while she was running in [Queens](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Queens), New York City. The judge had earlier declined the defense's motion of a re-trial due to what they alleged to be police and juror misconduct. [(ABC)](https://abcnews.go.com/US/queens-jogger-sentenced-life-prison/story?id=62573087)
*   Eight pedestrians in [Sunnyvale, California](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunnyvale,_California), are injured when a car is intentionally driven into them. The driver is arrested after crashing into a tree. The [FBI](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Bureau_of_Investigation) is assisting in the investigation. [(NBC News)](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/eight-pedestrians-struck-car-suspected-intentional-crash-n997911)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Prince Edward Island general election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Prince_Edward_Island_general_election)
    *   The [Progressive Conservative Party of Prince Edward Island](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Progressive_Conservative_Party_of_Prince_Edward_Island) wins its first minority government since the [Island's 1890 general election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1890_Prince_Edward_Island_general_election), while the [Green Party of Prince Edward Island](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Green_Party_of_Prince_Edward_Island) has beaten the [Prince Edward Island Liberal Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_Edward_Island_Liberal_Party) by taking most of from their seats and becoming the province's new Official Opposition party. ## Science and technology

    *   Sixteen soldiers including a driver are killed after a landmine explosion in the [Gadchiroli district](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gadchiroli_district) of [Maharashtra](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maharashtra), India. ## Arts and culture

*   [2019 Japanese imperial transition](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Japanese_imperial_transition)
    *   The [Japanese Era](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_era_name) [Reiwa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reiwa) (令和) begins as Emperor [Naruhito](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naruhito) [accedes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enthronement_of_the_Japanese_Emperor) to the [Chrysanthemum Throne](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chrysanthemum_Throne) as the 126th [Emperor of Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emperor_of_Japan). The Emperor inherits two of the [Three Sacred Treasures of Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Imperial_Regalia_of_Japan) during a symbolic ceremony, which formalises his ascension. [(_The Mainichi_)](https://mainichi.jp/english/articles/20190430/p2a/00m/0na/023000c) [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-48101637)

*   [Monarchy of Thailand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monarchy_of_Thailand)
    *   [Vajiralongkorn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vajiralongkorn), [King of Thailand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/King_of_Thailand), marries his head of security and mistress, General [Suthida Tidjai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suthida), days before his coronation. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-thailand-king/thai-king-names-his-consort-queen-days-before-coronation-idUSKCN1S73TQ)

## Law and crime

*   [WikiLeaks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WikiLeaks) founder [Julian Assange](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Julian_Assange) is sentenced to 50 weeks in prison by a judge in the [United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom) for breaching [bail](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bail) in 2012. Assange still faces possible extradition to the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) on charges of conspiracy to commit computer intrusion. [(NPR)](https://www.npr.org/2019/05/01/718945707/british-judge-sentences-julian-assange-to-50-weeks-in-prison)[(The Guardian)](https://www.theguardian.com/media/2019/may/01/julian-assange-jailed-for-50-weeks-for-breaching-bail-in-2012)

## Politics and elections

*   [Fiona Onasanya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiona_Onasanya), the member of the UK Parliament for [Peterborough](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peterborough_(UK_Parliament_constituency)), is removed from her position following a successful [recall petition](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Peterborough_recall_petition) in the wake of her conviction for [perverting the course of justice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perverting_the_course_of_justice), becoming the first MP in the country's history to lose their seat in this manner. A [by-election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peterborough_by-election,_2019) will be called to elect a replacement MP. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-cambridgeshire-48123355)
*   [British Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_the_United_Kingdom) [Theresa May](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theresa_May) fires [Gavin Williamson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gavin_Williamson) as [Secretary of State for Defence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secretary_of_State_for_Defence), following the leaking of information relating to a [National Security Council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Security_Council_(United_Kingdom)) meeting, regarding the security risk posed by Chinese multinational telecommunications company [Huawei](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Huawei). [Secretary of State for International Development](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secretary_of_State_for_International_Development) [Penny Mordaunt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penny_Mordaunt) is appointed the first-ever female British Defence Secretary. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2019/may/01/gavin-williamson-sacked-as-defence-secretary-over-huawei-leak) [(_Evening Standard_)](https://www.standard.co.uk/news/politics/penny-mordaunt-appointed-as-first-ever-female-defence-secretary-after-gavin-williamson-sacked-from-a4131876.html)
*   The UK Parliament declares "[an environment and climate emergency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Climate_change)." [(CNN)](https://amp.cnn.com/cnn/2019/05/01/europe/uk-climate-emergency-scn-intl/index.html)

# 2019-05-02

## Disasters and accidents

*   [2019 North Indian Ocean cyclone season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_North_Indian_Ocean_cyclone_season)
    *   Evacuation of approximately 800,000 people is underway as [Extremely Severe Cyclonic Storm Fani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyclone_Fani) heads toward the [Indian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/India) state of [Odisha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Odisha) (_formerly Orissa_) and is expected to make landfall Friday with wind speeds in excess of 200 km/h (127 mph). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-india-48121606)

## Health and environment

*   [2019 measles outbreak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_measles_outbreak)
    *   The _[Freewinds](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freewinds)_ cruise ship is quarantined in [Saint Lucia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saint_Lucia) over concerns of a [measles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Measles) [epidemic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Epidemic) after it is reported that one of the passengers has the disease. The cruise ship is reportedly owned by the [Church of Scientology](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Church_of_Scientology), a religious organization that opposes vaccinations against diseases such as measles. [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/05/02/health/st-lucia-measles-cruise-ship-quarantine/index.html)

## Law and crime

*   [Insys Therapeutics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Insys_Therapeutics) founder [John Kapoor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Kapoor) is found guilty of [racketeering](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Racket_(crime)) in an opioid-related bribery scheme. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/business-48143094)
*   [Myanmar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myanmar) security forces fire into a crowd of 275 [Rakhine people](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rakhine_people) detained during a search for [Arakan Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arakan_Army_(Kachin_State)) members, killing six and wounding eight. The [military](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tatmadaw) claim that they were forced to shoot after some of the detainees attempted to seize their weapons, despite warning shots and verbal warnings. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-myanmar-rakhine/myanmar-troops-kill-six-detain-scores-in-rakhine-over-suspected-rebel-links-military-spokesman-idUSKCN1S80R2)

## Politics and elections

*   [2020 Democratic Party presidential primaries](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Democratic_Party_presidential_primaries)
    *   [U.S. Senator](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Senate) [Michael Bennet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Bennet) from [Colorado](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colorado) announces [he is running](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Bennet_2020_presidential_campaign) for the [Democratic Party's](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democratic_Party_(United_States)) nomination to be [President of the United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) in [the 2020 presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_United_States_presidential_election). [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/05/02/us/michael-bennet-president-2020.html)
*   [Baltimore](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baltimore) Mayor [Catherine E. Pugh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catherine_Pugh) resigns. Pugh is being investigated over alleged financial improprieties via a so-called [self-dealing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Self-dealing) book sales arrangement (_similar to [pay-to-play](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pay_to_play)_) for her book, _Healthy Holly: Exercising is Fun_. [Baltimore City Council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baltimore_City_Council) president [Bernard "Jack" Young](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bernard_C._Young) has been serving as acting mayor since April 2. [(_Baltimore Sun_ via MSN.com)](https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/us/baltimore-mayor-pugh-resigns-after-month-on-leave-amid-investigation-into-her-business-deals/ar-AAANQQV) [(NPR)](https://www.npr.org/2019/05/02/717660592/baltimore-mayor-catherine-pugh-resigns-in-wake-of-childrens-book-scandal)

## Science and technology

*   [Facebook](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Facebook) and [Instagram](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Instagram) ban [far-right](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Far-right_politics) figures [Alex Jones](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alex_Jones), [Milo Yiannopoulos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Milo_Yiannopoulos), [Paul Joseph Watson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Joseph_Watson), [Paul Nehlen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Nehlen), [David Duke](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Duke) and [Laura Loomer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laura_Loomer), and [Nation of Islam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nation_of_Islam) leader [Louis Farrakhan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louis_Farrakhan), from their platforms and remove their pages for allegedly engaging in "violence and hate". [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/05/02/tech/facebook-ban-louis-farrakhan-infowars-alex-jones-milo-laura-loomer/index.html) [(NBC News)](https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/facebook-bans-alex-jones-louis-farrakhan-others-facebook-instagram-n1001311) [(JTA)](https://www.jta.org/quick-reads/facebook-is-finally-banning-anti-semites-like-david-duke-louis-farrakhan-and-alex-jones)

# 2019-05-03

## Business and finance

*   [Sinclair Broadcast Group](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sinclair_Broadcast_Group) buys [Fox Sports Networks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fox_Sports_Networks) from [The Walt Disney Company](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Walt_Disney_Company) for $10.6 billion. Disney was ordered by the [U.S. Justice Department](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Department_of_Justice) to sell FSN as part of its [purchase](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acquisition_of_21st_Century_Fox_by_Disney) of [21st Century Fox](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/21st_Century_Fox) last year due to its ownership of [ESPN Inc](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ESPN_Inc). [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/05/03/business/media/sinclair-disney-regional-sports-networks.html)
*   Documents filed in a United States [bankruptcy court](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bankruptcy_court) indicate that the bankrupt [utility](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Utility) company [Pacific Gas & Electric](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pacific_Gas_%26_Electric) has not been able to reach a settlement with its creditors over billions of dollars it owes under power purchase contracts. PG&E wants the issue settled by the bankruptcy court rather than by the [Federal Energy Regulatory Commission](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Energy_Regulatory_Commission). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-pg-e-us-renewables/pge-unable-to-strike-deal-over-renewable-power-contracts-court-documents-idUSKCN1S91W6)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [Mississippi River floods](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mississippi_River_floods)
    *   [Alton, Illinois](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alton,_Illinois), builds a barrier wall as the Mississippi River rises to levels not seen since the historic [1993 floods](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Great_Flood_of_1993). [(_Chicago Tribune_)](https://www.chicagotribune.com/news/nationworld/midwest/ct-spring-flooding-illinois-mississippi-river-20190503-story.html)
    *   The [Mississippi River](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mississippi_River) rises to its highest level since the 1993 floods at the [Quad Cities](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quad_Cities) in Illinois and Iowa. [(_Chicago Tribune_)](https://www.chicagotribune.com/news/nationworld/midwest/ct-spring-flooding-mississippi-river-1993-levels-20190502-story.html)
    *   Flooding from [Michigan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michigan) to the south damages homes and sends the [Mississippi River](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mississippi_River) to a 157-year high in [Davenport, Iowa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Davenport,_Iowa). [(_Weather Channel_)](https://weather.com/news/news/2019-05-03-flooding-mississippi-river-michigan-mississippi-davenport)
*   [2019 North Indian Ocean cyclone season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_North_Indian_Ocean_cyclone_season)
    *   [Cyclone Fani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyclone_Fani), an extremely severe [category 4](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saffir%E2%80%93Simpson_scale) storm and one of the strongest in recent years, makes landfall at the coastal town of [Puri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Puri) in the [Indian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/India) state of [Odisha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Odisha). Eight people have been killed in India, according to the [Press Trust of India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Press_Trust_of_India), and hundreds more injured. Severe damage and flooding has been reported. One million Indians and 2.1 million Bangladeshis have been evacuated. A [storm surge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Storm_surge) possibly up to 1.5m (5ft) is expected. The storm, weakening as it travels northeast through India, is expected to reach [Chittagong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chittagong) in [Bangladesh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bangladesh) Saturday. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-india-cyclone/cyclone-slams-into-indian-temple-town-bangladesh-braces-with-evacuation-order-idUSKCN1S905P) [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-india-48153413)
*   [Miami Air Flight 293](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miami_Air_Flight_293)
    *   A Boeing 737 arriving at [Naval Air Station Jacksonville](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naval_Air_Station_Jacksonville) in Florida slides off the runway into the [St. Johns River](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/St._Johns_River). All on board survive. [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2019/05/03/us/jacksonville-commercial-plane-river/index.html)

## Politics and elections

*   [Tax returns of Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tax_returns_of_Donald_Trump)
    *   The [California Senate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/California_State_Senate) passes a bill that would keep [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) out of the [2020 presidential primaries](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Republican_Party_presidential_primaries) until he releases his [tax returns](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tax_returns_of_Donald_Trump). [(The Hill)](https://thehill.com/homenews/state-watch/441908-california-senate-passes-bill-that-would-keep-trump-off-2020-ballot) [(Associated Press)](https://www.apnews.com/880e9ce35f884f059eecb2b68c8997a0)

## Sports

*   [2019 NBA playoffs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_NBA_playoffs)
    *   The [Portland Trail Blazers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portland_Trail_Blazers) defeat the [Denver Nuggets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Denver_Nuggets) 140-137 in quadruple overtime, making the game the first quadruple overtime game in the playoffs since 1953. [(The Guardian)](https://amp.theguardian.com/sport/2019/may/03/portland-denver-four-overtimes-nba-playoffs) [(Vladtv)](https://www.vladtv.com/article/254551/blazers-beat-the-nuggets-in-quadruple-overtime-1st-4ot-game-since-1953)

# 2019-05-04

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Libyan Civil War (2014–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libyan_Civil_War_(2014%E2%80%93present)), [Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant in Libya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_State_of_Iraq_and_the_Levant_in_Libya)
    *   An attack on forces loyal to [Field Marshal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Field_marshal_(Libya)) [Khalifa Haftar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khalifa_Haftar) in [Sabha, Libya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sabha,_Libya), kills at least nine people. [ISIL](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_State_of_Iraq_and_the_Levant) claims responsibility. [(AFP via _The Times of India_)](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/rest-of-world/nine-dead-in-is-attack-on-haftar-forces-in-south-libya/articleshow/69178531.cms)
*   [North Korea and weapons of mass destruction](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Korea_and_weapons_of_mass_destruction)
    *   [North Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Korea) fires several short-range projectiles from the east coast city of [Wonsan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wonsan). [(Reuters/AP via ABC Australia)](https://www.abc.net.au/news/2019-05-04/north-korea-fires-short-range-missile/11080184)
*   [Gaza–Israel clashes (May 2019)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaza%E2%80%93Israel_clashes_(May_2019))
    *   The [Israeli Air Force](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israeli_Air_Force) carries out dozens of airstrikes on the [Gaza Strip](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaza_Strip) in response to a barrage of rockets fired by [Hamas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hamas) militants. The [Turkish](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey) state-owned [Anadolu Agency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anadolu_Agency)'s media office in Gaza was among those hit by Israeli missiles, prompting outrage from Turkish officials. [(Deutsche Welle)](https://www.dw.com/en/israel-hits-offices-of-turkish-state-news-agency-in-gaza/a-48604155)
*   4 [Turkish soldiers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkish_Armed_Forces) were killed in an attack on their base in [Iraq](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq) by Kurdish forces. 20 [PKK members](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PKK) were also killed in the attack. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-turkey-security-soldiers/four-turkish-soldiers-killed-in-clashes-with-pkk-ministry-idUSKCN1RW07B)

## Arts and culture

*   [Vajiralongkorn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vajiralongkorn), [King of Thailand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/King_of_Thailand) since 2016, is officially [crowned](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coronation_of_Vajiralongkorn) sovereign. His wife [Suthida Tidjai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suthida_Tidjai), who he had married only three days prior, is declared Queen consort. [(Washington Post)](https://washingtonpost.com/world/2019/05/05/dressed-gold-new-thai-king-has-procession-through-bangkok-second-day-coronation-ceremonies/)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [2019 North Indian Ocean cyclone season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_North_Indian_Ocean_cyclone_season)
    *   [Cyclone Fani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyclone_Fani) starts affecting [Bangladesh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bangladesh), where over a million people have been evacuated from the storm's path. Authorities say the cyclone has killed at least five people in Bangladesh and damaged over a thousand homes. At least twelve people have been killed in total by the cyclone. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-india-cyclone/cyclone-hits-bangladesh-after-battering-india-mass-evacuations-save-lives-idUSKCN1SA05Y)

## Science and technology

*   [Interstellar Technologies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interstellar_Technologies) successfully launches unmanned rocket [MOMO-3](/w/index.php?title=MOMO-3&action=edit&redlink=1) from its launch facility in [Taiki, Hokkaido](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taiki,_Hokkaido), becoming the first commercially developed [Japanese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan) rocket to reach the [Kármán line](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K%C3%A1rm%C3%A1n_line). ## Sport

*   [2019 Kentucky Derby](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Kentucky_Derby)
    *   In [horse racing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thoroughbred_horse_racing), [Country House](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Country_House_(horse)) wins the 145th Kentucky Derby after [Maximum Security](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maximum_Security_(horse)) is disqualified. # 2019-05-05

## Armed conflict and attacks

*   [Gaza–Israel clashes (May 2019)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaza%E2%80%93Israel_clashes_(May_2019)), [Iran–Israel proxy conflict](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93Israel_proxy_conflict)
    *   [Hamas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hamas) and other militant groups in the [Gaza Strip](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaza_Strip) fire rockets at [Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel), killing two Israeli civilians in [Ashkelon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ashkelon) and one in [Ashdod](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ashdod). Retaliatory Israeli strikes on Gaza kill at least 23 [Palestinians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palestinians), including a senior Hamas commander. [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/05/05/middleeast/israel-airstrikes-gaza-rockets-intl/index.html) [(Haartez)](https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/430-gaza-rockets-fired-at-israel-one-israeli-dead-six-palestinians-said-killed-1.7199036)
*   [Taliban militants](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taliban) kill 13 and injure 55 people in an attack in [Puli Khumri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Puli_Khumri), [Afghanistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghanistan), using guns and suicide vests. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-48169104)
*   The [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) deploys [a carrier strike group](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carrier_Strike_Group_12) and a bomber task force to the Middle East to respond to threats from [Iran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran). A U.S. official told [CNN](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CNN), "... the threats were against both US maritime and land-based forces in the region." [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/05/05/politics/iran-carrier-bomber-task-force/index.html)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [Aeroflot Flight 1492](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aeroflot_Flight_1492)
    *   At least 41 passengers are killed after [Sukhoi Superjet 100](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sukhoi_Superjet_100) (flight SU1492), which suffered an inflight fire, is engulfed by fire after an emergency crash landing at [Sheremetyevo International Airport](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sheremetyevo_International_Airport), [Moscow](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moscow), Russia. A five-person crew and 78 passengers were on board. [(Aviation 24)](https://www.aviation24.be/airlines/aeroflot/sukhoi-superjet-makes-emergency-landing-at-moscow-sheremetyevo-after-a-fire-on-board/) [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-48171392)
*   Seven [Venezuelan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venezuela) military officers are killed in a helicopter crash. [(AP)](https://www.apnews.com/056d93e06fc146048be64fa0272bb5aa)

## International relations

*   [2019 Venezuelan presidential crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Venezuelan_presidential_crisis), [United States–Venezuela relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States%E2%80%93Venezuela_relations)
    *   The [President of the National Assembly of Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_National_Assembly_of_Venezuela) [Juan Guaidó](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Guaid%C3%B3) tells the [BBC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BBC) he is considering formally requesting the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) to launch a [military intervention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Humanitarian_intervention) to topple [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Venezuela) [Nicolás Maduro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicol%C3%A1s_Maduro). Guaidó led a [failed uprising](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Venezuela_uprising) against Maduro last month. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-latin-america-48172520?ocid=socialflow_twitter)

## Law and crime

*   [LGBT rights in Brunei](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_Brunei)
    *   [Brunei's Sultan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Sultans_of_Brunei) [Hassanal Bolkiah](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hassanal_Bolkiah) announces, via a television broadcast, that he has extended the moratorium on capital punishment for gay sex convictions. No executions have been carried out in [Brunei](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brunei) since 1957. There has been overwhelming international backlash against a number of the changes affected by the stricter interpretation of [Islamic law](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sharia) published on 3 April 2019. The Sultan also said Brunei will ratify the [United Nations Convention against Torture](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_Convention_against_Torture). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-48171165) [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/05/05/asia/brunei-lgbt-death-penalty-intl/index.html)

*   [The Steele dossier](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trump%E2%80%93Russia_dossier), [Special Counsel investigation (2017–2019)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special_Counsel_investigation_(2017%E2%80%932019)), [Operation Crossfire Hurricane](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Crossfire_Hurricane)
    *   The [Senate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Senate) [Homeland Security Committee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Senate_Committee_on_Homeland_Security_and_Governmental_Affairs) Chairman [Ron Johnson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ron_Johnson_(Wisconsin_politician)) and [Senate Finance Committee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Senate_Committee_on_Finance) Chairman [Chuck Grassley](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chuck_Grassley) request documents related to [Christopher Steele](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christopher_Steele), author of the Trump–Russia dossier, in a letter to [United States Secretary of State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Secretary_of_State) [Mike Pompeo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mike_Pompeo) and the [FBI](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Bureau_of_Investigation) [Director](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Director_of_the_Federal_Bureau_of_Investigation) [Christopher Wray](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christopher_A._Wray). [(CBS News)](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/senators-request-documents-related-to-christopher-steele-author-of-trump-dossier/)

[(Radio New Zealand)](https://www.radionz.co.nz/international/pacific-news/388941/solomon-islands-to-refloat-ship-after-oil-spill)

    *   Gunmen burn down a Catholic church during [mass](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mass_(liturgy)) and kill six people, including a priest, in [Dablo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dablo_Department), [Burkina Faso](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burkina_Faso).     *   The [United Arab Emirates](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Arab_Emirates) reports four commercial vessels were subject to "sabotage operations" just outside its territorial waters in the [Gulf of Oman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gulf_of_Oman) and two of the vessels suffer "significant damage" to their structure off the coast of [Fujairah](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fujairah). # 2019-05-14

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Saudi Arabia–Yemen relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabia%E2%80%93Yemen_relations), [Yemeni Crisis (2011–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yemeni_Crisis_(2011%E2%80%93present)), [Gulf of Oman incident](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gulf_of_Oman_incident)
    *   Two [Saudi Aramco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Aramco) oil pumping stations are attacked in an apparent drone strike according to [Saudi Arabia's](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabia) Energy Ministry. The stations are linked to a pipeline transporting oil from the eastern fields to the western coast port of [Yanbu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yanbu) on the [Red Sea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_Sea). [(Associated Press)](https://www.apnews.com/c4da5c059fd841bf96d4103e55359329) [(Bloomberg)](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-05-14/saudi-aramco-pumping-stations-targeted-in-limited-attack-spa)

## Disasters and accidents

*   A 7.5 [MMS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moment_magnitude_scale) quake rattles [New Ireland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Ireland_(island)), [Papua New Guinea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Papua_New_Guinea). Police Sergeant Frank Kilaur says that the quake was "very, very violent" but no immediate reports of major damages or casualties have been reported. A tsunami alert is issued by the [Pacific Tsunami Warning Center](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pacific_Tsunami_Warning_Center). The tsunami threat has now largely passed. [(Pacific Tsunami Warning Center)](https://ptwc.weather.gov/ptwc/text.php?id=pacific.TSUPAC.2019.05.14.1435) [(Radio New Zealand)](https://www.rnz.co.nz/international/pacific-news/389216/7-point-5-quake-rattles-papua-new-guinea-s-rabaul) [(_Daily Express_)](https://www.express.co.uk/news/world/1127027/Papua-New-Guinea-earthquake-tsunami-solomon-islands-pacific)

## International relations

*   [Russia–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia%E2%80%93United_States_relations)
    *   [United States Secretary of State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Secretary_of_State) [Mike Pompeo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mike_Pompeo) meets [Russian President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Russia) [Vladimir Putin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vladimir_Putin) and warns [Russia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia) to not interfere in the [2020 United States presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_United_States_presidential_election). [(NPR)](https://www.npr.org/2019/05/14/723211912/on-visit-to-russia-pompeo-says-we-would-not-tolerate-interference-in-2020-electi) [(Miami Herald)](https://www.miamiherald.com/news/nation-world/article230372354.html)

*   Former [New York](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_City) [congressman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York%27s_9th_congressional_district) [Anthony Weiner](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anthony_Weiner) is released from a [halfway house](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Halfway_house) in [the Bronx](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Bronx), completing his 21-month federal prison sentence for illicit online contact with a 15-year-old girl. [(_Los Angeles Times_)](https://www.latimes.com/politics/la-na-pol-anthony-weiner-prison-sentence-released-20190514-story.html) [(_New York Post_)](https://nypost.com/2019/05/14/anthony-weiner-released-from-bronx-halfway-house/)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Venezuelan presidential crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Venezuelan_presidential_crisis)
    *   [Venezuelan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venezuela) security forces surround the [Palacio Federal Legislativo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palacio_Federal_Legislativo) in [Caracas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caracas), preventing opposition [National Assembly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Assembly_(Venezuela)) lawmakers from entering the building to discuss a response to the recent arrest of National Assembly Vice President [Edgar Zambrano](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edgar_Zambrano). [(Euronews)](https://www.euronews.com/2019/05/14/venezuela-security-forces-block-opposition-lawmakers-from-entering-parliament)

## Science and technology

*   [Microarchitectural Data Sampling](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microarchitectural_Data_Sampling)
    *   [Security researchers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Information_security) from [Graz University of Technology](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graz_University_of_Technology) and [Catholic University of Leuven](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/KU_Leuven) discover a major new class of Microarchitectural Data Sampling [vulnerabilities](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vulnerability_(computing)) called ZombieLoad in [Intel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intel) [processors](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_processing_unit), which, if exploited, can be used to steal sensitive information directly from the processor. Almost every computer with an Intel chip dating back to 2011 is affected by these vulnerabilities. [(ZombieLoad disclosure website)](https://zombieloadattack.com/) [(TechCrunch)](https://techcrunch.com/2019/05/14/zombieload-flaw-intel-processors/)
    *   [Linux kernel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linux_kernel) developers, [Apple](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple_Inc.), [Google](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Google) and [Microsoft](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microsoft) release emergency [patches](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patch_(computing)) for their products to mitigate ZombieLoad. [(TechCrunch)](https://techcrunch.com/2019/05/14/intel-chip-flaws-patches-released/) [(Phoronix)](https://www.phoronix.com/scan.php?page=news_item&px=MDS-Kernel-Fixes)
*   [Mass surveillance industry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mass_surveillance_industry)
    *   [WhatsApp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WhatsApp) confirms a major security bug in the app let hackers remotely install surveillance software on its user's devices. All 1.5 billion users are urged to update WhatsApp as a precaution. The technology used in the [cyberattack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyberattack) appears to have originated from [NSO Group](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NSO_Group), a technology company operating out of [Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-48262681) [(_The Independent_)](https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/gadgets-and-tech/news/whatsapp-update-how-to-iphone-android-bug-hack-attack-security-a8912591.html)

# 2019-05-18

## Arts and culture

*   [Eurovision Song Contest 2019](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eurovision_Song_Contest_2019)
    *   [Duncan Laurence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Duncan_Laurence), representing the [Netherlands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Netherlands), wins the 2019 edition of the [Eurovision Song Contest](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eurovision_Song_Contest) with the song "[Arcade](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arcade_(song))".
