## Disasters and accidents

*   Five foreign tourists, four of whom were Canadians, are killed when their [Piper PA-32](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Piper_PA-32) crashes into the [Atlantic Ocean](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atlantic_Ocean) near [Honduras](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Honduras) shortly after taking off from [Roatán](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roat%C3%A1n) island. [(Reuters via MSN.com)](https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/world/five-foreign-tourists-killed-in-plane-crash-in-honduras/ar-AABzBDl?ocid=spartandhp)

## Health and environment

*   [Dengue fever](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dengue_fever)
    *   The [Cook Islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cook_Islands) secretary of health, Josephine Herman, says that the country is holding and containing the latest outbreak of Dengue, which has killed 22 people and infected another 28. [(Radio New Zealand)](https://www.rnz.co.nz/international/pacific-news/389509/cooks-health-secretary-says-dengue-total-up-to-50l)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Argentine general election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Argentine_general_election)
    *   Former [Argentine President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Argentina) [Cristina Fernández de Kirchner](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cristina_Fern%C3%A1ndez_de_Kirchner) announces that she will run for [Vice President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vice_President_of_Argentina) in the 2019 Argentine general election, with former [Chief of Staff](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chief_of_the_Cabinet_of_Ministers) [Alberto Fernández](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alberto_Fern%C3%A1ndez) as her running mate for President. [(_Télam_)](http://www.telam.com.ar/notas/201905/359235-alberto-fernandez-presidente-cristina-vice-cfk-formula-kirchnerismo-elecciones.html), [(_La Nación_)](https://www.lanacion.com.ar/politica/alberto-fernandez-presidente-cristina-kirchner-vice-video-nid2249202)
*   [2019 Australian federal election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Australian_federal_election)
    *   Voters in [Australia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia) go to the polls to elect new members of the [House of Representatives](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australian_House_of_Representatives) and half of the [Senate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australian_Senate). [(SBS)](https://www.sbs.com.au/news/vote-2019-australians-head-to-the-polls-in-tight-federal-election)
    *   Prime Minister [Scott Morrison](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scott_Morrison) declares victory. It remains unclear whether his [Liberal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liberal_Party_of_Australia)-[National](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Party_of_Australia) [Coalition](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coalition_(Australia)) has won a majority of seats, or whether it will form a [minority government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minority_government). [(_Sydney Morning Herald_)](https://www.smh.com.au/federal-election-2019/coalition-backs-morrison-to-stay-liberal-leader-regardless-of-election-outcome-20190518-p51opw.html)
    *   Despite [opinion polls](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opinion_polling_for_the_2019_Australian_federal_election) predicting a Labor victory, the [Labor Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australian_Labor_Party) loses several seats, with support in the key state of [Queensland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Queensland) far lower than expected. Opposition Leader [Bill Shorten](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bill_Shorten) concedes defeat and steps down as party leader. [(_Canberra Times_)](https://www.canberratimes.com.au/story/6131296/shorten-stands-down-as-labor-leader/?cs=14231)
    *   Former Prime Minister [Tony Abbott](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tony_Abbott) loses [his seat](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Division_of_Warringah) to independent candidate and former Olympian [Zali Steggall](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zali_Steggall). [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/global/2019/may/18/australian-election-tony-abbott-loses-his-warringah-seat-to-zali-steggall)
*   [Efforts to impeach Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Efforts_to_impeach_Donald_Trump)
    *   [Justin Amash](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Justin_Amash) from [Michigan's 3rd congressional district](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michigan%27s_3rd_congressional_district) becomes the first [Republican](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_Party_(United_States)) [U.S. Representative](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_House_of_Representatives) to support the [impeachment](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Impeachment_in_the_United_States) of [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump). [(Fox News)](https://www.foxnews.com/politics/lawmaker-breaking-with-gop-accuses-trump-of-obstruction-impeachable-conduct)
*   [Ibiza affair](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ibiza_affair)
    *   [Vice-Chancellor of Austria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vice-Chancellor_of_Austria), [Heinz-Christian Strache](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heinz-Christian_Strache), steps down both as Vice-Chancellor and chairman of the [Freedom Party of Austria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freedom_Party_of_Austria) due to an alleged corruption scandal. [(DW)](https://www.dw.com/en/austrian-vice-chancellor-heinz-christian-strache-resigns-following-alleged-corruption-scandal/a-48783968)
    *   [Sebastian Kurz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sebastian_Kurz), [Chancellor of Austria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chancellor_of_Austria), announces the dissolution of his [government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kurz_government) and calls for a [snap election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Austrian_legislative_election). [(Independent)](https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/austria-election-kurz-heinz-christian-strache-corruption-scandal-resignation-video-a8920216.html)

## Sports

*   [2019 FA Cup Final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_FA_Cup_Final), [2018–19 Manchester City F.C. season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018%E2%80%9319_Manchester_City_F.C._season)
    *   [Manchester City F.C.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manchester_City_F.C.) win England's [2018–19 FA Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018%E2%80%9319_FA_Cup) by defeating [Watford F.C.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Watford_F.C.) 6-0 in [the final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_FA_Cup_Final), marking the first time that an English club has won [all three domestic titles in one season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Treble_(association_football)#Domestic_trebles). [(England's Football Association)](http://www.thefa.com/news/2019/may/18/fa-cup-final-man-city-watford-180519)

# 2019-05-19

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   An explosion hits a tourist bus carrying [South African](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Africa) nationals near the [Grand Egyptian Museum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_Egyptian_Museum) in [Giza](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Giza), [Egypt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Egypt), injuring at least 14 people. [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2019/05/19/africa/egypt-museum-blast-tourists-intl/index.html)
*   [Iraq–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq%E2%80%93United_States_relations), [Iran–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93United_States_relations)
    *   A rocket explodes inside the heavily fortified [Green Zone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Green_Zone) sector of [Iraq](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq)'s capital, landing less than a mile from the [U.S. Embassy in Baghdad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Embassy_of_the_United_States,_Baghdad) amid heightened tensions in the region between the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) and [Iran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran). [(Associated Press)](https://www.apnews.com/890156f1ffc1457ba97acd598753be94) [(Los Angeles Times)](https://www.latimes.com/world/la-fg-iraq-rocket-near-us-embassy-20190519-story.html)

## Business and economy

*   [China–United States trade war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China%E2%80%93United_States_trade_war)
    *   [Google](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Google) pulls [Android](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Android_(operating_system)) update support for [Huawei](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Huawei) phones, as well as the [Google Play Store](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Google_Play) and [Gmail](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gmail) apps, after the [Chinese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China) technology company was blacklisted by the [United States Commerce Department](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Department_of_Commerce). [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2019/may/19/google-huawei-trump-blacklist-report)

## International relations

*   The [White House](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White_House) is expected to announce the first part of their [Middle East peace proposal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Middle_East_peace_proposals) in what officials are calling an economic "workshop" to encourage investing capital in the [West Bank](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/West_Bank), [Gaza](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaza_Strip), and the region. The workshop is expected to happen on June 25 and 26 in [Manama](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manama), [Bahrain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bahrain). [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2019/05/19/politics/white-house-middle-east-peace-proposal/index.html)
*   [Iran–Saudi Arabia relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93Saudi_Arabia_relations)
    *   [Saudi Arabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabia)'s [Adel al-Jubeir](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adel_al-Jubeir) says his country "seeks to avert war, ready to respond with force and determination" to a would-be attack by Iran. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/05/saudi-arabia-seeks-avert-war-ready-respond-force-190519055552084.html)

## Law and crime

*   Several gunmen open fire inside a bar in [Belém](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bel%C3%A9m), [Brazil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil), killing at least eleven people. [(Bloomberg)](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-05-19/urgent-brazil-officials-report-massacre-media-say-11-dead-at-bar)
*   [Crime in Alabama](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crime_in_Alabama)
    *   A man shoots three police officers, one fatally, in [Auburn, Alabama](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Auburn,_Alabama). The suspect is still at large. [(CBS News)](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/grady-wilkes-manhunt-alleged-shooter-several-police-officers-trailer-park-outside-auburn-alabama-today-2019-05-20/)

*   Binary [Aten asteroid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aten_asteroid) [(66391) 1999 KW4](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/(66391)_1999_KW4) and its [minor-planet moon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minor-planet_moon) make their closest-ever recorded flyby of [Earth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earth) at 3.2 million miles away. # 2019-05-27

## Armed attacks and conflicts

*   [French police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Law_enforcement_in_France) arrest four people in connection with last Friday's bombing in [Lyon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lyon)'s historic city center that injured 13 people. Anti-terrorist prosecutors are leading the investigation. [District mayor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2nd_arrondissement_of_Lyon) Denis Broliquier said the bomb was a relatively weak explosive that was too small to kill. No one has claimed responsibility for the attack. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-48420490)

## Business and economy

*   Italian firm [Fiat Chrysler](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiat_Chrysler_Automobiles) proposes a merger with French carmaker [Renault](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Renault). The new company will be based in the [Netherlands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Netherlands) and will be listed on the [Milan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Borsa_Italiana), [Paris](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paris_Bourse) and [New York](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_Stock_Exchange) stock exchanges. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/business-48420334)

## Disasters and accidents

*   At least 45 people die when a boat sinks on [Lake Mai-Ndombe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lake_Mai-Ndombe) in western [Democratic Republic of Congo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democratic_Republic_of_Congo). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-48421344)
*   Eight miners die in a goldmine explosion in central [Zimbabwe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zimbabwe). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/live/world-africa-48419494)
*   An airplane crashes in [Sergipe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sergipe), Brazil, killing Brazilian singer [Gabriel Diniz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gabriel_Diniz). [(G1)](https://g1.globo.com/se/sergipe/noticia/2019/05/27/corpo-de-bombeiros-e-acionado-para-atender-acidente-envolvendo-queda-de-bimotor.ghtml)
*   Christopher Kulish, an American attorney from [Boulder, Colorado](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boulder,_Colorado), dies while [climbing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_people_who_died_climbing_Mount_Everest) [Mount Everest](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mount_Everest). [(ABC News)](https://abcnews.go.com/amp/US/wireStory/colorado-climber-dies-reaching-top-mount-everest-63310099)
*   [U.S. tornadoes of 2019](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tornadoes_of_2019)
    *   Multiple destructive tornadoes strike [Dayton, Ohio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dayton,_Ohio), and surrounding communities. There was at least one known fatality in [Celina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Celina,_Ohio). Multiple homes and businesses were destroyed, with reports of numerous power outages and a boil and water conservation advisory issued for Dayton. [(Accuweather)](https://www.accuweather.com/en/weather-news/large-destructive-tornado-strikes-dayton-as-severe-storms-ravage-ohio/70008380)

## Law and crime

*   [Romania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romania)'s [Supreme Court](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High_Court_of_Cassation_and_Justice) denies [Social Democratic Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Social_Democratic_Party_(Romania)) leader [Liviu Dragnea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liviu_Dragnea)'s appeal of his conviction and three-and-a-half year prison sentence for corruption. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-48421430)

[(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-brazil-violence-prisons/brazil-officials-find-42-prisoners-dead-in-amazonas-state-after-deadly-gang-clash-idUSKCN1SX1WM?il=0) [(_Firstpost_)](https://www.firstpost.com/world/clashes-between-prisoners-in-brazils-amazonas-claim-15-lives-authorities-say-victims-were-killed-with-sharpened-toothbrushes-6706231.html)

## Politics and elections

    *   [Austrian Chancellor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chancellor_of_Austria) [Sebastian Kurz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sebastian_Kurz) loses a no-confidence vote following a corruption [scandal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ibiza_affair) over a secret video. # 2019-05-28

## International relations

*   [Australia–China relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia%E2%80%93China_relations), [South China Sea dispute](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_China_Sea_dispute)
    *   [Australian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia) helicopters, from the Royal Australian Navy flagship [HMAS _Canberra_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMAS_Canberra_(L02)), are forced to make an emergency landing after being targeted by lasers from fishing boats in the [South China Sea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_China_Sea). The _Canberra_ was being trailed by a Chinese warship. [(AP via MSN.com)](https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/world/australian-navy-pilots-struck-by-lasers-in-south-china-sea/ar-AAC1WbQ)

## Law and crime

*   [Kawasaki stabbings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kawasaki_stabbings)
    *   A man stabs to death two people and wounds 17 others, including sixteen children, in [Kawasaki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kawasaki,_Kanagawa), [Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan), before slitting his own throat; he later dies of his wounds. Three people are in critical condition. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-48428695) [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/05/27/asia/japan-stabbing-intl/index.html)
*   Former [Tehran Mayor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_mayors_of_Tehran) [Mohammad-Ali Najafi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohammad-Ali_Najafi) is arrested after confessing to the murder of his wife. [(IFP)](https://ifpnews.com/exclusive/ex-vice-president-of-iran-confesses-to-murder-of-wife/)
*   [China–United States trade war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China%E2%80%93United_States_trade_war)
    *   [Huawei](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Huawei) files for a [summary judgment](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Summary_judgment), seeks to expedite its [March](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portal:Current_events/2019_March_6) lawsuit against the [U.S. Government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_government_of_the_United_States), challenging the constitutionality of _Section 889_ of the [National Defense Authorization Act](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Defense_Authorization_Act) that bans U.S. executive government agencies from procuring Huawei and [ZTE](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ZTE) telecommunications equipment based on national security. [(CNBC)](https://www.cnbc.com/2019/05/29/huawei-files-motion-for-summary-judgement-in-lawsuit-against-us.html) [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/05/28/tech/huawei-lawsuit-us-china/index.html)

## Politics and elections

## Health and environment

*   A study, published in the journal _[Science](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Science_(journal))_, finds a [genetically enhanced](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genetic_engineering) fungus that produces spider toxin can rapidly kill huge numbers of the mosquitoes that spread [malaria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malaria). Trials held in [Burkina Faso](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burkina_Faso) showed mosquito populations collapsed by 99% within 45 days. The fungus did not affect other insects, such as bees. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/health-48464510) [(_Science_)](https://science.sciencemag.org/content/364/6443/894)
*   [Measles resurgence in the United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Measles_resurgence_in_the_United_States)
    *   Sixty new cases in the past week are reported, bringing this year's total to 971 cases in 26 U.S. states – the highest since 1994. The [CDC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Centers_for_Disease_Control_and_Prevention) warns, "If these outbreaks continue through summer and fall, the United States may lose its [measles elimination status](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Measles#Americas)." [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-48468801)

[(BBC News)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-48469408)
    *   [Mexican President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Mexico) [Andrés Manuel López Obrador](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andr%C3%A9s_Manuel_L%C3%B3pez_Obrador) responds with a letter to the U.S. president stating he wants to avoid a confrontation, saying that ideals such as justice and universal brotherhood are more important than borders. He also ordered his [foreign minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secretary_of_Foreign_Affairs_(Mexico)) to travel to Washington on Friday. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trade-mexico-president/america-first-is-a-fallacy-mexicos-president-responds-to-trump-tariff-idUSKCN1T109N?il=0)

[(CBS News)](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/edward-gallagher-navy-seal-charged-war-crimes-iraq-released-pending-trial/)
*   [Virginia Beach shooting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virginia_Beach_shooting)

## Health and environment

*   Authorities say that a patient has died amid an outbreak of [Legionnaires' disease](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legionnaires%27_disease) in a recently opened hospital in [Grove City, Ohio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grove_City,_Ohio). # 2019-06-05

## Armed attacks and conflicts

*   [Sudanese protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018%E2%80%9319_Sudanese_protests)
    *   The Central Committee of Sudanese Doctors say the number of people killed this week in Sudan is at least 100, and that 40 bodies were pulled from the [River Nile](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nile) at [Khartoum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khartoum) on Tuesday. Members of the [Rapid Support Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rapid_Support_Forces_(Sudan)) have reportedly been roaming the streets attacking civilians as it pushes deeper into Khartoum. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-48512413)
    *   A Sudanese official denies that 100 people were killed by a paramilitary unit during protests, saying that the number was at most 46. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-48535165)

## Business and economy

*   [Fiat Chrysler](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiat_Chrysler_Automobiles) withdraws its merger proposal for French carmaker [Renault](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Renault) after Renault board members were unable to reach a decision on the offer. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/business-48537453)
*   [YouTube](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/YouTube) announces a major policy shift concerning [hate speech](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hate_speech) and harassment on the video sharing platform, saying it will specifically ban videos that include [neo-nazi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neo-Nazism) and supremacist content, subsequently demonetizing and suspending the accounts of several popular [right-wing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Right-wing) channels, including [Steven Crowder](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steven_Crowder). The policy update comes days after YouTube announced a ban on minors [livestreaming](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Livestreaming) without adult supervision. [(CNET)](https://www.cnet.com/news/youtube-to-ban-supremacist-and-hoax-videos-in-tougher-hate-speech-policy/)

## International relations

*   [Taiwan–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taiwan%E2%80%93United_States_relations)
    *   The [Trump administration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presidency_of_Donald_Trump) informs [Congress](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Congress) of a potential $2 billion arms deal with [Taiwan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taiwan) that includes the [M1A2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M1_Abrams), the U.S.'s latest [main battle tank](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_battle_tank), and a resupply of anti-air and anti-armor weapons. [(Bloomberg)](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-06-05/trump-administration-readies-a-2-billion-taiwan-arms-package)

## Law and crime

*   [Australian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia) [federal police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australian_Federal_Police) raid the headquarters of the country's public broadcaster, [Australian Broadcasting Corporation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australian_Broadcasting_Corporation), in connection with 2017 leaked documents alleging [Australian Special forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australian_Special_forces) engaged in unlawful killings and gross misconduct in [Afghanistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghanistan). Yesterday, police raided _[Herald Sun](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Herald_Sun)_ journalist [Annika Smethurst](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annika_Smethurst)'s home regarding other alleged leaks of national security information. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-australia-48522729) [(_Business Insider_)](https://www.businessinsider.com/australia-federal-police-raid-offices-australia-broadcasting-network-2019-6)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Danish general election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Danish_general_election)
    *   The center-left [Social Democrats](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Social_Democrats_(Denmark)) win 91 of the 179 seats in the [Folketing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Folketing) (parliament). Current Liberal Prime Minister [Lars Løkke Rasmussen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lars_L%C3%B8kke_Rasmussen) concedes defeat, paving the way for Social Democrat leader [Mette Frederiksen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mette_Frederiksen) to take power. Ms. Frederiksen, 41, is set to be the country's youngest [prime minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Denmark). [(The Local)](https://www.thelocal.dk/20190605/denmark-goes-to-the-polls-in-crucial-general-election-with-voters-seeking-change) [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-48535939)
*   [President of Peru](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Peru) [Martín Vizcarra](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mart%C3%ADn_Vizcarra) wins a motion of confidence in the [Congress of the Republic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Congress_of_the_Republic_of_Peru). [(_Reuters_)](https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-peru-politics/with-confidence-vote-peru-revives-debate-over-anti-graft-reforms-idUKKCN1T61WN)

    *   The [Labour Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Labour_Party_(UK)) holds the [Peterborough](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peterborough_(UK_Parliament_constituency)) seat in the by-election, defying predictions that they would lose the seat to the [Brexit Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit_Party). [(KTRK-TV)](https://abc13.com/amp/weather/1-dead-after-crane-collapses-over-apartment-during-dallas-storms/5339379/)
*   A woman is killed when a police officer driving under the influence crashes into a restaurant in Illinois. [(MSN)](https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/us/police-drunk-off-duty-police-officer-crashes-into-restaurant-kills-woman/ar-AACEFdZ?ocid=spartanntp)

## Law and crime

*   Former [Boston Red Sox](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boston_Red_Sox) [designated hitter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Designated_hitter) [David Ortiz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Ortiz) is shot in the [Dominican Republic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dominican_Republic) during a reported robbery attempt. He is expected to fully recover following surgery. [(Heavy)](https://heavy.com/sports/2019/06/david-ortiz-shot-video-condition/amp/) [(ESPN)](https://www.espn.com/mlb/story/_/id/26937958/red-sox-legend-ortiz-stable-shooting-dr)

Dodon, as well as the [Parliament of Moldova](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parliament_of_Moldova) defy the move, hence triggering a [constitutional crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Constitutional_crisis).     *   Over 1 million people gather in the streets of [Hong Kong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hong_Kong) to protest a new controversial law which would allow China to extradite fugitives from the city. [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/06/08/asia/hong-kong-extradition-bill-protest-intl/index.html)

    *   The [Portugal national football team](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portugal_national_football_team) defeats the [Netherlands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Netherlands_national_football_team) in the final of the [2018–19 UEFA Nations League](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018%E2%80%9319_UEFA_Nations_League), 1–0, to become the first champions of the tournament. *   [2019 French Open](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_French_Open_%E2%80%93_Men%27s_Singles)
    *   Spaniard [Rafael Nadal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rafael_Nadal), who turned 33 this past Monday, defeats Austrian [Dominic Thiem](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dominic_Thiem) 6–3, 5–7, 6–1, 6–1 for his 12th French Open men's singles championship, and his 18th [Grand Slam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_Slam_(tennis)) title. ## Armed conflicts and attacks

    *   An attack on a village near the town of [Sangha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sangha,_Mali) in central [Mali](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mali) kills 95 [Dogon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dogon_people) villagers. The document draws criticism from [LGBT](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT) groups. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-48584892)

*   [Defense contractors](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arms_industry) [United Technologies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Technologies) and [Raytheon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raytheon) agree to merge into a combined company that would generate $74 billion in annual sales, making it the second-largest aerospace and defense company in the U.S. [(CNBC)](https://www.cnbc.com/2019/06/10/raytheon-united-technologies-to-merge-what-experts-are-watching.html) [(Bloomberg)](https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2019-06-09/raytheon-is-united-technologies-50-billion-finishing-touch)

## Health and environment

*   [Phase-out of lightweight plastic bags](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phase-out_of_lightweight_plastic_bags)
    *   [Canadian Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Canada) [Justin Trudeau](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Justin_Trudeau) announces that [Canada](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canada) will ban all single-use plastics as early as 2021 in a bid to significantly reduce [plastic pollution](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plastic_pollution). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-48477087)

    *   In [San Bernardino, California](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Bernardino,_California), Charles "Chase" Merritt is found guilty of four counts of murder in the 2013 deaths of the McStay family. [(_The Los Angeles Times_)](https://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-mcstay-family-murders-verdict-20190610-story.html)
*   [Rape in India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rape_in_India)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [Sinking of _Hableány_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sinking_of_Hable%C3%A1ny)
    *   Four bodies are recovered by salvage crews during the raising of the wreck of the _Hableány_, which sank on the [Danube](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Danube) in Budapest last month. Four other people are still missing. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-48591791)

# 2019-06-13

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [June 2019 Gulf of Oman incident](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/June_2019_Gulf_of_Oman_incident), [Iran–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93United_States_relations), [Iran–Saudi Arabia relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93Saudi_Arabia_relations)
    *   Two [oil tankers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oil_tanker), one Norwegian and one Japanese, are damaged and abandoned after being attacked in the [Gulf of Oman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gulf_of_Oman), with all crew members aboard both ships safely rescued. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-48619771)
    *   The [United States Secretary of State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Secretary_of_State) [Mike Pompeo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mike_Pompeo) and [Saudi Arabia Foreign Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs_(Saudi_Arabia)) [Adel al-Jubeir](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adel_al-Jubeir) directly blame [Iran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran) for being behind the attacks on both ships. Iranian officials deny the U.S. claims. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-48630374) [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-tankers-saudi/saudi-arabia-agrees-iran-was-behind-tanker-attacks-saudi-minister-idUSKCN1TE36X)
    *   The [United States Central Command](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Central_Command) (CENTCOM) releases a video showing what CENTCOM spokesperson says, is an [Iranian Revolutionary Guard Corps'](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_Revolutionary_Guard_Corps) patrol boat approaching the Kokuka Courageous "and was observed and recorded removing an unexploded [limpet mine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Limpet_mine) from the M/T Kokuka Courageous." [Iran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran) denies involvement. [(Associated Press)](https://www.apnews.com/6a48842e263541a5b3451f0d41dee01a) [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-tanker/u-s-blames-iran-for-tanker-attacks-in-gulf-of-oman-iran-rejects-assertion-idUSKCN1TE0OI)
*   A [suicide bomber](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suicide_attack) kills eleven and injures thirteen in an attack in [Jalalabad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jalalabad), [Afghanistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghanistan). [(Reuters)](https://reut.rs/2MMsrTF) [(News18)](https://www.news18.com/news/world/11-killed-13-injured-in-suicide-bombing-in-afghanistan-isis-afghan-arm-claims-responsibility-2186029.html)

## Disasters and accidents

*   One of the towers of the centuries-old [Citadel of Ghazni](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Citadel_of_Ghazni), [Afghanistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghanistan) collapses amid heavy rainfall. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-48629680)

## Law and crime

*   [Flint water crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flint_water_crisis)
    *   [Michigan Attorney General](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michigan_Attorney_General) [Dana Nessel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dana_Nessel) announces that charges will be dropped against eight people in the [Flint](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flint,_Michigan) water crisis and investigations will be restarted in the scandal, which has plagued the city since 2014. [(Wall Street Journal)](https://www.wsj.com/articles/michigan-drops-charges-in-flint-water-case-as-it-restarts-investigation-11560452731) [(The Hill)](https://thehill.com/policy/healthcare/state-issues/448419-prosecutors-drop-flint-water-charges-restart-investigation)

## Politics and elections

*   The [U.S. Office of Special Counsel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._Office_of_Special_Counsel) (OSC) recommends that the [Trump administration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trump_administration) remove [Kellyanne Conway](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kellyanne_Conway) from her office as senior aide to President Trump because of her repeated violations of the [Hatch Act of 1939](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hatch_Act_of_1939). The Trump administration rejects the OSC's recommendations, saying they "are deeply flawed and violate \[Conway's\] constitutional rights to free speech and due process."     *   [White House Press Secretary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White_House_Press_Secretary) [Sarah Sanders](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sarah_Sanders) announces she will leave her job at the end of June. [(CBC)](https://www.cbc.ca/news/world/sarah-sanders-leaving-white-house-1.5174520)

## Science and technology

    *   [Twitter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Twitter) says it has removed thousands of accounts that were being run by the [Iranian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran) government, to spread propaganda and [fake news](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fake_news) on the [social media](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Social_media) platform. It has also removed over a hundred accounts linked to the [Catalan independence movement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catalan_independence_movement), and dozens of accounts related to [Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venezuela). # 2019-06-14

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [June 2019 Gulf of Oman incident](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/June_2019_Gulf_of_Oman_incident)
    *   An unnamed [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) official claims that, just prior to the attack on two merchant vessels, an Iranian vessel launched a surface to air missile at a MQ-9 Reaper drone in the vicinity of the attack. An additional MQ-9 Reaper is reported to have been shot down by Houthi rebels several days prior in the [Red Sea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_Sea). [(_CNN_)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/06/14/politics/us-drone-tracked-iranian-boats/index.html)
    *   The president of the Japanese shipping company offers a different account of the attack than that provided by the United States. Yutaka Katada says the [Filipino](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Filipinos) crew of the _Kokuka Courageous_ oil tanker said their vessel was apparently first hit by an [artillery shell](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shell_(projectile)) rather than a mine. The United States said the tanker was attacked by [limpet mines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Limpet_mine) and released a video it says shows Iranian special forces removing an unexploded mine from the oil tanker's side. [(_The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/japanese-ship-owner-contradicts-us-account-of-how-tanker-was-attacked/2019/06/14/7ea347d0-8eba-11e9-b6f4-033356502dce_story.html?utm_term=.df5f200cba2a) [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-48633016)
    *   A [U.S.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) official says [Iranian Navy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_Republic_of_Iran_Navy) [gunboats](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seraj) are preventing the damaged Norwegian-owned _Front Altair_ oil tanker from being towed away by two private tugboats in the [Gulf of Oman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gulf_of_Oman). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-attacks-usa-tugboats/iran-fast-boats-preventing-towing-of-damaged-altair-tanker-source-idUSKCN1TF2AP)
    *   [United Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations) Secretary-General [António Guterres](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ant%C3%B3nio_Guterres) calls for an independent investigation to establish the facts and responsibility for the oil tankers attacks in the Gulf of Oman. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-attacks-un/u-n-chief-calls-for-independent-probe-into-gulf-tanker-attacks-idUSKCN1TF24W?il=0)

## Disasters and accidents

*   At least 61 people have been killed and 356,000 evacuated from their homes as heavy rain and floods swept through large parts of southern and central [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China) this week. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/06/china-flood-death-toll-jumps-61-ministry-190614005730068.html)

## International relations

*   [Iran–Japan relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93Japan_relations), [Iran–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93United_States_relations)
    *   [Kyodo News Agency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyodo_News_Agency) reports that during his visit to mediate between the U.S. and Iran, Japanese PM [Shinzō Abe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shinz%C5%8D_Abe) asked Iran to release American prisoners held by Iran, though the response is "unclear" to the press. But Iran says it will not negotiate with the United States, rejecting Abe's bid to broker dialogue between the two countries amid escalating tensions in the Middle East. Iranian Foreign Minister [Javad Zarif](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Javad_Zarif) accuses the "B-Team" ([Mohammed bin Salman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohammed_bin_Salman), [John Bolton](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_R._Bolton) and [Benjamin Netanyahu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benjamin_Netanyahu)) of sabotaging diplomacy, including Abe's meeting, to hide its "economic terrorism" by accusing Iran of [attacking oil tankers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/June_2019_Gulf_of_Oman_incident). [(_The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/japans-abe-asked-iran-to-release-us-hostages-report-says-but-the-response-is-unclear/2019/06/13/43e501e0-8e4e-11e9-b162-8f6f41ec3c04_story.html?noredirect=on&utm_term=.2abd005bad62) [(Kyodo News)](https://english.kyodonews.net/news/2019/06/ad9943adea62-japan-scrambles-for-information-on-ship-attacks-near-strait-of-hormuz.html)
*   [Cyprus—Turkey relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyprus_dispute)
    *   [European Union Mediterranean state](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Southern_Europe) leaders offer full support to fellow EU member [Cyprus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyprus) in its dispute with [Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey) over offshore natural gas deposit ownership. [French President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_French_Republic) [Emmanuel Macron](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emmanuel_Macron), speaking for the EU, urges Turkey to stop “illegal activities” in Cyprus’s [exclusive economic zone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exclusive_economic_zone). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-eu-summit-mediterranean/southern-eu-leaders-back-cyprus-in-gas-dispute-with-turkey-idUSKCN1TF2JG?il=0) [(Reuters²)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-eu-france-macron/frances-macron-sides-with-cyprus-on-dispute-with-turkey-idUSKCN1TF2FO?il=0)

# 2019-06-15

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Yemeni Crisis (2011–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yemeni_Crisis_(2011%E2%80%93present))
    *   [Yemen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yemen)-based [Houthi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Houthi_movement) forces launch drone strikes on [Jizan Regional Airport](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jizan_Regional_Airport) and [Abha International Airport](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abha_International_Airport) in [Saudi Arabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabia). A [Saudi Arabian-led coalition](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabian-led_intervention_in_Yemen) spokesperson says a Houthi drone has been shot down near the Saudi city of [Abha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abha). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-yemen-security-saudi-drone/yemens-houthis-target-two-saudi-airports-with-multiple-drone-attacks-idUSKCN1TG0M3)
*   12 [Kenyan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenya) police officers are killed when their car hits a roadside bomb in east [Wajir County](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wajir_County), near the [Somali](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Somalia) border. The fate of the three other passengers is not known at this time. No one has claimed responsibility, though the police had been pursuing suspected [al-Shabab](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Shabaab_(militant_group)) militants fighting Somalia's government and its backers. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-48648777) [(Region week)](https://regionweek.com/kenya-12-police-officers-killed-in-attack-in-wajir-county-along-the-border-with-somalia/)
*   Twin explosions rock [Mogadishu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mogadishu) killing 11 and injuring over 25. The first bomb went off near a [checkpoint](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Security_checkpoint) for the presidential palace killing nine and the other [bomb](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Car_bomb) killed the two occupants in the [vehicle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vehicle). [Al Shabbab](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al_Shabbab) claimed responsibility. [(Time)](https://time.com/5607825/11-killed-explosions-somalia-mogadishu/) [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/06/somalia-killed-al-shabab-attacks-mogadishu-190615165754730.html)

The hotel owner is charged with the fatalities. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-india-48648769)

*   [2019 South American blackout](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_South_American_blackout)
    *   A massive [blackout](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Power_outage) hits [Argentina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina), [Uruguay](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uruguay), and southern [Brazil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil), leaving millions without power. [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/06/16/world/americas/power-failure-argentina-uruguay.html)

## Law and crime

*   A group of bandits attack a village in the Shinkafi local government area of [Zamfara State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zamfara_State), [Nigeria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nigeria), killing at least 34 civilians. The gunmen arrived on motorcycles and opened fire on civilians indiscriminately, later burning down homes. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-nigeria-security-northwest/armed-gang-kills-at-least-34-in-northwest-nigeria-police-say-idUSKCN1TH0F8)

## International relations

*   [Israel–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel%E2%80%93United_States_relations)
    *   [Israeli Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Israel) [Benjamin Netanyahu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benjamin_Netanyahu) formally unveils [Trump Heights](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trump_Heights), a new settlement in the [Golan Heights](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golan_Heights), named after [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) for his decision to recognise Israeli sovereignty over the [disputed](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Status_of_the_Golan_Heights) territory. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-48656431)
*   [Japan–Mongolia relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan%E2%80%93Mongolia_relations), [Japan–North Korea relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan%E2%80%93North_Korea_relations)
    *   [Foreign Minister of Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foreign_Minister_of_Japan) [Tarō Kōno](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tar%C5%8D_K%C5%8Dno) seeks cooperation from Mongolia over efforts to settle the issue of past abductions of Japanese nationals by North Korea, as Mongolia maintains friendly ties with Pyongyang. Japan has no ties with North Korea and pushes for further sanctions. [(The Japan Times)](https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2019/06/16/national/politics-diplomacy/japan-seeks-cooperation-mongolia-north-korean-abduction-issue-denuclearization/#.XQbFV7xKjcc)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Guatemalan general election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Guatemalan_general_election)
    *   Citizens of [Guatemala](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guatemala) head to the polls to vote for their next [president](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Guatemala) and new members of the country's [congress](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Congress_of_the_Republic_of_Guatemala). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-48621524)
*   [2019 Conservative Party (UK) leadership election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Conservative_Party_(UK)_leadership_election)
    *   The first televised debate between [Conservative Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conservative_Party_(UK)) candidates for [Leader of the Conservative Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leader_of_the_Conservative_Party_(UK)) and [Prime Minister of the United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_the_United_Kingdom) takes place in [London](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London). Frontrunnner [Boris Johnson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boris_Johnson) refuses to attend. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-48654729)
*   [2019 Hong Kong anti-extradition bill protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Hong_Kong_anti-extradition_bill_protests)
    *   The scheduled peaceful mass protest, despite bill suspension yesterday, of nearly 2 million people gather in Victoria Square demanding the legislation be withdrawn. If the organizers numbers are confirmed, this is the largest protest ever. [Hong Kong leader](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chief_Executive_of_Hong_Kong) [Carrie Lam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carrie_Lam) apologizes for proposing the bill. Police say turnout was 338,000 at its peak. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-china-48656471)

# 2019-06-18

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Iran–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93United_States_relations)
    *   In response to accusations by the United States that Iran is responsible for last week's [attacks on two oil tankers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/June_2019_Gulf_of_Oman_incident) in the [Gulf of Oman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gulf_of_Oman), and the subsequent increased U.S. military presence in the region, Iranian President [Hassan Rouhani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hassan_Rouhani) says "Iran will not wage war against any nation". [(CBC)](https://www.cbc.ca/news/world/iran-wont-wage-war-rouhani-1.5179430)
*   41 people have been confirmed to be killed in what the [government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Goverment) has called a terror attack which happened in the [Yoro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoro,_Mali) and Gangafani villages in [Mali](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mali). The attackers, riding motorcycles, targeted primarily [Dogon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dogon_people) villages. Last week there was another attack that [killed 35](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/June_2019_Mali_massacre) [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/06/18/africa/mali-attack-gangafani-yoro-intl/index.html)

## Business and economics

*   [California housing shortage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/California_housing_shortage)
    *   [Google](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Google) announces that it is setting aside $750 million in land and $250 million in financing to encourage developers in the [San Francisco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Francisco) area to build and rehabilitate housing, in order to ease the homeless crisis in a region where Google has 45,000 employees. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-alphabet-investment/google-invests-1-billion-to-ease-housing-shortage-near-california-headquarters-idUSKCN1TJ27I)
*   [Boeing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boeing) sells 200 of its [737 MAX](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boeing_737_MAX) planes to [International Airlines Group](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Airlines_Group), the first sale of the controversial airliners since two fatal crashes and subsequent [worldwide groundings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boeing_737_MAX_groundings) earlier this year. [(CNBC)](https://www.cnbc.com/2019/06/18/british-airways-parent-places-first-new-order-for-boeing-737-max-since-grounding.html)

## International relations

*   [Colombia–Venezuela relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colombia%E2%80%93Venezuela_relations)
    *   Colombian authorities deport Venezuelan refugees in the border town of [Cúcuta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C%C3%BAcuta); in response, the Venezuelan government restricts movement of Colombians into the country. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/06/colombia-deports-undocumented-venezuelans-entering-cucuta-190618123624569.html)

## Law and crime

*   It is reported that [Roberto Marrero](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roberto_Marrero), aide to Venezuela's partially-recognized interim President [Juan Guaidó](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Guaid%C3%B3), who was arrested several months ago, has his preliminary hearing completed, with Judge Carol Padilla denying his right to defense and ordering his incarceration. [(El Universal)](http://www.eluniversal.com/politica/43195/joel-garcia-roberto-marrero-sigue-en-privativa-de-libertad)

## Politics and elections

*   [Corruption in Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corruption_in_Venezuela)
    *   Partially-recognized Interim President of Venezuela [Juan Guaidó](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Guaid%C3%B3) and Venezuelan Ambassador to Colombia [Humberto Calderón Berti](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Humberto_Calder%C3%B3n_Berti) request that the Colombian government investigate two administrators of their own alliance on suspicion of embezzling US$100,000. [(WSJ)](https://www.wsj.com/articles/venezuela-opposition-threatened-by-embezzlement-allegations-11560904989)
*   [Donald Trump 2020 presidential campaign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump_2020_presidential_campaign)
    *   [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump)'s holds a rally in [Orlando](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orlando), [Florida](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Florida) that is billed as the official launch of his re-election campaign for the [2020 United States presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_United_States_presidential_election), although he already filed paperwork for a 2020 presidential campaign with the [Federal Election Commission](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Election_Commission) (FEC) on January 20, 2017. [ction-launch-speech-live-news-today-latest-updates-orlando-florida (_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2019/jun/18/trump-2020-campaign-ele,), [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/06/trump-officially-kick-2020-election-campaign-190618220218310.html), [(_The Atlantic_)](https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2019/06/trump-cant-relaunch-a-campaign-that-never-stopped/591949/)
*   [2019 Conservative Party (UK) leadership election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Conservative_Party_(UK)_leadership_election)
    *   [Boris Johnson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boris_Johnson) again leads after the second Tory MP leadership ballot with 126 ballots, 12 more than in the first round. [Dominic Raab](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dominic_Raab) is eliminated after coming in last with 30 votes, three fewer than the minimum needed to progress. [Jeremy Hunt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeremy_Hunt) (40), [Michael Gove](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Gove) (41), [Sajid Javid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sajid_Javid) (33) and [Rory Stewart](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rory_Stewart) (37) all received enough to advance to tomorrow's third round. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-48680189)
*   [Political appointments by Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Political_appointments_by_Donald_Trump)
    *   [Patrick Shanahan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patrick_M._Shanahan), who has been acting [Secretary of Defense](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Secretary_of_Defense) since January 1, has withdrawn his name from consideration as Secretary "... to devote more time to his family", President Trump said. [Secretary of the Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Secretary_of_the_Army) [Mark Esper](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mark_Esper) will be the acting Secretary of Defense. There are allegations of domestic violence against Mr. Shanahan. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-48665798)

## Armed conflicts and attacks

    *   [Iran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran)'s [Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_Revolutionary_Guard_Corps) shoots down an [American](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) [RQ-4 Global Hawk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northrop_Grumman_RQ-4_Global_Hawk) [spy drone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unmanned_aerial_vehicle) after it allegedly violates Iranian airspace.     *   An anonymous American official says the incident occurred in international airspace, and not over Iranian territory. [(_The Times of Israel_)](https://www.timesofisrael.com/us-official-confirms-iran-shot-down-drone-says-it-was-in-international-airspace/)
    *   [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump), when asked about the strike, says it is "hard to believe it was intentional". He later approves retaliatory military attacks against Iranian missile and radar facilities, but subsequently changes his mind. [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/06/20/politics/trump-iran-drone-downing/index.html) [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-48714414)

    *   [Trump administration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presidency_of_Donald_Trump) officials say that President [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) ordered the [United States Armed Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Armed_Forces) to conduct [military strikes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Military_strike) against targets of the [Armed Forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armed_Forces_of_the_Islamic_Republic_of_Iran) in retaliation for [downing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/June_2019_Iranian_shoot-down_of_American_drone) an American surveillance [drone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unmanned_aerial_vehicle) the day prior, and that he changed his mind hours later and ordered an immediate stop to the operation while American [warplanes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Military_aircraft) were in the air and [warships](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Warship) were in position. [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/06/20/world/middleeast/iran-us-drone.html) [(ABC News)](https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/president-trump-ordered-military-strike-iran-reversed-sources/story?id=63853570)
    *   [Iranian Americans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iranian_American) protest outside the [State Department](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Department_of_State) as tensions increase. [(NBC Washington)](https://www.nbcwashington.com/news/local/USIran-Tensions-Trigger-Protests-in-DC_Washington-DC-511646082.html)
*   [Saudi Arabia–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabia%E2%80%93United_States_relations)

[(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-iran-usa-saudi/trump-talks-to-saudi-crown-prince-on-iran-oil-idUSKCN1TM275)

    *   [Chile](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chile) is extending its offer of "democratic responsibility" visas, allowing Venezuelans to live in the country for up to two years, so that they may be applied for from any Chilean embassy or consulate in the world instead of just in Venezuela. ## Armed conflicts and attacks

    *   The Attorney General of [Ethiopia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethiopia)'s [Amhara Region](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amhara_Region), Migbaru Kebede, dies after having been wounded during the coup attempt two days earlier. Three children are also injured. Her grandson Jalen Plummer is arrested and charged with aggravated murder and felonious assault. [(Cleveland.com)](https://www.cleveland.com/metro/2019/06/man-charged-in-slaying-of-serial-killer-michael-madisons-mother-stabbing-of-three-sleeping-kids-in-cleveland.html)

## Science and technology

*   [Methane on Mars](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Methane_on_Mars)
    *   [NASA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NASA) announces that its _[Curiosity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curiosity_(rover))_ rover has detected the largest ever measurement of [methane](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Methane) on [Mars](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mars). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-48743551)
*   [Soyuz MS-11](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soyuz_MS-11) returned to [Earth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earth), landing in [Kazakhstan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kazakhstan), from the [International Space Station](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Space_Station) carrying [Canadian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canadian) [David Saint-Jacques](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Saint-Jacques), [American](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American) [Anne McClain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anne_McClain), and [Russian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian) [Oleg Kononenko](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oleg_Kononenko). The astronauts and cosmonaut spent 204 days aboard the ISS, a record for [Canada](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canada). [(CBC)](https://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/david-saint-jacques-1.5187999)

[Juul](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juul), the largest producer of e-cigarettes in the United States, which is based in the city, condemns the ban saying the move will drive people back to [tobacco smoking](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tobacco_smoking) and will create a [black market](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_market). *   The [Reserve Bank of Zimbabwe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reserve_Bank_of_Zimbabwe) announces that, effective immediately, foreign currencies such as the [United States dollar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_dollar) or [South African rand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_African_rand) will no longer be legal tender in the country, and that any use of foreign currency within [Zimbabwe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zimbabwe) will be a punishable offense. # 2019-06-26

## Armed conflict and attacks

## International relations

# 2019-06-30

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [War in Afghanistan (2001–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_in_Afghanistan_(2001%E2%80%93present))
    *   Four [humvees](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Humvee) packed with explosives controlled by [suicide bombers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suicide_attack) kill 23, including eight election workers, in the province of [Kandahar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kandahar_Province). The Taliban claimed 57 were killed. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-afghanistan-taliban/fighting-rages-across-afghanistan-as-peace-talks-continue-idUSKCN1TV0AD)
*   [2018–19 Sudanese protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018%E2%80%9319_Sudanese_protests)
    *   Ten people are killed in [Sudan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sudan) during clashes between the [Sudanese military](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sudanese_military) and civilian protesters. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-sudan-politics/tens-of-thousands-demand-civilian-rule-in-sudan-at-least-seven-killed-idUSKCN1TV0IY)
*   Gunmen open fire killing two guards and wounding another for Lebanese minister, Saleh al-Gharib. This attack happened in a mountain village near [Beirut](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beirut), [Lebanon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lebanon). [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/06/gunmen-open-fire-lebanese-minister-convoy-killing-190630164714839.html)
*   At least 23 people are dead and 300 missing after attacks on three [Fulani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fula_people) villages in central [Mali](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mali). Additionally, 12 people are killed when their vehicle drives over a [land mine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Land_mine). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mali-security/attack-on-mali-fulani-village-kills-23-local-mayor-idUSKCN1TW2YT)

## Disasters and accidents

*   Ten people are killed when a [Beechcraft BE-350 King Air](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beechcraft_Super_King_Air#Super_King_Air_300/350) crashes into a hangar at [Addison Airport](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Addison_Airport) in [Addison, Texas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Addison,_Texas). [(NBC News)](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/10-dead-plane-crash-texas-n1025126)

## International relations

*   [2019 North Korea–United States DMZ Summit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_North_Korea%E2%80%93United_States_DMZ_Summit), [North Korea–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Korea%E2%80%93United_States_relations), [South Korea–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korea%E2%80%93United_States_relations), [North Korea–South Korea relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Korea%E2%80%93South_Korea_relations), [2018–19 Korean peace process](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018%E2%80%9319_Korean_peace_process)
    *   [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump), together with [South Korean President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_South_Korea) [Moon Jae-in](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moon_Jae-in), meets [North Korean leader](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_leaders_of_North_Korea) [Kim Jong-un](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kim_Jong-un) at the [Joint Security Area](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joint_Security_Area), becoming the first sitting U.S. president to step foot in North Korea. Trump also invites Kim to the [White House](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White_House) to resume talks about denuclearizing the Korean Peninsula. [(NBC News)](https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/trump-kim-jong-un-meet-dmz-n1025041) [(Business Insider)](https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-shakes-hands-with-kim-jong-un-and-invites-him-to-the-white-house-2019-6) [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/politics/live-news/trump-dmz-kim-live-intl-hnk/h_7c89c85737f16f7da758bcc1319c8b87)

## Law and crime

*   In the second similar case within a week, police in [Toyonaka](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toyonaka), [Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan), arrest Ryotaro Taniguchi for keeping the body of his deceased mother a year after her death. He is quoted as saying he didn't want to pay for the funeral. Police are investigating whether or not Taniguchi continued to receive his mother's pension. [(_Japan Today_)](https://japantoday.com/category/crime/man-arrested-for-keeping-mother%E2%80%99s-body-in-apartment-for-a-year) [(_The Japan Times_)](https://japantoday.com/category/crime/man-admits-not-reporting-father%E2%80%99s-death-for-months-in-order-to-keep-collecting-pension)

In the messages, Judge Moro illegally advises the prosecutors in including pieces of evidence against defendants of cases presided by him and suggests dates for [Federal Police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Police_of_Brazil) operations. The messages also suggest that Moro withheld evidence to prevent cases being transferred out of his jurisdiction to the [Supreme Federal Court](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supreme_Federal_Court).     *   Iran announces plans to begin enriching uranium beyond the limit set in its 2015 nuclear deal, with world powers pressing Europe to salvage the accord after the United States [withdrew from it](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_withdrawal_from_the_Joint_Comprehensive_Plan_of_Action) last year. ## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Greek legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Greek_legislative_election)
    *   Citizens of [Greece](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greece) go to the polls to vote for the next members of the [Hellenic Parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hellenic_Parliament). [(BBC News)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-48897925)
    *   Leader of the Opposition [Kyriakos Mitsotakis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyriakos_Mitsotakis), from [New Democracy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Democracy_(Greece)), wins an absolute majority and is expected to be sworn in [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Greece) as incumbent [Alexis Tsipras](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Tsipras) falls to second place. Far-right [Golden Dawn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golden_Dawn_(political_party)) loses all the seats they had in the Parliament. [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/07/world/europe/greek-elections-results.html)
*   [Operation Car Wash](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Car_Wash), [Foreign relations of Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foreign_relations_of_Venezuela), [Foreign relations of Brazil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foreign_relations_of_Brazil)
    *   New leaked messages between Brazilian judge [Sérgio Moro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S%C3%A9rgio_Moro) and prosecutors of Operation Car Wash show that Moro suggested they leak confidential information concerning [Odebrecht](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Odebrecht)'s activities in [Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venezuela) to members of the Venezuelan opposition. Some prosecutors even entertained the possibility of provoking a civil war in Venezuela over the leaks. [(_The Intercept Brasil_)](https://theintercept.com/2019/07/07/lava-jato-vazamento-delacao-venezuela/)

Golden Boot winner [Megan Rapinoe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Megan_Rapinoe) scored on a penalty kick, followed by [Rose Lavelle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rose_Lavelle)'s strike in the 69th minute.     *   Hosts [Brazil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team) defeat [Peru](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peru_national_football_team) 3–1 in the [final match](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica_Final) of the Copa América at the [Estádio do Maracanã](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Est%C3%A1dio_do_Maracan%C3%A3) in [Rio de Janeiro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rio_de_Janeiro). [(_The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/sports/2019/07/07/mexico-vs-usa-gold-cup-final/)
*   [FIBA Women's EuroBasket 2019](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIBA_Women%27s_EuroBasket_2019)
    *   [Spain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spain_women%27s_national_basketball_team) wins its fourth title of the Eurobasket competition after defeating [France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France_women%27s_national_basketball_team) in the final match. [(_El Mundo_)](https://www.elmundo.es/deportes/baloncesto/2019/07/07/5d2257f6fc6c83df078b4691.html)

# 2019-07-08

## Business and economics

*   [Deutsche Bank](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deutsche_Bank) announces lay-offs – roughly 18,000 job cuts – around the globe as part of a "reinvention", scrapping its global equities and cutting its [fixed income](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fixed_income) operations. [(Deutsche Bank)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-deutsche-bank-strategy/axe-falls-on-18000-deutsche-bank-jobs-in-8-3-billion-reinvention-idUSKCN1U309P) [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/08/business/dealbook/deutsche-bank.html)

## Disasters and accidents

*   Flash flooding in [Washington, D.C.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Washington,_D.C.) delivers a month's worth of rain on the local area in the span of an hour. The torrential rain leaves commuters stranded on car rooftops, floods several metro stations and causes flooding in the [White House](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White_House). [(cnet)](https://www.cnet.com/news/drain-the-swamp-scary-dc-flooding-spreads-to-the-white-house/)

## International relations

*   [African Continental Free Trade Agreement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/African_Continental_Free_Trade_Agreement)
    *   African leaders agree on a continent-wide [free trade zone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Free_trade_zone), which encompasses all [African nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/African_Union) except for [Eritrea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eritrea) and [Somaliland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Somaliland). The various European territories located in Africa are also excluded. It will be the largest [free trade zone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Free_trade_zone) since the creation of the [World Trade Organization](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Trade_Organization). [(DW)](https://www.dw.com/en/african-leaders-launch-landmark-55-nation-trade-zone/a-49503393)

## Law and crime

*   The [International Criminal Court](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Criminal_Court) declares [Bosco Ntaganda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bosco_Ntaganda) guilty of having committed [war crimes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_crime) during the [Ituri conflict](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ituri_conflict) in the [Democratic Republic of the Congo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democratic_Republic_of_the_Congo). [(DW)](https://www.dw.com/en/icc-convicts-congo-warlord-bosco-ntaganda-of-war-crimes-including-rape-and-murder/a-49508655)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Greek legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Greek_legislative_election)
    *   Winner of the general election [Kyriakos Mitsotakis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyriakos_Mitsotakis) is sworn in as the new [Prime Minister of Greece](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Greece), succeeding [Alexis Tsipras](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Tsipras). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-greece-election-oath/greek-conservative-mitsotakis-sworn-in-as-prime-minister-idUSKCN1U312Y)
*   [Tax returns of Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tax_returns_of_Donald_Trump)
    *   [New York Governor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Governor_of_New_York) [Andrew Cuomo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andrew_Cuomo) signs a bill that will allow [congressional committees](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Congress) to access [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump)'s state tax returns. [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/08/nyregion/trump-ny-taxes-cuomo.html)

    *   [New Zealand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Zealand_national_cricket_team) defeats [India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/India_national_cricket_team) in the first semi-final of the [Cricket World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Cricket_World_Cup). [(_The Independent_)](https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/cricket/india-vs-new-zealand-world-cup-result-final-score-latest-news-update-a8998956.html)

The [United States women's national soccer team](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_women%27s_national_soccer_team) wins the [Outstanding Team Award](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Outstanding_Team_ESPY_Award) for their [2019 FIFA Women's World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_FIFA_Women%27s_World_Cup) victory, [Giannis Antetokounmpo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Giannis_Antetokounmpo) wins the [Best Male Athlete Award](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Best_Male_Athlete_ESPY_Award), [Alex Morgan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alex_Morgan) wins the [Best Female Athlete Award](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Best_Female_Athlete_ESPY_Award), and [Saquon Barkley](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saquon_Barkley) wins the [Breakthrough Athlete of the Year Award](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Best_Breakthrough_Athlete_ESPY_Award). [(ESPN)](https://www.espn.com/espn/story/_/id/27164007/uswnt-morgan-take-home-top-honors-espys)

# 2019-07-11

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Libyan Civil War (2014–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libyan_Civil_War_(2014%E2%80%93present))
    *   Four people are killed and over 30 injured in a [car bomb](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Car_bomb) attack at a funeral for a senior [Libyan National Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libyan_National_Army) commander in [Benghazi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benghazi). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-libya-security/four-killed-as-car-bomb-targets-funeral-in-libyas-benghazi-sources-idUSKCN1U61QW?il=0)
*   [Syrian Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Civil_War)
    *   A car bomb detonated in a Turkey-backed rebel city, [Afrin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afrin,_Syria), near the entrance, killing 11 and injuring over 30 badly. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-syria-security-blast/blast-kills-11-wounds-many-in-syrias-rebel-held-afrin-idUSKCN1U610A)
    *   Another car bomb detonated in the city of [Qamishli](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qamishli) near a church, injuring 11. The [Islamic State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_State_of_Iraq_and_the_Levant) claimed responsibility. [(Rudaw)](https://www.rudaw.net/english/middleeast/syria/11072019)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [Tropical Storm Barry (2019)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tropical_Storm_Barry_(2019))
    *   [Louisiana Governor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Governor_of_Louisiana) [John Bel Edwards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Bel_Edwards) declares a [state of emergency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/State_of_emergency) as [Tropical Storm Barry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tropical_Storm_Barry_(2019)) makes unprecedented levels of [rainfall](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rainfall) on [Louisiana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louisiana), [Mississippi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mississippi), [Alabama](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alabama) and the western [Florida Panhandle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Florida_Panhandle). [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/07/11/weather/tropical-flooding-thursday-wxc-trnd/index.html) [(CNN²)](https://www.cnn.com/us/live-news/gulf-of-mexico-storm-july-11-2019/index.html)
*   Seven people, including six foreign tourists, are killed and 100 others injured during a violent storm that swept across [Thessaloniki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thessaloniki), [Greece](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greece). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-48945821)

## Law and crime

*   British right-wing activist [Tommy Robinson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tommy_Robinson_(activist)) is sentenced to nine months in prison for [contempt of court](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Contempt_of_court) — minus time served equals about another 10 weeks in prison. Supporters attacked police and journalists following the court proceedings. Police say no new arrests were made. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-48950672)
*   American rapper [R. Kelly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/R._Kelly) is arrested in [Chicago](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicago) on federal sex crime charges. [(NBC News)](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/amp/ncna1029126)

## Science and technology

*   [JAXA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JAXA)'s _[Hayabusa2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hayabusa2)_ space probe makes its second successful and final landing on [Apollo asteroid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_asteroid) [162173 Ryugu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/162173_Ryugu). [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/science/2019/jul/11/falcon-has-landed-japans-hayabusa2-probe-touches-down-on-asteroid)

# 2019-07-12

## Armed conflict and attacks

*   [Asasey hotel attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asasey_hotel_attack)
    *   A [car bomb](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Car_bomb) and a [gun attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shooting) kill at least 26, including two prominent journalists and nine foreigners, in [Kismayo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kismayo), [Somalia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Somalia). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-48969781)
*   [War in Afghanistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_in_Afghanistan_(2001%E2%80%93present))
    *   A suicide bomber kills nine people and injures 40 others at a wedding in the [Nangarhar Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nangarhar_Province) in [Afghanistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghanistan). The bomber is believed to be a minor. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-48960149) [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-afghanistan-attack/suicide-bomber-kills-five-at-wedding-party-in-eastern-afghanistan-idUSKCN1U70KL)

## International relations

*   [Russia–Turkey relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia%E2%80%93Turkey_relations)
    *   [Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey) receives its first shipment of the [S-400 missile system](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S-400_missile_system) from [Russia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia), defying [U.S.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) and [NATO](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NATO) calls to cancel the deal. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-48962885)

## Politics and elections

*   [U.S. Secretary of Labor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Secretary_of_Labor) [Alexander Acosta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexander_Acosta) announces his resignation from office amid growing public criticism over his past role in securing a 2008 plea deal for former financier [Jeffrey Epstein](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeffrey_Epstein), after Epstein was arrested and charged with [sex trafficking](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sex_trafficking) of minors. He is to be replaced by Acting Secretary [Patrick Pizzella](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patrick_Pizzella) effective July 19. [(NBC News)](https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/white-house/trump-s-labor-secretary-alex-acosta-resigns-after-criticism-over-n1029226)
