# 2019-07-13

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [War in Afghanistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_in_Afghanistan_(2001%E2%80%93present))
    *   [Taliban](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taliban) gunmen storm a hotel in [Badghis Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Badghis_Province), killing four [soldiers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghan_Armed_Forces) and two civilians. Three of the five gunmen are killed and two are arrested. [(RFE/RadioLiberty)](https://www.rferl.org/a/taliban-attack-hotel-badghis-province-qal-e-naw-afghanistan/30054035.html)
    *   A [U.S. soldier](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Armed_Forces) is also killed in a separate bombing in [Wardak Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maidan_Wardak_Province). [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/07/afghan-forces-service-member-killed-taliban-attacks-190713162234523.html)
*   [Terrorism in the United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terrorism_in_the_United_States)
    *   A gunman attempts to attack an immigration detention center in [Tacoma, Washington](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tacoma,_Washington), but four policemen shoot him dead. The gunman was armed with a rifle and [incendiary devices](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Incendiary_device). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-48978394)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [Manhattan blackout](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manhattan_blackout_of_July_2019)
    *   A blackout in New York City affects 42,000 people near [Times Square](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Times_Square). [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/07/13/us/new-york-power-outages/index.html)
*   [Monsoon of South Asia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monsoon_of_South_Asia)
    *   Three days of heavy rain in [Nepal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nepal) trigger floods and landslides resulting in at least 43 deaths. [India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/India) was also affected by heavy floods, resulting in the death of 10 people. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-48979668)
*   [Tropical Storm Barry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hurricane_Barry_(2019)) increases to 121 kilometers per hour (75 miles per hour), becoming the first hurricane of the [2019 Atlantic hurricane season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Atlantic_hurricane_season).

## Sports

*   [2019 Wimbledon Championships](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Wimbledon_Championships_%E2%80%93_Women%27s_Singles)
    *   [Simona Halep](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simona_Halep) defeats [Serena Williams](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serena_Williams) (6–2, 6–2) to win the 2019 Wimbledon women's singles championship, her first Wimbledon victory and her second [Grand Slam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_Slam_(tennis)) singles title. Williams was attempting to equal [Margaret Court](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Margaret_Court)'s all-time record of 24 Grand Slam singles titles. [(The Guardian)](https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2019/jul/13/simona-halep-stuns-serena-williams-to-win-first-wimbledon-title)

# 2019-07-14

## Disasters and accidents

*   A [GippsAero GA8 Airvan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GippsAero_GA8_Airvan) [sky diving](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sky_diving) operation plane crashes on an island outside [Umeå](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ume%C3%A5), [Sweden](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sweden), killing all nine people onboard. ## International relations

*   [Argentina–Brazil relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina%E2%80%93Brazil_relations)
    *   [Brazilian President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Brazil) [Jair Bolsonaro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jair_Bolsonaro) renews his support for the [re-election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Argentine_general_election) of [Argentine President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Argentina) [Mauricio Macri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mauricio_Macri). "We're brothers, and I want prosperity for our nations", he concludes in an interview. ## Science and technology

*   The [European Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Union)'s [Galileo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Galileo_(satellite_navigation)) [satellite navigation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Satellite_navigation) system suffers a major outage due to a "technical incident related to its ground infrastructure", taking all active Galileo satellites offline. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-48985399)

## Sports

*   [2019 Wimbledon Championships](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Wimbledon_Championships)
    *   In the [men's singles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Wimbledon_Championships_%E2%80%93_Men%27s_Singles) final match, Serbian [Novak Djokovic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Novak_Djokovic) beats Swiss [Roger Federer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roger_Federer) in five sets for his 16th [Grand Slam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_Slam_(tennis)) [title win](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Grand_Slam_related_tennis_records) in a match that lasted four hours and 56 minutes. It was the [longest Wimbledon final of all time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All-time_tennis_records_%E2%80%93_men%27s_singles), and also the first men's singles final in any of the four Grand Slam events that went to a fifth-set tiebreaker. [(Wimbledon)](https://www.wimbledon.com/en_GB/news/articles/2019-07-14/djokovic_completes_hattrick_of_final_wins_against_federer.html) [(ESPN)](https://www.espn.com/tennis/story/_/id/27189215/djokovic-tops-federer-epic-wimbledon-final)
*   [2019 Cricket World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Cricket_World_Cup)
    *   [England](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/England_cricket_team) beats [New Zealand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Zealand_national_cricket_team) in the [2019 Cricket World Cup Final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Cricket_World_Cup_Final) on total [boundaries](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boundary_(cricket)#Scoring_runs) after both regulation play and a [super over](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Super_over) end in a tie. [(ESPN)](https://www.espn.com/cricket/series/8039/game/1144530/england-vs-new-zealand-final-icc-cricket-world-cup-2019.html)

# 2019-07-16

## Business and economy

*   Nate Sutton, associate general counsel of [Amazon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amazon_(company)), in testimony before a committee of the [U.S. Senate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._Senate), denies that the company uses individual data to compete unfairly with smaller sellers using its third-party platform. [(Seeking Alpha)](https://seekingalpha.com/news/3478264-amazon-refutes-congressional-antitrust-concern?dr=1#email_link)

## Law and crime

*   [Odebrecht case](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Odebrecht#Legal_problems)
    *   Former [President of Peru](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Peru) [Alejandro Toledo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alejandro_Toledo) is arrested in the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) following an extradition request. [(_US News_)](https://www.usnews.com/news/best-states/california/articles/2019-07-16/peru-says-former-president-alejandro-toledo-arrested-in-us)
*   American popular musician [R. Kelly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/R._Kelly) pleads not guilty to federal sex-assault charges and is denied bail. [(NBC News)](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/r-kelly-pleads-not-guilty-denied-bail-sweeping-sex-crime-n1030441)

## Politics and elections

*   The [European Parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Parliament) elects [Ursula von der Leyen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ursula_von_der_Leyen) of [Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany) as the new [President of the European Commission](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_European_Commission). Succeeding [Jean-Claude Juncker](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jean-Claude_Juncker), she will be sworn in on 1 November 2019. She is the first woman to be elected to this office in EU history. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-49010801)
*   [Christine Lagarde](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christine_Lagarde) announces that she will step down as managing director of the [International Monetary Fund](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Monetary_Fund). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/amp/business-49009226)
*   [Puerto Rico Governor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Governor_of_Puerto_Rico) [Ricardo Rosselló](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ricardo_Rossell%C3%B3) says that he will remain in office despite protests. [(CBS News)](https://www.cbsnews.com/amp/news/puerto-rico-governor-ricardo-rossello-defies-calls-to-resign-despite-escalating-protests/)

# 2019-07-17

## Disasters and accidents

*   [2018–19 Kivu Ebola epidemic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018%E2%80%9319_Kivu_Ebola_epidemic)
    *   The [World Health Organisation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Health_Organisation) declares the most recent [Ebola](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ebola) outbreak in the eastern [Democratic Republic of the Congo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democratic_Republic_of_the_Congo) a [Public Health Emergency of International Concern](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Public_Health_Emergency_of_International_Concern). [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/jul/17/drc-ebola-epidemic-is-international-emergency-says-who)
*   A national emergency is declared in the [Philippines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines) after more than 100,000 people contract [dengue fever](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dengue_fever). [(Fox News)](https://www.foxnews.com/world/philippines-national-emergency-dengue-fever)

## International relations

*   The [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) removes [NATO](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NATO) [ally](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey%E2%80%93United_States_relations) [Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey) from the [Joint Strike Fighter program](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joint_Strike_Fighter_program), following the country's acquisition of the [Russian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia) [S-400 missile system](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S-400_missile_system). Turkey had planned to buy 100 [F-35 Lightning II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lockheed_Martin_F-35_Lightning_II) jets. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-49023115)

## Law and crime

*   [AMIA bombing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AMIA_bombing)
    *   At request of Israel and the United States, Argentina [officially declares](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_designated_terrorist_groups) [Hezbollah](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hezbollah) a terrorist organization, freezing assets and expelling all members of the organization from the country. It also holds it responsible for the [1994 attack against AMIA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AMIA_bombing). [(_Clarín_)](https://www.clarin.com/politica/gobierno-oficializa-decreto-hezbollah-considerado-grupo-terrorista-argentina_0_eWTtCRypT.html) [(_Perfil_)](https://www.perfil.com/noticias/politica/amia-aumentan-indemnizaciones-declaran-terroristas-hezbollah-habra-duelo-nacional-2019.phtml) [(TN)](https://tn.com.ar/politica/el-gobierno-incluye-hezbollah-en-la-lista-de-organizaciones-terroristas_979023)
*   Mexican drug lord [Joaquín "El Chapo" Guzmán](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joaqu%C3%ADn_%22El_Chapo%22_Guzm%C3%A1n) is sentenced to life in prison plus thirty years, and is ordered to forfeit US$12.6 billion. He accused the U.S. government of "torture and corruption" during his sentencing hearing in the U.S. District Court in Brooklyn, New York. He will likely be sent to [ADX Florence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ADX_Florence) in Colorado to serve his sentence. [(CNBC)](https://www.cnbc.com/2019/07/17/drug-kingpin-el-chapo-sentenced-to-life-in-prison.html)
*   Pakistan arrests [Hafiz Saeed](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hafiz_Saeed), the founder of [Lashkar-e-Taiba](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lashkar-e-Taiba), which has been blamed by the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) and [India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/India) for the [2008 Mumbai terror attacks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2008_Mumbai_attacks) that left more than 160 people dead. [(CBS News)](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/pakistan-arrest-hafiz-saeed-terror-suspect-lashkar-e-taiba-imran-khan-meeting-donald-trump-washington-2019-07-17/)
*   A shooting in [Erbil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erbil), [Iraqi Kurdistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraqi_Kurdistan), leaves two dead, including a [Turkish](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey) diplomat. [(DW)](https://www.dw.com/en/turkish-diplomat-killed-in-iraqs-kurdish-capital-irbil/a-49619981)

## Politics and elections

*   [President-elect of the European Commission](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_European_Commission) [Ursula von der Leyen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ursula_von_der_Leyen) resigns from her position as [Federal Minister of Defence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Ministry_of_Defence_(Germany)) of [Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany). Chancellor [Angela Merkel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Angela_Merkel) appoints [Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annegret_Kramp-Karrenbauer), the leader of the ruling [CDU](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CDU_(Germany)), as her successor. [(_Deutsche Welle_)](https://www.dw.com/en/leader-of-merkels-cdu-annegret-kramp-karrenbauer-to-become-german-defense-ministah/a-49613916-0)
*   [2018–19 Sudanese protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018%E2%80%9319_Sudanese_protests)
    *   Representatives of [Sudan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sudan)'s [military](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sudanese_military) and the civil opposition sign the first of two parts of a power-sharing deal which is supposed to last until free elections in 2022. [(DW)](https://www.dw.com/en/sudans-military-and-opposition-sign-first-part-of-power-sharing-deal/a-49615502)
*   [Efforts to impeach Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Efforts_to_impeach_Donald_Trump)
    *   The [U.S. House of Representatives](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_House_of_Representatives) votes 332–95 to table an [impeachment](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Impeachment_in_the_United_States) measure against [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump). [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2019/07/17/politics/trump-impeachment-house-vote/index.html)
*   During a [campaign rally](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump_2020_presidential_campaign), [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) calls out the ["Squad" members](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Squad_(United_States_Congress)) saying that they "hate our country". ## Science and technology

*   Astronomers rule out the chances of ~30-meter asteroid [2006 QV89](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2006_QV89)'s impacting Earth in September 2019 by eliminating the possibility of its passing through an area where it would have to be if it were on an impacting orbit. Prior to this, the asteroid had been given a one-in-7,000 chance of impacting Earth. [(phys.org)](https://phys.org/news/2019-07-esa-asteroid-earth.html)

*   [2019 Hong Kong anti-extradition bill protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Hong_Kong_anti-extradition_bill_protests)
    *   A mob of suspected masked [triad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Triad_(organized_crime)) members dressed in white and armed with batons attack commuters at [Yuen Long station](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuen_Long_station), injuring 45, including a pro-democracy legislator and a pregnant woman. [Hong Kong police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hong_Kong_Police_Force) have been accused of allowing the violence to happen due to their refusal to detain any of the assailants and decision to limit emergency services in the area.     *   [Pro-Beijing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pro-Beijing_camp_(Hong_Kong)) legislator [Junius Ho](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Junius_Ho) applauds the assailants for their actions, saying they should be "pardoned for defending their homes" and calling them his "heroes". [(HKFP)](https://www.hongkongfp.com/2019/07/22/just-chaos-bloodshed-hong-kong-district-hundreds-masked-men-assault-protesters-journalists-residents/) [(SCMP)](https://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/politics/article/3019621/pro-beijing-lawmaker-junius-ho-defends-white-clad-mob)

One of the suspects has been killed after engaging with the police, while another is still at large. [(SF Chronicle)](https://www.sfchronicle.com/crime/article/Multiple-people-hurt-in-shooting-at-Gilroy-Garlic-14191974.php) [(CBS News)](https://www.cbsnews.com/live-news/shooting-gilroy-garlic-festival-san-francisco-bay-area-live-updates-today-2019-07-28/)

[(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/jul/28/hong-kong-protest-take-democracy-struggle-uk-politicians)

## Sports

[(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/sport/cycling/49145747)

    *   [President of the United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) announces in a tweet that the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) will impose import tariffs of 10% on [US$](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/US$)300 billion worth of [Chinese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China) exports starting September 1. [(CNBC)](https://www.cnbc.com/amp/2019/08/01/trump-says-us-will-impose-10percent-tariffs-on-300-billion-of-chinese-goods-starting-september-1.html)

## Disasters and accidents

*   The town of [Whaley Bridge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whaley_Bridge) in [Derbyshire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Derbyshire), England, is evacuated after heavy rain and flooding causes structural damage to the nearby dam at the [Toddbrook Reservoir](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toddbrook_Reservoir) amid fears the dam could collapse. A severe flood warning has been issued for communities situated along the [River Goyt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/River_Goyt). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-derbyshire-49189955)

## International relations

*   [2019 Venezuelan presidential crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Venezuelan_presidential_crisis)
    *   U.S. Commerce Secretary [Wilbur Ross](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wilbur_Ross) says that the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) has "a blueprint" to recover Venezuela's economy if [Nicolás Maduro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicol%C3%A1s_Maduro) leaves office as the nation's disputed [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Venezuela). [(Wall Street Journal)](https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-details-plan-to-rebuild-venezuela-under-democratic-rule-11564667567)
    *   [U.S President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S_President) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) says that he is considering a [blockade](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blockade) of [Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venezuela) as the U.S increases pressure on President Maduro to step down.[(Reuters)](https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-venezuela-politics-trump-idUKKCN1UR5Q9)

## Science and technology

*   [List of nearest exoplanets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_nearest_exoplanets)
    *   Astronomers from the [Max Planck Institute for Astronomy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Max_Planck_Institute_for_Astronomy) announce the discovery of [red dwarf](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_dwarf) star [GJ 357](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GJ_357) and its three confirmed [exoplanets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exoplanet) in the [Hydra constellation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydra_(constellation)), one of which (GJ 357 d) is highly likely to be a [super-Earth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Super-Earth) planet located in the system's [circumstellar habitable zone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Circumstellar_habitable_zone) where life can exist. The discovery was made using [NASA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NASA)'s [Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transiting_Exoplanet_Survey_Satellite) (TESS). [(_The Independent_)](https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/gadgets-and-tech/news/nasa-exoplanet-alien-life-tess-discovery-planet-world-a9034736.html)

# 2019-08-02

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Yemeni Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yemeni_Civil_War_(2015%E2%80%93present)), [Al-Qaeda insurgency in Yemen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Qaeda_insurgency_in_Yemen)
    *   At least 19 [Yemeni soldiers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republic_of_Yemen_Armed_Forces) are killed by an [Al-Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Qaeda_in_the_Arabian_Peninsula) attack on a [military camp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Military_camp) in [Abyan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abyan), [Yemen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yemen). [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/08/al-qaeda-launches-deadly-attack-army-base-southern-yemen-190802081549242.html)
*   [2019 Bangkok bombings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Bangkok_bombings)
    *   Multiple bomb blasts hit [Bangkok](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bangkok), [Thailand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thailand), as [United States Secretary of State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Secretary_of_State) [Mike Pompeo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mike_Pompeo) attends a regional security summit. At least four people are injured. [(DW)](https://www.dw.com/en/thailand-multiple-bomb-blasts-hit-bangkok/a-49859694)

## International relations

*   [Russia–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia%E2%80%93United_States_relations)
    *   The [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) formally withdraws from the [Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intermediate-Range_Nuclear_Forces_Treaty) with [Russia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia). [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2019/08/02/politics/nuclear-treaty-inf-us-withdraws-russia/index.html)

## Law and crime

*   [2019 Zagreb shooting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Zagreb_shooting)
    *   A gunman opens fire in the home of his ex-wife in [Zagreb](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zagreb), [Croatia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Croatia), killing six, including a ten-year-old child. He later committed suicide after a manhunt. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-croatia-shooting-idUSKCN1US1FA)
*   [Women's rights in Saudi Arabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Women%27s_rights_in_Saudi_Arabia)
    *   [Saudi Arabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabia) grants women the right to travel without permission from [a male guardian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Women%27s_rights_in_Saudi_Arabia#Male_guardians), and expands their marriage and custodial rights in a series of royal decrees. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-saudi-women/saudi-arabia-lifts-travel-restrictions-on-women-grants-them-greater-control-idUSKCN1UR5TB?il=0)
*   [Capital punishment in Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capital_punishment_in_Japan)
    *   Japan carries out the first executions this year, [hanging](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hanging) Koichi Shoji, 64, who killed two women in 2001, and [serial killer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serial_killer) Yasunori Suzuki, 50, who killed three women between 2004 and 2005 in [Fukuoka Prefecture](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fukuoka_Prefecture). [(Kyodo News)](https://english.kyodonews.net/news/2019/08/78df0b0b5344-breaking-news-japan-executes-2-death-row-inmates-fri-morning.html)

## Politics and elections

*   [UK House of Commons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UK_House_of_Commons): [2019 Brecon and Radnorshire by-election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Brecon_and_Radnorshire_by-election)
    *   The [Liberal Democrats](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liberal_Democrats_(UK)) gain the [Brecon and Radnorshire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brecon_and_Radnorshire_(UK_Parliament_constituency)) seat from the [Conservatives](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conservative_Party_(UK)). This marks the first time a seat has changed hands in a by-election triggered by a successful [recall petition](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Recall_of_MPs_Act_2015). The working majority of the [Conservative government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Johnson_ministry) is reduced to one. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2019/aug/02/brecon-radnorshire-byelection-lib-dems-jane-dodds-win-cuts-johnson-commons-majority-to-one)
*   [Political appointments by Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Political_appointments_by_Donald_Trump)
    *   President Trump announces he will not nominate Representative [John Ratcliffe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Ratcliffe_(American_politician)) to replace Dan Coats as [Director of National Intelligence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Director_of_National_Intelligence) when he resigns on August 15, and plans to block Principal Deputy Director of National Intelligence [Sue Gordon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Susan_M._Gordon) from serving as acting director. [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/08/02/us/politics/trump-ratcliffe-dni.html?module=inline) [(_The New York Times_²)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/08/02/us/politics/john-ratcliffe-sue-gordon.html?login=email&auth=login-email)
*   [Romanian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romania) [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Romania) [Viorica Dăncilă](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viorica_D%C4%83ncil%C4%83) sacks [Minister of Education](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ministry_of_National_Education_(Romania)) [Ecaterina Andronescu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecaterina_Andronescu) for her controversial comments in a [television](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Television) interview about murdered 15-year-old girl Alexandra Macesanu, saying she was "taught not to get in cars with strangers". A 65-year-old man has since admitted killing Alexandra Macesanu and another teenage girl who has been missing since April. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-49210168)
*   [Deforestation in Brazil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deforestation_in_Brazil)
    *   [Brazil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil)'s [National Space Research Institute](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Institute_for_Space_Research) Director-General [Ricardo Galvão](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ricardo_Galv%C3%A3o) is dismissed from office as a result of the release of data showing a rise in Amazon [deforestation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deforestation_in_Brazil). President [Jair Bolsonaro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jair_Bolsonaro) has called the release of the data "irresponsible and sensationalist". [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-49212115) [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/aug/02/brazil-space-institute-director-sacked-in-amazon-deforestation-row)

## Sports

*   [Argentine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina) footballer [Lionel Messi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi) is suspended from his [national team](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team) for three months and fined US$50,000 for criticizing the [South American Football Confederation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CONMEBOL). [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/08/02/sports/soccer/lionel-messi-conmebol.html)

# 2019-08-03

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [2019 El Paso shooting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_El_Paso_shooting)
    *   At least 20 people are killed and 26 others injured in a [mass shooting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mass_shooting) at a [Walmart](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walmart) in [El Paso](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/El_Paso), [Texas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Texas). A suspect, Patrick Crusius of [Allen, Texas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allen,_Texas), is in custody. Prior to the shooting, Crusius released a [manifesto](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manifesto) online titled _The Inconvenient Truth_, in which he cited a "[Hispanic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hispanic_and_Latino_Americans) invasion of Texas" and "[simply defending my country from ethnic and cultural replacement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Great_Replacement)" as motives for the attack. The case is being investigated as [domestic terrorism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Domestic_terrorism_in_the_United_States). [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/us/live-news/el-paso-tx-shooting-live-updates/index.html)
*   [Indian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/India) authorities issue evacuation orders for thousands of people, including tourists and [Hindu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hindus) [pilgrims](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pilgrim) heading to the [Amarnath Temple](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amarnath_Temple) for [yatra](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yatra) (which has been cancelled) to immediately leave [Jammu and Kashmir](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jammu_and_Kashmir) because of security alerts about possible militant attacks. Also, the pilgrimage to [Machel Mata](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Machel_Mata) for yatra, which also began on 1 July, has been suspended. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-india-49222571) [(CNN-News18)](https://www.news18.com/news/india/dont-panic-jammu-kashmir-governor-tells-political-parties-as-tourists-and-pilgrims-leave-valley-2256657.html)

## International relations

*   [Argentina–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina%E2%80%93United_States_relations)
    *   [President of Argentina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Argentina) [Mauricio Macri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mauricio_Macri) receives the [United States Secretary of Commerce](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Secretary_of_Commerce) [Wilbur Ross](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wilbur_Ross), who expresses full support from the U.S. for his re-election. [(La Nación)](https://www.lanacion.com.ar/politica/sin-titulo-nid2273928)

## Politics and elections

*   [2018–19 Sudanese protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018%E2%80%9319_Sudanese_protests), [2019 Sudanese transition to democracy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Sudanese_transition_to_democracy)
    *   The [African Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/African_Union) announces the [Sudanese military council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transitional_Military_Council_(2019)) and the opposition agreed to a constitutional declaration that will pave the way to a new transitional government. It calls for the new government to be headed by six civilians and five generals, and formally places the [Rapid Support Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rapid_Support_Forces) under military command. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-49213901)
*   Several hundred people are detained by [Russian police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Police_of_Russia) at unauthorized protests in Moscow. The protests occurred because several opposition candidates were disqualified from running in the upcoming [Moscow City legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Moscow_City_Duma_election). [(RT)](https://www.rt.com/russia/465731-moscow-unsanctioned-protest-opposition/)

## Sports

*   [X Games Minneapolis 2019](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X_Games)
    *   [Mitchie Brusco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mitchie_Brusco) becomes the first [skateboarder](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skateboarder) in history to complete a 1260° (3½-revolution [aerial spin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aerials_(skateboarding))) in competition. [(CBS Sports)](https://www.cbssports.com/general/news/watch-american-mitchie-brusco-lands-first-ever-1260-in-skateboarding-at-x-games/)

# 2019-08-04

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [2019 Cairo bombing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Cairo_bombing)
    *   A car drives into three other cars causing an explosive crash outside the [National Cancer Institute Egypt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Cancer_Institute_Egypt) campus in central [Cairo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cairo), killing 20 people and injuring 47 others. The Interior Ministry says that the car that hit the others contained explosives and was to be used in a terrorist operation. The driver fled the scene before the explosion. The minister accuses the [Islamist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamism) [Hasm Movement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hasm_Movement) of being behind the attack. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-egypt-security-blast/seventeen-dead-in-car-explosion-in-central-cairo-health-ministry-idUSKCN1UV00G?il=0)

## International relations

*   [2019 Persian Gulf crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Persian_Gulf_crisis), [Iran–Iraq relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93Iraq_relations)
    *   [Iran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran) seizes a foreign tanker, reported to be [Iraqi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq), in the [Persian Gulf](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Persian_Gulf), according to Iranian state media. The Iranians accuse the tanker of "smuggling fuel for some [Arab countries](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arab_states_of_the_Persian_Gulf)". [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-49225916)

## Law and crime

*   [2019 Dayton shooting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Dayton_shooting)
    *   A [mass shooting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mass_shooting) occurs at a bar in the [Oregon Historic District](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oregon_Historic_District) of [Dayton, Ohio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dayton,_Ohio), [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States). Nine people are killed and at least 27 others are injured. The suspect shooter is killed by police. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-49224816)

## Science and technology

*   [French](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/French_people) inventor [Franky Zapata](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franky_Zapata) successfully crosses the [English Channel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/English_Channel) on the jet-powered [Flyboard Air](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flyboard_Air). The 22-mile (35.4-km) journey took 22 minutes with one refueling stop about halfway to [Dover](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dover), England. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-49225001) [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2019/aug/04/franky-zapata-crosses-channel-by-hoverboard-at-second-attempt)

## Sports

*   [2019 Women's British Open](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Women%27s_British_Open)
    *   In [golf](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golf), [Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan)'s [Hinako Shibuno](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hinako_Shibuno) wins the year's final [major championship](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Women%27s_major_golf_championships) by one shot over [American](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) [Lizette Salas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lizette_Salas). Shibuno, a 20-year-old rookie on the [Japan LPGA Tour](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan_LPGA_Tour), was playing outside her home country for the first time, and was also playing for the first time in a major recognized by the [U.S. LPGA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LPGA). [(AP via ESPN)](https://www.espn.com/golf/story/_/id/27321973/shibuno-wins-women-british-open-debut)

# 2019-08-06

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [War in Donbass](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_in_Donbass)
    *   Four [Ukrainian Ground Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukrainian_Ground_Forces) soldiers are killed in an attack by pro-[Russian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia) [separatists](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Separatist_forces_of_the_war_in_Donbass), near the village of [Pavlopil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pavlopil) in the war-torn eastern [Donetsk Oblast](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donetsk_Oblast). [(RFE/RL)](https://www.rferl.org/a/four-ukrainian-soldiers-killed-in-clashes-with-russia-backed-separatists/30095022.html)

## International relations

*   [United States–Venezuela relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States%E2%80%93Venezuela_relations), [International sanctions during the Venezuelan crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_sanctions_during_the_Venezuelan_crisis)
    *   [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) signs an executive order freezing all assets and interests of the [Venezuelan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venezuela) government as contained within the United States, a severe escalation from recent industry sanctions and verbal rhetoric. Twenty-one exceptions are issued, for companies providing services including aid and telecommunications. [(Reuters)](https://ca.reuters.com/article/topNews/idCAKCN1UW1MP-OCATP)
*   [India–Pakistan relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/India%E2%80%93Pakistan_relations), [Kashmir conflict](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kashmir_conflict)
    *   [Pakistani Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Pakistan) [Imran Khan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Imran_Khan) vows to fight [India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/India)'s unilateral decision to revoke Indian-administered [Kashmir](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kashmir)'s autonomy, including in the [United Nations General Assembly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_General_Assembly) and [Security Council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council). Mr. Khan stated this move is a breach of [international law](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_law), adding he feared the possibility of [ethnic cleansing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethnic_cleansing) in the Muslim-majority region. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-49258923)
    *   [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China), which administers the Kashmir territories of [Aksai Chin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aksai_Chin) and the [Trans-Karakoram Tract](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trans-Karakoram_Tract), voices opposition to this "unacceptable" Indian move and, along with [Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey), reaffirms their support for a peaceful resolution. [(EurAsian Times)](https://eurasiantimes.com/china-turkey-support-pakistans-stance-on-resolution-kashmir-dispute/) [(_Newsweek_)](https://www.newsweek.com/china-pakistan-warn-india-border-1452896)
    *   Kashmir remains on [lockdown](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lockdown), with the internet out and nearly all phone lines severed. [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/08/06/world/asia/jammu-kashmir-india.html)

## Law and crime

*   [Florida Governor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_governors_of_Florida) [Ron DeSantis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ron_DeSantis) orders law enforcement to handle a criminal probe of [Jeffrey Epstein](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeffrey_Epstein)'s jail release in 2000. [(CNBC)](https://www.cnbc.com/2019/08/06/florida-governor-orders-criminal-probe-over-prior-jeffrey-epstein-case.html)

## Politics and elections

*   [Crisis in Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crisis_in_Venezuela)
    *   The Argentine government says it has already received "hundreds" of reports of [human rights abuses](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_rights_in_Venezuela) and criminal accusations against the Venezuelan government, days after Argentina offered Venezuelans in the country to file reports against the Venezuelan government. [(_La Nación_)](https://www.lanacion.com.ar/politica/el-gobierno-recibio-centenares-denuncias-exiliados-venezolanos-nid2274676)

## Science and technology

*   Scientists at the [Spring](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spring,_Texas), [Texas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Texas) [Arch Mission Foundation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arch_Mission_Foundation) confirm that [tardigrades](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tardigrade) in a [cryptobiotic state](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptobiotic_state) were added to the payload of the failed [SpaceIL](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SpaceIL) _[Beresheet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beresheet)_ lander that crashed on the [Moon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moon) on 11 April 2019, and may have survived the crash. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/science/2019/aug/06/tardigrades-may-have-survived-spacecraft-crashing-on-moon) [(CNET)](https://www.cnet.com/news/tardigrades-are-now-on-moon-thanks-to-crashed-israeli-spacecraft-water-bears/)
*   [2019 in spaceflight](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_in_spaceflight)
    *   The [European Space Agency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Space_Agency) successfully launches the [German Aerospace Center](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German_Aerospace_Center)\-operated [ERDS-C](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Data_Relay_System) [laser communication](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laser_communication_in_space) satellite on a [Ariane 5](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ariane_5) from the [Guiana Space Centre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guiana_Space_Centre) in [French Guiana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/French_Guiana). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-49240745)

# 2019-08-09

## Business and economy

*   The [U.S. Environmental Protection Agency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._Environmental_Protection_Agency) has given waivers to 31 small oil refineries, freeing them from obligations to blend biofuels into their gasoline. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-ethanol-epa/trumps-epa-grants-31-small-refinery-waivers-from-biofuel-laws-angering-corn-lobby-idUSKCN1UZ2AV?il=0)
*   The [International Monetary Fund](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Monetary_Fund) finds that China's currency, the [yuan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuan_(currency)), has been "broadly stable" against other currencies over the last year. The yuan is pulled down by market pressures due to the slowing economy. Suggesting little intervention by [China's central bank](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/People%E2%80%99s_Bank_of_China), the IMF position is at odds with the designation of China by the U.S. as a [currency manipulator](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Currency_manipulator). [(AP News)](https://apnews.com/acaaa89d6ff84499977480f3145c91c1)

[(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-britain-powercut/major-power-cut-impacting-homes-transport-in-large-parts-of-britain-idUSKCN1UZ20J)

## Law and crime

*   [Canadian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canadians) tourist Kristian Lee Baxter, who had been held in [Syrian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syria) detention since 2018, is released in [Lebanon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lebanon). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-49291172)
*   _[Le Parisien](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Le_Parisien)_ claims [French](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France) ex-head of security [Yves Bonnet](/w/index.php?title=Yves_Bonnet&action=edit&redlink=1) \[[fr](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yves_Bonnet)\] brokered a secret deal with [Fatah](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fatah) in the 1980s offering immunity in exchange for no further [terror attacks in France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terrorism_in_France). [(The Guardian)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/aug/09/we-made-a-deal-ex-french-spy-chief-admits-1983-pact-with-fatah-terrorists)

## Politics and elections

*   [Deputy Prime Minister of Italy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deputy_Prime_Minister_of_Italy) [Matteo Salvini](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matteo_Salvini) presents a [vote of no-confidence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vote_of_no-confidence) against [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Italy) [Giuseppe Conte](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Giuseppe_Conte). ## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Saudi Arabian-led intervention in Yemen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabian-led_intervention_in_Yemen)
    *   Saudi coalition forces intervene in [Aden](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aden).     *   Israeli riot police clash with Palestinians at the [Al-Aqsa Mosque](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Aqsa_Mosque) and [Temple Mount](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Temple_Mount) site in [East Jerusalem](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/East_Jerusalem). With holidays coincidentally falling on the same day (11 August) this year for both Judaism and Islam, some Palestinians began protesting the admittance of Jewish visitors to the site, despite a longstanding agreement barring Jewish visitors. Following the agreement, the Al-Aqsa police barred Jews from the site. Israeli forces then fired rubber bullets and tear gas at people inside. The Jews were then admitted, which caused further tensions on both sides of the dispute. ## Disasters and accidents

*   According to [Interfax](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interfax), the governor of [Arkhangelsk Oblast](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arkhangelsk_Oblast) dismisses as "complete nonsense" the advice by authorities in [Severodvinsk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Severodvinsk) to residents of [Nyonoksa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nyonoksa) to evacuate on August 14. This follows the accidental explosion on Thursday of what is speculated to be a nuclear-powered missile. Russian nuclear agency [Rosatom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rosatom) says the failed test involved a "nuclear isotope power source" for a liquid-propelled rocket engine. # 2019-08-15

## Disasters and accidents

*   [Ural Airlines Flight 178](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ural_Airlines_Flight_178)
    *   A [Ural Airlines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ural_Airlines) [Airbus 321](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Airbus_321) crash lands in a field near [Zhukovsky International Airport](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zhukovsky_International_Airport) in [Moscow Region](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moscow_Region), [Russia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia). The event is dubbed the "Miracle over [Ramensk](/w/index.php?title=Ramensk&action=edit&redlink=1)", as only 23 passengers had minor injuries, similar to [US Airways Flight 1549](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/US_Airways_Flight_1549). *   A [Cessna Citation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cessna_Citation_family) carrying former [NASCAR](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NASCAR) driver [Dale Earnhardt Jr.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dale_Earnhardt_Jr.), his wife and infant daughter crashes on landing at [Elizabethton Municipal Airport](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elizabethton_Municipal_Airport) in [Elizabethton, Tennessee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elizabethton,_Tennessee). # 2019-08-23

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Syrian Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Civil_War), [2019 Northwestern Syria offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northwestern_Syria_offensive_(April_2019%E2%80%93present)#Army_captures_rebel_pocket,_surrounds_Turkish_observation_post)
    *   The [Syrian Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Army) captures the entire northern [Hama](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hama_Governorate)\-southern [Idlib](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idlib_Governorate) rebel pocket, asserting control over the strategic towns of [Kafr Zita](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kafr_Zita), [Al-Lataminah](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Lataminah) and [Murak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Murak,_Syria), as well as numerous villages and [an archaeological site](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tell_Afis), following the withdrawal of rebel forces.     *   The [Turkish observation post](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkish_military_operation_in_Idlib_Governorate) near Murak is [encircled](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Encirclement) by government forces. [(Al Arabiya)](https://english.alarabiya.net/en/News/world/2019/08/23/Al-Qaeda-claims-Pakistan-detained-wife-of-its-chief-Zawahiri.html)

    *   [U.S.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) officials confirm that an airstrike on an [Iranian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran) weapons depot in [Amirli](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amirli), [Iraq](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq) on July 19 that killed two Iranian military commanders was conducted by [Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel). # 2019-08-25

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Israeli–Lebanese conflict](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israeli%E2%80%93Lebanese_conflict)
    *   [2019 Beirut drone crash](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Beirut_drone_crash)
        *   [Hezbollah](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hezbollah) says two [Israeli](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel) [drones](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unmanned_aerial_vehicle) went down in the [Moawwad](/w/index.php?title=Moawwad&action=edit&redlink=1) neighborhood of [Dahieh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dahieh) (South [Beirut](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beirut)), [Lebanon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lebanon), and they did not shoot them. A small [reconnaissance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reconnaissance) drone fell on the roof of the Hezbollah media building, then another drone exploded nearby, causing damage to the building. Residents report a loud blast. The [Israeli Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel_Defense_Forces) says it does not comment on "foreign reports". The [Lebanese Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lebanese_Armed_Forces) confirms the drones as Israeli. [(AP News)](https://apnews.com/f6838eab9e9f4bb6b587013f26fad961) [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/08/israeli-drones-beirut-hezbollah-190825052725185.html) [(Reuters)](https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-lebanon-security-israel/lebanese-army-says-one-israeli-drone-fell-another-exploded-in-beirut-overnight-idUKKCN1VF075)
*   [Iran–Israel conflict during the Syrian Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93Israel_conflict_during_the_Syrian_Civil_War)
    *   Iran denies that yesterday's attack in southern [Syria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syria) by Israel hit their installations. The [Syrian Observatory for Human Rights](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Observatory_for_Human_Rights), an [opposition](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_opposition)\-aligned medium, claims the missiles killed one Iranian and two people from Hezbollah. [(_Times of Israel_)](https://www.timesofisrael.com/iran-denies-its-posts-were-hit-in-syria-strike-2-hezbollah-fighters-said-killed/)
*   [2019 Israeli airstrikes in Iraq](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Israeli_airstrikes_in_Iraq)
    *   Alleged Israeli airstrikes hit a Iran backed [Popular Mobilization Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Popular_Mobilization_Forces) convoy near [Al-Qa'im](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Qa%27im_(town)), [Iraq](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq).[\[1\]](about:blank#cite_note-1)

## Disasters and accidents

*   A helicopter and an [ultralight airplane](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ultralight_aviation) plane collide near the town of [Inca](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inca,_Spain), on the island of [Mallorca](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mallorca), [Spain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spain), killing seven people including two children, according to regional government officials. [(Sky News)](https://news.sky.com/story/five-dead-after-helicopter-and-small-plane-collide-in-majorca-11793978)

## Politics and elections

*   [Rohingya crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rohingya_crisis)
    *   At [Kutupalong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kutupalong_refugee_camp), the world's largest [refugee camp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Refugee_camp), in [Cox's Bazar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cox%27s_Bazar), [Bangladesh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bangladesh), 200,000 people gather peacefully to remember the day, in 2017, when a [violent crackdown](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northern_Rakhine_State_clashes#25_August_ARSA_attacks) by [Myanmarese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myanmar) security forces compelled 740,000 [Rohingya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rohingya) to flee over the border. [(France24)](https://www.france24.com/en/20190825-200-000-rohingya-rally-to-mark-genocide-day-in-bangladesh-camps)
*   [2020 United States presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_United_States_presidential_election), [2020 Republican Party presidential primaries](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Republican_Party_presidential_primaries)
    *   Conservative radio host and former [Illinois](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_Illinois) congressman [Joe Walsh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Walsh_(Illinois_politician)) announces [his run](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Walsh_2020_presidential_campaign) for president, becoming only the second Republican to challenge incumbent [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump). [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/08/25/politics/joe-walsh-take-on-trump-in-2020-republican-primary/index.html)

# 2019-09-06

## Disasters and accidents

*   At least 43 people are now confirmed to have been killed by [Hurricane Dorian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hurricane_Dorian) in [the Bahamas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Bahamas). The death toll is expected to rise further. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-49616990)

## Politics and elections

*   [Niuean](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Niue) [MP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Member_of_Parliament) [Terry Coe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terry_Coe) says there is "growing concern" over the absence of [Premier](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Premier_of_Niue) [Toke Talagi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toke_Talagi), who is reportedly undergoing medical treatment in [New Zealand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Zealand) and has not been seen in public since July and, prior to that, early April. Coe says Niue's citizens are concerned that the state affairs are seemingly being conducted from New Zealand, and the island nation's acting premier has held power for an unusually long period of time due to Talagi's absence. [(Radio New Zealand)](https://www.rnz.co.nz/international/pacific-news/398214/growing-concern-in-niue-over-premier-s-absence-opposition-mp)
*   [Robert Mugabe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Mugabe), the [second president](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Zimbabwe) of [Zimbabwe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zimbabwe), dies at the age of 95. [(CNBC)](https://www.cnbc.com/2019/09/06/former-president-of-zimbabwe-robert-mugabe-has-died.html)
*   The [United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom)'s [House of Lords](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_of_Lords) approves a bill forcing Prime Minister [Boris Johnson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boris_Johnson) to ask the [European Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Union) for a [Brexit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit) deadline extension. The bill will now become law once receiving [royal assent](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Royal_assent) from [Queen Elizabeth II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elizabeth_II). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-49612757)

## Science and technology

*   A [denial-of-service attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Denial-of-service_attack) takes down [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia), with users unable to access the [encyclopedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Encyclopedia) in [Europe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Europe) and parts of the [Middle East](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Middle_East). The [Wikimedia Foundation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikimedia_Foundation) blames a "massive and very broad" [distributed denial of service attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Distributed_denial_of_service_attack). [(_The Independent_)](https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/gadgets-and-tech/wikipedia-down-not-working-google-stopped-page-loading-encyclopedia-a9095236.html) [(Deutsche Welle)](https://www.dw.com/en/malicious-attack-takes-wikipedia-offline-in-germany/a-50335521) [(TechCrunch)](https://techcrunch.com/2019/09/07/wikipedia-blames-malicious-ddos-attack-after-site-goes-down-across-europe-middle-east/)
*   The [Indian Space Research Organization](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indian_Space_Research_Organization) loses contact with the [Chandrayaan-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chandrayaan-2) probe moments before its [soft landing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soft_landing_(aeronautics)). Had the mission been successful, [India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/India) would have been the fourth nation to [have landed a probe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_missions_to_the_Moon) on the [Moon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moon). [(NPR)](https://www.npr.org/2019/09/06/758419791/indias-attempt-to-land-rover-at-moon-s-south-pole-fails)

# 2019-09-09

## Disasters and accidents

*   [Typhoon Faxai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Typhoon_Faxai_(2019)) kills three people and causes damage to [Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan)'s capital [Tokyo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tokyo). [(_The Japan Times_)](https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2019/09/09/national/typhoon-faxai/)

## International relations

*   [Nuclear program of Saudi Arabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuclear_program_of_Saudi_Arabia)
    *   Saudi Arabia says it experiments with two [nuclear reactors](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuclear_reactor) and wants to go ahead with the "full [nuclear cycle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuclear_cycle)", implying also [uranium enrichment](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enriched_uranium#Enrichment_methods). The United States states they would like to pursue a [Section 123 Agreement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Section_123_Agreement) to accompany the transfer of U.S. technology. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-energy-wec-saudi-nuclearpower/saudi-arabia-wants-to-enrich-uranium-for-nuclear-power-minister-idUSKCN1VU168)
*   The [International Monetary Fund](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Monetary_Fund) confirms that [Kristalina Georgieva](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kristalina_Georgieva) is the only candidate for the nomination as its Managing Director. [(Politico.eu)](https://www.politico.eu/article/georgieva-in-one-horse-race-for-imf-top-job/)

## Law and crime

*   [2019 Samoa assassination plot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Samoa_assassination_plot)
    *   Three suspects appear in court in [Apia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apia), [Samoa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samoa), where two of them enter not-guilty pleas and the other a guilty plea on charges of conspiracy to assassinate the Prime Minister of Samoa. The defendant who pleaded guilty is due to be sentenced on September 30. [(RNZ)](https://www.rnz.co.nz/international/pacific-news/398399/man-pleads-guilty-to-conspiring-to-assassinate-samoa-pm)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Tuvaluan general election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Tuvaluan_general_election)
    *   Citizens of [Tuvalu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tuvalu) head to the polls to elect the 15 members of the [parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parliament_of_Tuvalu). [(Fenui News)](https://www.facebook.com/fenuinews/photos/a.459192167575297/1491829800978190/)
*   [Politics of the United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Politics_of_the_United_Kingdom)
    *   [John Bercow](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Bercow) announces his resignation as [Speaker of the House of Commons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Speaker_of_the_House_of_Commons_(United_Kingdom)), effective October 31. [(_The Irish Times_)](https://www.irishtimes.com/news/world/uk/bercow-to-stand-down-as-commons-speaker-at-end-of-october-1.4012412)
*   An [Iranian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran) female football fan, [Sahar Khodayari](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sahar_Khodayari), dies one week after setting herself on fire outside a [court](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Judicial_system_of_Iran), reportedly after learning she may have to serve a six-month sentence for trying to [enter a football stadium alongside men](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Women%27s_rights_in_Iran#Sports). [(_The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/middle_east/iranian-female-soccer-fan-dies-after-setting-herself-on-fire/2019/09/10/8b4a7d30-d3a9-11e9-8924-1db7dac797fb_story.html)

# 2019-09-11

## Business and economy

*   [China–United States trade war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China%E2%80%93United_States_trade_war)
    *   China publishes a list of 16 U.S. goods that will be temporarily exempted from its retaliatory import tariffs. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trade-china/china-exempts-some-u-s-goods-from-retaliatory-tariffs-as-fresh-talks-loom-idUSKCN1VW0IP)
    *   China announces that it will allow the import of [soymeal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soybean_meal) from [Argentina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina), to ensure livestock feed under the impact of the trade war with the U.S. As of Friday September 6, 2019, China allowed Soy meal, Rapeseed meal and sun flower meal from Russia. [(Global Times)](http://www.globaltimes.cn/content/1164329.shtml)
*   [2019 Japan–South Korea trade dispute](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Japan%E2%80%93South_Korea_trade_dispute)
    *   [South Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korea) announces it will file a complaint with the [World Trade Organization](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Trade_Organization) over [Japanese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan) government export controls. [(Marketwatch)](https://www.marketwatch.com/story/south-korea-will-complain-to-wto-about-japans-trade-curbs-2019-09-10?link=MW_latest_news)

## Disasters and accidents

*   A crash of a twin-engine [Convair 440](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Convair_440) cargo plane near [Toledo, Ohio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toledo,_Ohio), kills the two people on board. [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2019/09/11/us/ohio-toledo-plane-crash/index.html)
*   [Effects of Hurricane Dorian in The Bahamas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Effects_of_Hurricane_Dorian_in_The_Bahamas)
    *   The [Bahamian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Bahamas) National Emergency Management Agency lists approximately 2,500 people as missing after [Hurricane Dorian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hurricane_Dorian) devastated the islands last week. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-latin-america-49666942)

## Politics and elections

*   Suffering from [pneumonia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pneumonia), [Tongan Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Tonga) [ʻAkilisi Pōhiva](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%CA%BBAkilisi_P%C5%8Dhiva) is rushed from hospital in [Nukuʻalofa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuku%CA%BBalofa) to one in [Auckland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Auckland), [New Zealand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Zealand), where he was treated for a liver condition earlier this year. According to a government spokesperson, Pōhiva is in a "very serious" condition. [(RNZ)](https://www.rnz.co.nz/international/pacific-news/398579/tongan-pm-akilisi-pohiva-medevaced-to-auckland)
*   [B.J. Habibie](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/B.J._Habibie), reformist Indonesian president, dies at 83, after spending more than a week in intensive care. [(The Washington Post)](https://beta.washingtonpost.com/local/obituaries/bj-habibie-reformist-indonesian-president-dies-at-83/2019/09/11/aef7ea16-d493-11e9-9610-fb56c5522e1c_story.html?noredirect=on)
*   [Japanese Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Japan) [Shinzō Abe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shinz%C5%8D_Abe) rearranges [his government cabinet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cabinet_of_Japan#Current_Cabinet_of_Japan), naming replacements at the [Defense](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minister_of_Defense_(Japan)), [Foreign Affairs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minister_for_Foreign_Affairs_(Japan)), [Environment](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minister_of_the_Environment_(Japan)) and [Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Summer_Olympics) [ministries](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ministries_of_Japan), among others. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/09/japan-pm-picks-foreign-defence-ministers-reshuffle-190911043258966.html)
*   [Politics of the United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Politics_of_the_United_Kingdom)
    *   [Scotland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scotland)'s [Court of Session](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Court_of_Session) rules that [UK Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_the_United_Kingdom) [Boris Johnson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boris_Johnson) violated the law by his [suspension of Parliament from 9 September to 14 October](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_British_prorogation_controversy), encouraging calls for MPs to get back to work immediately. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-britain-eu-watson/brexit-in-chaos-after-court-rules-pms-suspension-of-parliament-was-unlawful-idUSKCN1VV2S6)
    *   The [Johnson ministry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Johnson_ministry) releases the [Operation Yellowhammer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Yellowhammer) contingency plans in the event of a [no-deal Brexit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/No-deal_Brexit) to the public. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-49670123)
*   [2019 Canadian federal election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Canadian_federal_election)
    *   [Canadian Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Canada) [Justin Trudeau](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Justin_Trudeau) calls a general election on 21 October. [Governor General](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Governor_General_of_Canada) [Julie Payette](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Julie_Payette), the [acting head of state](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viceroy), formally dissolves [Parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parliament_of_Canada). [(_The Independent_)](https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/canada-election-federal-general-justin-trudeau-news-latest-a9101286.html)

## Science and technology

*   Scientists from Denmark and the United Kingdom report they have identified genetic information from a 1.7-million-year-old _[Stephanorhinus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephanorhinus)_ tooth enamel from [Dmanisi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dmanisi_historic_site), [Georgia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Georgia_(country)), making it the oldest genetic data ever recorded. [(_Cosmos_)](https://cosmosmagazine.com/palaeontology/the-oldest-genetic-data-ever-recorded)
*   [Discoveries of exoplanets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Discoveries_of_exoplanets)
    *   [Water vapor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Water_vapor) is detected on [exoplanet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exoplanet) [K2-18b](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K2-18b), a [super-Earth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Super-Earth) which is located about 111 [light-years](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Light-years) away from [Earth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earth). It is the first time water has been confirmed on an exoplanet within the [circumstellar habitable zone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Circumstellar_habitable_zone) of a star. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-49648746) [(Business Insider)](https://www.businessinsider.com/water-vapor-on-potentially-habitable-super-earth-exoplanet-2019-9)

# 2019-09-12

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [2019 Diyarbakır bombing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Diyarbak%C4%B1r_bombing)
    *   Seven civilians are killed and nine are injured, two of whom critically, in a roadside attack by the [PKK](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PKK) in the southeastern [Turkish](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey) city of [Diyarbakir](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diyarbakir). [(Anadolu Agency)](https://www.aa.com.tr/en/turkey/pkk-terrorist-attack-in-se-turkey-kills-7-civilians-/1580369)

## Business and economy

*   The [European Central Bank](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Central_Bank) announces new [monetary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monetary_policy) [stimulus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stimulus_(economics)), with a second round of [quantitative easing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quantitative_easing#Eurozone_and_Switzerland) "for as long as it deems necessary" and lowering its already-[negative](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Negative_interest_on_excess_reserves#Europe) main deposit rate. [(CNBC)](https://www.cnbc.com/2019/09/12/european-central-bank-launches-new-bond-buying-program.html)

## Disasters and accidents

*   A train derails in the [Democratic Republic of the Congo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democratic_Republic_of_the_Congo)'s [Tanganyika Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tanganyika_Province), killing at least 50 people and injuring 23 others. [(_The Independent_)](https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/africa/congo-train-derail-death-toll-latest-minister-steve-mbikay-a9102401.html)

## Law and crime

*   The [French National Assembly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Assembly_(France)) says its [president](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_presidents_of_the_National_Assembly_of_France), [Richard Ferrand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Ferrand), is put under formal investigation in a "financial impropriety" case. Ferrand stepped down as a [minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minister_of_Territorial_Development_(France)) in [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_France) [Emmanuel Macron](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emmanuel_Macron)'s [government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_France) in 2017 over the case related to property deals, eight years ago, by a health insurance fund he managed in [Brittany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brittany_(administrative_region)). Prosecutors in [Lille](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lille) say he is charged with a [conflict of interest](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conflict_of_interest). [(Reuters via France 24)](https://www.france24.com/en/20190912-frances-national-assembly-leader-macron-ally-investigated-graft-probe) [(AFP via _The Straits Times_)](https://www.straitstimes.com/world/europe/french-assembly-chief-and-macron-ally-probed-over-property-deals)
*   [Death of Sahar Khodayari](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sahar_Khodayari)
    *   Iran's [judiciary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Judicial_system_of_Iran) issues a warrant to arrest actress [Saba Kamali](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saba_Kamali) after she posted a text in her Instagram sympathizing with [Sahar Khodayari](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sahar_Khodayari), which was reported to be found "insulting" to the third Shiite Imam, Hussain ibn Ali. [(Radio Farda)](https://en.radiofarda.com/amp/30160647.html)

## Politics and elections

*   [Tongan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tonga) [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Tonga) [ʻAkilisi Pōhiva](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%CA%BBAkilisi_P%C5%8Dhiva), age 78, dies one day after being taken to a [New Zealand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Zealand) hospital from his native country. [(RNZ)](https://www.rnz.co.nz/news/pacific/398621/tongan-pm-akilisi-pohiva-dies-aged-78)
*   [2020 U.S. Democratic Party presidential debates and forums](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Democratic_Party_presidential_debates_and_forums)
    *   The third major [Democratic Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democratic_Party_(United_States)) televised debate takes place at the [Health and Physical Education Arena](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Health_and_Physical_Education_Arena) in [Houston](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Houston), [Texas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Texas), with a focus on [health care in the United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Health_care_in_the_United_States). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-49684419)

## Science and technology

*   [Interstellar objects](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interstellar_object)
    *   [C/2019 Q4 (Borisov)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C/2019_Q4_(Borisov)), a second [interstellar comet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interstellar_comet) after [ʻOumuamua](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%CA%BBOumuamua) in 2017, is discovered by an amateur astronomer. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/science-environment-49676757)
*   [Social media use in politics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Social_media_use_in_politics)
    *   [Twitter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Twitter) [suspends](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Twitter_suspensions) several [Cuban](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cuba) government and [state media](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/State_media) accounts, including [First Secretary of the Communist Party of Cuba](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/First_Secretary_of_the_Communist_Party_of_Cuba) [Raúl Castro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ra%C3%BAl_Castro) and his daughter [Mariela Castro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mariela_Castro). The pro-government [Union of Journalists of Cuba](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Union_of_Journalists_of_Cuba) denounces the suspensions as "massive censorship". [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/sep/12/twitter-raul-castro-state-media-outlets-blocked) [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-latin-america-49683029)
    *   [Facebook](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Facebook) suspends a chatbot on [Israeli Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Israel) [Benjamin Netanyahu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benjamin_Netanyahu)'s official page for violating its [hate speech](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hate_speech) policy. Netanyahu says the mistake was made by a volunteer employee. [(_The Guardian)_](https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2019/sep/12/facebook-disables-netanyahu-page-bot-over-hate-speech-violation)

# 2019-09-13

## Business and economy

*   [Parisian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paris) metro workers launch a [general strike](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/General_strike), the largest of its kind [since 2007](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/November_2007_strikes_in_France), in protest at [Emmanuel Macron’s](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emmanuel_Macron) pension reforms. Two of the sixteen [metro lines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paris_M%C3%A9tro) and two major [regional train lines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rail_transport_in_France) are shut down during morning rush hour. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-france-protests-subway/paris-commuter-chaos-as-metro-workers-strike-over-pension-reform-idUSKCN1VY0GD?il=0)

## Disasters and accidents

*   A fire in a hospital kills eleven people in [Rio de Janeiro, Brazil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rio_de_Janeiro,_Brazil). [(G1)](https://g1.globo.com/rj/rio-de-janeiro/noticia/2019/09/13/oito-corpos-sao-retirados-do-predio-incendiado-do-hospital-badim-no-rio-numero-de-mortos-vai-a-nove.ghtml)

## International relations

*   [Sanctions against North Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sanctions_against_North_Korea), [North Korea–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Korea%E2%80%93United_States_relations)
    *   The [U.S. Treasury](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._Treasury) imposes sanctions on the [Lazarus Group](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lazarus_Group) and two of its affiliates, accusing them of being responsible for several recent cyberattacks under direction from North Korea's [RGB](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reconnaissance_General_Bureau) intelligence agency. [(_Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/us-sanctions-north-korean-hackers-accused-in-sony-attack-dozens-of-other-incidents/2019/09/13/ac6b0070-d633-11e9-9610-fb56c5522e1c_story.html)

## Law and crime

*   [Ponte Morandi collapse](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ponte_Morandi_collapse)
    *   Three employees of infrastructure firm [Atlantia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atlantia_(company)) are arrested by [Italian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italy) police on suspicion of offences connected to falsification of safety documentations for motorway bridges. The probe follows the disaster which killed 43 in August 2018. [(Reuters)](https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-italy-motorway-investigation-atlantia/three-atlantia-employees-arrested-in-probe-linked-to-genoa-bridge-collapse-idUKKCN1VY123)
*   American actress [Felicity Huffman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Felicity_Huffman) is sentenced to fourteen days in jail and fined US$30,000 for her role in the [college admissions bribery scandal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_college_admissions_bribery_scandal). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-education-cheating/actress-felicity-huffman-gets-14-days-behind-bars-in-u-s-college-scandal-idUSKCN1VY0Z8)

# 2019-09-14

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [2019 Abqaiq–Khurais attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Abqaiq%E2%80%93Khurais_attack), [Saudi Arabian-led intervention in Yemen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabian-led_intervention_in_Yemen)
    *   Two [Saudi Aramco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Aramco) oil refineries, one in [Abqaiq](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abqaiq) and one in [Khurais](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khurais_oil_field), [Saudi Arabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabia), are attacked by [drones](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unmanned_Aerial_Vehicle), resulting in massive fires. The fires are under control, according to the [Saudi Arabian Interior Ministry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ministry_of_Interior_(Saudi_Arabia)). [Houthi militants](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Houthi_movement) claim responsibility, saying that they used 10 drones for the attack. [(Euronews)](https://www.euronews.com/2019/09/14/drone-attacks-on-saudi-aramco-facilities-saudi-media)
    *   According to [Al Jazeera](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al_Jazeera), Saudi Aramco's exports and oil production are disrupted by 5 million barrels of oil a day, half of the entire Saudi Arabian oil exports.
