*   The world's largest airport, [Beijing Daxing International Airport](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing_Daxing_International_Airport), formally opens to commercial flights. [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/daxing-international-airport-beijing-opens/index.html)

## Disasters and accidents

*   A 6.5-magnitude earthquake strikes the [Maluku Islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maluku_Islands) in eastern [Indonesia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indonesia). Twenty-three people are killed and 100 others injured. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/09/indonesia-reports-deaths-ambon-earthquake-190927055115329.html)
*   Around 100 people are evacuated from Breivika port in [Tromsø](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Troms%C3%B8), [Norway](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norway), after [Russian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia) trawler [FV](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ship_prefix) _Bukhta Naezdnik_ catches fire and develops a heavy list. The burning ship has a tank of [ammonia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ammonia) and 200,000 litres of [diesel oil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diesel_oil) on board. The ship is purposely capsized to reduce the risk of the ammonia tank exploding. [(BreakingNews.ie)](https://www.breakingnews.ie/world/explosion-risk-as-russian-trawler-catches-fire-in-norwegian-harbour-953159.html) [(The Independent)](https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/russia-ship-fire-trawler-tromso-breivika-explosion-evacuation-a9121606.html)
*   At least 30 miners are killed after a [gold mine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gold_mine) collapses due to a landslide in the [Tibesti Region](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tibesti_Region), [Chad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chad). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-49839574)

*   A woman in [Florida](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Florida) is arrested and charged with [explosives](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Explosives) offences after a police raid on her home finds 24 [pipe bombs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pipe_bomb) and bomb-making material and several other weapons. She admits constructing the devices to harm people. Police were notified of the problem by the 27-year-old's parents. [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2019/10/04/us/florida-woman-pipe-bombs/index.html)
*   [2019 college admissions bribery scandal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_college_admissions_bribery_scandal)
    *   [Agustin Huneeus](/w/index.php?title=Agustin_Huneeus&action=edit&redlink=1) is sentenced to five months in prison and a fine of [$](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/US_Dollar)300,000 for his involvement in the college admissions scandal. *   [Hwaseong serial murders](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hwaseong_serial_murders)
    *   Police in [South Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korea) receive confessions from convicted murderer Lee Chun-jae to the serial rapes and murders, which occurred between 1986 and 1991 and left at least nine dead. He denies a tenth murder, now believed to be perpetrated by a copycat. The investigations inspired the movie _[Memories of Murder](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Memories_of_Murder)_ and saw 21,000 people investigated. Lee, who is serving life for the 1994 rape and murder of his sister in law, cannot be prosecuted because the [statute of limitations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Statute_of_limitations) has expired. He had been linked to three victims earlier this month by [DNA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DNA). *   [Paris police headquarters stabbing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paris_police_headquarters_stabbing)
    *   [Counter-terror](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Counter-terror) investigators confirm the man who killed four people at [Paris](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paris) [police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Law_enforcement_in_France) headquarters two days ago was a [convert](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Religious_conversion#Islam) who adhered to a radical version of [Islam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islam) and had contact with radical Islamists. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-49945640)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [Ukraine–European Union relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukraine%E2%80%93European_Union_relations)
    *   The [European Aviation Safety Agency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Aviation_Safety_Agency) revokes its authorisation of [Ukraine Air Alliance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukraine_Air_Alliance), effectively banning the airline from all airspace in the [European Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Union). The move follows and is in response to yesterday's crash of an [Antonov An-12](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antonov_An-12) owned by the airline after it ran out of fuel near [Lviv](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lviv), [Ukraine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukraine). [(The Aviation Herald)](http://avherald.com/h?article=4cd99477&opt=0)

    *   Russian Deputy Prime Minister [Yuri Borisov](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yury_Borisov) visits ally Venezuela, reiterating Russia's support of [disputed president](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Venezuelan_presidential_crisis) [Nicolás Maduro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicol%C3%A1s_Maduro) and announcing new trade deals with the economically crippled country. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-russia-venezuela/russian-deputy-prime-minister-in-venezuela-to-support-maduro-idUSKCN1WK0CF)

## Law and crime

*   [2019 Lower Manhattan killings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Lower_Manhattan_killings)
    *   In [Lower Manhattan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lower_Manhattan), [New York City](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_City), four [homeless](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Homelessness_in_the_United_States) men are beaten to death and a fifth severely injured while sleeping. A 24-year-old man, also believed homeless, is in custody. [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2019/10/05/us/new-york-homeless-men-killed/index.html)
*   After acquitting five Muslim men of murder, [Thai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thailand) judge [Kanakorn Pianchana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kanakorn_Pianchana) gives a speech complaining of corrupt pressure upon the judiciary, including in this case, to convict without sufficient evidence. He then shoots himself in the chest in court in [Yala](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yala_Province), but survives. Criticism from judges of the Thai legal system is rare, but rights groups claim Muslims often face trumped-up charges in the region, which is Muslim-majority and suffers from insurgency. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-49945636)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Emirati parliamentary election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Emirati_parliamentary_election)
    *   A pool of citizens of the [United Arab Emirates](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Arab_Emirates) head to the polls in the country's fourth parliamentary election. [(Gulf News)](https://gulfnews.com/uae/government/emiratis-head-to-the-polls-in-fnc-elections-1.66903098)

## Sports

*   [2019 World Artistic Gymnastics Championships](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_World_Artistic_Gymnastics_Championships)
    *   In the [floor exercise](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Floor_(gymnastics)), [Simone Biles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simone_Biles) lands a triple-twisting double backflip in a tucked position. The new skill will be named "Biles 2", the third element named after her, and will have a [FIG difficulty value](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Code_of_Points_(artistic_gymnastics)#The_FIG_Code_of_Points) of J. [(PopSugar via Yahoo!)](https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/simone-biles-starts-off-worlds-185211838.html)

# 2019-10-06

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Syrian Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Civil_War), [Kurdish–Turkish conflict (2015–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kurdish%E2%80%93Turkish_conflict_(2015%E2%80%93present)), [Northern Syria Buffer Zone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northern_Syria_Buffer_Zone)
    *   Following a phone call between [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) and [Turkish President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Turkey) [Recep Tayyip Erdoğan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Recep_Tayyip_Erdo%C4%9Fan), the [White House](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White_House) says that [Turkish Armed Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkish_Armed_Forces) will launch an incursion into [Syrian Democratic Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Democratic_Forces)\-held northern [Syria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syria), and that [United States Armed Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Armed_Forces) will be withdrawing from the region to avoid clashing with its [NATO](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NATO) ally. ## Law and crime

    *   Police in [Kansas City, Kansas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kansas_City,_Kansas), are seeking two unnamed suspects after two men [opened fire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mass_shootings_in_the_United_States) at a bar, killing four people and wounding another five. *   [Crime in Austria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crime_in_Austria)

He gives himself up at the police station. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-austria-crime/five-murdered-in-austrian-ski-town-of-kitzbuehel-police-idUSKCN1WL07L)

## Politics and elections

*   The [Jordanian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jordan) [government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cabinet_of_Jordan) announces it has struck a deal with the teachers' union to end a month-long strike that affected at least 1.5 millon students. The strike was instigated over pay in light of new [austerity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Austerity) measures. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-jordan-strike-teachers/jordan-reaches-deal-with-teachers-union-to-end-one-month-strike-idUSKCN1WK0KQ?il=0)
*   [2019 Kosovan parliamentary election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Kosovan_parliamentary_election)
    *   Following the resignation of [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Kosovo) [Ramush Haradinaj](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ramush_Haradinaj) in July, voters in [Kosovo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kosovo) cast their ballots to elect the new members of the [Assembly of the Republic of Kosovo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assembly_of_the_Republic_of_Kosovo). *   [2019 Portuguese legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Portuguese_legislative_election)
    *   [Portuguese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portugal) voters head to the polls to elect a new session to the [Assembly of the Republic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assembly_of_the_Republic_(Portugal)). In line with [opinion polls](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opinion_polling_for_the_2019_Portuguese_legislative_election), exit polls show the incumbent [Socialist Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Socialist_Party_(Portugal)) winning the most seats, but likely not quite enough to form a majority. [(euronews)](https://www.euronews.com/2019/10/05/portugal-elections-who-are-the-main-parties) [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-portugal-election-socialist/portugals-socialists-claim-election-victory-idUSKBN1WL0I6)
*   [2019 Tunisian parliamentary election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Tunisian_parliamentary_election)

## Science and technology

    *   Scientists say that, using data from the [Hubble Space Telescope](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hubble_Space_Telescope), they have found evidence of a 300,000-year-long [burst of radiation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seyfert_flare) originating 3.5 million years ago from or near [the center of our galaxy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sagittarius_A*), erupting through both [galactic poles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Galactic_pole), with effects on the [Magellanic Stream](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magellanic_Stream), 200,000 light-years away. [(EarthSky)](https://earthsky.org/space/explosion-milky-way-center-seyfert-flare-magellanic-stream)

# 2019-10-08

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Turkish involvement in the Syrian Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkish_involvement_in_the_Syrian_Civil_War), [Northern Syria Buffer Zone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northern_Syria_Buffer_Zone)
    *   Turkish officials say that [Turkish Air Force](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkish_Air_Force) jets have begun [bombing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bombardment) the [Syrian-Iraqi border](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian-Iraqi_border) on Monday night ahead of an imminent ground [invasion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Invasion) of northern [Syria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syria) that is controlled by [Kurdish](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kurds_in_Syria)\-led [Syrian Democratic Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Democratic_Forces), whom Turkey regards as terrorists.     *   A bomb explodes in a classroom at [Ghazni University](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ghazni_University) in [Afghanistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghanistan), wounding at least nineteen students. The same university was targeted last month with a bomb attached to a university [minibus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minibus) that killed one and injured five. [(Gulf News)](https://gulfnews.com/world/asia/afghanistan-bomb-goes-off-inside-classroom-wounds-19-1.66988845)
*   Two [sappers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sapper) die and four more are wounded trying to defuse [World War II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II) shells in Poland. The last such casualties occurred in 1982. [(Xinhua)](http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2019-10/09/c_138456810.htm) [(TVN24)](https://www.tvn24.pl/gen-boguslaw-bebenek-to-pierwszy-od-1982-r-smiertelny-wypadek-zolnierzy-podczas-rozminowania,975760,s.html)

## International relations

*   [Brexit negotiations in 2019](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit_negotiations_in_2019)
    *   [President of the European Council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_European_Council) [Donald Tusk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Tusk) tells [Prime Minister of the United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_the_United_Kingdom) [Boris Johnson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boris_Johnson) that "what's at stake is not a stupid blame game", after a UK source said talks were "close to breaking down" following a reported argument in a phone call between Johnson and [German chancellor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chancellor_of_Germany) [Angela Merkel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Angela_Merkel) on the subject of the post-Brexit status of [Northern Ireland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northern_Ireland). *   [China–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China%E2%80%93United_States_relations), [China–United States trade war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China%E2%80%93United_States_trade_war)
    *   The [U.S. State Department](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Department_of_State) announces it imposed visa restrictions on numerous [Chinese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China) government officials it believes responsible for the [detention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xinjiang_re-education_camps) or [abuse](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_rights_in_China#Uyghur_Muslims) of [Muslim](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islam_in_China) [Uighurs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uighurs) and other [ethnic minorities](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethnic_minorities_in_China) in [Xinjiang province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xinjiang). The move follows the [Department of Commerce](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Department_of_Commerce) adding twenty-eight Chinese firms and bureaus to their "trade blacklist" on Monday for similar reasons. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-china-muslims/u-s-imposes-visa-restrictions-on-chinese-officials-over-muslim-treatment-idUSKBN1WN29H)

## Law and crime

*   Thirteen men are arrested in the [United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom) for a drug smuggling conspiracy which over several years moved 50 tonnes of illegal drugs from the [Netherlands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Netherlands), valuing over tens of millions of [pounds](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pound_sterling). The [National Crime Agency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Crime_Agency) called it “the biggest ever \[drug\] conspiracy that we've seen in the UK”. [(_Chicago Tribune_)](https://www.chicagotribune.com/sns-bc-lt--ecuador-political-crisis-20191008-story.html)

# 2019-10-13

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [2019 Turkish offensive into north-eastern Syria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Turkish_offensive_into_north-eastern_Syria), [NES–Syria relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NES%E2%80%93Syria_relations)
    *   The [Syrian Democratic Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Democratic_Forces) agree to allow the [Syrian Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Army) to enter the SDF-held cities of [Manbij](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manbij) and [Kobani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kobani) in an attempt to deter [Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey) from attacking the towns. [(Defence Post)](https://thedefensepost.com/2019/10/13/syria-government-russia-kobani-manbij-sdf/) [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-syria-security-towns-report/report-syrian-army-to-enter-sdf-held-kobani-manbij-idUSKBN1WS0K0?feedType=RSS&feedName=worldNews&&rpc=401) [(Al Arabiya)](https://english.alarabiya.net/en/News/middle-east/2019/10/13/Syrian-army-to-enter-SDF-held-Kobani-Manbij-Monitor.html)
    *   As many as 700 [ISIL](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_State_of_Iraq_and_the_Levant) family members escape an [Ayn Issa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ayn_Issa) camp. [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/10/13/middleeast/turkish-forces-cut-main-road-syria-intl/index.html)

    *   Multiple mortars hit [Mogadishu Airport](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mogadishu_Airport), wounding at least six people. [Al-Shabaab](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Shabaab_(militant_group)) claims responsibility for the attack. [(VOA News)](https://www.voanews.com/africa/al-shabab-mortar-attacks-hits-area-around-mogadishu-airport) [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-somalia-security/mortar-bombs-strike-somalias-mogadishu-airport-six-injured-source-idUSKBN1WS0ED)
*   [Russian–Syrian hospital bombing campaign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian%E2%80%93Syrian_hospital_bombing_campaign), [Russian military intervention in the Syrian Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_military_intervention_in_the_Syrian_Civil_War)
    *   _[The New York Times](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_New_York_Times)_ claims it can prove [Russian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia) aircraft bombed four [Syrian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syria) hospitals in a matter of hours in May, using a combination of logbooks from [planespotters](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aircraft_spotting), recorded radio transmissions, and eyewitnesses. [(The Independent)](https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/russia-syria-bomb-hospitals-war-kurds-putin-assad-idlib-a9153786.html)

## Disasters and accidents

*   48 people are confirmed dead, about 100 others are injured and 17 are missing after [Typhoon Hagibis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Typhoon_Hagibis_(2019)) makes landfall in [Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan). [(Sky News)](https://news.sky.com/story/typhoon-hagibis-elderly-woman-falls-to-her-death-from-rescue-helicopter-11834366)
*   The 90-metre cargo ship [MV](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ship_prefix) _Rhodanus_, with a crew of seven, runs aground in the [Mouths of Bonifacio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bonifacio,_Corse-du-Sud) nature reserve in the [Strait of Bonifacio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strait_of_Bonifacio) off [Corsica](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corsica). French maritime police say the vessel did not respond to calls for around an hour before grounding, and that fuel was not thought to be leaking. [(France 24)](https://www.france24.com/en/20191013-cargo-ship-runs-aground-in-corsican-nature-reserve)
*   A gas explosion kills nine people in a restaurant in [Wuxi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wuxi), [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China). [(The Independent)](https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/asia/gas-explosion-restaurant-china-death-toll-dead-wuxi-jiangsu-a9154121.html)

## International relations

*   At [Saint Peter's Square](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saint_Peter%27s_Square), [Vatican City](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vatican_City), the pope praises the 19th-century Anglican convert [John Henry Newman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Henry_Newman), who was a unifying figure in both the [Anglican](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anglican_Communion) and [Catholic churches](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catholic_Church). [(ABC News)](http://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/pope-canonizes-john-henry-newman-unifier-divided-world-66241676)

## Law and crime

*   [California](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/California) becomes the first [U.S.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) state to ban the sale of [fur](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fur) products. The law goes into effect on January 1, 2023. [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2019/10/13/us/california-bans-fur-products-trnd/index.html)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Tunisian presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Tunisian_presidential_election)
    *   Voters in [Tunisia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tunisia) go to the polls to elect a new [president](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Tunisia). Conservative academic [Kaïs Saïed](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ka%C3%AFs_Sa%C3%AFed) wins more than 70% of the votes. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/10/karoui-saied-face-tunisia-presidential-election-191012203427620.html) [(The Guardian)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/oct/14/tunisia-election-exit-polls-point-to-landslide-win-for-robocop-kais-saied)
*   [2019 Polish parliamentary election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Polish_parliamentary_election)
    *   Voters in Poland go to the polls to elect a new government. The incumbent right-wing [Law and Justice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Law_and_Justice) is expected to slightly increase its plurality. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-poland-election/second-term-awaits-nationalist-pis-as-divided-poles-vote-idUSKBN1WR0O4)

# 2019-10-16

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [War in Afghanistan (2001–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_in_Afghanistan_(2001%E2%80%93present))
    *   A [Taliban](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taliban) [truck bomb](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Truck_bomb) in eastern [Afghanistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghanistan) kills three [police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghan_National_Police) officers and injures 36 other people, including twenty children. [(al-Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/10/car-bomb-kills-police-wounds-children-eastern-afghanistan-191016053735525.html)
*   [Syrian Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Civil_War), [2019 Turkish offensive into north-eastern Syria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Turkish_offensive_into_north-eastern_Syria)
    *   Following the withdrawal of troops, [U.S.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) warplanes bomb its own munitions storage bunker (the [Lafarge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lafarge_(company)) [cement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cement) factory) to prevent the the munitions and other equipment from being used by opposing forces. [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2019/10/16/politics/us-airstrike-storage-site-syria/index.html)

## Business and economy

*   [General Motors](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/General_Motors) and the [United Auto Workers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Auto_Workers) announce that they have reached a tentative deal to end a month-long [strike](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strike_action) that cost the company [US$](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_dollar)2 billion. It will be sent to union members tomorrow for final approval. If approved, workers will receive a pay raise and [temporary workers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Temporary_work) will be granted a more simplified path to [full-time employment](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Full-time). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-autos-labor/uaw-gm-leaders-have-a-deal-now-workers-will-decide-idUSKBN1WV241)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [2019 Mindanao earthquake](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Mindanao_earthquake)
    *   A magnitude 6.3 earthquake strikes the province of [Cotabato](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cotabato), [Philippines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines), at 19:37 local time (11:37 UTC) killing at least 5 people and wounding 53 others. [(_GMA News_)](https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/regions/712001/2-dead-after-strong-mindanao-quake/story/)

## Law and crime

*   [2019 Hong Kong protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Hong_Kong_protests)
    *   [Jimmy Sham](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jimmy_Sham), a leader of the [Hong Kong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hong_Kong) protests, is attacked by a group of hammer-wielding men in the [Mong Kok District](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mong_Kok_District) of the [Kowloon Peninsula](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kowloon_Peninsula), and is taken to hospital with severe head injuries. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-china-50073583)
*   [Trial of Catalonia independence leaders](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trial_of_Catalonia_independence_leaders)
    *   The nine [pro-Catalonia independence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catalonian_independence) politicians jailed earlier this week issue a joint plea for an end to violent protests across the region. Meanwhile, the [Spanish government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spanish_government) says it will meet protestors with a "firm, proportional and united" response. [(The Guardian)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/oct/16/police-clash-with-catalonia-protesters-in-second-night-of-violence)
    *   The violence of the protests in [Tarragona](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tarragona), [Girona](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Girona), [Lleida](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lleida) and [Barcelona](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barcelona) increases, while there are clashes with [Mossos d'Esquadra](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mossos_d%27Esquadra) in [Reus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reus). Four protesters and one policeman are injured in a pro-independence protest in [Madrid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Madrid). [(_El Mundo_)](https://www.elmundo.es/cataluna/2019/10/16/5da6aa66fdddff61428b45b0.html) [(_El País_)](https://elpais.com/politica/2019/10/16/actualidad/1571207756_038911.html)
    *   The [Spanish Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Spain) [Pedro Sánchez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pedro_S%C3%A1nchez_(politician)) advises in a [press conference](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Press_conference) that the [Government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_Spain) will act with moderation but not concrete exceptional measures yet. [(_El País_)](https://elpais.com/politica/2019/10/16/actualidad/1571210620_205746.html)
*   Around 337 people in a dozen countries are arrested for participating in a [child pornography](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Child_pornography) network that hosted up to 250,000 videos depicting [child sexual abuse](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Child_sexual_abuse). Officials in the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States), [United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom), and [South Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korea) called it one of the largest child pornography operations to date. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-crime-exploitation/hundreds-arrested-worldwide-in-sweeping-child-porn-investigation-idUSKBN1WV1WW)

# 2019-10-17

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [2019 Turkish offensive into north-eastern Syria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Turkish_offensive_into_north-eastern_Syria)
    *   After meeting with [Turkish President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Turkey) [Recep Tayyip Erdoğan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Recep_Tayyip_Erdo%C4%9Fan), [U.S. Vice President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vice_President_of_the_United_States) [Mike Pence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mike_Pence) says [Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey) has agreed to a five-day ceasefire in [Syria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syria) while the United States helps facilitate the withdrawal of [Kurdish](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kurds) fighters. [(_The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/pence-arrives-in-turkey-as-us-seeks-to-halt-erdogans-syria-offensive/2019/10/17/55b806aa-f04c-11e9-bb7e-d2026ee0c199_story.html)

## Disasters and accidents

*   The number of people confirmed killed in central and eastern [Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan) by [Typhoon Hagibis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Typhoon_Hagibis_(2019)) rises to 77, while nine other people are still missing. [(NHK World)](https://www3.nhk.or.jp/nhkworld/en/news/special/01/1919/)
*   A [Peninsula Air](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peninsula_Air) passenger plane carrying 42 people [crashes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PenAir#Accidents_and_incidents) at an airport in [Unalaska](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unalaska), [Alaska](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alaska). One passenger on the [Saab SB20](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saab_SB20) is killed, and at least one more is seriously injured. [(KTUU))](https://www.ktuu.com/content/news/Plane-off-runway-at-Unalaska-Airport-563346322.html)

## Health and environment

*   [2019 United States outbreak of lung illness linked to vaping products](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_United_States_outbreak_of_lung_illness_linked_to_vaping_products)
    *   [Electronic cigarette](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electronic_cigarette) maker [Juul](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juul) announces it will stop producing most of its flavored cartridges, excluding mint and menthol. [(Arstechnica)](https://arstechnica.com/science/2019/10/juul-halts-sales-of-some-flavors-but-not-the-ones-teens-use-most/)

## International relations

*   [Brexit negotiations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit_negotiations), [Brexit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit)
    *   The [United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom) and the [European Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Union) agree on a new [Brexit withdrawal agreement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit_withdrawal_agreement) deal following talks in [Brussels](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brussels). [Current coalition](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Johnson_ministry) partner the [Democratic Unionist Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democratic_Unionist_Party) subsequently announces they will oppose the deal. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-50079385)

## Law and crime

*   [Murder of Kathleen Jo Henry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Murder_of_Kathleen_Jo_Henry)
    *   Police in [Anchorage, Alaska](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anchorage,_Alaska) charge Brian Steven Smith, who was arrested on October 8 for the murder of Kathleen Jo Henry, with a second murder, that of Veronica Abouchuk. Smith reportedly confessed to killing Abouchuk and told authorities where her body could be found. [(KTLA Los Angeles)](https://ktla.com/2019/10/17/man-seen-in-strangling-video-charged-in-killing-of-2nd-woman-in-alaska/)
*   The [New York City Council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_City_Council) votes to close [Rikers Island](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rikers_Island), [the city](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_City)'s main prison, by 2026. The complex's infrastructural deterioration and [excessive abuses](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rikers_Island#Abuse_and_neglect_of_prisoners) were the cited reasons. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-new-york-rikers/new-york-city-council-votes-to-close-infamous-rikers-island-jails-idUSKBN1WW2ZW)
*   The fourth night of violence in the streets of [Catalonia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catalonia) in protest of the sentence of the Catalan independence leaders leaves 33 arrested and 80 injures. In [Tarragona](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tarragona), the main door of the city hall is burnt. [(_El País_)](https://elpais.com/ccaa/2019/10/17/catalunya/1571348005_655263.html)[(_La Vanguardia_)](https://www.lavanguardia.com/vida/20191018/47104590938)

## Politics and elections

*   Representative [Elijah Cummings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elijah_Cummings), Maryland Democratic Congressman and [House Oversight Committee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_House_Committee_on_Oversight_and_Reform) Chair, dies at age 68. [(ABC News)](https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/rep-elijah-cummings-house-oversight-committee-chair-dead/story?id=66338264)
*   [List of Trump administration dismissals and resignations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Trump_administration_dismissals_and_resignations)
    *   [U.S. Secretary of Energy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Secretary_of_Energy) [Rick Perry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rick_Perry) announces he will resign by the end of the year. [(NPR)](https://www.npr.org/2019/10/17/593950148/energy-secretary-rick-perry-resigns)
*   [Trial of Catalonia independence leaders](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trial_of_Catalonia_independence_leaders), [2019 Catalan Protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Catalan_Protests)
    *   The Catalan president [Quim Torra](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quim_Torra), in a special plenary session at the [Parliament of Catalonia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parliament_of_Catalonia) announces that he will convene a third independence referendum and a Constitution throughout the legislature. [(_El Periódico_)](https://www.elperiodico.com/es/politica/20191017/torra-autodeterminacion-govern-erc-jxcat-7686835)

## Science and technology

*   [NASA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Aeronautic_and_Space_Administration) announces that the [InSight](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/InSight) Mars lander's heat probe had successfully dug 3 centimetres (1.2 in) into the ground after becoming stuck 35 centimetres (14 in) in the ground in February 2019, confirming that the probe had not hit a rock and instead simply didn't have enough friction in the soil to dig much deeper. The vehicle landed near the Martian equator in November 2018. [(Space.com)](https://www.space.com/mars-insight-lander-burrowing-probe-hope.html)

# 2019-10-19

## Disasters and accidents

*   [SIEV X](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SIEV_X)
    *   An [Iraqi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraqis) man is arrested at [Brisbane Airport](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brisbane_Airport) for his membership in a [human trafficking](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_trafficking) syndicate responsible for chartering a boat carrying 421 [Afghan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghans) and Iraqi refugees [to Australia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asylum_in_Australia). More than 350 of those aboard perished when the boat sank off the coast of [Indonesia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indonesia) in October 2001. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2019/oct/19/siev-x-tragedy-iraqi-man-charged-in-australia-in-connection-with-deaths-of-350-people)
*   A dam on the Seiba river in [Krasnoyarsk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Krasnoyarsk), [Siberia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siberia), collapses, flooding a nearby gold mine and cabins used to house miners. At least 15 people die, with 13 more missing and 14 hospitalised. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-50108413)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Santiago protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Santiago_protests)
    *   The [Chilean government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chilean_government) declares a [state of emergency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/State_of_emergency) in the capital [Santiago](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Santiago), following riots in response to a price hike in [Santiago Metro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Santiago_Metro) fares. Overnight, the high-rise headquarters of [Enel Generación Chile](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enel_Generaci%C3%B3n_Chile) is [set on fire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arson) by rioters. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-latin-america-50106743)
    *   19 stations of the [Santiago Metro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Santiago_Metro) are set on fire during the night. [(_La Tercera_)](https://www.latercera.com/nacional/noticia/incendios-estaciones-del-metro/868259/)
    *   Police and military officers clash with protestors in [Plaza Baquedano](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plaza_Baquedano), [Maipú Main Square](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maip%C3%BA,_Chile) and other places, while several _[cacerolazos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cacerolazo)_ are heard in the city. [(_ADN Radio_)](https://www.adnradio.cl/noticias/deportes/cacerolazo-convocado-por-vecinos-finalizo-con-incidentes-en-la-plaza-de-maipu/20191019/nota/3968118.aspx)
    *   [Curfew](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curfew) is announced for the [Greater Santiago](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greater_Santiago) area, the first time it is used since the end of the [Pinochet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Augusto_Pinochet) [dictatorship](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Military_dictatorship_of_Chile_(1973%E2%80%931990)). [(_El Desconcierto_)](https://www.eldesconcierto.cl/2019/10/19/decretan-inedito-toque-de-queda-en-santiago-tras-fracaso-del-gobierno-en-contener-ola-de-protestas/)
*   [Brexit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit)
    *   The [British Parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parliament_of_the_United_Kingdom) votes 322 to 306 to pass the so-called "[Letwin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oliver_Letwin) amendment" to the [Withdrawal Agreement Bill](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit_withdrawal_agreement), which states it will not approve any withdrawal agreement unless all relevant formal legislation is passed. In effect any subsequent vote on a deal is not considered final, and [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_the_United_Kingdom) [Boris Johnson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boris_Johnson) will be forced to ask for an extension. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-britain-eu-letwin-vote/uk-lawmakers-vote-for-letwin-proposals-forcing-johnson-toward-brexit-delay-idUSKBN1WY0D0) [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2019/10/19/uk/brexit-letwin-amendment-scli-intl-gbr/index.html)
*   [2019 Lebanese protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Lebanese_protests)
    *   Four ministers resign from the [current cabinet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lebanese_government_of_January_2019), stating that the government is incapable of addressing any of the issues under current circumstances. Conversely, [Hassan Nasrallah](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hassan_Nasrallah) of [Hezbollah](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hezbollah) announces that his group will continue to support the government, saying, "All of us have to shoulder the responsibility of the current situation that we arrived at." [(Al-Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/10/tens-thousands-protest-day-lebanon-191019180840017.html)

# 2019-10-21

## Arts and culture

*   A team of ocean explorers announce the discovery of [Imperial Japanese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Empire_of_Japan) [aircraft carrier](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aircraft_carrier) _[Akagi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_aircraft_carrier_Akagi)_ on the [Pacific](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pacific_Ocean) seafloor. The vessel was sunk in 1942 during the [World War II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II) [Battle of Midway](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Midway). [(The Guardian)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/oct/21/humbling-wreckage-of-japanese-ships-from-battle-of-midway-found-in-pacific)

## International relations

*   [New Zealand–United Kingdom relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Zealand%E2%80%93United_Kingdom_relations)
    *   The Foreign Minister of New Zealand [Winston Peters](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winston_Peters) accuses the [United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom) of "walking out" on Pacific aid to small island nations. The accusation surprised British officials. [(RNZ)](https://www.rnz.co.nz/international/pacific-news/401460/uk-walked-out-on-pacific-nz-s-foreign-minister)

## Law and crime

*   [Murder of Ján Kuciak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Murder_of_J%C3%A1n_Kuciak)
    *   Authorities in [Slovakia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slovakia) charge four people with murdering investigative journalist Ján Kuciak and his fiancée. The killings sparked widespread anti-corruption protests and forced the resignation of [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Slovakia) [Robert Fico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Fico). [(The Guardian)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/oct/21/slovakia-four-people-charged-murder-investigative-journalist-jan-kuciak)
*   [Opioid epidemic in the United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opioid_epidemic_in_the_United_States)
    *   [Teva Pharmaceuticals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teva_Pharmaceuticals), [McKesson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/McKesson), and [AmerisourceBergen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AmerisourceBergen) reach a US$260 million settlement hours before a civil trial in [U.S. federal court](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._federal_court) in [Cleveland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cleveland), [Ohio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ohio), brought as a class-action lawsuit representing communities affected by opioid addiction. [(The Guardian)](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2019/oct/21/opioid-makers-drug-industry-trial-cleveland-ohio)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Canadian federal election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Canadian_federal_election)
    *   Voters in [Canada](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canada) go to the polls to elect members of the 43rd Canadian Parliament. Polls show [Justin Trudeau](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Justin_Trudeau)'s [Liberals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liberal_Party_of_Canada) and [Andrew Scheer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andrew_Scheer)'s [Conservatives](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conservative_Party_of_Canada) deadlocked with equal numbers of support after a divisive campaign. [(CBC)](https://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/grenier-polls-election-end-1.5327737) [(CTV News)](https://election.ctvnews.ca/frantic-final-push-for-votes-marks-final-day-of-divisive-campaign-1.4646693)
    *   The Liberal Party win a pluralty of seats, and will remain in government, albeit as a [minority](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minority_government) and having lost the popular vote to the Conservative Party. The [Bloc Québécois](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bloc_Qu%C3%A9b%C3%A9cois) resurge from a 10-seat rump at dissolution to take third place and regain official party status. [(CBC)](https://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/federal-election-results-2019-cbc-leaders-1.5329485) [(CTV News)](https://election.ctvnews.ca/trudeau-nabs-minority-government-loses-the-popular-vote-in-tumultuous-campaign-1.4649117)
*   [2019 Chilean protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Chilean_protests)
    *   [Chilean President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chilean_President) [Sebastián Piñera](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sebasti%C3%A1n_Pi%C3%B1era) says that Chile is "at war" as violence continues in the capital and other cities. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/10/dead-santiago-supermarket-set-fire-191020052021604.html)
*   [2019 Lebanese protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Lebanese_protests)
    *   The [Lebanese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lebanon) government passes a series of economic measures, such as slashing government wages and extending financial aid to poor families, in an attempt to placate protestors. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-50118300)

## International relations

*   [Japan–South Korea relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan%E2%80%93South_Korea_relations), [2019 Japan–South Korea trade dispute](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Japan%E2%80%93South_Korea_trade_dispute)
    *   Japan and South Korea hold a high-level bilateral meeting for the first time since the trade dispute, with Japanese Prime Minister [Shinzō Abe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shinz%C5%8D_Abe) meeting with his counterpart [Lee Nak-yeon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lee_Nak-yeon). [(_The Japan Times_)](https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2019/10/24/national/politics-diplomacy/abe-meets-south-korean-prime-minister/#.XbFdXnPZHqA)

## Law and crime

*   [2019 Grays incident](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Grays_incident)
    *   The people found deceased in a lorry in [Essex](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Essex) yesterday are identified as Chinese nationals. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-essex-50162617)
*   [Persecution of homosexuals in Uganda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uganda_Anti-Homosexuality_Act,_2014)
    *   The law authorities announce that they have arrested 16 [LGBT activists](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_activist) on suspicion of [gay sex](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gay_sex). He is the first UK man found guilty of such a crime, and is remanded in custody to await his November 7 sentencing hearing. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-merseyside-50167158)

## Politics and elections

*   The remains of former Spanish dictator [Francisco Franco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francisco_Franco) are exhumed from [Valle de los Caídos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Valle_de_los_Ca%C3%ADdos) and are moved to a private mausoleum with his wife [Carmen Polo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carmen_Polo), 44 years after his death. Some pro-Franco protestors gather outside the national mausoleum. [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2019/10/24/europe/franco-exhumation-spain-intl/index.html)
*   [2019 Lebanese protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Lebanese_protests)
    *   As protests enter its eighth day, [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Lebanon) [Michel Aoun](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michel_Aoun) in a televised address states he is willing to meet with protestors and offers support for various reforms, such as increasing transparency for banks and lifting [immunity for government officials](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Absolute_immunity). He however states that changes “can only happen through state institutions" in response to calls to bring down the government. [(Al-Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/10/waiting-lebanon-aoun-invites-protesters-talk-191024112324367.html)
*   The [Chicago Teachers Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicago_Teachers_Union)'s strike enters its sixth school day as it is unable to reach an agreement with [Chicago Public Schools](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicago_Public_Schools). [(NBC Chicago)](https://www.nbcchicago.com/news/local/cps-classes-canceled-for-sixth-day-thursday-chicago-teachers-strike-563728431.html)

# 2019-10-28

## Armed conflicts and attacks

    *   Three women are killed after [Afghan and Pakistani forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghanistan%E2%80%93Pakistan_relations) clash in [Kunar Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kunar_Province). [(CityNews Vancouver)](https://www.citynews1130.com/2019/10/28/afghan-official-pakistani-forces-open-fire-killing-3-women/)

*   [Maghreb insurgency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Insurgency_in_the_Maghreb_(2002%E2%80%93present)), [Pobé Mengao shooting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pob%C3%A9_Mengao_shooting)
    *   Gunmen kill 16 people after they refused to help buy them [ammunition](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ammunition). The attack happened in the village of [Pobé Mengao](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pob%C3%A9_Mengao) in [Burkina Faso](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burkina_Faso). [(_Jeune Afrique_)](https://www.jeuneafrique.com/848805/politique/burkina-faso-au-moins-15-civils-tues-dans-le-nord-du-pays/)

    *   A gunman opens fire on a [mosque](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mosque) in [Bayonne](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bayonne), [Nouvelle-Aquitaine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nouvelle-Aquitaine), [France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France), wounding two before being detained. The perpetrator is an 84-year-old man who ran for the [National Front](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Rally_(France)) in the [2015 regional elections](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2015_French_regional_elections). [(_The Daily Telegraph_)](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2019/10/28/france-mosque-shooting-man-arrested-two-shot-bayonne/)
*   [War in Afghanistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_in_Afghanistan_(2001%E2%80%93present))
    *   An [improvised explosive device](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Improvised_explosive_device) detonates in a partially constructed building in [Bati Kot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bati_Kot), [Afghanistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghanistan). The bomb kills two labourers and injures five more, three seriously. [(Xinhua News Agency)](http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2019-10/28/c_138509726.htm)

*   An explosion kills five people at a petroleum plant in [Shaanxi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shaanxi), [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China). A further three are missing. [(_South China Morning Post_)](https://www.scmp.com/news/china/society/article/3035190/china-oil-plant-explosion-leaves-five-dead)

## Law and crime

    *   [Charles Kupperman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Kupperman), [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump)'s former [deputy national security adviser](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deputy_National_Security_Advisor_(United_States)), defies a [congressional](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Congress) [subpoena](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Subpoena) to testify before the [House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_House_Permanent_Select_Committee_on_Intelligence) regarding the [impeachment inquiry into President Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Impeachment_inquiry_against_Donald_Trump). [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/10/28/politics/charles-kupperman-no-show-deposition/index.html)

## Politics and elections

*   [Brexit negotiations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit_negotiations)
    *   The [European Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Union) agrees to delay the deadline again for a [Brexit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit) deal until January 31, 2020. [(BBC News)](https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-50205603)
*   [October 2019 Iraqi protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/October_2019_Iraqi_protests)
    *   The [Iraqi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq) government enacts a curfew in [Baghdad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baghdad) as renewed protests enters its fourth day. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/10/iraq-declares-curfew-ongoing-mass-anti-government-poritests-191028134431588.html)
*   [2019 Chilean protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Chilean_protests)
    *   President [Sebastián Piñera](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sebasti%C3%A1n_Pi%C3%B1era) changes eight ministries of his [cabinet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cabinet_of_Chile), notably with [Interior Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ministry_of_the_Interior_and_Public_Security_(Chile)) [Andrés Chadwick](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andr%C3%A9s_Chadwick) and [Financial Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ministry_of_Finance_(Chile)) [Felipe Larraín Bascuñán](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Felipe_Larra%C3%ADn_Bascu%C3%B1%C3%A1n) being replaced with [Gonzalo Blumel](/w/index.php?title=Gonzalo_Blumel&action=edit&redlink=1) and [Ignacio Briones](/w/index.php?title=Ignacio_Briones&action=edit&redlink=1) respectively. New rounds of protests and riots erupt in [Santiago](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Santiago) and other cities after the announcement. [(BBC News)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-50207883) [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/oct/28/chile-president-sebastian-pinera-replaces-cabinet-protests)
*   [2019 Lebanese protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Lebanese_protests)
    *   Central Bank Governor [Riad Salame](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riad_Salame) says the economy of Lebanon is "days" away from collapsing. [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2019/10/28/middleeast/lebanon-salame-economy-collapse-intl/index.html)
    *   The [U.S. House of Representatives](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_House_of_Representatives) announces it will vote this week to formalize the [impeachment inquiry into President Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Impeachment_inquiry_against_Donald_Trump). [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/10/28/politics/house-impeachment-procedure-vote/index.html)

## Science and technology

*   A study by [Garvan Institute of Medical Research](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Garvan_Institute_of_Medical_Research) in [Sydney](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sydney), and headed by geneticist [Vanessa Hayes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vanessa_Hayes), pinpoints the [Okavango region](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Okavango_delta) in northern [Botswana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Botswana) as [the origin of](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_evolution) [modern humans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Homo_sapiens). Other scientists express skepticism at this, particularly at the study's primary evidence coming from [mitochondrial DNA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mitochondrial_DNA). [(BBC News)](https://www.bbc.com/news/science-environment-50210701) [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/science/2019/oct/28/ancestral-home-of-modern-humans-is-in-botswana-study-finds) [(_Nature_)](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41586-019-1714-1)

# 2019-10-29

## Business and economics

*   [WhatsApp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WhatsApp) sues [Israeli](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel) cyber intelligence firm [NSO Group](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NSO_Group) for allegedly spying on 1,400 users on four continents. Among those affected were diplomats, journalists, and government officials. If moved forward, it could set a major legal precedent for [cybersecurity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Computer_security). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-facebook-cyber-whatsapp-nsogroup/whatsapp-sues-israels-nso-for-allegedly-helping-spies-hack-phones-around-the-world-idUSKBN1X82BE?il=0)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [South Airlines Flight 8971](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Airlines_Flight_8971)
    *   The [National Bureau of Air Accidents Investigation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Bureau_of_Air_Accidents_Investigation_of_Ukraine) of [Ukraine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukraine) concludes its investigation with the release of a final report concluding the pilot's excessive speed reductions as he attempted to land in weather conditions beyond his qualifications were the accident's cause. [(The Aviation Herald)](http://avherald.com/h?article=45db0756&opt=0)

## International relations

*   [Turkey–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey%E2%80%93United_States_relations), [Armenia–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armenia%E2%80%93United_States_relations), [Armenian Genocide recognition](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armenian_Genocide_recognition)
    *   The [United States House of Representatives](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_House_of_Representatives) votes 405 to 11 to officially recognize the [Armenian Genocide](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armenian_Genocide) as a [genocide](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genocide) for the first time. [Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey) condemns the resolution, describing it as "a meaningless political step", and that "its sole addressees are the Armenian lobby and anti-Turkey groups". [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-turkey-armenia/u-s-house-backs-measure-recognizing-armenian-genocide-idUSKBN1X82LY)
*   [Israel–Jordan relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel%E2%80%93Jordan_relations)
    *   [Jordan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jordan) recalls its ambassador to Israel when the latter refuses to release two Jordanian citizens whom [Foreign Affairs Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minister_of_Foreign_Affairs_(Jordan)) [Ayman Safadi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ayman_Safadi) says have been held illegally for months without charges. They were arrested in August for crossing into the [West Bank](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/West_Bank) to attend a family wedding. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-jordan-israel-envoy/jordan-recalls-envoy-to-israel-to-protest-detention-of-two-citizens-idUSKBN1X82JI)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Lebanese protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Lebanese_protests)
    *   [Lebanese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lebanon) [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Lebanon) [Saad Hariri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saad_Hariri) submits his resignation to [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Lebanon) [Michel Aoun](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michel_Aoun). [(Al-Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/10/lebanon-pm-saad-hariri-offers-resignation-mass-protests-191029123235727.html)
*   [October 2019 Iraqi protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/October_2019_Iraqi_protests)
    *   [Shia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shia_Islam) cleric [Muqtada al-Sadr](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Muqtada_al-Sadr), who heads the [current ruling bloc](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alliance_Towards_Reforms), calls on the opposition to help him introduce a [motion of no confidence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Motion_of_no_confidence) against [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Iraq) [Adil Abdul-Mahdi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adil_Abdul-Mahdi). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-iraq-protests-sadr/iraqs-sadr-calls-on-rival-to-join-him-in-ousting-pm-idUSKBN1X825R?il=0)
*   [2019 United Kingdom general election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_United_Kingdom_general_election)
    *   The [House of Commons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_of_Commons_of_the_United_Kingdom) votes 438 to 20 to approve [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_the_United_Kingdom) [Boris Johnson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boris_Johnson)’s call to hold a general election on December 12. [(Reuters)](https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-britain-eu/britain-set-for-december-12-election-to-break-the-brexit-deadlock-idUKKBN1X80QT)

*   [Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_State_of_Iraq_and_the_Levant)
    *   Turkish [Interior Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ministry_of_the_Interior_(Turkey)) [Süleyman Soylu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S%C3%BCleyman_Soylu) announces that ISIL prisoners will be [sent back](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deportation) to their home countries. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-syria-security-turkey-islamic-state/turkey-says-will-send-islamic-state-prisoners-to-home-countries-idUSKBN1XC08B?il=0)
    *   ISIL claims responsibility for the attack in [Mali](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mali) on 1 November that killed 54. [(NBC News)](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/militants-kill-54-attack-mali-army-post-claims-responsibility-n1075721)
    *   [ISIL – Sinai Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_State_of_Iraq_and_the_Levant_%E2%80%93_Sinai_Province) pledges allegiance to the new caliph, [Abu Ibrahim al-Hashimi al-Qurayshi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abu_Ibrahim_al-Hashimi_al-Qurayshi). [(Voice of America)](https://www.voanews.com/middle-east/egypts-sinai-province-swears-allegiance-new-leader)
*   Illegal loggers in [Amazon rainforest](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amazon_rainforest) shoot dead an indigenous warrior named Paulo Paulino Guajajara and injure another. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-brazil-indigenous/illegal-loggers-kill-amazon-indigenous-warrior-who-guarded-forest-wound-another-idUSKBN1XC0GR)

The blockades were set up after security forces clashed with protestors earlier. # 2019-11-05

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Yemeni Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yemeni_Civil_War_(2015%E2%80%93present)), [Yemeni peace process](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yemeni_peace_process)
    *   [Yemen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yemen) and the [Southern Transitional Council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Southern_Transitional_Council) sign a power-sharing deal in [Riyadh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riyadh), [Saudi Arabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabia), to put an end to infighting between the two groups in [Aden](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aden). *   [Mexican Drug War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexican_Drug_War)
    *   [2019 Sonora massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Sonora_massacre)
        *   [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) offers [Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico) [military](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Armed_Forces) support to help defeat [drug cartels](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drug_cartel), should his counterpart [Andrés Manuel López Obrador](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andr%C3%A9s_Manuel_L%C3%B3pez_Obrador) request help, after nine [American Mexican](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Mexican) [Mormon fundamentalists](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Church_of_the_Firstborn_(LeBaron_order)), including six children, are killed in an ambush by suspected cartel members in [Sonora](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sonora), northern Mexico. [(_The Independent_)](https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/us-politics/trump-mexico-war-us-army-troops-drug-cartels-twitter-a9185881.html)

## Law and crime

*   [LGBT rights in the Cook Islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_the_Cook_Islands)
    *   The [Cook Islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cook_Islands) announces it will retain its ban on [homosexual](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Homosexuality) [practises by men](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gay_sexual_practices) and that it will be [extended to women](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lesbian_sexual_practices) as well. Homosexuals face up to seven years of imprisonment on the islands. [(RNZ)](https://www.rnz.co.nz/international/pacific-news/402530/cook-islands-retains-ban-on-homosexuality)
*   [Crime in Italy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crime_in_Italy)
    *   Three [firefighters](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Firefighter) are killed while two others and a [policeman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Law_enforcement_in_Italy) are injured after an explosion at an abandoned farm building in [Quargnento](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quargnento), [Piedmont](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Piedmont), [Italy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italy). The explosion was caused by two bombs placed by unknown people, and his suspected that the target of the attack were the owners of the building. [(_Il Messaggero_)](https://www.ilmessaggero.it/italia/alessandria_esplosione_cascina_casa_morti_vigili_fuoco_oggi_5_novembre_2019-4842506.html)
*   [Murder of Ana Kriégel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Murder_of_Ana_Kri%C3%A9gel)
    *   An [Irish](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Irish_people) judge sentences two 15-year-old boys to jail for the 2018 murder of 14-year-old Ana Kriégel in suburban [Dublin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dublin). The boys were 13-years-old at the time they murdered her and are the youngest people convicted of murder in [Ireland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republic_of_Ireland). They have not been named due to their age. One boy was sentenced to [life in detention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Life_imprisonment) to be reviewed after twelve years—he was also sentenced to eight years for [sexual assault](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sexual_assault) to run concurrently with the murder sentence. The other boy was sentenced to 15 years in prison, but his sentence will be reviewed after eight years instead of twelve. Her parents said that "justice has been served for Ana", but about the sentences that "forever is not long enough". [(RTE)](https://www.rte.ie/news/ireland/2019/1105/1088699-kriegel-sentencing/) [(RTE2)](https://www.rte.ie/news/courts/2019/1105/1088828-ana-kriegel/)

## Politics and elections

*   [Impeachment inquiry against Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Impeachment_inquiry_against_Donald_Trump)
    *   [Gordon Sondland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gordon_Sondland), the [United States Ambassador to the European Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Ambassador_to_the_European_Union), reverses his previous testimony, admitting to a _[quid pro quo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quid_pro_quo)_ in the withholding of military aid for [Ukraine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukraine). *   [2019 Virginia elections](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Virginia_elections), [2019 Kentucky gubernatorial election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Kentucky_gubernatorial_election)
    *   Democrats win majorities in both houses of the [Virginia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virginia) [General Assembly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virginia_General_Assembly) ([Senate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Senate_of_Virginia) and [House](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virginia_House_of_Delegates)), resulting in Democratic [trifecta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_trifecta) control of the [governorship](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Governor_of_Virginia) and General Assembly for the first time since 1993. Democratic [Kentucky Attorney General](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attorney_General_of_Kentucky) [Andy Beshear](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andy_Beshear) defeats Republican incumbent [Matt Bevin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matt_Bevin) to win the [governorship](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Governor_of_Kentucky) of Kentucky. [(Vox)](https://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2019/11/5/20944109/virginia-elections-legislature-results-democrats) [(_The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/polls-open-in-virginia-balance-of-power-in-state-government-is-at-stake/2019/11/05/bdb57972-ff5b-11e9-8501-2a7123a38c58_story.html) [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2019/11/05/politics/virginia-election-democrats-control/index.html)
*   [Elections in New York (state)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elections_in_New_York_(state))
    *   [New York City](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_City) becomes the largest city in the United States to adopt [ranked-choice voting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ranked-choice_voting). [(Vox)](https://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2019/11/5/20948376/new-york-election-results-ranked-choice-voting) [(_The Hill_)](https://thehill.com/homenews/state-watch/469167-new-york-city-to-adopt-ranked-choice-voting)

## Disasters and accidents

    *   During her testimony before [U.S. House](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_House_of_Representatives) investigators last month in the [impeachment inquiry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Impeachment_inquiry_against_Donald_Trump) into [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump), [Fiona Hill](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiona_Hill_(presidential_advisor)), President Trump's former top adviser on [Russia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia) and [Europe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Europe), said that she received death threats, "hateful calls", and was the subject of false "[conspiracy theories](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conspiracy_theory)" as part of a targeted harassment campaign she claims was implemented after she agreed to cooperate with the inquiry on impeachment, according to a deposition transcript.     *   Several dozen policemen were seen joining the protests against Evo Morales' government in at least three cities. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-bolivia-election/bolivian-police-seen-joining-scattered-anti-morales-protests-idUSKBN1XI20M) [(The Guardian)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/nov/09/bolivian-police-mutiny-in-opposition-to-evo-morales)

# 2019-11-09

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [2019 Chilean protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Chilean_protests)
    *   Overnight, protesters forcibly storm the [Argentine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina) [embassy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Embassy) in [Santiago](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Santiago) and [set it on fire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arson) because of the [Argentine government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentine_government)'s support for [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Chile) [Sebastián Piñera](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sebasti%C3%A1n_Pi%C3%B1era). *   [2019 Bolivian protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Bolivian_protests)
    *   [Police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Law_enforcement_in_Bolivia) guards outside Bolivia's presidential palace abandoned their posts and join the protest against [Evo Morales](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evo_Morales). [(Associated Press)](https://apnews.com/336592adf2524dc3a582a95ec9372f5f) [(Fox News)](https://www.foxnews.com/world/police-join-protesters-abandon-their-posts-outside-bolivias-presidential-palace)

## Disasters and accidents

    *   The bodies of three people killed by bushfires in [Australia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia) are found – two near [Glen Innes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glen_Innes,_New_South_Wales), and one at [Johns River](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Johns_River,_New_South_Wales) – as fires that have destroyed at least 150 houses continue to burn in eastern [New South Wales](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_South_Wales) and [Queensland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Queensland). [(_The Sydney Morning Herald_)](https://www.smh.com.au/national/nsw/nsw-bushfires-live-firefighters-to-assess-damage-amid-unprecedented-emergency-20191109-p538ye.html)
*   Half a million people are evacuated from the [Bangladesh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bangladesh) coastal area in preparation for the landfall of [Cyclone Bulbul](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyclone_Bulbul). [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/09/asia/cyclone-bulbul-bangladesh-eastern-india-intl/)

## Law and crime

    *   The [Supreme Court of India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supreme_Court_of_India) rules in favor of [Hindus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hindus) over a place of worship that has been the center of disputes between them and the [Muslim community](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islam_in_India) in the country. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-india-religion-temple-explainer/indian-court-rules-in-favor-of-hindus-in-explosive-row-with-muslims-idUSKBN1XJ01Z)

*   [President of Sierra Leone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Sierra_Leone) [Julius Maada Bio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Julius_Maada_Bio) calls for urgent action on [Guinea-Bissau](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guinea-Bissau) to "avoid a [civil war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Civil_war)". He makes the statement before the Chairman of [ECOWAS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ECOWAS), [Nigerien](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Niger) [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Niger) [Mahamadou Issoufou](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mahamadou_Issoufou). The "Mustang" model name, previously employed by Ford's muscle cars, could be an important asset for the new venture. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-50422965)

*   [2019 Hong Kong protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Hong_Kong_protests)

[(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-hongkong-protests/hong-kong-students-arm-themselves-for-showdown-as-police-take-breather-idUSKBN1XO06C)
*   [Japan–South Korea relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan%E2%80%93South_Korea_relations)
    *   [South Korean government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korean_government) officials announce that [Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan) and the United States are interested in renewing the [GSOMIA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan%E2%80%93South_Korea_General_Security_of_Military_Information_Agreement) pact between Japan and [South Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korea) to maintain bilateral cooperation between the two nations in defense issues. # 2019-11-15

## Business and economy

*   The [Iranian government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_the_Islamic_Republic_of_Iran) announces that, effective immediately, [petrol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gasoline) will be rationed to 60 litres per month, and prices will increase 50%. Fuel beyond the limit will cost double. Iranians take to the street to oppose the price hikes, which result from [American sanctions in response to Iran's nuclear program](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_sanctions_against_Iran). [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/ajimpact/petrol-rationing-price-hikes-iranians-surprise-191115155053008.html) [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/15/world/middleeast/iran-gasoline-prices-rations.html)

## International relations

*   [North Korean abductions of Japanese citizens](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Korean_abductions_of_Japanese_citizens), [Japan–North Korea relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan%E2%80%93North_Korea_relations)
    *   [Sakie Yokota](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yokota_family), the mother of a [Japanese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_people) girl abducted by [North Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Korea) 42 years ago at the age of 13, appeals directly to [Kim Jong-un](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kim_Jong-un) to release her and all Japanese abductees. She also decries the lack of [Japanese government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_government) action on the issue. [(NHK)](https://www3.nhk.or.jp/nhkworld/en/news/20191115_17/)
*   [Japan–South Korea relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan%E2%80%93South_Korea_relations), [Japan–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan%E2%80%93United_States_relations), [South Korea–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korea%E2%80%93United_States_relations)
    *   Japan, [South Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korea) and the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) agree to boost multilateral military cooperation and defense issues. [(Yonhap Korean Agency)](https://en.yna.co.kr/view/AEN20191115004300325)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Hong Kong protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Hong_Kong_protests)
    *   A 70-year-old bystander dies after being hit by a brick in clashes between local residents and brick-throwing [protesters](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Protester). [Police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hong_Kong_Police_Force) investigate the act as [murder](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Murder). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-china-50428704) [(_South China Morning Post_)](https://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/politics/article/3037927/hong-kong-protests-police-treat-death-70-year-old-cleaner)
    *   [Pro-Beijing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pro-Beijing) Hong Kong Justice Secretary [Teresa Cheng](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teresa_Cheng_(politician)) is "assaulted by a crowd" and "sustains an injury" in [London](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London). China's Foreign Ministry condemns the protesters. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-hongkong-protests-diplomacy/china-strongly-condemns-attack-on-hong-kong-government-official-in-london-idUSKBN1XP0BM?il=0) [(_South China Morning Post_)](https://www.scmp.com/news/china/diplomacy/article/3037830/hong-kong-justice-secretary-teresa-cheng-injured-london-while)
*   [2019 Chilean protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Chilean_protests)
    *   An agreement is signed by most of the political parties supporting a referendum in April 2020 regarding the draft of a new constitution through a [constituent convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Constituent_assembly). This will be the first time the [Constitution of Chile](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Chile) is written with popular participation. [(Cooperativa)](https://www.cooperativa.cl/noticias/pais/manifestaciones/historico-los-chilenos-definiran-en-plebiscito-si-hay-nueva/2019-11-15/012059.html)
*   [Criminal charges brought in the Special Counsel investigation (2017–2019)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criminal_charges_brought_in_the_Special_Counsel_investigation_(2017%E2%80%932019))
    *   A federal jury convicts [Roger Stone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roger_Stone) of lying to the [United States Congress](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Congress) and tampering with a witness about his efforts to learn about the anti-secrecy group [WikiLeaks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WikiLeaks)'s release of [hacked Democratic emails](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2016_Democratic_National_Committee_email_leak) in the [2016 U.S. presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2016_United_States_elections). [(_The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/public-safety/roger-stone-jury-weighs-evidence-and-a-defense-move-to-make-case-about-mueller/2019/11/15/554fff5a-06ff-11ea-8292-c46ee8cb3dce_story.html)
*   [2019 Bolivian protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Bolivian_protests)
    *   Security forces open fire on protesters in [Cochabamba](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cochabamba), killing at least five. [(CBC)](https://www.cbc.ca/news/world/bolivia-protests-deaths-1.5362104)

    *   Thousands of protestors take to the streets in [Colombia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colombia) demanding the resignation of [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Colombia) [Iván Duque Márquez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iv%C3%A1n_Duque_M%C3%A1rquez). The protests were instigated over controversial tax and labor reforms proposed by [Congress](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Congress_of_Colombia), murders of indigenous leaders, and the government’s failure to implement the [FARC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Revolutionary_Armed_Forces_of_Colombia) [peace deal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colombian_peace_process). [(_Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/the_americas/with-nationwide-strike-colombia-joins-south-americas-season-of-protest/2019/11/21/2d3adf0e-0bef-11ea-8054-289aef6e38a3_story.html)
