# 2019-11-22

## Business and economy

*   [China–United States trade war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China%E2%80%93United_States_trade_war)
    *   The U.S. [Federal Communications Commission](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Communications_Commission) (FCC) unanimously votes to label Chinese telecommunications giants [Huawei](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Huawei) and [ZTE](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ZTE) as national security risks, thereby disqualifying them from the [Universal Service Fund](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universal_Service_Fund). In a separate vote, the FCC mandates that [national wireless carriers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_United_States_wireless_communications_service_providers) remove both companies' products from their existing networks. The companies have 30 days to appeal. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-china-huawei-tech/fcc-votes-5-0-to-bar-chinas-huawei-zte-from-government-subsidy-program-idUSKBN1XW1TC)
*   [2019 Japan–South Korea trade dispute](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Japan%E2%80%93South_Korea_trade_dispute)
    *   [South Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korea) halts its [World Trade Organization](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Trade_Organization) complaint concerning [Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan)'s tightened export controls of key chemicals South Korea uses for [computer chips](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Computer_chip) and displays. [(Voice of America)](https://www.voanews.com/east-asia-pacific/south-korea-reverses-course-will-still-share-intel-japan)
*   [Amazon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amazon_(company)) files a lawsuit against the [United States Department of Defense](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Department_of_Defense) for awarding a [US$](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._dollar)10 billion [cloud computing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cloud_computing) contract to [Microsoft](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microsoft). The company had previously accused the Department of bias in their decision, given CEO [Jeff Bezos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeff_Bezos) has been a vocal critic of [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-amazon-com-pentagon-microsoft/amazon-files-lawsuit-contesting-pentagons-10-billion-cloud-contract-to-microsoft-idUSKBN1XX00M?il=0)

## Health and environment

*   [Samoa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samoa) confirms that 20 persons, mostly children, have died of [measles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Measles), and 11 more are in critical condition. Authorities recorded 1,644 cases since the outbreak began last month. [(RNZ)](https://www.rnz.co.nz/international/pacific-news/403902/samoa-measles-death-toll-hits-20-eleven-children-critical)

## International relations

*   [Chagos Archipelago sovereignty dispute](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chagos_Archipelago_sovereignty_dispute)
    *   The [United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom) misses a [United Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations) deadline to return control of the disputed [Chagos Archipelago](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chagos_Archipelago) to [Mauritius](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mauritius), prompting the [government of Mauritius](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_Mauritius) to call the UK an "illegal [colonial occupier](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colonialism)". [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-50511847)

## Law and crime

*   [Murder of Grace Millane](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Murder_of_Grace_Millane)
    *   After a three-week trial, a 27-year-old New Zealand man is found guilty of murdering 22-year-old British tourist Grace Millane in [Auckland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Auckland) in December 2018. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-essex-50512163)
*   Former [Paraguayan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paraguay) [Congresswoman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Congress_of_Paraguay) Cynthia Tarragó is arrested alongside her husband at [Newark Liberty International Airport](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Newark_Liberty_International_Airport) in [Newark, New Jersey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Newark,_New_Jersey) and charged with [money laundering](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Money_laundering), following an undercover operation from [FBI](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Bureau_of_Investigation) agents who purported to be drug traffickers. According to court documents, in addition to money laudering, Tarragó offered to [traffic drugs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Illegal_drug_trade) herself from Paraguay. [(_ABC Color_)](https://www.abc.com.py/tv/abc-noticias/2019/11/22/detienen-a-cynthia-tarrago-en-eeuu/) [(_Última Hora_)](https://www.ultimahora.com/detienen-cynthia-tarrago-eeuu-blanqueo-dinero-n2856211.html) [(_The Philadelphia Inquirer_)](https://www.inquirer.com/business/money-laundering-cocaine-marijuana-paraguay-newark-cynthia-tarrago-diaz-raimundo-va-fbu-20191122.html)

## Politics and elections

*   [2021 German federal election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Next_German_federal_election)
    *   [Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annegret_Kramp-Karrenbauer), who replaced [German Chancellor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chancellor_of_Germany) [Angela Merkel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Angela_Merkel) as leader of the [Christian Democratic Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christian_Democratic_Union_of_Germany), threatens to stand down as a chancellor candidate if her [centre-right](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Centre-right) party continues to disagree over support. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-50520902) [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/nov/22/merkel-successor-annegret-kramp-karrenbauer-back-her-or-sack-her) [(_The Telegraph_)](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2019/11/22/mini-merkel-faces-critics-back-sack-challenge/)
*   [2019 Bolivian protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Bolivian_protests), [2019 Bolivian political crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Bolivian_political_crisis)
    *   [Bolivia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bolivia)'s new [interior minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interior_minister), Arturo Murillo, files a criminal complaint against former [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Bolivia) [Evo Morales](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evo_Morales) for alleged [sedition](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sedition) and [terrorism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terrorism). [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/nov/22/bolivia-evo-morales-terrorism-sedition-interim-government) [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-bolivia-politics/bolivias-interim-government-charges-morales-with-sedition-and-terrorism-idUSKBN1XW26Y)

# 2019-11-23

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [November 2019 Syria bombings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/November_2019_Syria_bombings)
    *   A [car bomb](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Car_bomb) detonates in [Tell Abyad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tell_Abyad), [Raqqa Governorate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raqqa_Governorate), killing ten people and wounding 25 others. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-syria-security/car-bomb-kills-at-least-10-people-near-syrias-border-with-turkey-idUSKBN1XX0BS?il=0)
*   [2019 Colombian protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Colombian_protests)
    *   Three [Colombian police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Police_of_Colombia) are killed and seven wounded by a [car bomb](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Car_bomb) in [Santander de Quilichao](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Santander_de_Quilichao), [Cauca](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cauca_Department) province. [(The Guardian)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/nov/23/colombian-protests-flare-again-as-looting-erupts-in-bogota)

## Health and environment

*   [Tonga](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tonga) and [Fiji](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiji) declare a [state of emergency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/State_of_emergency) as part of an ongoing [measles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Measles) outbreak. Conditions worsen in [Samoa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samoa) where the death toll continues to rise and schools remain closed. There are 1,797 confirmed cases as of Saturday, with 153 detected on Friday alone. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-50528834)

## International relations

*   [2019 Iranian fuel protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Iranian_fuel_protests)
    *   [Iranian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran) [Vice President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vice_President_of_Iran) [Eshaq Jahangiri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eshaq_Jahangiri) warns regional states of dire consequences, claiming the protests are directly linked to the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States), [Saudi Arabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabia), and [Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-iran-gasoline-protests/iran-warns-regional-states-of-consequences-if-they-stoked-unrest-idUSKBN1XX07O)
*   [Iran–Iraq relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93Iraq_relations)
    *   The [border between](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran-Iraq_border) Iran and [Iraq](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq) reopens, after being closed for a week due to mass protests in their [respective](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Iranian_fuel_protests) [countries](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Iraqi_protests). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-iraq-iran-border/iraq-iran-border-crossing-reopens-after-week-long-closure-statement-idUSKBN1XX0BB?il=0)
*   [China–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China%E2%80%93United_States_relations)
    *   [Chinese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China) [Foreign Affairs Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foreign_Minister_of_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China) [Wang Yi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wang_Yi_(politician)) accuses the United States of being the "world's biggest destabilizing factor" and of "smear\[ing\] China everywhere" at the [G20](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/G20) meeting in [Nagoya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nagoya). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-china-usa-trade/china-attacks-u-s-at-g20-as-the-worlds-biggest-source-of-instability-idUSKBN1XX09P?il=0)
*   [Pope Francis travels to Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_pastoral_visits_of_Pope_Francis)
    *   During his 23 November to 26 November journey to [Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan), [Pope Francis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pope_Francis) visits [Tokyo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tokyo), [Nagasaki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nagasaki) and [Hiroshima](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hiroshima). The only pope to previously visit Japan was Pope John Paul II in 23–26 February 1981. [(Holy See Press Office)](https://press.vatican.va/content/salastampa/en/bollettino/pubblico/2019/10/28/191028a.html) [(Vatican News)](https://www.vaticannews.va/en/vatican-city/news/2019-11/pope-john-paul-ii-visit-japan-1981.html)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Bougainvillean independence referendum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Bougainvillean_independence_referendum)
    *   People in the [Autonomous Region of Bougainville](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Autonomous_Region_of_Bougainville) vote to choose between more [autonomy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Autonomy) within [Papua New Guinea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Papua_New_Guinea) or outright [independence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Independence). However, the [Papua New Guinea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_Papua_New_Guinea) central government will have the final say on accepting independence. [(RNZ)](https://www.rnz.co.nz/international/pacific-news/403929/expectations-high-as-bougainville-referendum-gets-underway)
*   [2019 referendum on the creation of a Sidama region](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_referendum_on_the_creation_of_a_Sidama_region)
    *   The [Ethiopian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethiopia) [electoral board](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Election_Board_of_Ethiopia) announces that the [referendum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Referendum) to grant autonomy to the [Sidama Zone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sidama_Zone) passed with 98.5% of the vote. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-ethiopia-politics/ethiopias-sidama-vote-overwhelmingly-to-form-autonomous-region-idUSKBN1XX0GR?il=0)
*   [Climate change policy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Climate_change_policy_of_the_United_States), [Harvard-Yale football game](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harvard-Yale_football_game)
    *   A non-violent protest was held at the [Yale Bowl](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yale_Bowl) during the annual [Harvard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harvard)\-[Yale](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yale) [football](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_football) game at halftime. The apparently scheduled protest included both Yale and Harvard students. The students were protesting the colleges' usage of endowments from [fossil fuel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fossil_fuel) companies. The game was delayed for about an hour. There were some arrests. [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/23/us/harvard-yale-climate-protest-trnd/index.html) [(_The New York Times_}](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/23/us/harvard-yale-game-protest.html)

## Sports

*   [2019 Copa Libertadores](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Copa_Libertadores)
    *   The premier [association football](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Association_football) club competition of South America concludes with [Brazilian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil) club [Flamengo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clube_de_Regatas_do_Flamengo) beating titleholders [River Plate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Club_Atl%C3%A9tico_River_Plate) 2-1 in [Lima](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lima)'s [Monumental Stadium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Estadio_Monumental_%22U%22). It is their first title since 1981 and second overall. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/50532892)

    *   [Police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Law_enforcement_in_the_Netherlands) report that three young people have been wounded in a stabbing on a shopping street in [The Hague](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Hague), [Netherlands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Netherlands). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-netherlands-stabbing/dutch-police-several-wounded-in-stabbing-in-the-hague-idUSKBN1Y329Y)

The attacker, [Usman Khan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Usman_Khan_(militant)), wearing a fake [explosive belt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Explosive_belt), is shot dead by [police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_Police) on the bridge. [(_Time_)](https://time.com/5741250/nato-summit-2019/)

## Law and crime

*   [Pakistani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pakistanis) [business tycoon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Business_tycoon) [Malik Riaz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malik_Riaz) agrees to surrender [£](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pound_sterling)190 million in cash and assets to the [United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom)'s [National Crime Agency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Crime_Agency), including his [Grade II listed](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Listed_building)\-[London](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London) home in [One Hyde Park](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/One_Hyde_Park). *   The [Federal Supreme Court of Switzerland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Supreme_Court_of_Switzerland) upholds a 2018 ruling that the [Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liberation_Tigers_of_Tamil_Eelam) is not a [criminal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crime_in_Sri_Lanka) group. Even though it carried out [terrorist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terrorism_in_Sri_Lanka) attacks, the [Tamil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tamils) Tigers' primary objective in the [Sri Lankan Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sri_Lankan_Civil_War) was, according to the court, to be recognised as an independent ethnic community. ## Politics and elections

    *   [Antti Rinne](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antti_Rinne) resigns as the [Prime Minister of Finland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Finland) after losing the support of [coalition](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coalition_government) partner [Centre Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Centre_Party_(Finland)) over Rinne's handling of [industrial strikes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strike_action). The [Rinne Cabinet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rinne_Cabinet) will continue as a [caretaker government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caretaker_government) until a new [government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_Finland) can be formed. *   [2020 Democratic Party presidential primaries](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Democratic_Party_presidential_primaries)
    *   [California](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/California) [Senator](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Senate) [Kamala Harris](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kamala_Harris) drops out of the presidential race, citing a lack of funds for [her campaign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kamala_Harris_2020_presidential_campaign). *   [Impeachment inquiry into Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Impeachment_inquiry_into_Donald_Trump)
    *   The [U.S. House Intelligence Committee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_House_Permanent_Select_Committee_on_Intelligence) releases a 330-page report of its impeachment inquiry saying there is "overwhelming" evidence of misconduct and obstruction of Congress by [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump). It is sent to the [U.S. House Judiciary Committee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_House_Committee_on_the_Judiciary) for review. [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2019/12/03/politics/house-intelligence-committee-report/index.html)

# 2019-12-06

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [2019 Iraqi protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Iraqi_protests)
    *   Gunmen in vehicles open fire on protesters in [Baghdad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baghdad) killing over 19 and injuring around 70 others. Three of the dead were [Iraqi police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraqi_Police). The victims were either stabbed or shot. [(AP)](https://apnews.com/2d15fae86ea3e86dcf417f1d26a3461b) [(Telegraph)](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2019/12/06/gunmen-cars-kill-least-15-injure-scores-baghdad-protests/) [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2019/12/killed-central-baghdad-assailants-fire-live-rounds-191206190824237.html)
*   [Terrorism in Kenya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terrorism_in_Kenya)
    *   At least ten people including seven [Kenyan police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenya_Police) are killed when armed gunmen ambush a bus in Kotulo, [Kenya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenya). Police suspect the Somalian Islamist group [Al-Shabaab](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Shabaab_(militant_group)) is behind the attack. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-kenya-attack/at-least-eight-killed-in-kenya-in-suspected-islamist-militant-attack-idUSKBN1YA27Z) [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/12/10-killed-kenya-bus-attack-claimed-al-shabab-191207082718077.html)
*   [Naval Air Station Pensacola shooting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naval_Air_Station_Pensacola_shooting)
    *   A shooter kills three people and injures eight more at [Naval Air Station Pensacola](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naval_Air_Station_Pensacola), [Florida](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Florida), [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States), before being shot and killed by police. [(_Pensacola News Journal_)](https://www.pnj.com/story/news/2019/12/06/breaking-active-shooter-reported-base-nas-pensacola/4351773002/)
*   [Allied Democratic Forces insurgency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allied_Democratic_Forces_insurgency)
    *   Islamists kill 17 civilians in two attacks in eastern [Democratic Republic of the Congo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democratic_Republic_of_the_Congo). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-congo-security/islamist-rebels-kill-at-least-17-in-eastern-congo-local-official-idUSKBN1YA1YJ)

## Disasters and accidents

*   A collision between a [U.S. Navy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._Navy) boat and a [U.S. Coast Guard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._Coast_Guard) boat in [Kodiak, Alaska](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kodiak,_Alaska)'s [Womens Bay](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Womens_Bay,_Alaska) injures nine, one critically. [(_Stars & Stripes_)](https://www.stripes.com/news/coast-guard/coast-guard-navy-boats-collide-in-alaska-nine-injured-1.610036)
*   A gas explosion and consecutive fire in an apartment building in [Prešov](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pre%C5%A1ov), Slovakia killed at least seven people and injured dozens. [(_Deutsche Welle_)](https://www.dw.com/en/slovakia-7-die-in-gas-explosion-dozens-injured/a-51559162) [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2019/12/07/world/europe/ap-eu-slovakia-gas-explosion.html)

## Law and crime

*   [2019 Samoa measles outbreak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Samoa_measles_outbreak)
    *   [Samoan Police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Law_enforcement_in_Samoa) arrest Edwin Tamasese, an [anti-vaccination](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vaccine_hesitancy) campaigner, for incitement against a [government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_Samoa) order. [(ABC Australia)](https://www.abc.net.au/news/2019-12-06/anti-vaxxer-charged-samoa-amid-nationwide-immunisation-drive/11772714)
*   The [United States District Court for the Central District of California](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_District_Court_for_the_Central_District_of_California) unanimously votes to throw out a [US$](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._dollar)190 million [defamation suit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Defamation) against entrepreneur [Elon Musk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elon_Musk) by [Tham Luang cave rescuer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tham_Luang_cave_rescue) Vernon Unsworth. The lawsuit, considered to be the first major suit by a private individual over comments made on [Twitter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Twitter), was filed over Musk calling him a “[pedo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pedophilia) guy” in a Tweet after Unsworth criticized his role in the rescue. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-musk-lawsuit/tesla-boss-elon-musk-wins-defamation-trial-over-his-pedo-guy-tweet-idUSKBN1YA13U?il=0)

# 2019-12-07

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [2019 Iraqi protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Iraqi_protests)
    *   A drone attacks the home of prominent [Shia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shia_Islam) cleric [Muqtada al-Sadr](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Muqtada_al-Sadr), leaving no casualties and causing minimal damage. The attack follows a shooting against protestors in [Baghdad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baghdad) yesterday. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-iraq-protests-baghdad/rocket-hits-iraqi-clerics-home-following-deadly-baghdad-attack-idUSKBN1YB09W)

    *   The [Taliban](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taliban) announce that the peace talks with the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) resumed "from where they stopped" in September. [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2019/12/07/politics/us-taliban-peace-talks-resume-doha-qatar/index.html)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [2018–19 Southern Africa drought](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018%E2%80%9319_Southern_Africa_drought)
    *   An unprecedented [drought](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drought) in [Zimbabwe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zimbabwe), which is considered the worst in a century, causes the [Victoria Falls](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Victoria_Falls) [waterfall](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Waterfall) on the [Zambezi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zambezi) river to almost completely cease flowing. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/dec/07/victoria-falls-dries-to-a-trickle-after-worst-drought-in-a-century)
*   A woman is killed and 18 other people injured when a bus crashes with a truck in [Milan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Milan), [Italy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italy). [(Ansa)](http://www.ansa.it/lombardia/notizie/2019/12/07/scontro-bus-camion-rifiuti-feriti_b566a1a7-0fe6-4eeb-b062-052f928302e6.html)

## International relations

*   [Iran–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93United_States_relations)
    *   In an act of cooperation that is rare in recent years, [Iran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran) releases [Princeton](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Princeton_University) PhD candidate [Wang Xiyue](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xiyue_Wang) while the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) releases [stem cell](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stem_cell) researcher Massoud Soleimani in a [prisoner exchange](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prisoner_exchange). Both [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) and [Iranian Foreign Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs_(Iran)) [Mohammad Javad Zarif](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohammad_Javad_Zarif) thank the [Swiss](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Switzerland) government for facilitating the swap. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-iran-usa-prisoners/united-states-and-iran-swap-prisoners-in-rare-act-of-cooperation-idUSKBN1YB08X)

## Law and crime

*   [Rohingya genocide](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rohingya_genocide)
    *   [Myanmar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myanmar)'s [Aung San Suu Kyi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aung_San_Suu_Kyi) travels to [The Hague](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Hague) where she is expected to face [genocide](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genocide) charges against her government for the alleged crimes committed against the [Rohingya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rohingya) [Muslim](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islam_in_Myanmar) minority, in what is described as one of the most-high profile international legal cases in a generation. [_(Telegraph)_](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2019/12/07/aung-san-suu-kyi-fight-genocide-charges-hague/)
*   Two [indigenous](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indigenous_peoples_in_Brazil) leaders from the [Guajajara](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guajajara) tribe are shot dead in a [drive-by shooting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drive-by_shooting) on a federal highway in [Brazil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil)'s [Maranhão](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maranh%C3%A3o) state. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/dec/08/amazon-indigenous-leaders-killed-in-brazil-drive-by-shooting)

# 2019-12-08

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Saudi Arabian-led intervention in Yemen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabian-led_intervention_in_Yemen), [Yemeni Crisis (2011–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yemeni_Crisis_(2011%E2%80%93present))
    *   [Sudanese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sudan) [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Sudan) [Abdalla Hamdok](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abdalla_Hamdok) says the [government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_Sudan) has reduced the number of [Sudanese Armed Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sudanese_Armed_Forces) troops in [Yemen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yemen) from 15,000 to 5,000, saying the conflict "can no longer be solved militarily". [(Reuters)](https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-sudan-politics/sudan-says-it-has-reduced-troops-in-yemen-to-5000-idUKKBN1YC0HX?il=0)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [2019 Delhi factory fire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Delhi_factory_fire)
    *   Forty-three workers are killed in a fire in a factory in [Delhi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Delhi), [India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/India). [(BBC)](https://bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-50703659)

## Law and crime

*   [Women's rights in Saudi Arabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Women%27s_rights_in_Saudi_Arabia)
    *   The [Ministry of Municipal and Rural Affairs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ministry_of_Municipal_and_Rural_Affairs_(Saudi_Arabia)) of [Saudi Arabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabia) announces that [gender-segregated](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sex_segregation) entrances are no longer mandatory for restaurants. This change is not considered compulsory however, and there are no announcements for similar changes to other public institutions. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/12/saudi-arabia-ends-gender-segregated-entrances-restaurants-191208171725619.html)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Hong Kong protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Hong_Kong_protests)
    *   After a massive march in the city, [Civil Human Rights Front](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Civil_Human_Rights_Front) leader and [Rainbow of Hong Kong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rainbow_of_Hong_Kong) activist [Jimmy Sham](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jimmy_Sham) says "it is the last chance for [Carrie Lam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carrie_Lam) to listen to the people". [(_Economic Times India_)](https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/international/world-news/hong-kong-protesters-mark-half-a-year-of-protest-with-mammoth-rally/articleshow/72430246.cms)
*   [2019 Sammarinese general election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Sammarinese_general_election)
    *   Citizens of [San Marino](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Marino) are called to the polls in the first round to elect the 60 members of the [Grand and General Council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_and_General_Council). [(_Il Resto del Carlino_)](https://www.ilrestodelcarlino.it/rimini/politica/elezioni-san-marino-2019-1.4927174)
*   [Politics of Finland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Politics_of_Finland)
    *   The [Social Democratic Party of Finland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Social_Democratic_Party_of_Finland) selects [Minister of Transport and Communications](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minister_of_Transport_and_Communications_(Finland)) [Sanna Marin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sanna_Marin) for [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Finland), following the resignation of [Antti Rinne](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antti_Rinne). If confirmed, she will become Finland's youngest ever Prime Minister and the world's youngest serving Prime Minister at age 34. [(Reuters)](https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-finland-government-pm/finlands-social-democrats-name-marin-to-be-youngest-ever-prime-minister-idUKKBN1YC0JQ)
*   [2019 Lebanese protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Lebanese_protests)
    *   Businessman Samir Khatib withdraws his candidacy for the [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Lebanon) position after failing to secure enough votes from the [Sunni Muslim](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lebanese_Sunni_Muslims) bloc last week. This leaves the ousted [Saad Hariri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saad_Hariri) as the only potential candidate. Massive protests are formed outside the [Parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parliament_of_Lebanon) building in response to Hariri’s possible return. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/12/lebanon-hariri-emerges-pm-candidate-khatib-withdraws-191208192459108.html)

# 2019-12-10

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Somali Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Somali_Civil_War_(2009%E2%80%93present))
    *   Near the [Villa Somalia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Villa_Somalia) [presidential palace](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presidential_palace) in [Mogadishu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mogadishu), five [al-Shabaab](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Shabaab_(militant_group)) gunmen attack a SYL hotel. Six people are killed: A police officer, the shooters, and three people inside a [kosher](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kosher_foods) [supermarket](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supermarket), which the shooters [barricaded](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barricade) themselves in. Police describe the shooting as an "[ambush](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ambush)". *   [Iranian involvement in the Syrian Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iranian_involvement_in_the_Syrian_Civil_War)
    *   Satellite images spot a tunnel system being dug at [Imam Ali military base](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Imam_Ali_military_base) in eastern [Syria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syria), which is controlled by the [Iranian military](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armed_Forces_of_the_Islamic_Republic_of_Iran); Western intelligence believe the tunnels are being constructed to house their missiles. [(Fox News)](https://www.foxnews.com/world/iran-underground-tunnel-missile-storage)

## International relations

*   [Myanmar–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myanmar%E2%80%93United_States_relations)
    *   The [United States Department of the Treasury](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Department_of_the_Treasury) blacklists four top [Burmese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myanmar) [military](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tatmadaw) leaders, including [Commander-in-Chief](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commander-in-Chief_of_Defence_Services) [Min Aung Hlaing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Min_Aung_Hlaing), for their role in the [persecution of Rohingya Muslims](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Persecution_of_Muslims_in_Myanmar) and other minorities. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-myanmar-sanctions/u-s-blacklists-head-of-myanmar-military-for-alleged-rights-abuses-against-rohingya-idUSKBN1YE1XU?il=0)

## Law and crime

*   [Ostrava hospital attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ostrava_hospital_attack)
    *   In [Ostrava](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ostrava), [Czech Republic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Czech_Republic), a man [opens fire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mass_shooting) in a hospital's waiting room, killing six people before fleeing, then shooting himself dead. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-czech-shooting/gunman-kills-six-in-czech-hospital-before-shooting-himself-idUSKBN1YE0P4)

*   _[Rohingya genocide case](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rohingya_genocide_case)_
    *   At the [International Court of Justice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Court_of_Justice), [The Gambia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Gambia) presents charges against the government of [Myanmar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myanmar) and its leader [Aung San Suu Kyi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aung_San_Suu_Kyi), who traveled to appear in the court. According to the prosecution, the Burmese government is responsible for mass rapes, widespread arson and killings of Rohingya children, among other crimes. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-myanmar-rohingya-world-court/as-suu-kyi-looks-on-gambia-details-mass-rapes-killings-in-myanmar-idUSKBN1YE0HL?il=0)
*   [2017 Saint Petersburg Metro bombing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2017_Saint_Petersburg_Metro_bombing)

# 2019-12-18

## Armed conflict and attack

*   [Boko Haram insurgency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boko_Haram_insurgency)
    *   [Boko Haram](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boko_Haram) militants open fire on civilians, killing 15 and wounding five others in a fishing village in [Chad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chad). 13 others were missing after the attack. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/12/chad-dozen-killed-boko-haram-attack-191218140312791.html)
*   Gunmen kill two [police officers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Law_enforcement_in_Pakistan) escorting a [polio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polio) [vaccination](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vaccination) team in [Lower Dir District](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lower_Dir_District), [Khyber Pakhtunkhwa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khyber_Pakhtunkhwa), [Pakistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pakistan). [(National Post)](https://nationalpost.com/pmn/health-pmn/gunmen-in-pakistan-kill-two-police-escorting-polio-vaccinators)

## Arts and culture

*   [Ilham Tohti](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ilham_Tohti), an [Uyghur](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uyghur_people) [economist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Economist) serving a [life sentence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Life_sentence) for his criticisms of [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China)’s policies in [Xinjiang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xinjiang), is awarded this year’s [Sakharov Prize](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sakharov_Prize). [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/12/jailed-uighur-economist-ilham-tohti-receive-sakharov-prize-191216064925850.html)

## International relations

*   Pakistan pulls out of an international summit of [Muslim nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Muslim_world) in [Kuala Lumpur](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kuala_Lumpur), [Malaysia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malaysia), scheduled to start this Thursday. [Foreign Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs_(Pakistan)) [Shah Mahmood Qureshi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shah_Mahmood_Qureshi) said it was done after [Saudi Arabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabia) and the [United Arab Emirates](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Arab_Emirates) expressed concern that the summit was to establish a rival bloc to the [Organisation of Islamic Cooperation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Organisation_of_Islamic_Cooperation). [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/12/pakistan-pulls-malaysia-summit-muslim-nations-191218082917256.html)

## Law and crime

*   The [Cabinet of Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cabinet_of_Germany) proposes to ban [conversion therapy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conversion_therapy) for both [transgender](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transgender) and [gay](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gay) people. The proposal was expanded to include people between the ages of 16 and 18. [(Deutsche Welle)](https://www.dw.com/en/germanys-cabinet-approves-ban-on-gay-transgender-conversion-therapy/a-51717750)

## Politics and elections

*   [Impeachment of Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Impeachment_of_Donald_Trump)
    *   The [United States House of Representatives](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_House_of_Representatives) votes largely along party lines to [impeach](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Impeachment_in_the_United_States) [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) for [abuse of power](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abuse_of_power) and [obstruction of Congress](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Obstruction_of_Congress). Trump becomes the third American president to be impeached by the House, after [Andrew Johnson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Impeachment_of_Andrew_Johnson) and [Bill Clinton](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Impeachment_of_Bill_Clinton). His impeachment proceedings continue on to the [Senate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Senate), which will give them a final verdict and decide whether or not he should be removed from office. [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/18/us/politics/impeachment-vote.html?action=click&module=Spotlight&pgtype=Homepage)

## Science and technology

*   [Cosmic Vision](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cosmic_Vision)
    *   [Arianespace](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arianespace) successfully launches the [European Space Agency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Space_Agency)'s [CHEOPS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CHEOPS) [space telescope](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Space_telescope) from [Guiana Space Centre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guiana_Space_Centre). The European observatory will search for new [exoplanets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exoplanet) and will be able to study an exoplanet's composition and internal structure. The launch also included [OPS-SAT](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OPS-SAT), an ESA [CubeSat](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CubeSat). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-50804258)

## Sports

*   [2019 Catalan protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Catalan_protests)
    *   Despite the boycott attempt by [Democratic Tsunami](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democratic_Tsunami), [El Clásico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/El_Cl%C3%A1sico) is played in [Camp Nou](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Camp_Nou), [Barcelona](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barcelona), with important security measures. [(Ruptly)](https://ruptly.tv/en/events/201912182042-LIVE2242)
    *   The first clashes between [Mossos d'Esquadra](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mossos_d%27Esquadra), [Boixos Nois](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boixos_Nois) and protestors occur outside the stadium, leaving 9 arrested and 70 injured. [(_El País_)](https://elpais.com/ccaa/2019/12/18/catalunya/1576691270_224054.html) [(_Marca_)](https://www.marca.com/en/football/barcelona/2019/12/18/5dfa844022601de4518b45bf.html) [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-50845732) [(_El Mundo_)](https://www.elmundo.es/deportes/futbol/primera-division/2019/12/18/5dfaaa6021efa0892f8b4643.html)

# 2019-12-20

## Armed conflict and attacks

*   [Syrian Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Civil_War)
    *   Fighting resumes in rebel-held northwestern [Syria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syria), as [government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_Syria) forces capture four villages by making their first large-scale push against rebel groups since the ceasefire that ended the [2019 northwestern Syria offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northwestern_Syria_offensive_(April%E2%80%93August_2019)) earlier this year. [(ABC News)](https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/syrian-troops-make-push-rebel-held-northwest-idlib-67856263)
*   [Citizenship Amendment Act protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Citizenship_Amendment_Act_protests)
    *   Further clashes between protesters and [police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Law_enforcement_in_India) in the northern [state](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/States_and_union_territories_of_India) of [Uttar Pradesh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uttar_Pradesh) leaves six people dead. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/12/killed-india-anti-citizenship-law-protests-rumble-191220171811195.html)

## Business and economy

*   [Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan) announces it will raise [military](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan_Self-Defense_Forces) spending (1.1%) for an eighth consecutive year to a record high as it invests in [ballistic missile](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ballistic_missile) and air defence to counter a perceived threat from [North Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Korea) and [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-japan-economy-budget-defence/japan-government-approves-eighth-straight-defense-spending-hike-to-record-high-idUSKBN1YO05N)

## International relations

*   [Israeli–Palestinian conflict](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israeli%E2%80%93Palestinian_conflict)
    *   [Chief Prosecutor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecutor_of_the_International_Criminal_Court) of the [International Criminal Court](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Criminal_Court) [Fatou Bensouda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fatou_Bensouda) announces she will launch a full investigation into allegations of [war crimes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_crime) in the [Palestinian territories](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palestinian_territories). [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/12/icc-investigate-alleged-war-crimes-palestinian-territories-191220143949348.html)
*   [Iran–Japan relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93Japan_relations)
    *   [Iranian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran) [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Iran) [Hassan Rouhani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hassan_Rouhani) meets with [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Japan) [Shinzō Abe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shinz%C5%8D_Abe) in [Tokyo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tokyo) to discuss renewing the [Iranian nuclear deal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joint_Comprehensive_Plan_of_Action). Rouhani is the first Iranian president to visit Japan in over 19 years. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/12/iran-rouhani-visits-japan-nuclear-deal-impasse-191220153826601.html)
*   [Foreign relations of Saudi Arabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foreign_relations_of_Saudi_Arabia)
    *   [Twitter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Twitter) bans almost 6,000 accounts, alleging that they were "amplifying messages favourable to Saudi authorities" in a [Saudi state](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabia)\-backed coordination. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-50872118)

## Law and crime

*   In _Urgenda Foundation v. State of the Netherlands_, the [Supreme Court of the Netherlands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supreme_Court_of_the_Netherlands) upholds a 2015 ruling that "protection from the potentially devastating effects of [climate change](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Climate_change)" is a [human right](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_rights), ordering the [Dutch government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cabinet_of_the_Netherlands) to cut [greenhouse gas emissions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greenhouse_gas#Direct_greenhouse_gas_emissions) by at least 25% by the end of 2020 compared to 1990 levels. [(climatecasechart.com)](http://climatecasechart.com/non-us-case/urgenda-foundation-v-kingdom-of-the-netherlands/) [(AP)](https://apnews.com/5534fe18ac5352ba43c74c9a64d6a20a)

## Politics and elections

*   [Brexit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit)
    *   The [House of Commons of the United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_of_Commons_of_the_United_Kingdom) votes 358–234 to pass the [government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_the_United_Kingdom)'s [Brexit withdrawal agreement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit_withdrawal_agreement) for the [United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom) to leave the [European Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Union) on 31 January 2020. The bill will now head to the [House of Lords](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_of_Lords) for final approval. The bill also rules out extending trade talks with the EU beyond 31 December 2020, known as the "transition period". [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-50870939)

## Science and technology

*   [Boeing Orbital Flight Test](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boeing_Orbital_Flight_Test)
    *   An [Atlas V N22](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atlas_V#Variants) rocket successfully launches the first space-faring [Boeing Starliner](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boeing_CST-100_Starliner) spacecraft during the [Boe-OFT](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boeing_Orbital_Flight_Test) mission. However, an issue with the spacecraft's [mission elapsed time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mission_elapsed_time) clock immediately after launch causes the premature depletion of the spacecraft's attitude control fuel, precluding the spacecraft's planned rendezvous with the [International Space Station](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Space_Station). An early reentry and landing of the spacecraft at the [White Sands Missile Range](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White_Sands_Missile_Range) is planned for 22 December. [(NPR)](https://www.npr.org/2019/12/20/790098677/in-uncrewed-test-boeings-starliner-capsule-fails-to-reach-space-station)

# 2019-12-21

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Somali Civil War (2009–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Somali_Civil_War_(2009%E2%80%93present))
    *   A [suicide attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suicide_attack) by [car bomb](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Car_bomb) in [Galkayo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Galkayo), [Somalia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Somalia), kills at least seven [civilians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Civilian), though the death toll is expected to rise according to military officials. According to a military spokesman, the suicide bomber tried to enter a hotel compound but failed and hit a military pickup. No group has claimed responsibility yet. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-somalia-attack-galkayo/suicide-bomb-outside-somali-hotel-kills-at-least-seven-military-idUSKBN1YP0KT)
*   [Islamic insurgency in the Maghreb (2002–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_insurgency_in_the_Maghreb_(2002%E2%80%93present)), [Operation Barkhane](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Barkhane)
    *   During his visit to [West Africa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/West_Africa), [French President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_France) [Emmanuel Macron](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emmanuel_Macron) says that French forces killed 33 [Islamist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamism) militants in central [Mali](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mali) earlier that day. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/dec/21/french-forces-kill-33-islamic-extremists-in-mali-says-macron)
*   [Libyan Crisis (2011–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libyan_Crisis_(2011%E2%80%93present)), [Libya–Turkey relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libya%E2%80%93Turkey_relations)
    *   The [Libyan Coast Guard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libyan_Coast_Guard) loyal to [Field marshal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Field_marshal_(Libya)) [Khalifa Haftar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khalifa_Haftar) seizes a [Grenada](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grenada)\-flagged ship with a [Turkish](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turks) crew off the coast of [Derna, Libya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Derna,_Libya), according to a spokesman for the [Libyan National Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libyan_National_Army). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-libya-security-turkey/eastern-libyan-forces-seize-ship-with-a-turkish-crew-spokesman-idUSKBN1YP0LW)

## Business and economy

*   [Nord Stream 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nord_Stream_2) says it will finish construction "as soon as possible" after a contractor suspends pipe-laying work due to U.S. sanctions on the Russian gas pipeline to Europe. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-russia-nord-stream-completion/nord-stream-2-to-press-on-with-europe-gas-pipe-despite-u-s-sanctions-idUSKBN1YP061)
*   [Russia–Ukraine relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia%E2%80%93Ukraine_relations)
    *   [Russia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia) and [Ukraine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukraine) reach a new five-year agreement on gas transit. [(AP)](https://apnews.com/5025492604b2378ef41e5e040351814c)

## Disasters and accidents

*   A fire at an apartment building in [Las Vegas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Las_Vegas), [Nevada](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nevada), [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States), kills six people and injures thirteen others. [(Associated Press)](https://www.abc12.com/content/news/Fire-in-Las-Vegas-apartment-complex-kills-6-injures-13-566405781.html)
*   A bus collides with a truck near [Gualán](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gual%C3%A1n), [Guatemala](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guatemala), killing at least 21 people including seven children, according to the [Guatemalan Public Ministry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ministries_of_Guatemala). [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2019/12/21/americas/guatemala-bus-crash/index.html)

## Law and crime

*   [Censorship in Pakistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Censorship_in_Pakistan), [Blasphemy in Pakistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blasphemy_in_Pakistan), [Capital punishment in Pakistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capital_punishment_in_Pakistan)
    *   A court in [Multan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multan), [Punjab](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Punjab,_Pakistan), [Pakistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pakistan), sentences [university](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University) [professor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Professor) [Junaid Hafeez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Junaid_Hafeez) to death for [blasphemy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blasphemy) – verbal and on [Facebook](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Facebook). [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/12/pakistani-academic-junaid-hafeez-sentenced-death-blasphemy-191221091139428.html)
*   The [Royal Canadian Mounted Police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Royal_Canadian_Mounted_Police) arrest two suspects after they allegedly made online [death threats](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Death_threat) to [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Canada) [Justin Trudeau](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Justin_Trudeau). Trudeau had to wear a [bulletproof vest](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bulletproof_vest) during a visit to [Mississauga, Ontario](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mississauga,_Ontario), due to the threats made during his electoral campaign. [(Yahoo! News Canada)](https://ca.news.yahoo.com/rcmp-arrests-2-alleged-online-184209881.html)

# 2019-12-22

## Armed conflict and attacks

*   [Crisis in Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crisis_in_Venezuela)
    *   Attackers raid a [military](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Bolivarian_Armed_Forces_of_Venezuela) facility in the southern state of [Bolívar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bol%C3%ADvar_(state)), killing one soldier and stealing weapons. Authorities say the weapons are recovered and opposition-linked suspects are arrested. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-venezuela-military/southern-venezuela-military-facility-raided-one-soldier-dead-officials-idUSKBN1YQ0M9)

## Business and economy

*   [British](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom) retailer [Tesco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tesco) suspends operations at a factory in [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China) after the _[Sunday Times](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunday_Times)_ newspaper reports that a six-year-old in [London](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London) found a message from [Shanghai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shanghai) prisoners calling for help and urging whoever finds the message to alert a [human rights organisation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_rights_organisation), with a link to the author of the story, hidden inside a pack of [charity Christmas cards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charity_Christmas_card). Tesco says that it has a policy against using [prison labour](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prison_labour). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-50883161)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [2019–20 Australian bushfire season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_Australian_bushfire_season)
    *   [Fire and Rescue NSW](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fire_and_Rescue_NSW) firefighters gain access to previously cut-off towns and settlements by [bushfires](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bushfires_in_Australia) in [New South Wales](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_South_Wales), taking advantage of cooler weather. The small town of [Balmoral](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Balmoral,_New_South_Wales_(Southern_Highlands)) is reported as being destroyed with NSW Premier [Gladys Berejiklian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gladys_Berejiklian) saying there's "not much left" of the town. [(_Daily Telegraph_)](https://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/news/nsw/black-christmas-record-number-of-fireys-battle-terrifying-blazes/news-story/a8c4f2e3fbc15b85b9dc98f237b3605f) [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-australia-bushfires/australian-firefighters-access-badly-burned-towns-pm-defends-climate-policies-idUSKBN1YP0MG)

## Law and crime

*   A riot at a [maximum security](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maximum_security) [prison](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prison) in [El Porvenir, Atlántida](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/El_Porvenir,_Atl%C3%A1ntida), [Honduras](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Honduras) leaves at least 16 inmates dead, according to Honduran authorities. The riot comes just two days after another riot killed 18 inmates at a prison in the town of [Tela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tela). [(AP)](https://apnews.com/796606438edfbd2d5a79a7e200aa18f1)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Afghan presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Afghan_presidential_election)
    *   [Afghanistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghanistan)'s incumbent [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Afghanistan) [Ashraf Ghani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ashraf_Ghani) wins a slim majority of the votes in a September 28 election, delayed preliminary results showed after a poll that plunged the country into political crisis and was marred by allegations of fraud. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-afghanistan-election/afghanistans-ghani-wins-slim-majority-of-presidential-vote-in-preliminary-results-idUSKBN1YQ054)
*   [2019 Croatian presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Croatian_presidential_election)
    *   Citizens of [Croatia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Croatia) cast their votes in the latest [presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elections_in_Croatia). [(DW)](https://www.dw.com/en/croatians-head-to-presidential-polls-in-tight-race/a-51770348)
*   [2019 Hong Kong protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Hong_Kong_protests)
    *   Over a thousand protestors march in the [financial district](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central,_Hong_Kong) of [Hong Kong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hong_Kong) to show solidarity with [Uyghur](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uyghurs) [Muslims](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islam_in_China) in [Xinjiang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xinjiang). A dozen [police officers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hong_Kong_Police_Force) clash with the crowd to disperse them. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-hongkong-protests/clashes-as-police-try-to-clear-hong-kong-protesters-after-uighur-support-rally-idUSKBN1YQ076)

## Science and technology

*   [Boeing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boeing)'s unmanned [CST-100 Starliner](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boeing_CST-100_Starliner) crew capsule successfully reenters the atmosphere and lands at [White Sands Missile Range](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White_Sands_Missile_Range) in [New Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Mexico), [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States), after a failed rendezvous with the [International Space Station](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Space_Station). [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/science/2019/dec/22/nasa-boeing-starliner-capsule-lands-safely-new-mexico)

# 2019-12-24

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [War in Afghanistan (2001–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_in_Afghanistan_(2001%E2%80%93present))
    *   [Taliban](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taliban) insurgents ambush an [Afghan National Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghan_National_Army) [checkpoint](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Security_checkpoint), killing 15 members of the security forces. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-afghanistan-attack/taliban-kill-15-in-attack-on-afghan-security-checkpoint-local-officials-idUSKBN1YS0K2)
*   [Syrian Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Civil_War), [Northwestern Syria offensive (November 2019–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northwestern_Syria_offensive_(November_2019%E2%80%93present))
    *   The [Syrian Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Army) continues its offensive in southern [Idlib Governorate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idlib_Governorate) towards the key rebel-held city of [Ma'arrat al-Nu'man](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ma%27arrat_al-Nu%27man), capturing several towns and villages, including [Jarjnaz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jarjnaz) and [Sarman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sarman). Around 30,000 [civilians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Civilian) have fled the area in recent days, according to the [Syrian Observatory for Human Rights](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Observatory_for_Human_Rights). [(Channel News Asia)](https://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/world/syria-regime-forces-surround-turkish-army-post-in-idlib--12207822)
    *   A war monitor reports that eight people—including five children—were killed after a missile struck a school in [Jobas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jobas), [Idlib District](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idlib_District), used as a shelter for displaced civilians. Opposition activists blame [Russia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia). [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/12/children-killed-syria-missile-hits-school-191224115623082.html)
*   [Arbinda attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arbinda_attack)
    *   Thirty-five civilians are dead and six others are injured after [jihadists](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jihadists) stormed the town of [Arbinda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arbinda), [Soum Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soum_Province), [Burkina Faso](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burkina_Faso), and its military base, killing seven [soldiers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burkina_Faso_Armed_Forces). Eighty militants were also killed. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-50908880)
*   [Boko Haram insurgency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boko_Haram_insurgency)
    *   Gunmen attacked the Christian village of [Chibok](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chibok), killing seven [Christians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christianity). It is believed the attack was targeted for [Christmas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christmas) to send a message. [(VOA News)](https://www.voanews.com/africa/7-killed-nigeria-jihadist-attack-christmas-eve)

## Disasters and accidents

*   A bus plunges into a [ravine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ravine) in [South Sumatra](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Sumatra), [Indonesia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indonesia), killing at least 25 people. [(Sky News)](https://news.sky.com/story/sumatra-bus-crash-25-killed-after-262ft-ravine-plunge-11894592)

## International relations

*   [United States–Zambia relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States%E2%80%93Zambia_relations), [LGBT rights in Zambia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_Zambia)
    *   Sources report that the [U.S.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) has recalled its [ambassador to Zambia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Ambassador_to_Zambia) after a row over a conviction of men who were sentenced to prison in [Zambia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zambia) for consensual [homosexual acts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gay_sexual_practices). [President of Zambia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Zambia) [Edgar Lungu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edgar_Lungu) declared ambassador [Daniel Lewis Foote](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daniel_Lewis_Foote) _[persona non grata](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Persona_non_grata)_ because he had criticized the verdict while accusing Zambia of not actively prosecuting misappropriation of [donor aid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aid). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-50901537)

## Politics and elections

*   [2019 Iraqi protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Iraqi_protests)
    *   The [Council of Representatives](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Council_of_Representatives_of_Iraq) passes a series of electoral laws to placate protestors. The laws will allow voters to [select individuals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Single-member_district) rather than use [party lists](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Party-list_proportional_representation), and the candidates will represent [electoral districts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electoral_district) rather than [provinces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Governorates_of_Iraq). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-iraq-protests/iraq-passes-electoral-reforms-but-deadlock-remains-idUSKBN1YS157?il=0)
*   Thousands of [Ethiopian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethiopia) [Muslims](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islam_in_Ethiopia) march across the country in response to attacks last Friday that saw four [mosques](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mosque) and multiple Muslim-owned businesses burned in the [Amhara Region](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amhara_Region). [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/12/ethiopian-muslims-protest-mosques-burned-191224141944689.html)

# 2019-12-26

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Libyan Civil War (2014–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libyan_Civil_War_(2014%E2%80%93present)), [Libya–Turkey relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libya%E2%80%93Turkey_relations)
    *   [Turkish](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey) [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Turkey) [Recep Tayyip Erdoğan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Recep_Tayyip_Erdo%C4%9Fan) announces he will send [troops](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkish_Armed_Forces) to [Libya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libya) to help the internationally-recognized [Tripoli](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tripoli)\-based [Government of National Accord](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_National_Accord) after they requested support. He plans to submit his motion to the [Grand National Assembly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_National_Assembly_of_Turkey) on January 7 for approval. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/12/erdogan-announces-plan-send-troops-libya-191226090214331.html)
*   [Insurgency in the Maghreb](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Insurgency_in_the_Maghreb_(2002%E2%80%93present))
    *   Fourteen [Nigerien soldiers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Niger_Armed_Forces) are killed by heavily armed militant gunmen who ambushed the convoy in the [Tillabéri Region](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tillab%C3%A9ri_Region) of [Niger](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Niger). [(France24)](https://www.france24.com/en/20191226-niger-authorities-say-14-troops-killed-during-ambush-g5-sahel-force-west-africa)

## Law and crime

*   [Capital punishment in Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capital_punishment_in_Japan)
    *   [Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan) [executes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hanging#Japan) a foreigner for the first time since the disclosure of details of its sentences began in 2007. He was a [Chinese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_people_in_Japan) man convicted of killing a family of four. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-japan-deathpenalty/japan-executes-first-foreigner-in-years-a-chinese-man-who-killed-a-family-idUSKBN1YU07N) [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-50916494)
*   [Censorship in Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Censorship_in_Turkey)
    *   The [Constitutional Court of Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Constitutional_Court_of_Turkey) orders the immediate lifting of the [block of Wikipedia in Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Block_of_Wikipedia_in_Turkey), ruling it a [violation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_rights#Violations) of the [freedom of expression](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freedom_of_expression). In response to the news, Wikipedia co-founder [Jimmy Wales](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jimmy_Wales) says, "Welcome back, Turkey!" [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/dec/26/turkish-court-wikipedia-block-lifted)
*   [2020 Ivorian general election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Ivorian_general_election)
    *   In [Ivory Coast](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ivory_Coast), former rebel leader, prime minister and presidential candidate for next year's general election, [Guillaume Soro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guillaume_Soro), could face prison for life over an alleged [coup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coup) plot that involved amassing weapons, says the country's public prosecutor. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-ivorycoast-politics/ivory-coast-says-presidential-candidate-soro-plotted-a-coup-idUSKBN1YU14A?il=0)
*   A court in [Morocco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morocco) sentences a man to four years in prison for insulting the [king](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/King_of_Morocco). Authorities also arrest a [Twitter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Twitter) user for criticizing the long prison terms given to those who protest. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-morocco-trial/morocco-jails-one-man-detains-another-over-criticism-of-authorities-on-social-media-idUSKBN1YU16M)

## Politics and elections

*   [Citizenship Amendment Act protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Citizenship_Amendment_Act_protests)
    *   [Chief Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chief_Minister) of [Uttar Pradesh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uttar_Pradesh) [Yogi Adityanath](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yogi_Adityanath) threatens to confiscate property from more than 200 people, mostly [Muslims](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islam_in_India), allegedly to pay for damages caused by protesters. The northern [Indian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/India) [state](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/States_and_union_territories_of_India) has seen the most violence from the protests, with 18 out of the 25 killings happening there. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/12/indian-state-warns-law-protesters-confiscate-property-191226111207708.html)
*   [Freedom of religion in Montenegro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freedom_of_religion_in_Montenegro)
    *   Hundreds of protesters, mostly consisting of supporters of the pro-[Serbia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serbia) opposition bloc, march in [Podgorica](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Podgorica), [Montenegro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Montenegro), to protest a proposed law that would require [religious communities](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Religion_in_Montenegro) to provide proof of property ownership from before the [creation of Yugoslavia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Creation_of_Yugoslavia) in 1918. Protesters claim the law unfairly targets the predominant [Serbian Orthodox Church](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serbian_Orthodox_Church). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-montenegro-protest/serbs-protest-in-montenegro-ahead-of-vote-on-religious-law-idUSKBN1YU0WC?il=0)
*   [2020 Israeli legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Israeli_legislative_election)
    *   [Israeli](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel) [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Israel) [Benjamin Netanyahu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benjamin_Netanyahu) survives a primary challenge from former [Education Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ministry_of_Education_(Israel)) [Gideon Sa'ar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gideon_Sa%27ar) with 72% of the vote. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/dec/26/israel-voting-under-way-in-likud-primary-seen-as-threat-to-netanyahu)
*   [2019 Iraqi protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Iraqi_protests)
    *   [Iraqi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq) [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Iraq) [Barham Salih](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barham_Salih) rejects the nomination of [Basra](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basra_Governorate) governor [Asaad Al Eidani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asaad_Al_Eidani) for [Prime Minister of Iraq](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Iraq), stating that protesters will also oppose him due to his connections with [Iranian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran)\-backed [parties](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_political_parties_in_Iraq). As the [constitution](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Iraq) doesn't give him the power to officially veto candidates, Salih threatens to resign instead. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/12/iraq-president-threatens-quit-pm-nominee-191226132315483.html)

# 2019-12-30

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [December 2019 Mogadishu bombing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/December_2019_Mogadishu_bombing)
    *   [Al-Shabaab](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Shabaab_(militant_group)), an ally of [Al-Qaeda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Qaeda), claims responsibility for the attack in [Mogadishu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mogadishu), Somalia, that killed nearly 90 people. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-somalia-blast/al-qaeda-ally-claims-responsibility-for-somalia-blast-that-killed-90-people-idUSKBN1YY16C)
*   [Allied Democratic Forces insurgency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allied_Democratic_Forces_insurgency)
    *   [ADF](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allied_Democratic_Forces) militants kill twenty-two people in eastern [Democratic Republic of the Congo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democratic_Republic_of_the_Congo). They were all hacked with machetes and many also went missing in the attack. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/12/rebels-hack-civilians-death-eastern-drc-attack-191230182423732.html)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [2019–20 Australian bushfire season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_Australian_bushfire_season)
    *   Thousands of people are reported stranded on a local beach awaiting evacuation near [Mallacoota, Victoria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mallacoota,_Victoria), [Australia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia), as [bushfires](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bushfires_in_Australia) enter the coastal town. Four people are reported missing. Elsewhere, a volunteer [Fire and Rescue NSW](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fire_and_Rescue_NSW) firefighter died battling a bushfire near the town of [Jingellic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jingellic). [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2019/dec/31/mallacoota-fire-mayhem-armageddon-bushfires-rage-victoria-east-gippsland)

## International relations

*   [Bolivia–Spain relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bolivia%E2%80%93Spain_relations), [Bolivia–Mexico relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bolivia%E2%80%93Mexico_relations)
    *   In a tit-for-tat move, [Spain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spain) expels three [Bolivian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bolivia) diplomatic staff from [Madrid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Madrid) after interim [Bolivian President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Bolivia) [Jeanine Áñez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeanine_%C3%81%C3%B1ez) forced two Spanish diplomats and the [Mexican](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico) ambassador to leave. Their expulsions are related to the Mexican embassy in [La Paz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La_Paz)'s decision to shelter at least nine officials connected to [the government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presidency_of_Evo_Morales) of deposed President [Evo Morales](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evo_Morales). [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/12/bolivia-spat-spain-mexico-deepens-morales-allies-191230153945637.html)

## Law and crime

*   [Lulu and Nana controversy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lulu_and_Nana_controversy)
    *   [Chinese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China) state news agency [Xinhua](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xinhua_News_Agency) reports that [He Jiankui](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/He_Jiankui), who last year announced the birth of babies with modified [DNA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DNA), was sentenced to three years imprisonment and a fine of 3 million [yuan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Renminbi), for "[illegal medical practice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medical_malpractice)". Two other defendants are given lesser sentences. [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2019/12/30/china/gene-scientist-china-intl-hnk/index.html)
    *   The court in [Shenzhen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shenzhen) confirms his claim that a second woman was impregnated, and reveals that three [gene-edited](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genome_editing) babies were born instead of the previously believed two. [(New Scientist)](https://www.newscientist.com/article/2228710-scientist-behind-worlds-first-gene-edited-babies-sentenced-to-prison/)
*   A [Sudanese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sudan) court sentences 29 people to be hanged for the killing of a teacher in detention in February during protests that led to the overthrow of former president [Omar al-Bashir](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Omar_al-Bashir). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-50945224)
*   A [Yemeni](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yemenis) man, suspected to be an [Al-Qaeda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Qaeda) militant, is sentenced to death in [Saudi Arabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabia) for a November 11 [terror attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terror_attack) against a group of Spanish theatre actors in [Riyadh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riyadh), wounding three of them. An accomplice is sentenced to 12 years of jail. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-50947324)
*   Former CEO of the [Renault–Nissan–Mitsubishi Alliance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Renault%E2%80%93Nissan%E2%80%93Mitsubishi_Alliance) [Carlos Ghosn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carlos_Ghosn) escapes house arrest in [Tokyo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tokyo) and flees to [Lebanon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lebanon). He was under arrest for money laundering and underreporting his income, though he denies the charges. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-renault-nissan-ghosn-lebanon/ousted-renault-nissan-boss-ghosn-leaves-japan-for-lebanon-idUSKBN1YY1FM)
