# 2019-12-31

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [American-led intervention in Iraq (2014–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American-led_intervention_in_Iraq_(2014%E2%80%93present))
    *   [Angry supporters storm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attack_on_the_United_States_embassy_in_Baghdad) the [United States embassy in Baghdad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Embassy_of_the_United_States,_Baghdad), [Iraq](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq), in response to [the U.S. airstrike on Sunday](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_United_States_bombing_of_Kata%27ib_Hizbollah) against [Kata'ib Hezbollah](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kata%27ib_Hezbollah) militants. Iraqi officials say the U.S. ambassador and staff have been evacuated, but the [U.S. Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._Army) denies this. The U.S. ambassador is reportedly on holiday. [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._President) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) blames [Iran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran) for the attack. [(_The Independent_)](https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/iraq-protests-american-embassy-attack-violence-police-a9265131.html) [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/dec/31/iraq-riots-embassy-expose-america-weaker-fewer-options)
    *   According to an Iraqi official, demonstrators have prepared a [sit-in](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sit-in) protest in front of the embassy. [(Xinhua)](http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2019-12/31/c_138669405.htm)
    *   [Protesters in Tahrir Square](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_Iraqi_protests) distance themselves from the events around the U.S. embassy. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/12/protesters-embassy-baghdad-gear-sit-191231130210231.html)

## Business and economy

*   [Tencent](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tencent), along with [Singaporean](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Singapore) [sovereign wealth fund](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sovereign_wealth_fund) [GIC Private Limited](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GIC_Private_Limited) and the [Qatar Investment Authority](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qatar_Investment_Authority), purchase a 10% stake in the [Universal Music Group](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universal_Music_Group).     *   At least 30 people are killed in [Gamboru](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gamboru), [Borno State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Borno_State), in northeastern [Nigeria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nigeria) after an [improvised explosive device](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Improvised_explosive_device) [detonates](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Detonate) at a market on a bridge. No group immediately took responsibility. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-nigeria-security/thirty-killed-in-northeast-nigeria-bomb-blast-on-crowded-bridge-idUSKBN1Z526J)
*   [Mali War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mali_War)
    *   Five [soldiers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malian_Armed_Forces) are killed after their vehicle hit a [roadside bomb](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Improvised_explosive_device) while traveling in the [Alatona](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alatona) region. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/01/malian-soldiers-killed-roadside-attack-200106143333076.html)

## Arts and culture

*   [Funerals of Qasem Soleimani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Funerals_of_Qasem_Soleimani)
    *   A funeral service for [Qasem Soleimani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qasem_Soleimani), the [Iranian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran) [Quds Force](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quds_Force) commander who was slain in a [targeted killing in Baghdad last week](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Baghdad_International_Airport_airstrike), is attended by hundreds of thousands of people in [Tehran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tehran), [Iran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran). [(NPR)](https://www.npr.org/2020/01/06/794044616/iran-mourns-slain-gen-qassem-soleimani-and-vows-revenge) [(Axios)](https://www.axios.com/qasem-soleimani-iran-funeral-photos-f83662b9-dce3-4a7c-9e92-e0a24843e8ba.html)

## Business and economy

*   American retailer [Pier 1 Imports](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pier_1_Imports) announces it will close 450 stores and some [distribution centers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Distribution_center), and may soon file for [bankruptcy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bankruptcy_in_the_United_States). [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2020/01/06/business/pier-1-imports-bankruptcy/index.html)

## Disasters and accidents

*   A 5.8 magnitude [earthquake](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earthquake) strikes [Puerto Rico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Puerto_Rico), causing small [landslides](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Landslide), [power outages](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Power_outage), and severely cracking some homes. [(Associated Press)](https://nbc25news.com/news/nation-world/57-magnitude-quake-strikes-puerto-rico-damage-reported)
*   A [German](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germans) [tourist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tourism_in_Italy) critically wounded in the crash yesterday in [Luttach](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luttach), [Italy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italy), dies from her injuries, bringing the death toll to seven. [(Il Gazzettino)](https://www.ilgazzettino.it/italia/primopiano/incidente_alto_adige_6_morti_ragazzi_chi_sono-4965506.html)

## Law and crime

*   A court in the [United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom) sentences 36-year-old [Indonesian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indonesians_in_the_United_Kingdom) national [Reynhard Sinaga](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reynhard_Sinaga) to [life imprisonment](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Life_imprisonment) for [sexually assaulting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sexually_assault) at least 48 young men in [Manchester](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manchester). Sinaga was convicted of a total of 159 [sex offences](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sex_offence), and is said to be Britain's most prolific [serial rapist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serial_rapist). [(BBC News)](https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-50987823) [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-britain-rapist/indonesian-student-jailed-as-britains-worst-rapist-idUSKBN1Z519D)
*   [Police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Law_enforcement_in_Germany) shoot dead a [Turkish](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turks_in_Germany) man who tried to attack officers with a knife in the city of [Gelsenkirchen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gelsenkirchen), [North Rhine-Westphalia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Rhine-Westphalia), [Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany). Police say a search of the man's flat later did not suggest a [terrorist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terrorism_in_Germany) motive and that he was [mentally ill](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mentally_ill). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-51003868)

## Politics and elections

*   [Politics of the Marshall Islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Politics_of_the_Marshall_Islands)
    *   [David Kabua](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Kabua) is elected [President of the Marshall Islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_Marshall_Islands) by the [national legislature](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legislature_of_the_Marshall_Islands). He succeeds [Hilda Heine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hilda_Heine), who was seeking a second term, but lost in the first session vote. [(Radio New Zealand International)](https://www.rnz.co.nz/international/pacific-news/406763/new-president-for-marshall-islands)

# 2020-01-07

## Armed conflict and attacks

*   [Terrorism in Kenya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terrorism_in_Kenya)
    *   Four children are killed in an [Al-Shabaab](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Shabaab_(militant_group)) attack at a [primary school](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Primary_school) in [Garissa County](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Garissa_County), [Kenya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenya). [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/01/kenya-school-attacked-al-shabab-children-killed-200108065347512.html)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [Funerals of Qasem Soleimani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Funerals_of_Qasem_Soleimani)
    *   A [stampede](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stampede) occurs during the funeral of [Qasem Soleimani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qasem_Soleimani) in his hometown of [Kerman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kerman). [Iranian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran) state-affiliated media say at least 56 people are killed and 213 more are injured. [(CBC)](https://www.cbc.ca/news/world/iran-qassem-soleimani-us-kerman-1.5417178)
*   A magnitude 6.4 [earthquake](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Puerto_Rico_earthquake) strikes [Puerto Rico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Puerto_Rico), 1 person is killed and 9 people are injured. [(NBC)](https://nbcnews.com/news/latino/6-5-quake-strikes-puerto-rico-amid-heavy-seismic-activity-n1111666)

## International relations

*   [2019–20 Persian Gulf crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_Persian_Gulf_crisis), [Iran–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93United_States_relations)
    *   [Iran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran)'s [Islamic Consultative Assembly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_Consultative_Assembly) formally designates the [United States Department of Defense](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Department_of_Defense) as a "terrorist organization" in response to the assassination of General [Qasem Soleimani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qasem_Soleimani) in a [targeted killing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Baghdad_International_Airport_airstrike) in [Baghdad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baghdad), [Iraq](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq). Under the newly adopted bill, all [United States Armed Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Armed_Forces) personnel and [Pentagon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Pentagon) employees are "considered terrorists." [(Xinhuanet)](http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2020-01/07/c_138685013.htm) [(Channel News Asia)](https://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/world/iran-designates-us-forces-terrorists-for-killing-general-12240474)
    *   [Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany) announces a partial withdrawal of the [Bundeswehr](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bundeswehr) troops positioned in [Iraq](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq), citing security concerns. [(DW)](https://www.dw.com/en/germany-to-partially-withdraw-troops-from-iraq/a-51909308)
    *   Canada's Chief of the Defence Staff General [Jonathan Vance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jonathan_Vance) announces that some of its military personnel in Iraq will be moved to neighboring [Kuwait](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kuwait) over safety reasons. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-iraq-security-canada/canada-says-some-troops-in-iraq-to-be-moved-temporarily-to-kuwait-for-safety-idUSKBN1Z622W)
    *   [Kosovo Police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kosovo_Police) arrest Ikballe Berisha Huduti, the founder of a now defunct Islamic organization called Kur'ani, in [Pristina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pristina) following an order from the prosecution after she was accused of inciting [terrorist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terrorist) acts for social media comments against the United States over the death of Qasem Soleimani. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-kosovo-iran-crime/kosovo-arrests-iran-supporter-over-comments-after-soleimanis-death-idUSKBN1Z62AH) [(The New York Times)](https://www.nytimes.com/reuters/2020/01/07/world/middleeast/07reuters-kosovo-iran-crime.html)
*   [North Korea–South Korea relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Korea%E2%80%93South_Korea_relations)
    *   [South Korean President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korean_President) [Moon Jae-in](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moon_Jae-in) says there is a "desperate need" for practical ways to improve ties with North Korea and says he is ready to meet repeatedly with [Kim Jong-un](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kim_Jong-un) in [Pyongyang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pyongyang) if necessary. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-southkorea-politics-moon/south-koreas-moon-cites-desperate-need-for-ways-to-improve-ties-with-north-idUSKBN1Z603B)
*   [Foreign relations of Argentina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foreign_relations_of_Argentina), [2019 Venezuelan presidential crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Venezuelan_presidential_crisis)
    *   The government of Argentina says it will not recognize [Juan Guaidó](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Guaid%C3%B3) as [President of Venezuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Venezuela), and instead as the leader of the opposition in the country, and revokes the credentials of Guaidó's representative in Argentina. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-argentina-venezuela-trotta-idUSKBN1Z62IM)

## Law and crime

*   Japan issues an arrest warrant for former [Nissan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nissan) Chairman [Carlos Ghosn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carlos_Ghosn)'s wife Carole for allegedly lying during testimony. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-nissan-ghosn-statement/japan-issues-arrest-warrant-for-ghosns-wife-looks-for-ways-to-bring-him-back-idUSKBN1Z6057)

## Politics and elections

*   [November 2019 Spanish general election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/November_2019_Spanish_general_election)
    *   After a year of political deadlock, incumbent [Prime Minister of Spain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Spain) [Pedro Sánchez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pedro_S%C3%A1nchez_(politician)) is sworn in thanks to the support of left-wing parties and regional nationalists. He will form the first [coalition government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coalition_government) in the democratic era, with [Podemos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Podemos_(Spanish_political_party)) and its leader [Pablo Iglesias Turrión](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pablo_Iglesias_Turri%C3%B3n) as Second [Deputy Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deputy_Prime_Minister_of_Spain). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-51019358)

# 2020-01-09

## Armed conflict and attacks

*   [Insurgency in the Maghreb](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Insurgency_in_the_Maghreb_(2002%E2%80%93present))
    *   [2020 Tillabéri attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Tillab%C3%A9ri_attack)
        *   [Islamist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamist) militants kill over 25 [Nigerien soldiers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Niger_Armed_Forces) in an attack on an [army base](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Army_base) in [Tillabéri Region](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tillab%C3%A9ri_Region), [Niger](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Niger). 63 militants are also killed in the ensuing [shootout](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shootout). [(The Punch)](https://punchng.com/63-terrorists-25-others-killed-in-niger-army-base-attack/) [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-nigeria-security/suspected-islamists-kill-25-soldiers-in-niger-government-idUSKBN1Z82JN)
*   [Ukraine International Airlines Flight 752](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukraine_International_Airlines_Flight_752), [2019–20 Persian Gulf crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_Persian_Gulf_crisis)
    *   [U.S.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States), [Canadian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canada), [British](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom) and [Iraqi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq) officials say they believe the [plane crash](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plane_crash) near [Tehran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tehran) in which 176 were killed yesterday was likely caused accidentally by an [Iranian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran) [anti-aircraft missile](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anti-aircraft_weaponry), while Iran says it was due to "[mechanical failure](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mechanical_failure)". [(Newsweek)](https://www.newsweek.com/iranians-shot-down-ukraine-flight-mistake-sources-1481313), [(NPR)](https://www.npr.org/2020/01/09/794863678/we-will-surely-find-out-the-truth-questions-linger-about-jet-crash-in-iran) [(Reuters)](https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-iran-crash-britain/johnson-says-there-is-evidence-ukrainian-plane-was-shot-down-by-iran-missile-idUKKBN1Z82LD?il=0)
    *   _[The New York Times](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_New_York_Times)_ releases a verified video obtained from an Iranian citizen showing the plane being struck by what appears to be a [surface-to-air missile](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surface-to-air_missile). [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/09/video/iran-plane-missile.html)
    *   In a news conference, [Canadian Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Canada) [Justin Trudeau](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Justin_Trudeau) says it's "too early to draw definitive conclusions" that the downing of the plane was an "[act of war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Act_of_war)". Trudeau also condemns Iran's attack on U.S. bases in Iraq. [(National Post)](https://nationalpost.com/news/canada/champagne-asks-iran-to-let-canadian-officials-in-to-investigate-plane-crash)

## Disasters and accidents

*   A bus crashes in Iran's [Mazandaran Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mazandaran_Province), killing at least 20 passengers and injuring 24 others. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/01/reported-dead-bus-crash-iran-iranian-media-200109053940090.html)

## Law and crime

*   Judge Ghassan Ouiedat, a [Lebanese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lebanon) [prosecutor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecutor), imposes a [travel ban](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Travel_ban) on former Chairman of [Nissan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nissan) [Carlos Ghosn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carlos_Ghosn) after he was summoned over an [Interpol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interpol) warrant issued by Japan seeking his arrest on [financial misconduct](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Financial_misconduct) charges. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-nissan-ghosn-lebanon-questioning/lebanon-imposes-travel-ban-on-ex-nissan-boss-ghosn-judicial-source-idUSKBN1Z80ZC)
*   [Trial of Catalonia independence leaders](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trial_of_Catalonia_independence_leaders)
    *   The [Spanish Supreme Court](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spanish_Supreme_Court) revokes the immunity of jailed [Oriol Junqueras](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oriol_Junqueras) declared by the [European Court of Justice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Court_of_Justice) in a sentence on 19 December. This happens after the board of [European Parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Parliament) recognized the former [Vice President of Catalonia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_vice_presidents_of_Catalonia) as a [MEP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Member_of_the_European_Parliament) since 3 July and was elected president of the [Greens–European Free Alliance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greens%E2%80%93European_Free_Alliance) parliamentary group. [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2020/01/09/world/europe/ap-eu-spain-catalonia.html)

## Politics and elections

*   [Brexit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit)
    *   The [United Kingdom House of Commons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_of_Commons_of_the_United_Kingdom) votes 330–231 to pass the [Withdrawal Agreement Bill](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit_withdrawal_agreement) authorizing the country’s departure from the [European Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Union) at the end of the month. [(Associated Press)](https://nbc25news.com/news/nation-world/lawmakers-approve-brexit-bill-uk-on-course-for-jan-31-exit)

# 2020-01-10

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Ukraine International Airlines Flight 752](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukraine_International_Airlines_Flight_752)
    *   After [Canadian Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Canada) [Justin Trudeau](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Justin_Trudeau) suggests the plane was downed by an Iranian missile, Iranian authorities reject this theory. Iranian civil aviation chief says he is "certain" the plane was not hit by a missile, still asserting the cause was "mechanical failure". [(BBC News)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-51062369)
*   [2020 Quetta bombing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Quetta_bombing)
    *   A [bombing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bomb) claimed by the [Islamic State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_State_of_Iraq_and_the_Levant_%E2%80%93_Khorasan_Province) at a [mosque](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mosque) in [Quetta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quetta), [Balochistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Balochistan,_Pakistan), [Pakistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pakistan), kills at least 15 people and wounds 18 others, three days after a motorcycle bombing in the city killed two. [(The New York Times)](https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/10/world/asia/pakistan-mosque-bombing-isis-taliban.html)

## Arts and culture

*   Death of [Qaboos bin Said al Said](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qaboos_bin_Said_al_Said)
    *   [Omani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oman) [state television](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/State_media) announces the death of the [Sultan of Oman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_rulers_of_Oman) [Qaboos bin Said al Said](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qaboos_bin_Said_al_Said) aged 79. At the time of his death he was the longest serving head of state in the [Middle East](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Middle_East) and [Arab world](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arab_world). [(Reuters)](http://news.trust.org//item/20200110233755-nw853/)
    *   The high military council of [Sultan of Oman's Armed Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sultan_of_Oman%27s_Armed_Forces) calls on the [Omani royal family](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_of_Al_Said) to convene to name a successor to the late sultan within three days. A three-day period of [national mourning](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_mourning) is declared. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/jan/11/sultan-of-oman-dies-state-media-announces)

## International relations

*   [Iraq–United States relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq%E2%80%93United_States_relations), [Iran–Iraq relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93Iraq_relations), [2019–20 Persian Gulf crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_Persian_Gulf_crisis)
    *   Iraqi cleric and Grand Ayatollah [Ali al-Sistani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ali_al-Sistani) condemns both the United States and Iran over the escalation of conflict in [Iraq](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq), saying it shows blatant disregard for Iraqi [sovereignty](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sovereignty) and the suffering of the [Iraqi people](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraqi_people). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-iraq-security/iraqi-cleric-condemns-u-s-and-iran-as-fears-of-wider-conflict-persist-idUSKBN1Z80P5?il=0)

## Law and crime

*   An 11-year-old student [opens fire at his school](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/School_shooting) in [Torreón](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Torre%C3%B3n), [Coahuila](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coahuila), [Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico), killing a teacher and wounding six others [before committing suicide](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Murder%E2%80%93suicide). ## Politics and elections

*   [2019–20 Australian bushfire season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_Australian_bushfire_season)
    *   Thousands of people protest in [Melbourne](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Melbourne), [Brisbane](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brisbane) and [Sydney](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sydney), calling for the [resignation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Resignation) or ouster of [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Australia) [Scott Morrison](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scott_Morrison), accusing him of negligence over the Australian bushfires. *   [2020 Democratic Party presidential primaries](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Democratic_Party_presidential_primaries)
    *   Author and [self-help guru](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Self-help) [Marianne Williamson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marianne_Williamson) drops out of the U.S. presidential race. [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/10/us/politics/marianne-williamson-drops-out.html)
*   The [Tunisian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tunisia) [Parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assembly_of_the_Representatives_of_the_People) votes 134 to 72 to reject a cabinet proposed by [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_the_Republic_of_Tunisia)\-designate Habib Jemli. # 2020-01-12

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   Four [Iraqi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq) soldiers are wounded when mortar shells strike [Balad Air Base](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Balad_Air_Base), 40 miles (64 km) north of [Baghdad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baghdad), which houses [U.S.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) military personnel. The mortars struck the runway inside the base. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-iraq-security-base/mortar-bombs-strike-iraqi-military-base-of-balad-four-wounded-military-sources-idUSKBN1ZB0I0?il=0)

## Disasters and accidents

*   The [Taal Volcano](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taal_Volcano) in southern [Luzon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luzon), [Philippines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines), spews an [ash plume](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volcanic_ash) that measures approximately 10 to 15 kilometres (6.2 to 9.3 mi). The [Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippine_Institute_of_Volcanology_and_Seismology) designates a "level 4" alert level, indicating "an imminent hazardous eruption". [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/jan/13/philippines-lava-gushes-from-taal-volcano-as-alert-level-raised)
*   The government of the Canadian province of [Ontario](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ontario) apologizes for issuing a false alert about an incident at a [nuclear plant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuclear_plant) near [Toronto](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toronto) and blames a training exercise mistake. Angry local mayors demand an inquiry, saying the emergency message about the ageing [Pickering Nuclear Generating Station](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pickering_Nuclear_Generating_Station) has caused unnecessary distress. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-canada-nuclear/canada-province-says-sorry-after-training-mistake-sparks-false-nuclear-alert-idUSKBN1ZB0C8?il=0)

## International relations

*   [Japan–Saudi Arabia relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan%E2%80%93Saudi_Arabia_relations)
    *   Japanese PM [Shinzō Abe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shinz%C5%8D_Abe) arrives in Saudi Arabia in his first visit to the Middle East, where he expects to mediate between the United States and Iran amid heightening tensions. [(_The Japan Times_)](https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2020/01/12/national/politics-diplomacy/abe-meets-saudi-king-salman-calls-cooperation-stabilize-middle-east-talks-foreign-minister/)

## Politics and elections

*   [Ukraine International Airlines Flight 752](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukraine_International_Airlines_Flight_752), [2019–20 Iranian protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_Iranian_protests)
    *   Protests continue for a second day despite a large deployment of security forces. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/world-middle-east-51081833)
    *   United States President [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) tweeted in [Farsi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Farsi), warned Iranian leaders and showed his support to the protesters. [(CNN)](https://www.amp.cnn.com/cnn/2020/01/11/politics/trump-support-iran-protesters/index.html)
*   [The Gambia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Gambia) warns ousted leader [Yahya Jammeh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yahya_Jammeh) not to return to the country, saying his safety cannot be guaranteed if he returns without permission, a government spokesman says. A spokesman for Jammeh's party says he could arrive back at any time from exile in [Equatorial Guinea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Equatorial_Guinea). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-51082371)
*   [2019 Malta political crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Malta_political_crisis)
    *   [Robert Abela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Abela) wins the [Partit Laburista](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Partit_Laburista) leadership election, succeeding [Joseph Muscat](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Muscat) as [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Malta) after Muscat's resignation. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-51080574) [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2020/01/12/europe/malta-robert-abela-prime-minister-intl/index.html)

## Science and technology

*   [Chinese espionage in the United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_espionage_in_the_United_States)
    *   The [U.S. Department of the Interior](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Department_of_the_Interior) halts its civilian [drone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unmanned_aerial_vehicle) program indefinitely out of concerns that [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China), who manufactured the fleet via the [SZ DJI Technology Company](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DJI_(company)), is using it for espionage. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-drones/trump-to-halt-civilian-drone-program-over-china-tech-concerns-ft-idUSKBN1ZB0MU)

# 2020-01-15

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   Aftermath of the [Sudanese Revolution](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sudanese_Revolution)
    *   The [Sudanese Armed Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sudanese_Armed_Forces) says it has quelled a [mutiny](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mutiny) by soldiers loyal to ousted [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Sudan) [Omar al-Bashir](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Omar_al-Bashir) in the capital [Khartoum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khartoum). Former Director of the [National Intelligence and Security Service](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Intelligence_and_Security_Service) [Salah Gosh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salah_Gosh) is accused of orchestrating the mutiny, which left two troops dead. His current whereabouts are unknown. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-51112518)

## Arts and culture

*   The [Vatican](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holy_See) appoints [Francesca Di Giovanni](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francesca_Di_Giovanni) undersecretary for multilateral affairs in the [Secretariat of State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secretariat_of_State_(Holy_See)), the first woman to hold a management position in this office. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-51124478)

## International relations

*   [Egypt–Turkey relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Egypt%E2%80%93Turkey_relations)
    *   [Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey) summons its _[chargé d'affaires](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charg%C3%A9_d%27affaires)_ to [Egypt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Egypt) after accusing the [Egyptian security forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/State_Security_Investigations_Service) of raiding the [Cairo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cairo) offices of the state-run [Anadolu News Agency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anadolu_Agency) and arresting four of its employees. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-egypt-security/turkey-says-egyptian-security-forces-raid-news-agency-in-cairo-idUSKBN1ZE1U5?il=0)
*   [Japan–North Korea relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan%E2%80%93North_Korea_relations)
    *   North Korean state media condemn [Japanese Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Japan) [Shinzō Abe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shinz%C5%8D_Abe) for his attempts to reform the [pacifist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Article_9_of_the_Japanese_Constitution) [Japanese constitution](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Japan). The state media say that "in the event of a constitutional revision, which gives \[Japan's\] [self-defense forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan_Self-Defense_Forces) legitimacy, the Japanese reactionaries will have all the preconditions necessary to realize military aggression overseas". [(UPI)](https://www.upi.com/Top_News/World-News/2020/01/15/North-Korea-rails-against-Japan-plans-for-constitutional-amendment/6591579104508/)
*   [China–United States trade war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China%E2%80%93United_States_trade_war)
    *   In a meeting at the [White House](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White_House), [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) and [Chinese Vice Premier](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vice_Premier_of_China) [Han Zheng](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Han_Zheng) sign "Phase 1" of a new trade deal in which the U.S. will relax some of the tariffs imposed on Chinese imports while China agreed to buy more American products. Both sides also agree to not impose new tariffs. [(NPR)](https://www.npr.org/2020/01/15/796305300/trump-to-sign-phase-one-china-trade-deal-but-most-tariffs-remain-in-place)

## Politics and elections

*   The [Russian government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_Russia) of [Dmitry Medvedev's Second Cabinet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dmitry_Medvedev%27s_Second_Cabinet) [resigns](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Resignation_of_Russian_government) after [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Russia) [Vladimir Putin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vladimir_Putin) delivers the [Presidential Address to the Federal Assembly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presidential_Address_to_the_Federal_Assembly), in which he proposed several amendments to the constitution. Putin accepts the resignation. [Medvedev](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dmitry_Medvedev) says the constitutional changes would "significantly change Russia's balance of power". [(_The Independent_)](https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/dmitry-medvedev-resign-russia-prime-minister-putin-quit-latest-a9284741.html) [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-51120166)
*   [Greek](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greece) [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Greece) [Kyriakos Mitsotakis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyriakos_Mitsotakis) nominates [Council of State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Council_of_State_(Greece)) president [Aikaterini Sakellaropoulou](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aikaterini_Sakellaropoulou) to be [President of Greece](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Greece). If approved, she will be the first female president in Greek history. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-greece-politics-president/greek-pm-taps-top-female-judge-as-countrys-president-idUSKBN1ZE2FE?il=0)
*   The [Virginia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virginia) [House of Delegates](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virginia_House_of_Delegates) votes to ratify the [Equal Rights Amendment](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Equal_Rights_Amendment) decades after its deadline passed. As the amendment nonetheless now has enough [states](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._state) for it to be fully adopted, legal scholars are divided on whether this means the [Constitution of the United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Constitution_of_the_United_States) has been amended. [(NPR)](https://www.npr.org/2020/01/15/796754345/virginia-ratifies-the-equal-rights-amendment-decades-after-deadline)

---

# 2020-01-16

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   The [American-led coalition](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Combined_Joint_Task_Force_%E2%80%93_Operation_Inherent_Resolve) issues a statement saying that 11 U.S. service members were injured by the [January 8, 2020 attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Iranian_attack_on_U.S._forces_in_Iraq) by [Iran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran) on [U.S. forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._forces) in [Iraq](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq). The [U.S. Department of Defense](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Department_of_Defense) had initially assessed that there had been no injuries. [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2020/01/16/politics/service-members-injured-iran-strike/index.html)

## Arts and culture

*   [LGBT rights in South Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_South_Korea)
    *   In a landmark case, the [South Korean military](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korean_military) is set to decide on the first [transgender](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transgender) soldier's possible discharge. The soldier underwent [surgery](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sex_reassignment_surgery) overseas and is stationed in [Gyeonggi Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gyeonggi_Province). The case sparks a national debate on [LGBT](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT) issues in the military, which punishes [sex between two males](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gay_sexual_practices) with up to two years imprisonment. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-southkorea-military-transgender/south-korea-to-decide-on-first-transgender-soldier-amid-debate-idUSKBN1ZF1S0?il=0)

## Business and economy

*   The [U.S. Senate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Senate) votes 89–10 to pass the [United States–Mexico–Canada Agreement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States%E2%80%93Mexico%E2%80%93Canada_Agreement). Once ratified by [Canada](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canada), it will supersede the [North America Free Trade Agreement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_America_Free_Trade_Agreement). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trade-usmca/senate-passes-north-america-trade-deal-canada-still-to-approve-idUSKBN1ZF283?il=0)
*   [Alphabet Inc.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alphabet_Inc.), parent company of [Google](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Google), becomes the fourth American company to hit a stock [market capitalization](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Market_capitalization) of [US$](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._dollar)1 trillion. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-funds-google/which-company-just-hit-1-trillion-google-it-idUSKBN1ZF2SH)

## International relations

*   [Guatemalan President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Guatemala) [Alejandro Giammattei](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alejandro_Giammattei) cuts ties with [the government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presidency_of_Nicol%C3%A1s_Maduro) of disputed [Venezuelan President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Venezuela) [Nicolás Maduro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicol%C3%A1s_Maduro) and closes [Guatemala](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guatemala)'s embassy in [Caracas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caracas). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-guatemala-politics-venezuela/guatemalas-new-president-cuts-ties-with-venezuela-as-promised-idUSKBN1ZF2SB?il=0)

## Law and crime

*   After his escape from [Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan), [Carlos Ghosn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carlos_Ghosn)'s Japanese lawyer Junichiro Hironaka and seven other members of his defense resign. Hironaka says Ghosn's escape was a "complete surprise". [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2020/01/16/business/carlos-ghosn-lawyer/index.html)
*   The bodies of seven people are found in a [mass grave](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mass_grave) in the indigenous [Ngäbe-Buglé](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ng%C3%A4be-Bugl%C3%A9_Comarca) region of [Panama](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panama). Authorities believe a religious sect performed an [exorcism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exorcism) on the victims. Police rescued 15 people who had suffered bodily injuries. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-51144629)

## Politics and elections

*   [Mikhail Mishustin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mikhail_Mishustin) is appointed as new [Prime Minister of Russia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Russia). [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/16/world/europe/mikhail-mishustin.html)

# 2020-01-17

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Iraqi protests (2019–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraqi_protests_(2019%E2%80%93present))
    *   At least two people are killed and dozens injured after [Iraqi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq) security forces fire upon protesters at Sinak bridge in central [Baghdad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baghdad). [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/01/iraq-security-forces-kill-protesters-baghdad-200117192553279.html)

## Arts and culture

*   Foreign Minister of the [Maldives](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maldives) [Abdulla Shahid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abdulla_Shahid) says that his country could lose entire islands unless it can access cheap financing to fight [climate change](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Climate_change). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-climate-change-maldives/we-cant-wait-maldives-desperate-for-funds-as-islands-risk-going-under-idUSKBN1ZG0XS)

## Business and economy

*   [Icelandic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iceland) [fishing company](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fishery) [Samherji](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samherji) announces it will cease operations in [Namibia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Namibia). The company was embroiled in [a bribery scandal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fishrot_Files) there that resulted in the resignation of Namibian Fisheries Minister [Bernhardt Esau](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bernhardt_Esau) and Justice Minister [Sacky Shanghala](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sacky_Shanghala), as well as the arrest of two employees of [South African](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Africa) banking corporation [Investec](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Investec). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-namibia-samherji/icelands-samherji-exiting-namibia-following-bribery-scandal-idUSKBN1ZH0DF?il=0)

## Law and crime

*   [Crime in China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crime_in_China)
    *   A man is [sentenced to death](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capital_punishment_in_China) for [murdering](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Murder) a doctor in [Beijing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing) on [New Year's Eve](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Year%27s_Eve). The murder was the latest in a string of attacks on medical staff in [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China) by angry relatives blaming them for the lack of medical resources and services. [(Asia One)](https://www.asiaone.com/china/chinese-doctors-murder-overshadows-new-law-improve-public-health-care)

## Politics and elections

*   [Brazilian federal government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazilian_federal_government) secretary of culture, [Roberto Alvim](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roberto_Alvim), is dismissed after the broadcast of a video where he announces a new national prize on culture. In the video, Alvim seems to paraphrase a speech by [Joseph Goebbels](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Goebbels), [Nazi Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_Germany)'s [_Reichsminister_ of Propaganda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reich_Ministry_of_Public_Enlightenment_and_Propaganda). [(The Guardian)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/jan/17/brazil-culture-minister-goebbels-roberto-alvim-nazi)
*   [Ukrainian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukraine) [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Ukraine) [Oleksiy Honcharuk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oleksiy_Honcharuk) submits his [resignation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Resignation) after an audio clip of him allegedly criticizing [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Ukraine) [Volodymyr Zelensky](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volodymyr_Zelensky)’s economic policies was leaked earlier this week. Zelensky subsequently announces that Honcharuk is allowed to keep his position. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-ukraine-pm-resignation/ukraine-pm-offers-to-resign-after-tape-suggests-he-criticized-president-idUSKBN1ZG0RF)
*   [Ukraine International Airlines Flight 752 protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukraine_International_Airlines_Flight_752_protests)
    *   At a [Friday sermon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jumu%27ah) by [Iranian Supreme Leader](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supreme_Leader_of_Iran) [Ali Khamenei](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ali_Khamenei), his first in eight years, he defends the [Revolutionary Guards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_Revolutionary_Guard_Corps)’ accidental killing of passengers onboard [Ukraine International Airlines Flight 752](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukraine_International_Airlines_Flight_752) and praises [Operation Martyr Soleimani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Iranian_attack_on_U.S._forces_in_Iraq) for giving a “slap on the face” to the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States). His sermon comes as public anger mounts against the government for their handling of Flight 752. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/01/ayatollah-khamenei-defends-revolutionary-guard-friday-sermon-200117105420440.html)
*   Protesters squat an oil terminal in the eastern [Libyan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libya) town of [Zuwetina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zuwetina) at the request of tribal leaders, who claim that the [Government of National Accord](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_National_Accord) is using oil revenue to pay for foreign fighters, a reference to [Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey)'s sending of troops and arms in support of the GNA. The protesters are swiftly condemned by the state-owned [National Oil Corporation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Oil_Corporation). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-libya-oil/eastern-libyan-protesters-enter-zueitina-oil-port-announce-its-closure-idUSKBN1ZG2B5?il=0)

# 2020-01-18

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [War in Afghanistan (2001–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_in_Afghanistan_(2001%E2%80%93present))
    *   [Afghan presidential](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Afghanistan) spokesman Sediq Sediqqi says that the government rejects the proposed "reduction in violence" by the [Taliban](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taliban) as an "ambiguous term with no legal or military parameters". On Friday, the Taliban proposed a ten-day truce and to hold follow-up discussions with [Afghan government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghan_government) officials. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/01/afghan-government-demands-long-term-ceasefire-taliban-200117083410030.html)
*   [Yemen Civil War (2015–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yemen_Civil_War_(2015%E2%80%93present))
    *   [2020 Ma'rib attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Ma%27rib_attack)
        *   Eighty [military personnel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republic_of_Yemen_Armed_Forces) are killed by [ballistic missiles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ballistic_missile) and [drone strikes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drone_strike) in an attack reportedly carried out by the [Houthis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Houthi) against a military camp in the [Yemeni](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yemen) city of [Ma'rib](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ma%27rib), according to Saudi state TV. The Houthis have not claimed responsibility for the attack. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-51166943)
*   [Somali Civil War (2009–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Somali_Civil_War_(2009%E2%80%93present))
    *   [2020 Afgooye bombing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Afgooye_bombing)
        *   An [al-Shabaab](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Shabaab_(militant_group)) [car bombing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Car_bomb) kills four people and injures at least 20 others near [Afgooye](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afgooye), [Lower Shabelle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lower_Shabelle), [Somalia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Somalia).

## Arts and culture

*   [Megxit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Megxit)
    *   Officials with [Buckingham Palace](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buckingham_Palace) announced that effective spring of this year, [Prince Harry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_Harry,_Duke_of_Sussex) and his wife [Meghan Markle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Meghan,_Duchess_of_Sussex) will retain, but will no longer publicly use, the [style](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Style_(form_of_address)) [His/Her Royal Highness](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Royal_Highness), and will no longer receive public funds for royal duties.[(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-51163865)
    *   The couple will also repay [£](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pound_sterling)2.4 million of public money spent on renovating the [Frogmore Cottage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frogmore_Cottage).[(RTÉ News)](https://www.rte.ie/news/world/2020/0118/1108328-harry-meghan-royals/)
    *   The couple will keep their titles as Duke and Duchess of Sussex. While Prince Harry will lose all his [military](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/British_Armed_Forces) appointments, he will remain a [prince](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/British_prince). [(Sky News)](https://news.sky.com/story/harry-and-meghan-to-lose-royal-funds-and-hrh-titles-from-spring-11912020)
    *   Some news reports are calling this the "abdication' of Prince Harry. [(ITV News)](https://www.itv.com/news/2020-01-19/prince-harry-meghan-markle-royal-abdication-prince-henry-royal-family/)

# 2020-01-21

## Arts and culture

*   The [United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_the_United_Kingdom) and [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_the_United_States) [governments](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government) announce they have agreed to protect the [wreckage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wreck_of_the_RMS_Titanic) of the [RMS _Titanic_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RMS_Titanic). The agreement, signed by the British government in 2003, has come into effect after being ratified by [U.S. Secretary of State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._Secretary_of_State) [Mike Pompeo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mike_Pompeo). An official also says the UK will work with [Canada](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canada) and [France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France) to bring "even more protection" to the wreckage. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-northern-ireland-51188909)
*   [Rock musician](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rock_music) [Ozzy Osbourne](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ozzy_Osbourne) announces that he has been diagnosed with [Parkinson's disease](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parkinson%27s_disease). [(ABC News)](https://abcnews.go.com/GMA/Culture/ozzy-osbourne-opens-parkinsons-diagnosis-family-helped-back/story)

## Business and economy

*   [Gold Fields Ltd](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gold_Fields_Ltd), a [South African](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Africa) mining company, has hired an [investment bank](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Investment_bank), [RBC Capital Markets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RBC_Capital_Markets), to help it sell 30% of its gold project in northern [Chile](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chile). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-goldfields-m-a-chile/gold-fields-hires-advisor-to-sell-stake-in-chilean-gold-project-sources-idUSKBN1ZK1YG)

Already produced ones will remain grounded an additional month until June or July. [(CNN)](https://edition.cnn.com/2020/01/21/business/boeing-737-max-production-halt/index.html) [(NPR)](https://www.npr.org/2020/01/21/798312515/boeing-737-max-may-stay-grounded-into-summer)

[(_The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2020/01/21/coronavirus-us-case/)

[(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/01/north-korea-bans-foreign-tourists-china-virus-tour-agency-200122042416138.html)

## International relations

    *   [Ukraine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukraine) demands the [United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom)'s [National Counter Terrorism Policing Network](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Counter_Terrorism_Policing_Network) remove the country's [Tryzub](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coat_of_arms_of_Ukraine) [coat of arms](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coat_of_arms) from a guide on hate symbols associated with [white supremacy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White_supremacy) and [Neo-Nazism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neo-Nazism). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/blogs-trending-51174898)

*   [2019–20 Lebanese protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_Lebanese_protests)

# 2020-01-23

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Syrian Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Civil_War) and [Northwestern Syria offensive (November 2019–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northwestern_Syria_offensive_(November_2019%E2%80%93present))
    *   The [Russian Ministry of Defence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ministry_of_Defence_(Russia)) says that hundreds of rebels stormed [Syrian Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Army) positions in [Idlib Governorate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idlib_Governorate), the ensuing fighting left 50 rebels dead and 90 wounded while government forces lost 40 dead and 80 wounded. A military source cited by Syrian state news agency [SANA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Arab_News_Agency) says the [Jabhat al-Nusra](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jabhat_al-Nusra) terrorists used various weapons such as [car bombs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Car_bomb), under an "intensive [fire cover](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suppressive_fire)". [(Reuters via Al Arabiya English)](https://english.alarabiya.net/en/News/middle-east/2020/01/23/Up-to-40-Syrian-Soldiers-killed-80-wounded-in-Idlib-attack-IFAX-.html) [(SANA)](https://sana.sy/en/?p=183197) [BBC](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-51221225)

## Arts and culture

*   The _[Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bulletin_of_the_Atomic_Scientists)_ advances the [Doomsday Clock](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doomsday_Clock) to 100 seconds before midnight, citing the threats to human survival posed by [nuclear proliferation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuclear_proliferation), [climate change](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Climate_change) and "cyber-based disinformation." This is the closest to midnight that the clock has been since the project began in 1947. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-51213185)

## Business and economy

*   [Malaysian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malaysia) agriculture giant [FGV Holdings Berhad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FGV_Holdings_Berhad) announces it will increase its sugar imports from [India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/India) from 88,000 tonnes to 133,000 in an attempt to resolve the [palm oil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palm_oil) trade dispute between the two nations. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-india-malaysia-exclusive/exclusive-malaysia-to-buy-more-indian-sugar-to-resolve-palm-oil-spat-sources-idUSKBN1ZM0E8)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [2019–20 Australian bushfire season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_Australian_bushfire_season)
    *   A [C-130](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C-130) [water bomber](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Water_bomber) crashes in southern [New South Wales](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_South_Wales), [Australia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia), while helping control a [bushfire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bushfire). Three [American](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Americans) [firefighters](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Firefighters) are killed. [(ABC News)](https://www.abc.net.au/news/2020-01-23/nsw-rfs-air-tanker-crashes-near-numeralla-bushfire/11893554)

## Health and environment

*   [2019–20 Wuhan coronavirus outbreak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_Wuhan_coronavirus_outbreak)
    *   The death toll from the new [coronavirus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coronavirus) rises to 25 and 830 confirmed cases in [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China) as four more Chinese cities, [Huanggang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Huanggang), [Ezhou](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ezhou), [Chibi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chibi) and [Zhijiang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zhijiang,_Hubei) are to be placed under [quarantine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quarantine). The total number of people under quarantine is now over 20 million people. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-china-51230011) [(Business Insider)](https://www.businessinsider.com/china-wuhan-coronavirus-quarantine-extended-cities-cut-off-2020-1?r=US&IR=T)
    *   [Singapore](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Singapore) confirms its first case of new coronavirus, a 66-year-old Chinese man from [Wuhan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wuhan) who was travelling with his family. [(Channel News Asia)](https://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/singapore/wuhan-virus-pneumonia-singapore-confirms-first-case-12312860)

## International relations

*   Heads of state and dignitaries from around the world attend the fifth [World Holocaust Forum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Holocaust_Forum) at [Yad Vashem](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yad_Vashem) in Jerusalem to commemorate the 75th anniversary of the liberation of the [Auschwitz extermination camp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Auschwitz_extermination_camp) and to address the resurgence of [antisemitism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antisemitism) worldwide. [(_The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/middle_east/world-leaders-convene-in-jerusalem-to-remember-holocaust-and-counter-anti-semitism/2020/01/23/e82fa964-3d56-11ea-afe2-090eb37b60b1_story.html)

[The Gambia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Gambia) had brought a lawsuit before the court over charges of [genocide](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genocide). *   A judicial source close to former [Nissan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nissan) chairman [Carlos Ghosn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carlos_Ghosn) says that [Lebanon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lebanon) and [Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan) will have 40 days to decide whether he will be extradited back to Japan or stand trial in Lebanon. [(Reuters via Al Arabiya)](https://english.alarabiya.net/en/News/middle-east/2020/01/23/Lebanon-Japan-have-40-days-to-agree-on-fate-of-ex-Nissan-boss-Ghosn.html)

[(CNBC)](https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/24/saudi-foreign-minister-iran-has-to-change-its-behavior-and-policies.html)
*   [Censorship in Singapore](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Censorship_in_Singapore), [Malaysia–Singapore relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malaysia%E2%80%93Singapore_relations)
    *   Malaysian [human rights](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_rights) [advocacy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Advocacy) group [Lawyers for Liberty](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lawyers_for_Liberty) sues [Singaporean](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Singapore) [Home Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ministry_of_Home_Affairs_(Singapore)) [K. Shanmugam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K._Shanmugam) in [Malaysian High Court](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High_Courts_(Malaysia)) after his office invoked the country's anti-[fake news](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fake_news) law to censor the group's criticisms of the [death penalty there](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capital_punishment_in_Singapore). The [plaintiff](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plaintiff) argues that the move represents "an attempt by Singapore to encroach upon, stifle or crack down on freedom of speech in Malaysia". [(_South China Morning Post_)](https://www.scmp.com/week-asia/politics/article/3047550/malaysian-watchdog-accused-singapore-brutal-execution-methods)
*   [Morocco–Spain relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morocco%E2%80%93Spain_relations)
    *   The foreign ministries of [Spain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spain) and [Morocco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morocco) announce they will hold talks to resolve a dispute over [territorial water](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Territorial_water) rights in the [North Atlantic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atlantic_Ocean#Northern_Atlantic), caused by the [Moroccan parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parliament_of_Morocco) passing two laws that extended its claims to the coast of [Western Sahara](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Western_Sahara) earlier this week. Spain expressed concerns that these laws would encroach on its claims near the [Canary Islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canary_Islands). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-morocco-spain/morocco-spain-to-hold-talks-about-overlapping-territorial-waters-idUSKBN1ZN2EQ)

## Law and crime

*   [2020 Rot am See shooting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Rot_am_See_shooting)
    *   Six people are killed and two others wounded when a man [opens fire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mass_shooting) on his family members in [Rot am See](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rot_am_See), [Baden-Württemberg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baden-W%C3%BCrttemberg), [Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany). The mass shooter's parents are among the dead. [(ABC News)](https://abcnews.go.com/International/injured-probable-deaths-shooting-germany-police/story?id=68502982)
*   [LGBT rights in Mauritania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_Mauritania)
    *   Police detain a gay couple in [Nouakchott](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nouakchott) after a video purportedly of them marrying in a secret location emerges, in what is considered to be the first major prosecution of its kind in recent years. The attendees in the video were also detained. [(_North African Post_)](http://northafricapost.com/37280-mauritania-gay-couple-arrested-in-nouakchott-after-marriage.html)

# 2020-01-25

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   Two women, one of them pregnant, are killed and seven others are injured when artillery hits a [Rohingya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rohingya) village in [Rakhine State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rakhine_State). The locals blame [Myanmar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myanmar)'s [armed forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tatmadaw). The armed forces deny responsibility and blame the [Arakan Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arakan_Army_(Kachin_State)), and say the artillery hit the village amid ethnic clashes. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-myanmar-rohingya/two-rohingya-women-killed-as-myanmar-army-shells-village-mp-idUSKBN1ZO08H)
*   [Iraqi protests (2019–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraqi_protests_(2019%E2%80%93present))
    *   Iraqi security forces raid a protest site in [Baghdad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baghdad) and try to remove protesters in southern cities, firing [tear gas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tear_gas) and live bullets, killing four and wounding dozens more. The raid comes after [Muqtada al-Sadr](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Muqtada_al-Sadr) ordered his followers to withdraw. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-iraq-protests/iraqi-security-forces-raid-protest-camps-4-killed-after-sadr-supporters-withdraw-idUSKBN1ZO0AN?il=0)

## Health and environment

*   [2019–20 Wuhan coronavirus outbreak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_Wuhan_coronavirus_outbreak)
    *   [General Secretary of the Communist Party of China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/General_Secretary_of_the_Communist_Party_of_China) [Xi Jinping](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xi_Jinping) holds a special [Party Politburo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Politburo_of_the_Communist_Party_of_China) meeting where he says that the country faces a "grave situation" as he warns the virus is "accelerating its speed". [(_People's Daily_)](http://en.people.cn/n3/2020/0125/c90000-9651799.html)
    *   The [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) orders the evacuation of the [Consulate General of the United States, Wuhan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Consulate_General_of_the_United_States,_Wuhan) employees and U.S. citizens in the city. [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/25/world/asia/china-coronavirus.html#link-3db7b2fe)

## Science and technology

*   The [Boeing 777X](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boeing_777X) completes its first test flight near [Seattle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seattle), [Washington](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Washington_(state)), United States, after two delayed attempts. [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/boeing-777x-9-first-flight/index.html)

# 2020-01-26

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [War in Afghanistan (2001–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_in_Afghanistan_(2001%E2%80%93present))
    *   [Afghan forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghan_Armed_Forces) launch ground and air operations against the [Taliban](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taliban), killing 51 of them in nine [provinces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Provinces_of_Afghanistan) of the country. Afghanistan's [Ministry of Defense](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ministry_of_Defense_(Afghanistan)) say that the military conducted thirteen ground offensives and twelve airstrikes. In the northern province of [Balkh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Balkh_Province), local officials say that three women and four children were killed. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-afghanistan-attacks-surge/afghan-forces-launch-air-ground-attacks-on-taliban-killing-51-idUSKBN1ZP0EG)
*   [Syrian Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Civil_War), [Northwestern Syria offensive (November 2019–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northwestern_Syria_offensive_(November_2019%E2%80%93present))
    *   [Syrian government forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Armed_Forces) retake several cities in the [Idlib Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idlib_Province) area, amid a push from [Syrian President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_President) [Bashar al-Assad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bashar_al-Assad) to recapture the last rebel strongholds. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-syria-security/syrian-government-forces-capture-towns-in-advance-on-rebel-held-idlib-idUSKBN1ZP0FC)
*   [Mali War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mali_War)
    *   Nineteen [Malian soldiers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malian_Armed_Forces) are killed in an attack on an [army camp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Army_camp). No group has claimed responsibility. [(France24)](https://www.france24.com/en/20200126-mali-militant-attack-army-camp-al-qaeda-islamic-state-sokolo-niono-kill)
*   [Iraqi protests (2019–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraqi_protests_(2019%E2%80%93present))
    *   Amid further heavy clashes in [Baghdad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baghdad) rockets hit the United States embassy wounding at least one. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/01/iraq-rockets-hit-baghdad-green-zone-anti-gov-protests-200126195616176.html)[(The Guardian)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/jan/27/us-embassy-iraq-rocket-attack-injuries)

## Arts and culture

*   [62nd Annual Grammy Awards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/62nd_Annual_Grammy_Awards)
    *   [Billie Eilish](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billie_Eilish) sweeps the major categories winning [Song of the Year](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grammy_Award_for_Song_of_the_Year), [Record of the Year](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grammy_Award_for_Record_of_the_Year), [Album of the Year](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grammy_Award_for_Album_of_the_Year), and [Best New Artist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grammy_Award_for_Best_New_Artist). [(_Los Angeles Times_)](https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/music/story/2020-01-26/billie-eilish-sweeps-major-categories-2020-grammys)

## Health and environment

*   [2019–20 Wuhan coronavirus outbreak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_Wuhan_coronavirus_outbreak)
    *   A leading group on the prevention and control of the novel coronavirus outbreak is established, led by Chinese Premier [Li Keqiang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Li_Keqiang). The leading group decides to extend the [Spring Festival](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_New_Year) holiday to contain the coronavirus outbreak. [(Xinhua News)](http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2020-01/26/c_138735589.htm)

## Disasters and accidents

*   At least 39 people are dead in the [Brazilian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil) [states](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/States_of_Brazil) of [Minas Gerais](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minas_Gerais) and [Espírito Santo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Esp%C3%ADrito_Santo) after heavy rains hit the country's [southeast region](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Southeast_Region,_Brazil). [(VEJA)](https://veja.abril.com.br/brasil/minas-registra-cinco-mortes-por-causa-das-chuvas-e-buscas-continuam/)
*   [Death of Kobe Bryant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Death_of_Kobe_Bryant)
    *   Retired [NBA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NBA) player [Kobe Bryant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kobe_Bryant), his daughter and seven other people are killed in a helicopter crash in [Calabasas, California](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calabasas,_California), U.S. [(ABC News)](https://abcnews.go.com/US/dead-helicopter-crash-southern-california/story?id=68545466)

## Politics and elections

*   [2020 Peruvian parliamentary election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Peruvian_parliamentary_election)
    *   People in [Peru](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peru) head to the polls to elect the members of the country's [congress](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Congress_of_the_Republic_of_Peru) after its dissolution in September 2019. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-51208274)
*   [Impeachment trial of Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Impeachment_trial_of_Donald_Trump)
    *   An unpublished manuscript of former [National Security Advisor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Security_Advisor_(United_States)) [John Bolton](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Bolton)'s book reveals that [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) told him that unfreezing military aid to [Ukraine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukraine) was conditional on their performing investigations into [Joe Biden](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Biden) and [Hillary Clinton](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hillary_Clinton). [(New York Times)](https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/us/politics/trump-bolton-book-ukraine.html)

# 2020-01-28

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Syrian civil war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_civil_war), [Northwestern Syria offensive (November 2019–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northwestern_Syria_offensive_(November_2019%E2%80%93present))
    *   The [Syrian Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Army), backed by [Russian Air Force](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Air_Force) support, enters the largely deserted city of [Ma'arrat al-Nu'man](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ma%27arrat_al-Nu%27man) in the northern [Idlib Governorate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idlib_Governorate). Only light resistance is reported as most rebel groups, including [Hayat Tahrir al-Sham](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hayat_Tahrir_al-Sham), withdrew their fighters. The city had been under rebel control since October 2012. [(Middle East Eye)](https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/pro-government-forces-enter-syrian-rebel-town-maaret-al-numan)

## Business and economy

*   The [Barakah nuclear power plant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barakah_nuclear_power_plant) in the [United Arab Emirates](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Arab_Emirates), the first commercial [nuclear plant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuclear_plant) in the [Arab world](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arab_world), is declared ready for operation after years of delays. It is expected to go online sometime during this quarter. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/emirates-energy-nuclearpower-idAFL8N29X4CQ)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [2020 Caribbean earthquake](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Caribbean_earthquake)
    *   A magnitude 7.7 [earthquake](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earthquake) is recorded off the coast of [Jamaica](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jamaica). [(KRON 4 News)](https://www.kron4.com/news/world/7-3-magnitude-earthquake-hits-near-jamaica/)

## Health and environment

*   [2019–20 Wuhan coronavirus outbreak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_Wuhan_coronavirus_outbreak)
    *   [Palau](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palau)'s [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Palau) [Thomas Remengesau Jr.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_Remengesau_Jr.) bans [chartered flights](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chartered_flight) from [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/People%27s_Republic_of_China) and suspends charter flights from [Macau](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macau) and [Hong Kong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hong_Kong) until further notice. Remengesau is set to issue an executive order to that effect after a meeting with the National Emergency Committee. [(RNZ)](https://www.rnz.co.nz/international/pacific-news/408269/two-men-in-quarantine-in-samoa-over-coronavirus-fears)
    *   The Health Commission in the central [Chinese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China) province of [Hubei](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hubei) say there are 1,291 new confirmed cases of [novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Novel_coronavirus_(2019-nCoV)) and 24 more deaths, bringing the total death toll to 106 people. [(AFP via New Straits Times)](https://www.nst.com.my/world/world/2020/01/560268/china-virus-death-toll-jumps-106-nearly-1300-new-cases)
    *   [Chinese President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_President) [Xi Jinping](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xi_Jinping) tells the [World Health Organization](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Health_Organization) he is confident about defeating the "devil virus". [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-china-health/chinas-xi-tells-who-hes-confident-of-slaying-devil-virus-idUSKBN1ZR0CF)

## Law and crime

*   Prosecutor General of [Tajikistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tajikistan), Yusuf Rakhmon, announces the arrest of 113 alleged members of the [Muslim Brotherhood](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Muslim_Brotherhood). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-tajikistan-islamist/tajikistan-arrests-113-alleged-muslim-brotherhood-members-idUSKBN1ZR1C5)
*   [Investigations involving Benjamin Netanyahu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Investigations_involving_Benjamin_Netanyahu)
    *   [Prime Minister of Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Israel) [Benjamin Netanyahu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benjamin_Netanyahu) withdraws a request for [immunity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Immunity) to the [Knesset](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knesset). [Attorney General](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attorney_General_of_Israel) [Avichai Mandelblit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avichai_Mandelblit) formally indicts Netanyahu on charges of [bribery](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bribery), [fraud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fraud), and [breach of trust](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Breach_of_trust) in three cases of suspected [corruption](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corruption). [(Vox)](https://www.vox.com/2020/1/28/21111500/israeli-prime-minister-benjamin-netanyahu-corruption-trump-peace-plan)

## Politics and elections

*   [2020 New Zealand general election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_New_Zealand_general_election)
    *   [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_New_Zealand) [Jacinda Ardern](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jacinda_Ardern) announces that the next general election is to be held on September 19. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/jan/28/new-zealand-election-jacinda-ardern-sets-september-date-for-poll)

*   [Israeli–Palestinian conflict](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israeli%E2%80%93Palestinian_conflict), [Trump peace plan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trump_peace_plan)
    *   [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) and [Israeli Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Israel) [Benjamin Netanyahu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benjamin_Netanyahu) unveil a peace plan developed by the Trump administration for three years. The plan recognizes Israeli sovereignty over major settlement blocs in the [occupied](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israeli_occupation_of_the_West_Bank) [West Bank](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/West_Bank), as well as the [annexation of the Jordan Valley](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annexation_of_the_Jordan_Valley), in exchange for a freeze on new Israeli settlements in certain areas for four years. [Palestinian President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Palestine) [Mahmoud Abbas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mahmoud_Abbas) dismisses the plan as "nonsense", while Israeli opposition leader [Benny Gantz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benny_Gantz) casts his support for the plan. [(_Associated Press_)](https://apnews.com/f7d36b9023309ce4b1e423b02abf52c6)
