# 2020-01-29

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Syrian civil war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_civil_war), [Northwestern Syria offensive (November 2019–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northwestern_Syria_offensive_(November_2019%E2%80%93present))
    *   The [Syrian Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Army) say that the [armed forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Armed_Forces) are now in full control of the city of [Maaret al-Numan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maaret_al-Numan), after they entered it yesterday with little resistance. [(France24)](https://www.france24.com/en/20200129-syrian-army-takes-over-key-idlib-town-from-rebels-assad-damascus-aleppo)
*   [Mali War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mali_War)
    *   [Mali](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mali)'s [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Mali) [Boubou Cissé](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boubou_Ciss%C3%A9) announces that his country will increase the size of its [armed forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malian_Armed_Forces) by 50% in recruitment to uproot [jihadist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jihadist) groups. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mali-security-army/mali-plans-to-increase-the-size-of-its-army-to-rein-in-jihadists-idUSKBN1ZS2ZG)

## Business and economy

*   The [British government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/British_government) announces that rail firm [Northern](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northern_(train_operating_company)) will be [nationalized](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nationalization) following public outcry over [Arriva UK Trains](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arriva_UK_Trains) handling of the firm. Arriva says it "understood the government's decision", but blames problems on "external factors" such as rail infrastructure. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-51298820)
*   [Facebook](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Facebook) agrees to pay [US$](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._dollar)550 million to settle a [class action](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Class_action) lawsuit launched in 2015 over its mass harvesting of [biometric](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biometrics) data in the [state](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._state) of [Illinois](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Illinois). [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/29/technology/facebook-privacy-lawsuit-earnings.html)

## Disasters and accidents

*   In the [Indian state](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indian_state) of [Maharashtra](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maharashtra), two vehicles collide and plunge into a well, killing 26 people and injuring 32 others. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-india-accident/twenty-six-killed-in-india-as-bus-plunges-into-well-idUSKBN1ZS1IF)

[(KTLA)](https://ktla.com/2020/01/29/fire-erupts-at-high-rise-apartment-building-near-brentwood-for-2nd-time-since-2013/)

## Health and environment

*   [French](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France) Agriculture Minister [Didier Guillaume](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Didier_Guillaume) announces that the [culling of unwanted male chicks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chick_culling) will be outlawed by the end of 2021, becoming one of the first countries to initiate such a ban. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-51301915)

## International relations

*   [Algeria–Bangladesh relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algeria%E2%80%93Bangladesh_relations)
    *   [Algeria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algeria) reopens its [embassy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Embassy) in [Dhaka](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dhaka), after closing it in 1990. [(_New Age_)](https://www.newagebd.net/article/97994/algeria-reopens-embassy-after-3-decades-of-closure)
*   [Brexit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit)

[MEP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Member_of_the_European_Parliament) and Brexit campaigner [Nigel Farage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nigel_Farage) applauds its passage by saying "we'd be better off out", while [UK Labour](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Labour_Party_(UK)) MEP [Judith Kirton-Darling](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Judith_Kirton-Darling) tearfully states it "attacks the very foundation of our identity". [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/uk-britain-eu-parliament/tears-and-cheers-as-eu-lawmakers-give-final-nod-to-brexit-idUSKBN1ZS1EE)

    *   More than 6,000 passengers are barred from disembarking a [cruise ship](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cruise_ship) docked at [Civitavecchia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Civitavecchia), [Lazio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lazio), [Italy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italy), after authorities expressed concern that two [Chinese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_people) passengers have the [coronavirus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coronavirus). [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/jan/30/6000-passengers-stuck-on-cruise-ship-in-italy-over-coronavirus-fears)
    *   Two cases of [novel coronavirus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Novel_coronavirus_(2019-nCoV)) are confirmed in [Italy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italy) after two Chinese tourists are recovered in [Rome](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rome). [(_Il Messaggero_)](https://www.ilmessaggero.it/mondo/coronavirus_diretta_news_oggi_30_gennaio_2020_morti_casi_sospetti_cina_civitavecchia-5018156.html)

## Law and crime

*   The [Virginia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virginia), [Nevada](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nevada), and [Illinois](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Illinois) [state attorneys general](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/State_attorney_general) file a lawsuit to get the [Equal Rights Amendment](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Equal_Rights_Amendment) added to the [Constitution of the United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Constitution_of_the_United_States). [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2020/01/30/politics/equal-rights-amendment-virginia-litigation-trnd/index.html)
*   [Japanese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan) [prosecutors](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecutor) issue [arrest warrants](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arrest_warrant) against a former [United States special operations forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_special_operations_forces) [soldier](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Army) and two others for allegedly helping [Carlos Ghosn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carlos_Ghosn) to escape from Japan. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-nissan-ghosn/japan-issues-arrest-warrants-for-ex-u-s-soldier-two-others-for-ghosn-escape-idUSKBN1ZT0DK)
*   The [U.S. Customs and Border Protection](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._Customs_and_Border_Protection) reports that in August it discovered a 1,313 m (4,308 ft) [smuggling tunnel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Smuggling_tunnel) running from [Tijuana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tijuana) to [San Diego](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Diego), making it the longest tunnel of its type along the [Mexico–United States border](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico%E2%80%93United_States_border). It was possibly used by the [Sinaloa Cartel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sinaloa_Cartel). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-51304861)
*   [Catholic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catholic_Church) [Cardinal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cardinal_(Catholic_Church)) [Philippe Barbarin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippe_Barbarin) is acquitted by an [appellate court](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Appellate_court) of having covered up allegations of [child sexual abuse](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Child_sexual_abuse) by a former priest. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-church-abuse-france/french-court-overturns-earlier-guilty-verdict-on-cardinal-barbarin-idUSKBN1ZT1M1)

# 2020-02-01

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   Suspected [Islamist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamist) militants kill at least 62 [civilians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Civilian) in a series of [massacres](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Massacre) in eastern [Democratic Republic of the Congo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democratic_Republic_of_the_Congo) as killings of civilians intensify. The country's [armed forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armed_Forces_of_the_Democratic_Republic_of_the_Congo) launch counter-offensives against [insurgents](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Insurgent) of the [Allied Democratic Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allied_Democratic_Forces). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-congo-violence/militants-kill-dozens-in-east-congo-as-attacks-on-civilians-intensify-idUSKBN1ZV3OS)

## Disasters and accidents

*   400–500 people are left stranded at the [Sasquatch Mountain Resort](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sasquatch_Mountain_Resort) in [British Columbia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/British_Columbia), [Canada](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canada), after the road to the resort was damaged from landslides caused by heavy rain. Train service between [Vancouver](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vancouver) and [Seattle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seattle) was also suspenced until Monday due to mudslides. [(CTV News)](https://bc.ctvnews.ca/landslide-washouts-strand-500-people-on-sasquatch-mountain-ski-hill-1.4793567) [(CTV News)](https://bc.ctvnews.ca/mudslide-means-passenger-trains-between-vancouver-and-seattle-won-t-resume-until-monday-1.4793612)

## Health and environment

*   [2019–20 Wuhan coronavirus outbreak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_Wuhan_coronavirus_outbreak)
    *   [Kiribati](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kiribati) becomes the latest country in the Pacific to block [Chinese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_people) travelers by placing all [visa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Travel_visa) applications from [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China) on hold and ordering all those coming from countries with confirmed cases of the virus to self-[quarantine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quarantine). [(Radio NZ International)](https://www.rnz.co.nz/international/pacific-news/408618/coronavirus-kiribati-blocks-chinese-travellers)
    *   [Apple Inc.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple_Inc.) announces it will close all of its stores and offices in China until February 9 due to the outbreak. [(Gizmodo)](https://gizmodo.com/apple-is-closing-all-of-its-stores-and-corporate-office-1841410459)

## International relations

*   [Trump peace plan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trump_peace_plan)
    *   The [Palestinian Authority](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palestinian_Authority) cuts all ties with the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) and [Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel), including those relating to security, after rejecting a peace plan presented by [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._President) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-israel-palestinians-security/palestinian-authority-cuts-ties-with-israel-and-u-s-idUSKBN1ZV3PO)

## Law and crime

*   A court in [Egypt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Egypt) sentences a former special forces officer and 36 others to the [death penalty](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capital_punishment_in_Egypt) after being convicted on charges of [terrorism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terrorism_in_Egypt), court officials say. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-egypt-security/egypt-sentences-officer-turned-militant-and-36-others-to-death-idUSKBN1ZV3IW)
*   Police in [South Africa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Africa) launch a manhunt for the killers of nine illegal [miners](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miner) who were stoned to death in western [Johannesburg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Johannesburg).     *   Former Communications Minister [Mohammed Tawfiq Allawi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohammed_Tawfiq_Allawi) is appointed [Prime Minister of Iraq](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Iraq) by [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Iraq) [Barham Salih](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barham_Salih). # 2020-02-02

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [2020 Streatham stabbing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Streatham_stabbing)
    *   Three people are injured after a man attacked people with a [machete](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Machete) in [Streatham High Road](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Streatham_High_Road), [London](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London), [United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom). The attacker is shot dead by police. The incident is declared as [terrorism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terrorism_in_the_United_Kingdom)\-related. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-london-51349664)
*   [2020 Ghent stabbing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Ghent_stabbing)
    *   A female attacker reportedly stabs two people in [Ghent](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ghent), [East Flanders](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/East_Flanders), [Belgium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belgium). The suspect is shot and wounded by [Belgian police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belgian_police). [(Metro)](https://metro.co.uk/2020/02/02/police-shoot-knifeman-belgium-just-minutes-london-terror-attack-12169611/)
*   [Syrian civil war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_civil_war), [Northwestern Syria offensive (November 2019–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northwestern_Syria_offensive_(November_2019%E2%80%93present)), [Turkish involvement in the Syrian Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkish_involvement_in_the_Syrian_Civil_War)
    *   More than 200 [Turkish Armed Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkish_Armed_Forces) vehicles cross the [Syria–Turkey border](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syria%E2%80%93Turkey_border) into rebel-held [Idlib Governorate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idlib_Governorate) in an effort to halt the [Syrian Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Army) advance on the city of [Saraqib](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saraqib). [(_The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/europe/turkish-military-convoy-crosses-into-rebel-held-nw-syria/2020/02/02/17651c30-45d8-11ea-91ab-ce439aa5c7c1_story.html) [(Al Masdar News)](https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/turkish-military-attempts-to-block-syrian-armys-path-to-saraqib/)
*   [Sinai insurgency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sinai_insurgency)
    *   [Islamist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamism) militants bomb a [gas pipeline](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pipeline_transport) between [Egypt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Egypt) and [Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel) in the northern [Sinai Peninsula](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sinai_Peninsula). [(Ynet news)](https://www.ynetnews.com/article/rJyLd2VfI)

## Health and environment

*   [2019–20 Wuhan coronavirus outbreak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_Wuhan_coronavirus_outbreak)
    *   The first [coronavirus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Novel_coronavirus_(2019-nCoV)) death outside China is reported in the [Philippines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines). The victim was a [Chinese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_people) [tourist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tourism_in_the_Philippines), also infected with _[Streptococcus pneumoniae](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Streptococcus_pneumoniae)_ and [influenza B](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Influenza_B), who recently arrived in the country.     *   [New Zealand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Zealand) closes its borders to all foreign visitors from [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China) and bolsters screenings at its airports in response to the coronavirus outbreak. The travel ban will be in place for at least fourteen days. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/feb/03/coronavirus-outbreak-new-zealand-bans-foreign-travellers-from-china)

## Disasters and accidents

    *   [Avalanches](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avalanches) in [Van Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Van_Province), eastern [Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey), kill at least 38 people, leaving more trapped. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-51384440)
*   [Pegasus Airlines Flight 2193](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pegasus_Airlines_Flight_2193)
    *   A [plane crashes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plane_crash) after overrunning the runway at [Sabiha Gökçen International Airport](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sabiha_G%C3%B6k%C3%A7en_International_Airport), [Istanbul](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Istanbul), Turkey, killing 3 people and injuring 155 others. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-51384667)

## Health and environment

*   [2019–20 Wuhan coronavirus outbreak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_Wuhan_coronavirus_outbreak)
    *   Around 3,700 people aboard a [cruise ship](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cruise_ship) named _[Diamond Princess](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diamond_Princess_(ship))_ are [quarantined](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quarantine) after ten passengers test positive for the illness at the [port of Yokohama](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Port_of_Yokohama), Japan. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-china-health-japan/ten-passengers-on-cruise-liner-docked-in-japan-test-positive-for-coronavirus-idUSKBN1ZY2YE)
    *   A baby is diagnosed with the virus 30 hours after birth, in the first recorded case of the virus in a newborn. [(New Straits Times)](https://www.nst.com.my/world/world/2020/02/562896/baby-tests-positive-china-virus-just-30-hours-after-birth)

## International relations

*   [Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico) establishes diplomatic relations with the [Central African Republic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_African_Republic), resulting in Mexico having diplomatic relations with all [African](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_sovereign_states_and_dependent_territories_in_Africa) states. [(Government of Mexico)](https://www.gob.mx/sre/prensa/mexico-establishes-diplomatic-relations-with-the-central-african-republic?idiom=en)

## Law and crime

*   The [United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom)'s [Department for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Department_for_Digital,_Culture,_Media_and_Sport) begins a [public consultation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Public_consultation) on [decriminalizing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decriminalization) the failure to pay the [television licence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Television_licensing_in_the_United_Kingdom) fee. Currently, failure to pay the fee while using a television can result in fines and imprisonment. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-51373372)
*   [Bayard Rustin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bayard_Rustin) is posthumously [pardoned](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pardon) by [California Governor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Governor_of_California) [Gavin Newsom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gavin_Newsom) for "anti-gay charges". [(NBC News)](https://www.nbcnews.com/feature/nbc-out/bayard-rustin-gay-civil-rights-icon-pardoned-california-governor-anti-n1130501)
*   [Denmark](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Denmark) jails three men for potentially spying for [Saudi Arabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabia). [(ABC News)](https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/denmark-jails-men-suspected-spying-saudi-arabia-68769753?cid=clicksource_4380645_11_heads_posts_headlines_hed)
*   [LGBT rights in Nigeria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_Nigeria)
    *   A court in [Nigeria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nigeria) grants 47 men another delay in their trial over [homosexuality](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Homosexuality) and public displays of affection with members of the same sex. Judge Rilwan Aikawa says it is the last accepted delay at the [Lagos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lagos) court. The men face up to 10-year imprisonment if convicted in a closely watched trial. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-nigeria-lgbt/court-case-of-47-nigerian-men-charged-under-homosexuality-law-delayed-again-idUSKBN1ZZ2HJ?il=0)

## Politics and elections

*   [Impeachment trial of Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Impeachment_trial_of_Donald_Trump)
    *   The [United States Senate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Senate) votes on whether to acquit [U.S. President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump). By a vote of 52–48 almost entirely along party lines, the [Republican](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_Party_(United_States))\-majority Senate acquits Trump on the first article of impeachment, [abuse of power](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abuse_of_power), and acquits him on the the second charge, [obstruction of Congress](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Contempt_of_Congress), in a separate 53–47 vote. [Utah](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Utah) Senator [Mitt Romney](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mitt_Romney) casts the sole Republican guilty vote, against party lines, on the first article. [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/2020/02/05/us/politics/trump-acquitted-impeachment.html)
*   The [Romanian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romania) minority [government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_Romania) led by [Ludovic Orban](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ludovic_Orban) is toppled by a [vote of no confidence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vote_of_no_confidence). The event could lead to an [early election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Next_Romanian_legislative_election). [(DW)](https://www.dw.com/en/romanias-centrist-government-collapses-after-no-confidence-vote/a-52269157)

    *   [Li Wenliang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Li_Wenliang), the doctor who tried to issue the first warnings about the coronavirus outbreak, dies after contracting the virus. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-china-51403795)
    *   [Italy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italy) confirms that an [Italian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italians) man has contracted the virus, after he visited his girlfriend in [Wuhan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wuhan). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-china-health-royal-caribbean/royal-caribbean-bans-china-hong-kong-macau-passport-holders-from-ships-on-coronavirus-fears-idUSKBN2012I5)

# 2020-02-08

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [2020 Nakhon Ratchasima shooting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Nakhon_Ratchasima_shooting)
    *   A soldier [opens fire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mass_shooting) in a [military camp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Military_camp) and a [shopping center](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shopping_center) in [Nakhon Ratchasima](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nakhon_Ratchasima), [Thailand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thailand), killing 29 people and injuring 58 others before being shot dead by [police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Royal_Thai_Police) the next day. It is considered the deadliest mass shooting in the country's history. [(_Bangkok Post_)](https://www.bangkokpost.com/thailand/general/1853334/17-killed-as-soldier-opens-fire-in-korat) [(USA Today)](https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2020/02/08/thailand-soldier-terminal-21-mall-shooting-rampage-korat/4700184002/)
*   At least eight people have been killed and dozens have been injured in ethnic clashes in [Kazakhstan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kazakhstan). About 30 houses and 15 commercial properties were destroyed during the clash. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-51425938)
*   [War in Afghanistan (2001–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_in_Afghanistan_(2001%E2%80%93present))
    *   A [shootout](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shootout) during [joint exercises](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Military_exercise#Joint_exercise) with [U.S.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Army) and [Afghan soldiers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghan_National_Army) in [Nangarhar Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nangarhar_Province) leaves between four and six Americans, and six Afghans dead. It is unknown if the [Taliban](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taliban) or [rogue Afghan forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NATO_Training_Mission-Afghanistan#Green-on-blue_attacks) were responsible. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-afghanistan/american-afghan-soldiers-killed-in-shootout-in-afghanistan-ny-times-idUSKBN2020Q9)

## Business and economy

*   [Argentine Vice President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentine_Vice_President) [Cristina Fernández de Kirchner](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cristina_Fern%C3%A1ndez_de_Kirchner) declares that the [government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_Argentina) will not pay back its [US$](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._dollar)57 billion debt to the [International Monetary Fund](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Monetary_Fund) until the country exits its [recession](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Recession). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-cuba-argentina/argentina-wont-repay-imf-debt-till-recession-over-vp-fernandez-say-idUSKBN20302R?il=0)

    *   Two people – one [Japanese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_people) and one [American](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Americans) – die from coronavirus in [Wuhan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wuhan). They are the first foreigners (excluding [Hong Kong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hong_Kong) and [Macau](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macau)) to die from it. ## International relations

*   [Syria–Turkey relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syria%E2%80%93Turkey_relations)
    *   [Iranian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran) [Foreign Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs_(Iran)) [Mohammad Javad Zarif](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohammad_Javad_Zarif) offers to mediate between [Syria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syria) and [Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey) over escalating conflicts between the two nations following the [recent offensive in the Idlib Governorate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northwestern_Syria_offensive_(November_2019%E2%80%93present)). # 2020-02-09

## Arts and culture

*   [92nd Academy Awards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/92nd_Academy_Awards)
    *   At this year's [Oscars](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Academy_Awards), [South Korean](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cinema_of_South_Korea) film _[Parasite](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parasite_(2019_film))_ wins the most awards, including [Best Picture](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Academy_Award_for_Best_Picture) and [Best International Film](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Academy_Award_for_Best_International_Feature_Film). It becomes the first foreign-language film to win Best Picture. [(_The Hollywood Reporter_)](https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/lists/oscar-winners-2020-updating-live-full-list-1275973/item/director-1275980)

## Health and environment

*   [2019–20 Wuhan coronavirus outbreak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_Wuhan_coronavirus_outbreak)
    *   The death toll of the coronavirus outbreak surpasses the death toll of the [2002–03 SARS outbreak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Severe_acute_respiratory_syndrome#Outbreak_in_South_China), at 910 deaths. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/feb/09/coronavirus-global-death-toll-overtakes-sars-epidemic) [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/02/china-virus-death-toll-surges-800-infections-mount-200209003721741.html)

## International relations

*   [Cross-Strait relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross-Strait_relations)
    *   [Taiwan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taiwan) scrambles its [air force](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republic_of_China_Air_Force) to intercept [Chinese jets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/People%27s_Liberation_Army_Air_Force) after they circled the island during a combat drill. The drill is denounced by the [Taiwanese Defense Ministry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ministry_of_National_Defense_(Republic_of_China)) as a violation of its sovereignty. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-taiwan-china-defence/taiwan-scrambles-armed-jets-as-chinese-air-force-flies-around-island-idUSKBN2030AE)
*   [Israel–Palestine relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel%E2%80%93Palestine_relations)
    *   Israel blocks all Palestinian export of agricultural products from the occupied West Bank following Palestinian limitations on imports of Israeli cattle. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/02/israel-blocks-palestinian-agricultural-exports-jordan-200209104227779.html) [(_Haaretz_)](https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/israel-to-bar-palestinians-from-exporting-produce-via-jordan-as-trade-war-escalates-1.8506459)

## Politics and elections

*   [2020 Azerbaijani parliamentary election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Azerbaijani_parliamentary_election)
    *   [Azerbaijan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Azerbaijan) holds a [snap election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snap_election) after [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Azerbaijan) [Ilham Aliyev](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ilham_Aliyev) dissolved the [National Assembly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Assembly_(Azerbaijan)) last December. The opposition accuses Aliyev of limiting their ability to campaign, and calls for boycotts against the election. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-azerbaijan-election/azeri-president-moves-to-modernize-parliament-with-snap-election-idUSKBN2020S9) [(France24)](https://www.france24.com/en/20200209-azerbaijan-holds-elections-decried-as-sham-by-opposition)
*   [2020 Cameroonian parliamentary election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Cameroonian_parliamentary_election)
    *   After having been postponed twice, [parliamentary elections](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elections_in_Cameroon) are held in [Cameroon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cameroon). The ongoing [Anglophone Crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anglophone_Crisis) overshadows the process, with supporters of [Ambazonia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ambazonia) calling for a boycott of the election. [(DW)](https://www.dw.com/en/cameroon-elections-a-vote-marked-by-violence-and-abstention/a-52304640)
*   [2020 Irish general election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Irish_general_election)
    *   Counting of the first preference votes show [Sinn Féin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sinn_F%C3%A9in) leading with 24.1% of the vote, ahead of ruling party [Fine Gael](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fine_Gael) and main opposition party [Fianna Fáil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fianna_F%C3%A1il), each with 22.1%. Sinn Féin leader [Mary Lou McDonald](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mary_Lou_McDonald) claims victory, declaring that Ireland "is no longer a two-party system", and hopes to form a coalition government. [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/feb/09/sinn-fein-to-try-to-form-ruling-coalition-after-irish-election-success)
*   [2020 Swiss referendums](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Swiss_referendums), [LGBT rights in Switzerland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_Switzerland)
    *   [Swiss](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Switzerland) voters head to the polls to vote on a proposal to mandate quotas for affordable housing in new residential development projects, and whether to criminalize discrimination on the basis of [sexual orientation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sexual_orientation). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-51370820) [(_Irish Times_)](https://www.irishtimes.com/news/world/europe/switzerland-is-putting-its-housing-crisis-to-a-referendum-1.4155510)
    *   The proposal to mandate quotas is rejected, the proposal to criminalize discrimination on the basis of [sexual orientation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sexual_orientation) passes. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-51370820)
*   [President of El Salvador](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_El_Salvador) [Nayib Bukele](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nayib_Bukele) breaks into the [Legislative Assembly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legislative_Assembly_of_El_Salvador) with the Army and occupies the chair of the Speaker to demand the approval of a financial measure which couldn't pass earlier as there was no quorum. In a public release, the Presidency department calls for calm after a "demand of insurrection". The opposition accuses the president and the army of intimidation and a "[self-coup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Self-coup)". [(_El País_)](https://elpais.com/internacional/2020/02/10/america/1581294344_999638.html) [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-51439020) [(_The Washington Post_)](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/the_americas/el-salvador-standoff-deepens-over-loan-for-security-forces/2020/02/09/1eb51fb6-4b97-11ea-967b-e074d302c7d4_story.html) [(_The New York Times_)](https://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2020/02/09/world/americas/ap-lt-bc-el-salvador-loan-standoff.html)

## Science and technology

*   The [United Launch Alliance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Launch_Alliance) successfully launches the [European Space Agency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Space_Agency)'s [Solar Orbiter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Solar_Orbiter) (SolO) satellite from [Cape Canaveral Air Force Station](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cape_Canaveral_Air_Force_Station). The probe will study the [Sun](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sun), and in particular its inner [heliosphere](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heliosphere). He was an 80-year-old [Chinese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_people) [tourist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tourism_in_France) who had arrived in [Paris](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paris) with symptoms of the illness on January 16. *   [Storm Dennis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Storm_Dennis)

## International relations

*   [Australia–United Kingdom relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia%E2%80%93United_Kingdom_relations)
    *   Several senior [Australian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia) MPs cancel a planned trip to the [United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom) next month due to the latter allowing [Huawei](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Huawei) to help build its national [5G](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/5G) network. Australia had banned the Chinese telecom from participating in [their network](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telecommunications_in_Australia) due to [security concerns](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Huawei#Espionage_and_security_concerns). [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-australia-51513886)
*   [India–Turkey relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/India%E2%80%93Turkey_relations)

[(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/02/kashmir-india-tells-turkey-don-interfere-internal-affairs-200215182136914.html)

## Politics and elections

    *   [Shadow First Secretary of State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shadow_First_Secretary_of_State) [Emily Thornberry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emily_Thornberry) is eliminated from the [UK Labour](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Labour_Party_(UK)) leadership race after falling two nominations short of advancing to the next round. # 2020-02-16

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [South Sudanese Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Sudanese_Civil_War)
    *   [SPLM-IO](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sudan_People%27s_Liberation_Movement-in-Opposition) leader and former [Vice President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vice_President_of_South_Sudan) [Riek Machar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riek_Machar) rejects a peace proposal by President [Salva Kiir Mayardit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salva_Kiir_Mayardit). While Machar welcomes the provision to reduce the number of [states](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/States_of_South_Sudan) from 32 to 10, he opposes the creation of three administrative areas. [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/02/south-sudan-machar-rejects-president-kiir-peace-offer-200216090638473.html)
*   [Syrian civil war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_civil_war), [Northwestern Syria offensive (December 2019–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northwestern_Syria_offensive_(December_2019%E2%80%93present))
    *   Backed by [Russian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Air_Force) [airstrikes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Airstrike), [Syrian Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Army) troops take control of most of the [Aleppo countryside](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mount_Simeon_District), including the towns of [Anadan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anadan), [Haritan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haritan) and [Kafr Hamrah](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kafr_Hamrah) and over 30 villages amid a collapse in rebel defences. Much of the area has been under rebel control since 2012. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-syria-security-army/russian-backed-syrian-army-seizes-most-of-rebel-held-aleppo-province-state-media-idUSKBN20A0KQ?il=0) [(NBC News)](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/syrian-forces-seize-most-aleppo-province-eve-turkey-russia-talks-n1137631)

## Business and economy

*   The [United States District Court for the Eastern District of Missouri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_District_Court_for_the_Eastern_District_of_Missouri) rules that chemical companies [Bayer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bayer) and [BASF](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BASF) are accountable for the adverse effects of their [Dicamba](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dicamba)\-based [herbicides](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Herbicide) on American farmlands, and awards the plaintiff, a [peach](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peach) farmer, [US$](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._dollar)265 million in damages. Bayer announces it will appeal. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-bayer-dicamba-lawsuit/u-s-peach-grower-awarded-265-million-from-bayer-basf-in-weedkiller-lawsuit-idUSKBN20A0JJ?il=0)
*   A [German](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany) court orders [Tesla, Inc.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tesla,_Inc.) to temporarily halt construction of new manufacturing plant [Giga Berlin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Giga_Berlin) in [Grünheide](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gr%C3%BCnheide_(Mark)), [Brandenburg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brandenburg), due to the threat it poses to the local wildlife and water supplies. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/business-51525673)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [Storm Dennis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Storm_Dennis)
    *   The [bomb cyclone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Explosive_cyclogenesis) claims another victim, bringing the death toll to three. 198 [flood warnings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flood_warning) have been placed across [England](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/England). [(CNN)](https://www.cnn.com/2020/02/16/uk/storm-dennis-sunday-intl-gbr/index.html)

## Law and crime

*   [Azerbaijani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Azerbaijan) [police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Law_enforcement_in_Azerbaijan) detain three opposition party leaders and more than 100 activists for attempting to protest the results of last week's [parliamentary election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Azerbaijani_parliamentary_election). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-azerbaijan-election-opposition/azeri-police-detain-opposition-leaders-block-protest-against-election-result-idUSKBN20A0F3?il=0)
*   Nine [homeless](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Homelessness) drug users are shot dead while sleeping rough in the [Afghan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghanistan) capital [Kabul](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kabul). [(Al Jazeera)](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/02/homeless-drug-users-shot-dead-afghan-capital-police-200217032011711.html)

## Politics and elections

*   [2020 Paris municipal election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Paris_municipal_election)
    *   [French](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France) Health Minister [Agnès Buzyn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agn%C3%A8s_Buzyn) announces she will run for the [Parisian mayoral](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_mayors_of_Paris) position on the [La République En Marche!](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La_R%C3%A9publique_En_Marche!) ticket, after the party's original candidate [Benjamin Griveaux](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benjamin_Griveaux) withdrew yesterday due to a [sexting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sexting) scandal. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-france-politics/french-health-minister-to-run-for-paris-mayor-after-macron-ally-quits-idUSKBN20A0HI?il=0)
*   [2020 North Macedonian parliamentary election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_North_Macedonian_parliamentary_election)
    *   The [Assembly of North Macedonia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assembly_of_North_Macedonia) votes 108–12 to dissolve itself after [the country](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Macedonia) failed to start [accession talks with the European Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Accession_of_North_Macedonia_to_the_European_Union), and sets the parliamentary election date for April 12. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-north-macedonia-election/north-macedonia-parliament-dissolves-sets-poll-date-after-eu-shuns-talks-idUSKBN20A0ON)

# 2020-02-17

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [Syrian civil war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_civil_war), [Northwestern Syria offensive (December 2019–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northwestern_Syria_offensive_(December_2019%E2%80%93present))
    *   [Syrian President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Syria) [Bashar al-Assad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bashar_al-Assad) gives a televised speech on the [military](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Armed_Forces) offensives in north-western Syria, saying the offensives in [Aleppo Governorate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aleppo_Governorate) and [Idlib Governorate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idlib_Governorate) will continue regardless of [Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey)'s threats while adding that the recent [Syrian Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Army) victories are a prelude to the opposition's "final defeat, sooner or later". [(Al Masdar News)](https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/victory-in-aleppo-does-not-mean-end-of-syrian-war-assad/) [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-syria-security-assad/syrias-assad-says-his-forces-gains-are-prelude-to-rebels-final-defeat-idUSKBN20B1MM)
*   [February 2020 Quetta bombing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/February_2020_Quetta_bombing)
    *   At least 10 people are killed by a [suicide bomber](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suicide_bomb) on a motorcycle in [Quetta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quetta), [Balochistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Balochistan,_Pakistan), [Pakistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pakistan). [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-pakistan-blast/suicide-blast-kills-10-in-pakistan-city-of-quetta-idUSKBN20B1B5)

## Business and economy

*   [General Motors](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/General_Motors) pulls out of [right-hand drive markets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Left-hand_traffic), ending the [Holden](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holden) brand in [Australia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia). [(9 News)](https://www.9news.com.au/national/holden-axed-from-australia-in-2020-ending-72-years-of-car-making/29ba88b5-3061-4839-921d-b2fea77dcd21)
*   [Emirati](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Arab_Emirates) port operating firm [DP World](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DP_World) returns to being wholly [state-owned](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/State-owned_enterprise) by the [Dubai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emirate_of_Dubai) government, after its [sovereign wealth fund](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sovereign_wealth_fund) [Dubai World](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dubai_World) buys back the company's remaining stakes. DP World is subsequently delisted from the [NASDAQ Dubai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NASDAQ_Dubai) exchange. [(Reuters)](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-dp-wrld-delisting/dubais-dp-world-to-delist-return-to-full-state-ownership-idUSKBN20B0F8?il=0)
*   The [Aleppo International Airport](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aleppo_International_Airport) in [Aleppo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aleppo), [Syria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syria), opens to the public for the first time since 2013. Syrian Transport Minister [Ali Hammoud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ali_Hammoud) says regular commercial flights will begin within days, starting with [Cairo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cairo), [Egypt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Egypt). [(Reuters)](https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-syria-security/syrian-forces-consolidate-control-of-aleppo-air-strikes-under-way-idUKKBN20B0X3) [(Al Masdar News)](https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syria-to-reopen-aleppo-international-airport-for-first-time-in-9-years/)

## Disasters and accidents

*   [Storm Dennis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Storm_Dennis)
    *   The lower reaches of many rivers, including the [Severn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/River_Severn) at [Shrewsbury](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shrewsbury), continue to rise as a result of excess runoff from upstream. The [River Wye](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/River_Wye) in [Hereford](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hereford) has now reached its highest level in recorded history. [(BBC)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-51526879)

[(BBC)](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-51537144)

## Law and crime

*   [Sagamihara stabbings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sagamihara_stabbings)
    *   Prosecutors in [Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan) announce they are officially seeking the [death penalty](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capital_punishment_in_Japan) against [Satoshi Uematsu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Satoshi_Uematsu) for stabbing 19 [disabled](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Disability_in_Japan) people to death in 2016. ## Politics and elections

*   [Andrew Sabisky](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andrew_Sabisky), an advisor to [UK Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_the_United_Kingdom) [Boris Johnson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boris_Johnson), resigns after [racist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Racism_in_the_United_Kingdom) and [sexist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sexism) comments, as well as comments supporting [eugenics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eugenics), allegedly attributed to him resurface.     *   Denny Hamlin wins his second consecutive Daytona 500, and his third overall, becoming the first driver to win the race consecutively since [Sterling Marlin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sterling_Marlin) did so between 1994 and 1995. [Ryan Newman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ryan_Newman_(racing_driver)) is hospitalized with serious but non-life threatening injuries after an airborne crash coming to the finish. # 2020-02-21

## Armed conflicts and attacks

*   [War in Afghanistan (2001–present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_in_Afghanistan_(2001%E2%80%93present)), [Afghan peace process](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghan_peace_process)
    *   A seven-day "reduction of violence" between [United States troops](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Armed_Forces), [Afghan troops](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afghan_Armed_Forces), and the [Taliban](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taliban) is due to start at midnight local time (19:30 UTC). If the partial [truce](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ceasefire) is successful, a US–Taliban agreement on withdrawing American troops would be signed on February 29. [(NBC News)](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/u-s-taliban-reduction-violence-start-friday-ahead-broader-deal-n1140206)
*   [Kashmir conflict](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kashmir_conflict)
    *   India and Pakistan have engaged in a military confrontation across the _de facto_ border in [Kashmir](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kashmir); [Indian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indian_Armed_Forces) and [Pakistani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pakistan_Armed_Forces) forces [exchanged fire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_India%E2%80%93Pakistan_border_skirmishes) near the [Line of Control](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Line_of_Control) (LoC) in [Kupwara district](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kupwara_district), [Jammu and Kashmir](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jammu_and_Kashmir_(union_territory)). One Pakistani soldier died in the exchange of fire. [(Hindustan Times)](https://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/indian-forces-respond-to-ceasefire-violation-by-pakistan-in-jammu-and-kashmir/story-6MexMQaEkfMVDSz59WGvfP.html)

## Armed conflicts and attacks

    *   Two Kashmiri civilians alleged to be [Lashkar-e-Taiba](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lashkar-e-Taiba) militants are killed by [Indian soldiers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indian_Army) at [Anantnag](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anantnag), [Jammu and Kashmir](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jammu_and_Kashmir_(union_territory)), in a [counter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Counter-terrorism)\-[terrorism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terrorism_in_India) operation. *   Five [terrorists](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terrorism_in_Pakistan) are killed in [Peshawar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peshawar), [Khyber Paktunkhwa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khyber_Paktunkhwa), [Pakistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pakistan), by the Counter-Terrorism Department ([CTD](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pakistan_Army)) in a heavy exchange of fire during a search operation. The country has never before defaulted. Lebanon's [government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_Lebanon) debt is about 170% of its yearly [gross domestic product](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gross_domestic_product). [(_The Guardian_)](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/mar/07/lebanon-to-default-on-debt-for-first-time-amid-financial-crisis)

        *   [Italian Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_Prime_Minister) [Giuseppe Conte](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Giuseppe_Conte) extends the [quarantine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quarantine) lockdown, to cover all the [region](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Regions_of_Italy) of [Lombardy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lombardy) and 14 other [northern](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northern_Italy) [provinces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Provinces_of_Italy), affecting over a quarter of the national population.         *   Inmates at several prisons in Italy revolt with reports of riots at [prisons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prison) in [Modena](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Modena), [Foggia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foggia), [Naples](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naples), [Frosinone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frosinone) and [Alessandria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alessandria) due to fears the coronavirus lockdowns will end visits from relatives. At least eight inmates, six in Modena, have died of [overdose](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Overdose) after assaulting the prison's pharmacy, while about 20 escaped in Foggia. [(Open)](https://www.open.online/2020/03/09/coronavirus-rivolta-in-un-carcere-di-modena-morto-un-detenuto/)
        *   [Chief of Staff of the Italian Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chief_of_Staff_of_the_Italian_Army) [Salvatore Farina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salvatore_Farina_(soldier)) tested positive for coronavirus and self-isolates, as well as [President of Piedmont](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Piedmont) [Alberto Cirio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alberto_Cirio).
